title: Sr. Software Sales Executive
description:
The Global Large Law Firm Senior Sales Executive is responsible for selling HighQ, Contract Express, and Thought Trace to the legal community within an assigned territory. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Large Law accounts. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of West products, sales techniques appropriate for a long sales cycle and the needs of the legal profession in order to bundle information solutions to meet broader firm needs.

This position can currently allow someone to be based remotely, but there may be an expectation to relocate within the territory in the future.

**About the Role:**

* **Drive Results:** Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel; Support in developing and executing territory growth strategies
* **Closing**: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and drive deals to close
* **Relationship Management**: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals
* **Product Proposition**: Possess core knowledge across products within the sub-segment and engage Sales Specialists where deep product expertise is required to drive to close
* **Reporting**: Utilize an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals; KPI's include: Nurturing opportunities and moving more complex sales to close, i.e. New logo sales and existing ‘non-named’ account incremental sales
* **Client & Market Intelligence**: Understand specific customer archetypes and needs which are most prevalent within the sub-segment and territory

**About You:**

* Minimum 5 years successful software sales experience in a consultative selling environment to C-level players
* 4 year college degree, or equivalent experience
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Excellent communication skills and closing skills
* Effective time management skills
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
* Proficient in MS Office/Internet
* Working knowledge of West products, experience selling into large law accounts, and strong knowledge and background in the legal profession and/or legal publishing industry required
* High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting
* Proficient database management skills
* Law degree preferred
* Able to travel as required

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-AY1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

***Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings [click here](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/content/dam/ewp-m/documents/careers/en/pdf/onboarding/fake_job_posting_scam_careers_site.pdf) to know more.***

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on [thomsonreuters.com](https://thomsonreuters.com).

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following (New York City, San Francisco, Culver City). The target total cash compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $200,200 - $371,800. The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following states (CA, CO, CT, NV, WA) and/or remote. The target total cash compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $182,000 - $338,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive. Pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay and any target sales incentive are part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

title: Mobile Product Manager
description:
**Mobile Product Manager**

Reuters is seeking an energetic and experienced **Mobile Product Manager** to join our customer experience team to work across our Reuters.com and Reuters Connect – our B2C and B2B offerings.

We are looking for an experienced Mobile App Product Manager to work with our mobile product management team on our Reuters iOS and Android apps. We're looking for someone that lives and breathes consumer experiences across all mobile platforms.

You're an accountable, hands on problem-solver with a positive attitude, letting nothing stand in the way. You thrive when moving a project from ambiguity to clarity. You're a natural collaborator equally comfortable talking tech with developers, user experience with designers, copy and positioning with product marketers, numbers with finance and marketing, and strategy with executive leadership. You pay attention to people, connect with them, and know how to achieve great things together. You have a strong sense of purpose and integrity, with deep emotional intelligence. 

You’ll play a pivotal role in developing the company's mobile roadmap and shipping product and features that will spark explosive growth and be used by millions of consumers. 

You come from an environment where you’ve held a product role managing a mobile app that is operating at significant scale and have been there from launch through to scale. You should have a solid reputation for building great mobile products that have a big impact, as well as a proven track record of execution at tech companies.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Mobile Product Manager****,** you will:

* Work with our mobile product management team to develop and drive forward the mobile product vision to align with the company vision and help inform product and design team roadmaps and goal setting
* You've held a product role (in-house) at a consumer tech or e-commerce company that is in top 100 of its respective app store category
* You've launched great iOS and Android apps
* You're obsessed with measuring the impact of everything you ship
* You’re obsessed with pixel perfect design and creating simple yet powerful user experiences
* You collaborate successfully with designers and engineers
* You think strategically but you also are hands-on managing delivery details
* Your adept to listening to the consumer and turning customer feedback into improved user experiences
* You have experience working with growth marketing teams and instrumenting the app for measurement and analytics
* You're up on all the latest trends in mobile, payments, and other emerging platforms and you have a strong instinctual sense of where things are going so that you can ensure Reuters continuing success in the future.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Mobile Product Manager****,** if you have:

* 3-5 years of software product management experience, with demonstrated wins
* Experience managing a top 100 app from launch to scale and beyond
* 2+ years of mobile (iOS, Android, web) product management experience
* Strong communication skills, including presentation skills
* Excellent SQL knowledge and can generate data insights yourself
* International experience a plus

**What’s in it For You**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity, and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.

Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

#LI-FP1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

title: Implementation Consultant
description:
**Implementation Consultant, Global Trade** 

Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are an enterprise software, content and services provider of Global Trade and Tax solutions – meaning, we build software to help companies manage international trade and complex tax needs. Our ONESOURCE Global Trade Management software helps companies get their products across borders and into the hands of consumers like you. We’re looking for smart, creative, individuals to work directly with our customers and implement our software. 

  

As an Implementation Consultant you will be driving exciting opportunities interfacing with customers & internal teams while supporting global corporations. Through this experience you will gain a greater understanding and appreciation for how corporations are being run in today’s markets. 

Within this program we offer extensive training, mentoring, and guidance to start you on the path to a successful career in consulting at Thomson Reuters. You will be trained in best practices, methodologies, and gain the technical and functional skills required to participate in enterprise software projects focused on supporting Global Trade, Compliance and Tax departments. These projects include implementation of enterprise software, content, and services to our customers.  You will also be exposed to the ONESOURCE platform and all services provided across our Corporates business. 

As a member of the Professional Services team, you will strive to enable and simplify the work of Global Trade, Compliance and Tax professional in Corporations focusing on Global Trade. 

The Implementation Consultant will work closely with Project Managers to lead implementations of Tax and Global Trade software at client sites in Global Implementations.  This position is part of the Corporates Professional Services department.  We deliver enterprise Global Trade, Compliance and software that provides critical information and software solutions to companies of all sizes. 

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Implementation Consultant, you will:

* Interact with client Global Trade, Compliance, Tax and Technology professionals in Fortune 500 clients
* Lead business and requirements sessions and formulate into design/solution documentation
* Engage with other key teams such as Product Management & Engineering within Thomson Reuters as appropriate to deliver end to end solutions
* Delegate project tasks to junior members of the project in order to ensure delivery of all related requirements
* Prepare and execute test scripts and test cases
* Explain system or tool related issues/problems and solutions to Global Trade, Compliance, Tax & technical staff
* Work with clients to translate their business processes and policy into our Solutions
* Complete tasks and take project ownership with limited supervision
* Perform technical or functional roles on medium to large projects
* Support sales teams by providing product demos

**About You**

* 5+ years relative work experience
* Exposure to Global Trade or Supply Chain Businesses
* Experience with process analysis, design & mapping
* Experience Implementing Enterprise Software including Cloud Solutions and third-party applications
* Experience creating and executing test cases and test scripts
* Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills and know how to share information professionally and concisely
* Must be able to work effectively in a team environment
* Proficient in working with computers and standard business software like Microsoft Office
* Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently
* Ability to be a self-starter
* Creative problem-solving skills & motivated to drive innovation
* Ability to work in a diverse work environment
* Knowledge in SQL programming

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Tax Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Partnership Tax professional to join our development team. As a **Tax Analyst** with Thomson Reuters, you will make an immediate impact on how our customers accomplish their work and grow their advisory business. You will participate in design, development, and testing of our ONESOURCE Tax product line using in-house development tools.  In this role, you will collect, analyze, and prioritize requirements from various subject matter experts from our internal sources to define and make required changes to the ONESOURCE Tax software. It will require working closely with internal teams. The position requires a forward-thinking attitude to implement tax law changes in advance of a typical tax filing season.

**About the Role**  
In this opportunity as a **Tax Analyst** you will:

* Communicate with other internal teams to stay abreast of tax law changes per jurisdiction
* Constant monitoring of IRS and state taxing agency tax law changes by review of Checkpoint and other sources to stay current on impending tax law changes
* Implement changes to existing software
* Design the client interface for the tax planning software
* Write/and or communicate design changes for software engineers
* Test software products
* Write help documentation
* Train supporting help and answer questions

  
**About You**  
You’re a fit for the role of **Tax Analyst** if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field
* Two or more years of Partnership (1065) tax preparation experience
* Extensive knowledge of Partnership tax law - 1065
* Strong written and interpersonal communication skills
* Knowledge of ADO and tracking of work items through multiple teams

**Desired Experience:** 

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) OR Enrolled Agent (EA)
* ONESOURCE Tax a plus

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Learning Editor, Visuals - Reuters
description:
Reuters is looking for an accomplished and dynamic journalist to drive training in visual journalism. You will be part of the global learning team, responsible for designing and delivering virtual and in-person training that supports the ambitions of our video and pictures teams and helps us attract and retain the world’s best, diverse talent.

The successful candidate will help to build on our current visuals’ training curriculum, aligning it with our strategic priorities and client needs. They will help to anticipate and identify where we face the most pressing talent challenges, and implement fresh training approaches to address them. They will have a strong track record in video or pictures, be grounded in the news file, and have a flair for engaging and motivating their peers.

The **Learning Editor, Visuals** will think strategically about training formats – from workshops, masterclasses and on-demand video tutorials, to online campaigns and on-the-job learning initiatives. They will be confident in organising, facilitating or delivering training across a broad range of topics, including outside of their specific visuals remit.

**About the Role**

As the Learning Editor, Visuals you will:

* Work closely with other members of the Global Learning team, the global editors for Video and Pictures, and other senior editors, to design, deliver and coordinate learning programmes.
* Be digitally fluent and be able to explain audiences' shifting needs.
* Work with newsroom leaders to help meet visuals’ strategic objectives, on everything from speed, standards and storytelling, to advanced shooting and pictures editing.
* Be comfortable with technology and be able to support the rollout and adoption of major initiatives like Hive, drones and mirrorless cameras.
* Proactively help anticipate and identify where our most pressing training needs are within the visuals team, and suggest innovative approaches to address them.
* Upskill our visuals team to make it fit for the future and give staff the opportunity to develop throughout their careers.
* Help to drive visuals knowledge across the wider editorial population.
* Produce relevant learning materials in a range of forms – ebriefs, tipsheets, trainer packs, coverage drills, shooting exercises, videos, eLearning modules etc.
* Deliver interactive and engaging training in real or virtual classrooms.

**About You**

To be a Learning Editor, Visuals you are likely to have:

* Extensive experience as a visuals journalist or producer
* Deep knowledge of our visuals systems and technology
* Great news judgment and facility with story-telling across multiple formats
* A strong understanding of our client needs
* Exceptional people and management skills, including an ability to motive staff

**Please note, the deadline for applications is Monday, 23rd January 2023.**

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Arabic Financial Correspondent, Reuters
description:
Reuters is seeking a financial reporter with excellent contact building and strong news judgement to join the Arabic Service in Cairo. The successful candidate will be part of a reporting team to break original news, get exclusives, write quick updates and long-form enterprising stories.

The successful candidate will be able to work fast under pressure without compromising on Reuters’ accuracy. Delivers timely news and insight in line with principles of accuracy, independence and freedom from bias.

As our **Arabic Financial Correspondent****,** you will:

•    Plan, report and write a full range of Reuters stories – from day-to-day news and quick exclusives to longer feature-length pieces  
•    Help Reuters stand out from the competition with scoops, analysis, and insightful journalism  
•    Build a wide range of sources and contacts including from government institutions, companies and banks   
•    Be able to work under pressure in a very fast-paced environment  
•    Work closely with other reporters and editors in Egypt and Sudan bureau, including video and photo colleagues  
•    Coordinate with our Middle East Breaking News Hub to publish alerts and updates  
•    Follow regional events and markets  
•    Monitor Arab and international media and help make changes to keep Reuters ahead on speed and original content  
 

To be our **Arabic Financial Correspondent**, you will likely have:

•    Economic or financial news reporting experience  
•    Excellent source building skills  
•    Excellent command of Arabic and English    
•    Sound news judgement and story conceptualization  
•    Solid understanding of the economy and politics in Egypt and the Middle East  
•    Appetite for investigative reporting  
•    Ambition and quick thinking  
•    Proven ability to work in a team  
•    Commitment to Reuters values of trust and accuracy  
•    Willingness to learn new skills and adapt to new tools and technology  
 

**Please note, the deadline for applications is 15th January 2023.**

**What’s in it for You****?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

title: Project Manager - Africa Region
description:
**Project Manager – Africa Region**

Join a team that has unique expertise combining the power of journalism and the law to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights.

For more than 35 years, we have promoted the highest standards in journalism by training reporters around the world to cover issues relevant to their local context, accurately and impartially. Today, we work to strengthen local and national journalism, improve media ethics, standards and regulation, combat misinformation, and explore and shape the future of the profession. We do this through newsroom consultancy, journalism training and mentoring, capacity-building, and via our funding of the Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism at the University of Oxford.

We provide support to journalists and independent media outlets to produce and distribute high quality journalism in some of the world’s most challenging environments.

We are seeking a Project Manager to join our TRF Programmes Team. The role will be based in South Africa or Kenya.

**Job description**

The Project Manager will help to define the scope and manage a number of projects spread across the African continent. S/he/they will work closely with members of the team to ensure technical and/or business objectives are achieved and the effective delivery of his/her portfolio, including compliance with client and contract requirements. S/he/they will hold responsibility for financial oversight of allocated programmes by coordinating with Project Coordinators, partners and the finance team.

In addition, the position will work closely with our Global Development Team and the Regional Programme Manager for Africa to contribute towards strategic networking and business development opportunities in support of the development of TRF’s work, partners and impact in the Africa region.

**About The Role**

* Delivers projects within the constraints of scope, time and cost to agreed levels of quality, within the organization’s governance and project management framework.
* Produce reports to key stakeholders on programme progress, including preparing narrative, identifying success stories, and providing financial updates to donors.
* Facilitate information sharing within the Programmes Team and with other Foundation units.
* Drive the external profile of the Foundation by representing the Foundation in networks, forums, and project consortia.
* Travel regularly and internationally to monitor programme implementation and ensure programme quality.
* Identify, assesses and manage risks to the success of the project.
* Effectively manage project team conflicts, build collaborative partnerships with stakeholders, and obtain commitment to make decisions.
* Estimates costs, timescales and resource requirements for the successful completion of each project to agreed scope and constraints.
* Prepares and maintains project plans and tracks activities against the plan.
* Implement effective communication plan and operating rhythm, including provision of regular and accurate reports.
* Be at the forefront of latest donor trends in key strategic regions across Africa, and share knowledge across the Programmes and Business Development teams.
* Work closely with the Business Development team to proactively develop a high-quality pipeline for the TRF Africa programme strategy, building key relationships with donors and potential partners.
* Support the Business Development team on funding opportunities through proposal development, activity design and budget planning.

**About You**

* Experience working with a variety of international donors, particularly FDCO, GEC, USAID and  NORAD.  Familiarity with donor reporting requirements.
* Track record in managing successful projects in the international development context.
* Outstanding project or programme management skills, and experience with monitoring and evaluation (building log frames, theories of change).
* Excellent budget and financial management, including fluency in Excel.
* Resilience, ability to cope with high pressure projects and work environments and find solutions to problems when they arise.
* Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
* Ability to quickly understand complex information and communicate to non-experts.
* Excellent interpersonal skills – able to establish and maintain positive working relationships both internally and externally, with people from a wide variety of cultures and backgrounds
* Experience in development of successful funding proposals and securing multi-year, high value income.
* Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written, to capture and share stories of programmatic impact and promote the work of TRF externally.
* Fluency in English; other languages (such as French and Swahili) would be an advantage.

**Desired skills**

* Experience in a role in journalism/media, international relations, international development, politics or relevant field.
* Experience in remote programme management, programme start up, mobilisation and close down.

**What’s in it For You**

At the Thomson Reuters Foundation, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Perspective and Impact**: Interested in working for a dynamic global organization with a focus on social impact? With hubs all over the world from Bangkok to Madrid to Rio de Janeiro, join a truly international team with a shared goal of helping to build societies around the world that are free, fair and informed.
* **A Unique Approach**: Our expertise in media and the law is world class; we combine the power of both to address the critical issues faced by humanity.
* **Our Relevance**: With a focus on advancing media freedom, fostering more inclusive economies and promoting human rights, our work has never been more needed than right now.
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.
* **Learning & Development**: We are dedicated to the continual professional development of our employees and offer access to both in-house and external training opportunities.

**About Thomson Reuters Foundation**

The [Thomson Reuters Foundation](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.trust.org%2F&data=02%7C01%7CJoanna.Uttley%40thomsonreuters.com%7C67c82a1ef32748f2655508d81f70a313%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637293915919654511&sdata=VY7pCJKJcDNw6oyawB26rbdNCfYjjw%2FGq8FiR74mRHk%3D&reserved=0) is corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. As an independent charity, registered in the UK and the USA, we work to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique media and legal services to drive systemic change.

**Applicants must have the right to work in South Africa** **or Kenya**

**Location:** South Africa/Nairobi - Kenya

title: Editorial Intern
description:
**About the position**

Reuters is looking for an editorial intern in Singapore. Reporting to the Deputy Editor for Commodities and Energy in Asia, the successful candidate will work alongside commodities and energy reporters to produce world-class business journalism and gain experience reporting on a wide variety of commodities markets from oil to agriculture to metals.

Full-time Internship Period: Feb - Aug 2023

**About the role**

In this role, you will:

* Write daily market reports covering commodities futures and/or Asian physical oil markets and derivative markets
* Closely monitor buy/sell tenders, physical oil cargo movements from producer centres to consumer hubs, refinery outages
* Report on daily oil product prices in Asia
* Use multimedia as appropriate to tell stories- graphics, pictures and TV
* Work together with large global teams to break news and undertake initiative stories

**About you**

You're a fit for this role if you have:

* Excellent written English; knowledge of Asian languages preferential for content research purposes
* Comfort with maintaining and using databases to generate data-driven stories
* News judgment, ability to write with speed, clarity and accuracy
* Proven ability to report and execute initiative stories
* Strong data handling & analysis skills

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days

title: Senior Training Consultant
description:
The Senior Training Consultant is responsible for training end users, partners and clients as well as developing training and learning curriculum in the use of our 3E products, applications, and processes. Their responsibilities include but are not limited to planning, designing, and developing training materials, participants & facilitator guides, learning activities and exercises, know the content before training facilitation of the training program, and provide developmental feedback learners.

Aside from being an expert in their area of specialty, the Senior Training Consultant needs to be able to communicate with learners during the training process, delivering training in a classroom, remote, or hands-on application setting in a clear and concise manner, and ensure that the learners can apply their training in real-world work settings. 

**About the Role:**

In this role as a **Senior Training Consultant**, you will:

* Design, develop, and deliver both live and web-based sessions to enhance usage of Thomson Reuters products by leveraging understanding of customer needs
* Support development of course materials, training documentation, or other educational content, as required
* Build and maintain client relationships supporting their use and application of Thomson Reuters products
* Collaborate with peer trainers and consultants as part of an agile squad aligned by customer workflow
* Maintain up to date knowledge on product enhancements and changes
* Manage logistics for designated engagements (calendar, registration, attendance tracking, facility set-up, etc.)
* Participate in training program development; develops questions, learning objectives and certification exams
* Work with experts in product development, technical support, sales and marketing to ensure that course content reflects current product features
* Act as a mentor to newly hired trainers with planned training schedule and activities
* Educate and coach staff, partners and clients on the system application processes and provide relevant application tips to improve efficiency
* Provide end-user follow up assistance and support as planned and escalates to Training Manager
* Partner with Training Director to assist with organizing, prioritizing, and scheduling training program and project/work assignments

**About You**

You’re a fit for the **Senior Training Consultant** if you have:

* Bachelor's degree in Education, Information Technology, English, Communications is required, or equivalent work experience
* Working knowledge of 3E is required
* Product Training experience providing cross-functional coordination for adult training principles
* Expertise in creating, researching, designing/writing, or improving training programs or curriculums (classroom and virtual)
* Prior experience with rolling out complex training programs to employees and clients is highly desired
* Experience building and maintaining collaborative relationships with internal personnel, business owners, and stakeholders
* Experience presenting training to stakeholders
* An understanding of various law firm workflows is highly desired
* Intermediate proficiency with Windows based application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, as well as SharePoint)
* Preferred experience leading training efforts
* Certifications or credentialing experience a plus

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Técnico de Sucesso do Cliente
description:
**Técnico de Sucesso do Cliente,** Legal

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Técnico de Sucesso do Cliente em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

O *Técnico de Sucesso do Cliente* da Thomson Reuters  foca em fortalecer a parceria com os nossos clientes e garantir que eles possam maximizar seus resultados e extrair os melhores benefícios.  Acompanhamos todo o processo do cliente, garantindo adoção, retenção e satisfação  com os produtos e serviços da unidade de Legal Professional, para isso procuramos por profissionais inovadores e altamente motivados para trabalhar conosco.

Se você ama grandes desafios, gosta de se comunicar, é criativo e determinado venha fazer parte do nosso time!

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como **Técnico de Sucesso do Cliente**, você irá:

* Ser um canal de comunicação direta com os nossos clientes, estreitando o relacionamento e acompanhando a qualidade das soluções e serviços prestados;
* Auxiliar aos clientes a maximizar seus resultados e extrair os melhores benefícios de nossas ferramentas
* Desenvolver e aplicar as melhores práticas de Customer Success;
* Identificar pontos de contato que possam atuar como promotores ao longo da jornada do cliente;
* Diagnosticar riscos na retenção e atuar com foco na satisfação dos nossos clientes;
* Estabelecer uma relação estratégica e de confiança com clientes e parcerios;
* Ser o porta voz do cliente em contato com outras áreas do negócio;
* Garantir a entrega de valor contínuo.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Ensino Superior Completo ou Cursando em Direito ou áreas correlatas;
* Excelentes habilidades interpessoais, de comunicação e relacionamento;
* Experiência prévia com atendimento a clientes;
* Conhecimento de rotinas de um escritório de advocacia;
* Inglês Intermediário.

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos na empresa; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio , relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.
* **Remuneração**: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.

**#LI-ML1#**

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

title: Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations in Tax
description:
We are seeking a **Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations** to become a member of our International Tax team in Toronto. This role will be focusing on transfer pricing and valuations. It will be involved in multiple aspects of transfer pricing and valuations for intercompany transactions. This individual will report to the Vice President of Transfer Pricing. The role assumes significant on the job training, and work in a supportive team environment with access to continuous learning and professional growth and development.**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations**, you will:

* Assist VP Transfer Pricing with valuations of assets, business and shares, as well as quantitative modeling around transfer pricing.
* Analyze and research various Transfer Pricing and valuation issues arising from general business operations, restructurings driven by business or other strategic needs.
* Assist with a variety of projects, including: 
	+ global intercompany transactions arising from business operations or restructurings, and other general or strategic needs,
	+ integration of acquired assets and businesses,
	+ ensuring appropriate transfer pricing within parameters of transfer pricing principles and existing company policies,
	+ global tax compliance and transfer pricing tax audits globally.
* Develop a good understanding of various business processes through communications with the business teams, and other corporate groups including Legal, Treasury and Finance.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Analyst, Transfer Pricing and Valuations** if your background includes:

* A degree in finance or economics. In the alternative, a CBV designation (or CBV student) could be considered.
* A minimum of 3 years of experience in transfer pricing, economic analysis or valuation.
* Excellent modelling skills (working knowledge of excel is a must).
* Knowledge of accounting is a big plus
* A strong sense of ownership and attention to detail.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
***Executive Assistant*** para ***Thomson Reuters Argentina***

¡Queremos que seas parte de nuestro equipo de **South LatAm** en Thomson Reuters!

**¿Cuáles son las principales responsabilidades?**

* Manejo de la agenda del Director
* Administración de tarjetas de crédito
* Rendiciones de gastos recurrentes
* Organización de eventos
* Coordinación de visitas y asistencia en viajes
* Colaboración con el área de negocio

**Requisitos de la posición:**

* Ingles intermedio/avanzado
* Manejo de PowerPoint
* Manejo de Outlook y agendas
* 3 años de experiencia en posiciones similares
* Excelentes habilidades interpersonales

***¿Qué te proponemos?***

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad) 

🏥 Pre paga para vos y tu grupo familiar primario

💰 Subsidio internet mensual

🚀 Flex my way (trabajá desde donde quieras dentro del pais – 8 semanas al año)

🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)

🎁 Day off cumpleaños 

🍴 Servicio de vending in office

🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)

⌨ Allowance Home Office (one time) – compra de equipamiento 

🌅 Viernes flex de verano

💻 Equipamiento de trabajo

Nos diferenciamos por tener una **cultura centrada en la diversidad e inclusión**, gran compromiso en el **respeto & bienestar** de los colaboradores, y por sobre todo, un **excelente clima laboral** para que disfrutes la experiencia de trabajar en Thomson Reuters.

title: Client Manager, Inside SLF - FindLaw
description:
The Client Manager, FindLaw is responsible for developing and maintaining ongoing client relationships in order to achieve client and revenue retention goals within an assigned, territory or team.  This will be done by proactive and reactive management for each assigned account, close partnership with Field Consultants, and working cross functionally with all areas of FindLaw and across other Thomson Reuters departments that support our business.  The position will be based out of Eagan, MN.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Client Manager, FindLaw, you will:

* **Drive Results:** Secure contract renewals for assigned portfolio of customers and meet monthly renewal volume and revenue requirements by providing first class customer care for all clients
* **Consultation:** Ensure client retention and satisfaction with a select portfolio of accounts by proactively identifying problem areas, trends and opportunities, and recommend plan of action to client and/or stakeholders
* **Communication:** Provide account analytics and insight and recommend a plan of action and provide timely and proactive status updates to clients/stakeholders for all projects in process
* **Collaboration:**  Act as primary, internal, point of contact for assigned accounts and establish strong working relationships with clients, Field Consultants and other internal partners/stakeholders

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Client Manager, FindLaw if you have:

* A four-year degree required
* Minimum of 2 years client management and/or sales and marketing experience
* Proven success with retention of client population and associated revenue
* Well-developed negotiation skills and ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts required
* Strong communication and presentation skills, especially via telephone, required
* The ability to multitask, prioritize, and follow through in accordance with service level agreements.
* An understanding of digital marketing concepts and processes preferred
* An understanding and/or experience working with the legal industry preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

·       **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

·       **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

·       **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

·       **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

·       **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

·       **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Thomson Reuters is looking for a highly motivated Senior Product Manager to join the team responsible for driving tax solutions with Thomson Reuters flagship Direct Tax portfolio. In this role, you will work closely with product management and business unit leadership to define product strategy, execution and drive customer satisfaction and growth. You will drive the definition and development of Direct tax solutions for Tax firms, including Big 4, and collaborate to define innovative solutions.

This person is a talented, ambitious, self-directed enterprise-software product leader with Corporate Tax expertise to guide products from conception to launch and all stages of the product lifecycle. As a senior leader, you will be responsible for defining and creating valuable new products and features deeply rooted in customer needs to maximize product line profitability. You’ll define the product strategy and vision, work with customers to prioritize unmet user needs, and collaborate with a cross-functional team to launch products to the market.  
 

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Senior Product Manager, you will:

* Driving product solution vision and strategy to support the deployment of ONESOURCE  Income Tax and Tax Provision solutions in global markets for Accounting and Tax firms integrating with ONESOURCE Income Tax, ONESOURCE Corporate Tax and partner products. Enabling revenue generation across sub-segments by ensuring high-quality product features and services are delivered to new and existing geographies and customers.
* Deliver best-in-class solutions to support corporate tax departments to access and aggregate information from multiple sources, high performance and capable tax provision calculations, integration with tax departments compliance solutions and unparallel visibility to enable tax planning.
* Capture customer requirements, Conceptualize solutions, conduct market and competitive research, Plan product, and launch activities.
* Drive strategic initiatives related to the success of the Tax Provision solution, such as fit within the product portfolio, integration opportunities, product rationalization, and API strategy.
* Support customer segment channel and marketing organizations through Channel training, Regular and clear communication of product value and developments, and marketing new product features.
* Own the product definition, design, development, and business success championing tax products to prospects, customers, and internal stakeholders.
* Apply product management, industry, and market expertise to develop the product roadmap and provide thought leadership on emerging industry trends.
* Partner with Strategy, Sales, customers, internal stakeholders, Direct Tax and Platform  Product Managers, internal stakeholders, and customers to validate requirements and priorities and refine requirements for the broad market.
* Work with architecture, technical leads and user experience to determine the right technical solutions to develop faster, better and cost-effective solutions.
* Manage complete product lifecycle, including market requirements, product release plans, user story and success criteria authoring, and product launch activities.
* Work with key stakeholders (Product Management, Marketing, Proposition, Support and more) on collateral and campaigns, ensuring a well-planned and executed go-to-market strategy.
* Collaborate with user experience, product development, operations, service, and support departments and define product design and plans that align with product priorities and meet market demand.
* Prioritize work and make strategic tradeoff decisions during the development cycle, focusing on delivering immediate business value with shorter release cycles.
* Monitor market changes and trends to formulate and communicate competitive product positioning and identify opportunities for current and future business consideration.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Product Manager if your background includes:

* The position requires a blend of tax, accounting, and technology expertise.
* Driven to put customers at the center of discovery, design, prioritization and realize it with a quality work product that meets the highest standards.
* Demonstrate strong business acumen throughout the product management lifecycle.
* Self-starter who understands how to deal with ambiguity and priorities effectively.
* Strong analytic skills are required, including interpreting customer and segment leads needs into application and operational requirements.
* Collaborative team player with adept at resolving team conflicts, managing negotiations, providing feedback, and driving change management practices to achieve required outcomes.
* Required experience in Agile Scrum Agile Development Methodology focusing on the daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and consistently improving maturity in agile practices.
* Solid communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Bachelor’s degree in a technical or business-related field required. CPA  or other advanced degree preferred. Expertise in Corporate Tax,  financial close, and experience with Tax firms is a plus.
* 5+ years of relevant work experience delivering results in complex enterprise software, Familiarity with TR’s legal and Tax product portfolio in product management, proposition, or solution role a plus.
* Strong project management background and ability to manage a cross-functional team to deliver software releases.
* Experience with Agile / Scrum software development desired.
* Software as a Service (SaaS) business experience is highly desired.
* Demonstrated ability to bring a new product to market in a competitive environment.
* Demonstrated ability to define the product roadmap, translate business problems and customer needs into product requirements, and launch products to stakeholders, the market, and customers.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Tax Print Specialist (MN, MI, or TX)
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? We’re looking for experienced Sales Reps to join our Tax & Accounting sales team in Eagan, MN; Dallas, TX, or Ann Arbor, MI.

The Print Tax Specialist representative will be responsible for inbound and outbound calls in his or her respective territory. Reps will be calling on existing print tax customers to place yearly orders & cross-sell. The reps will also be responsible for finding new business through targeted campaigns.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Tax Print Specialist you will: 

* Selling print tax products and services to existing customers and new prospects
* Discuss the use of products, emphasizing product features based on analyses of customers' needs and on technical knowledge of product capabilities
* Maintain activity level of 50+ customer calls/emails per day
* Continuously work with management to refine sales strategy to optimize efficiency and results and initiate sales campaigns in order to meet sales expectations
* Learn and thoroughly understand Tax & Accounting products and services
* Understand how Tax & Accounting products are used in the Accounting, Tax and Finance industry to better present and sell Tax & Accounting products to meet the customers' needs
* Negotiate and close new and renewal business
* Meet or exceed assigned monthly & yearly quotas
* Ensure an accurate and timely process for maintaining customer account information and closing pricing transactions
* Maintain accurate and timely customer information with Sales Operations, Customer Service and Technical Support groups

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Tax Print Specialist if you:

* Bachelor’s degree or 2+ years successful professional sales experience in a related environment. Business-to-business preferred
* Ability to utilize effective selling skills
* Must be driven, passionate and achievement oriented and motivated by success
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quota target
* Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Ability to quickly learn technical content in nature and be able to explain and communicate value proposition effectively
* Effective time management skills
* Tax and Accounting background preferred
* Must be able to travel to tradeshows as needed

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:

* ### **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* ### **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* ### **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* ### **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sales Executive Legal Tracker/HighQ Corporates SMB (Remote)
description:
**Title:**  Sales Executive Legal Tracker/HighQ Corporates SMB (Remote)

**About the Role**:

In this opportunity you will:

* Sell Thomson Reuters Legal Tracker, HighQ, and Document Intelligence to prospective Corporate Legal (and related) Departments.
* Work East Coast Selling Hours (This is a SouthEast Territory)
* Meet new sales quota
* Conduct face-to-face/web-based appointments
* Conduct pre-demo qualifying calls/conversations and short demos
* Maintain a pipeline of at least 1.5x quota
* Prospect, sell and build pipeline for Legal Tracker, HighQ, and Document Intelligence
* Establish and maintain strong sales partnership with sales partners
* Update salesforce.com daily and regularly and utilize as only CRM tool

**About You:** 

You're a fit for the role if you have:

* Sales Skills: Ability to navigate complex software and solutions sales cycle
* New business mining, prospecting and cold calling skills: develop a high volume of new business opportunities
* Consultative Selling Skills: build credibility and trust in order to navigate a complex sales cycle
* Business Acumen: strong understanding of our customers’ business and industry
* Effective sales presentation skills: effectively present the product and value propositions
* Forecasting Skills: ability to forecast accurately
* Team Communication: collaborate and communicate regularly and effectively within team and cross-functionally with other departments
* Relationship and Influencing Skills: ability to build relationships with, and influence all levels within an organization, including senior management.
* Commitment to People: professional, courteous, respectful and friendly
* Collaboration/Partnership: team oriented, generous with sharing best practices and feedback; ability to be fluid and creative working with prospects and internally rather than within a rigid structure
* Customer first: customer-centric mentality
* Integrity: operates honestly and with high standard of ethics
* Delivering results: focused and able to take initiative, motivated, self-starter
* Positive attitude: enthusiasm, energy, passion, curiosity. Open and adaptable to change
* Minimum of 5 years direct field sales experience (sales experience in the corporate sector preferred) with proven, exemplary track record of sales quota overachievement
* Experience and track record in software sales
* 4 year college degree required, Law degree a plus
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations. 10-20% travel required.

**What's in it for you!**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
