title: Project Manager, End User Compute
description:
**EUC Project Manager, End User Compute Portfolio, Employee Technical Services**

Do you enjoy bringing technology strategies from ideas to reality? Do you find purpose in enabling others to perform their best work? Thomson Reuters Employee Experience Technology Team is seeking a Project Manager to be based in our Bangalore or Hyderabad office area to coordinate the delivery of company End User Compute technology initiatives.

The End User Compute Project Manager is responsible for assisting in driving global project plans to improve the Thomson Reuters end user experience by introducing new products and services to our Employees and Partners. The Project Manager champions the introduction of new and efficient ways of using physical, virtual and desktop technology services in our day-to-day work environment. The Project Manager will create and drive testing plans, holding all project team members, partners, business testers and associated teams accountable for all assigned work and action items, identifying risks and gaps in use case testing and ensuring remediation, communicating updates and summaries upwards and laterally, engaging with business stakeholders as necessary, and collaborating with external partners to ensure all parties remain synchronized.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Project Manager, End User Compute, you will:

* **Be a Technology Partner for Change** Be the face of exciting initiatives to provide our teams with the latest physical and virtual desktop technologies to perform their best work. Inspire and drive business groups to participate to convert technology vision into reality and validate business use cases. Team members to partner with may include Project teams, Service Management, Architects, 3rd Party Providers, Sourcing and Contracts teams, IT Security, HR, Finance, and Business Stakeholders.
* **Be a Problem Solver** Use sound judgment and assertiveness to demonstrate business benefits and to ensure decisions are fully understood and accepted. Make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer quantitative and qualitative data.
* **Be a Strategic and Critical Thinker** Balance the big-picture view with connecting the dots, details and interdependencies to build and implement testing plans with a high potential for effectiveness and success. Avoid potential issues by identifying strategic and operational risk and implementing mitigation measures.
* **Be an Effective Organizational Communicator** Communicate the best level of information with the appropriate level of detail at the right time based on the stakeholder or group. Listen to perspective and concerns, form options, recommendations, and messaging, and be highly accountable in response. Know when and how to challenge with alternatives.
* **Be a Champion for Innovation** Challenge the status quo, offer new ideas and encourage others to share theirs. Lead the exploration, testing and implementation of new methods balanced with measured risk mitigation. Demonstrate and encourage resiliency with any results and always maintain team morale.
* **Be an Effective Cross Functional Partner** Build and maintain relationships across the company. Learn what other teams do and how they operate. Ask what you can do to make inter-team working processes even better. Seek functionally diverse perspective and input where critical or valuable.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Project Manager, End User Compute Service Strategy, if your background includes:

* 6+ years of proven experience as a Project Manager of technology initiatives
* Working knowledge of Compute/Desktop operating systems (PC and Mac), Cloud hosted services, Virtual Desktop products such as Citrix, VMware, Amazon WorkSpaces, Amazon EC2 Mac, Windows 365
* Proven results delivering projects within the constraints of scope, time, cost, to agreed levels of quality and fulfilling all business requirements
* Ability to define, scope, and manage global projects at or above $1 million in value and spanning 6-12+ months
* Work with multiple teams that may have differing priorities and working/cultural practices
* Effective management of project team conflicts, building collaborative partnerships with stakeholders, and obtaining commitment to make decisions
* Effective preparation and maintenance of project plans and tracking of activities against the plan
* Working Knowledge of financial and commercial models which govern technology service contracts and license agreements
* Proven strong Critical Thinking, Written and Oral communication skills

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: work form anywhere; caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: #2 Operator in Bindery (3rd shift)
description:
We are hiring an experienced #2 Bindery Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a #2 Bindery Operator**,** you will be responsible for reviewing job specifications, performing set-up tasks, monitoring the equipment and troubleshooting on our Core Publishing Solutions team. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months.  **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 3rd shift – 10:30 pm – 6:30 am
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a #2 Bindery Operator, you will be responsible for:   

* Reviewing job specifications for material and set-up requirements
* Performing or delegating/overseeing set-up tasks
* Monitoring the equipment and product through the job run to ensure a high-quality product
* Performing moderately complex trouble-shooting related to product or equipment
* Communicating effectively during shift and at shift hand-off
* Evaluating mechanical condition of equipment, completing preventative maintenance, involving Maintenance as needed
* Using computer-based workflows applications to manage files
* Accurately documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, etc
* Accurately marking, verifying and tagging loads correctly to ensure inventory accuracy
* Providing work direction to others, whether direct crew or other individuals in the workstream
* Actively participating in company safety programs and contributing to a safe culture
* Performing training as needed
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures
* Generating, implementing, performing and sustaining continuous improvement ideas as well as housekeeping procedures to maintain work area
* Participating in project teams as needed
* Providing back up for other operators to cover absences or breaks
* Recommending and implementing process improvements

**About You:** 

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Experience leading and training others
* Experience working in an industrial setting with a wide range of production machinery
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot, make decisions and resolve machine issues
* Experience with Lean and continuous improvement
* Competent with rulers and measurement
* Good communication skills
* Able to run multiple pieces of equipment
* Experience on Perfect Binders with up to 40 station collators, 3-knife trimmers, inline boxing and palletizing
* Experience with hard-cover casing-in lines, collating/kitting lines with up to 30 streamfeeder stations, packaging/cartooning lines, Sitma mail lines, Aster sewing equipment and hot foil stampers
* Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Can regularly stand, walk, crouch, bend, reach and kneel
* Can wear Personal Protective Equipment including steel toe shoes and ear protection
* Able to pass a background check and drug test, as applicable for the role

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year, shift premium of 3rd shift - $4.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

  

**Bonus:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success 

 #LI-PK1

title: Legal Counsel (MSP or DAL)
description:
We are currently seeking a **Legal Counsel** with a proven record of customer service and a practical, problem-solving approach to providing commercial legal services in a technology-enabled, data-driven corporate, legal department. The successful candidate needs to be a hands-on commercial lawyer with experience with U.S. government contracts, and exceptional communication skills, capable of providing sound legal and business advice and counsel to sales professionals, product management, and other internal customers. The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying and analyzing legal issues, drafting and negotiating documents, presenting commercially viable recommendations, and assuring legal compliance. When dealing with internal or external customers, the successful candidate will seek to enhance the customer experience and simplify the customer’s interaction with the legal function.

This opportunity is with Thomson Reuters based in either, Minneapolis−Saint Paul, or Dallas. The role sits within the Customers & Commercial team of the Thomson Reuters General Counsel Office, a highly collaborative team focused on enabling business growth and mitigating risk for the customer-centric commercial group. To be successful in this role you should have the experience and capability to handle a broad range of legal and compliance matters.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Legal Counsel**, you will:

* Review, draft, and negotiate a wide range of customer facing and partner agreements, primarily complex software (including SaaS) and information licensing agreements, re-distribution, hosting, content acquisition, consulting and professional services agreements, non- disclosure agreements and other commercial agreements relating to sales of Thomson Reuters products and services.
* Work within the Customers & Commercial team identifying legal, regulatory and compliance requirements and risks associated with various business initiatives and developing and implementing appropriate mitigation strategies. Work with members of the General Counsel Office on enterprise-wide legal issues and projects.
* Operate within policy guidelines and requirements set for Thomson Reuters lawyers to ensure compliance and consistency.
* Research and respond to general legal inquiries from Thomson Reuters internal customers that relate to corporate, commercial, intellectual property and compliance matters, including privacy-related matters, and advise business on appropriate legal action to be taken.
* Contribute know-how to the group’s Knowledge Management initiatives and help to build an open knowledge sharing culture.
* Provide practical and insightful business and strategic advice, leveraging experience in the practice of law and the legal profession.
* Undertake other reasonable duties as requested.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Legal Counsel** if your background includes:

* 3-5 years post qualification experience in private practice and/or as in-house legal counsel advising on the sell rather than the buy side
* Excellent technical legal knowledge in contract and commercial law, particularly with SaaS products and solutions.
* Experience negotiating contracts with U.S. Government customers.
* Excellent negotiation and drafting skills.
* Excellent written/verbal communication skills. Ability to positively influence behavior of multiple stakeholders.
* Ability to think strategically and creatively, to identify and resolve legal issues.
* Excellent communication, organization, and analytical skills, and an aptitude for problem-solving Ability to think strategically and creatively, to identify and resolve legal issues, desire and ability to quickly learn about Thomson Reuters’ products and services, and its internal processes and organizational structure.
* Ability to successfully work in a team environment and in a matrixed organization and ability to build rapport and trust with both internal and external stakeholders. Ability to juggle multiple matters at once and work independently in a fast-paced environment and prioritize accordingly. Ability to exercise good judgement on when to seek help and where to find appropriate resources to solve problems.
* Authorized to practice law.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Director of Global Reader Revenue - Reuters Professional
description:
**Director of Global Reader Revenue - Reuters Professional**

**This hybrid role can be completed from either our London or New York offices.**

The **Director of Global Reader Revenue, Reuters Professional**, will be responsible for driving reader revenue and audience engagement/development both on and off our range of platforms. **Reuters Professional** is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news with impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

**About the Role**

As our **Director of Global Reader Revenue****,** you will:

* Analyze audience data to establish the scale of different audience groupings and customer cohorts to inform product development.
* Develop and execute a global audience strategy
* Create a strategy and lead Reuters entry into new reader revenue streams
* Articulate the value of highly-engaged audiences to advertising sales.
* Partner with product teams to deploy the right tools to build relationships with the Reuters audience (i.e. content personalization and machine learning).
* Partner with product teams to optimize the on and off platform experience to drive audience acquisition and monetization.
* Partner with editorial teams and customers to develop, test and launch new content services and products aimed at increasing audience volume and engagement.
* People management:  Guide development of a high performing team ensuring they receive sufficient structured training, monitoring and mentoring as appropriate.
* Play a core role on Professional leadership team, influencing direction and strategy over time.

**Key areas of responsibility include:**

* Serving as the voice and champion of our professional audience.
* Utilizing data and continual testing to drive continuous improvement in average revenue per user (ARPU) and customer experience metrics.
* Partnering with editorial and product teams to modify, enhance and create services and products with the goal of increasing audience volume and engagement.
* Providing the thought leadership and implementation strategy for new revenue streams.

**Key Deliverables:**

* Develop an audience proposition with insight to guide product development
* Devise and deliver a Customer Voice Program across all markets that frequently gathers customer feedback, generates actionable insights and converts to business improvements.
* Reader revenue and ARPU targets
* Customer churn and retention targets
* Customer CPA and LTV targets
* Continue to test models and solutions with A/B parallel approach
* Expand and enhance existing offerings (newsletters, verticals, new services)
* Data driven analysis to continually improve engagement

**About You**

To be our **Director of Global Reader Revenue** you will have:

* Proven leadership experience working in the online media sector, ideally with strong record of accomplishments in the news or media sector
* Proven ability to think strategically about business opportunities and future customer needs in the media industry
* Ability to work effectively at detailed level with product requirements and delivery against customer needs
* Proven track record in audience development and acquisition, ideally within an international news or business environment
* Extensive data analytical skills
* Proven track record of success working in complex and highly matrixed corporate business environments
* Experience working in a global organization.

**Please be advised that the deadline for applications is 23:59 on Sunday 5th February 2023.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

title: Associate Quality Assurance and E-File Analyst
description:
The ONESOURCE - Gosystem - Associate Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the testing of assigned projects for various ONESOURCE/Gosystem Income tax products. The Analyst will review functional test plans; develop control data, templates, and calculations to validate software features.   
Any Bachelor's degree in accounting/finance/business.  
 Relevant of 2-4 Years U.S. Tax experience in preparation of 1120 or 1065 returns is mandatory.   
Independently, the candidate must be able to analyze and resolve complex tax software problems, document software deficiencies and understand the business/customer requirements.  
   
Shift timings need to be flexible as per business requirement.   
Essential Day-to-Day Responsibilities:  
 * Strong computer skills.
* Strong analytical and diagnostic abilities.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Provide quality assurance of assigned products including the systems that create, measure and maintain these products.
* Candidate should be to analyze the data in the locators/scenarios for the correctness of the software and review various functional test plans. Should be able to test the **software for correct tax calculations.**
* Candidate must be independently able to analyze and resolve complex tax **software problems**, document software deficiencies and understand the business/customer requirements.
* Candidate would be working on support to US developers on **Support calls** by assisting on **heat cases.**
* Evaluate design, specifications, and processes from the perspective of the customer through testing of products.
* Candidates need to test the software on **various releases** in maintenance and production phases.
* Candidate should be able to work in pressure oriented atmosphere and should be able to work on multi tasking.
* Should be able to meet the deadlines given and report to the seniors and Team lead.
* Candidates need to work on Regression testing manually as well as using MTB test banks.
* Candidate should be able to do the critical regression after each release to the clients in the production.
* Assist in the creation of documentation and enforcement of product and performance standards.
* Perform content-related and end-user testing of products.
* Identify and investigate problems encountered through the testing process.
* Previous Quality Assurance testing experience is added advantage
* Exposure to GoSystem Tax software is added value
* Should be proficient in **US Tax Technicals**.

**Shift timings :** 2PM to 11PM ISTDo you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? title: Senior Product Manager, Sports & Special Events
description:
**Senior Product Manager – Sports and Special Events**

**This full-time position will be based in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.**

Are you an innovator? Want to be part of a team developing some of the most exciting products in the world of sport and special events? Keen to be part of a global team? This might be the role for you.

**Reuters** are seeking a **Senior Product Manager** to develop our **Sports and Special Event** products. You'll be working on our **flagship sports wires** that supply newsrooms with material from the world’s top sporting events in text, pictures, video, graphics and more. As our **Senior Product Manager**, you’ll also work on our Special Events products. These are specific services related to large, planned occasions including major global sporting events and political elections. Our business and clients are truly global. As a **Senior Product Manager for Sports and Special Events**, you’ll collaborate with our matrixed, multi-cultural and multidisciplinary teams whilst working a range of external clients that reflect that same diversity.

**Reuters’ Sports and Special Events** products are constantly evolving and we’re looking for someone that’s keen to work in an innovative space. You’ll be working on new and exciting products and will be instrumental in allowing **Reuters** to expand beyond its traditional newsroom clients. As such, natural curiosity and desire to innovate and evolve our data, technology, and business approach is a must. 

**About the Role**

As **Senior Product Manager – Sports and Special Events,** you will:

* Act as the key product stakeholder for all Sports products, ensuring the voice of the customer is heard in every step of development and with our editorial teams and partners.
* Act as an escalation point for all product issues, particularly as a sounding board and guide for our front-line sales organization.
* Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the overall health of the product to identify new opportunities for improvement.
* Work with editorial, technology, legal, marketing, customer support, and other teams to ensure that our practices, templates, and procedures keep our product best in class and make us an easy company to do business with.
* Manage exceptions and unexpected changes to the product and operations.
* Work with the wider Thomson Reuters organization to develop, support and ensure adherence to corporate level best practices.
* Manage a range of internal and external relationships. These include prospective and existing clients; Reuters Editorial; our content partners (such as USA Today, Field Level Media & STATS-Perform) and a range of sales, product and marketing teams within Thomson Reuters.

**About You**

As **Senior Product Manager – Sports and Special Events**, it’s likely that you:

* Have demonstrable experience in developing new products as a Product Manager or by working in a similar cross-functional capacity, potentially from a news, media, digital, data, sports content, or technology focus.
* Are a great listener. We’re looking for someone who actively listens to their customers and takes feedback into decision making processes.
* Are an excellent communicator that’s comfortable interacting with our high-profile customers and partners on a global scale. We’re looking for someone with a global mindset and the ability to adapt their communication styles to respect and engage effectively with different cultures.
* Can effectively use data and analytics to set key success metrics and monitor your products’ performance efficiently. We're looking for someone who can demonstrate an interest in the data and technology that powers our products (such as news metadata, machine learning, AI, sports analytics or election polling).
* Are comfortable influencing cross-functional teams without formal authority. We’re looking for a collaborator that can keep our customer’s needs at heart. As such, we're looking for someone that's comfortable challenging the status quo when needed.

**Please Note: Completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 (GMT) on Sunday 22nd January 2023.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sr. Systems Engineer
description:
* Analyzes customer problems of high complexity
* Assesses scope of impact
* Mitigates customer impact of issues and defines, reviews, and executes work arounds
* Identifies options for problem resolution and initiates action
* Engages others as appropriate and escalates as required
* Provides advice or training to users about the application systems' functionality, correct operation or constraints, and corrects user faults
* Liaises with various application development and content teams, customer service teams, and other software and hardware support teams.
* Proactively monitors production and nonproduction environments and/or applications
* Provides input for technical plans and solutions.
* Provides technical guidance to less experience analysts
* Has in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline or area and provides subject matter expertise
* Provides task directions to other analysts.
* Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or application problems of high complexity.
* Works on medium to large, moderately complex projects/issues that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
* Leads project planning sessions with team members where there are projects within the scope of the support team.
* Manages multiple and sometimes competing priorities.
* Prepares status updates for customer problems or projects.
* Regularly communicates and shares knowledge with rest of the team.
* Performs actions aligned with defined standards
* The following are required for some positions but not all:
* Develops, configures, or supports tools for system monitoring and/or troubleshooting.\*
* Develops software application modules using disciplined software development processes in order to fix a problem and to communicate the changes effectively.\*
* Carries out unit testing and implements application modules they have developed or modified, ensuring application meets needs of client and business. \*
* Provides ongoing maintenance of either mainframe or client/server applications or tools, depending upon projects with which previously have experience.\*

title: Software QA Engineer
description:
* Provides input for the planning, integration, casing, scripting, and execution of all testing required of a single software change or project.
* Provides the complete Test planning document for assigned project.
* Reviews business requirements and designs specifications for low to moderately complex changes/systems for completeness and testability.
* Develops, writes and maintains the test plans, develops test scripts for automation for assigned projects.
* Conducts testing using company-specific, manual, programmatic or automated processes.
* Executes test scripts/cases and communicates the results of testing.
* Provides inputs and escalates issues in bug triage meetings and coordinates with development team if required under the guidance of the Lead.
* Tests modules of larger software products or smaller stand-alone software products to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects.
* Develops software to test Applications.
* Leverages technical solutions on assigned projects.
* Stays current with industry trends and identifies technologies that will impact the business.
* May lead project sub team.
* This may include responsibility for training staff.
* Some roles are responsible for limited coordination of the work of others.
* Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or problems of moderate complexity.
* Works on small to medium complex projects/issues that require a singular area of expertise.
* Typically works in a single QA team, as a member of the team.
* Works on projects/changes of minimal to medium complexity.
* Estimates effort required for own work
* Identifies risk, comes up with mitigation plans, and implements the same.
* Reports progress on problem resolution to management.
* Recommends improvements to the testing processes to create efficiencies.

title: Associate Content Technical Specialist
description:
**Associate Content Technical Specialist | Content Operations**

The Associate Content Specialist participates in an Editorial or Content Operations team and assists in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).

**About the Role**

    As Associate Content Technical Specialist, you will:

* **Publishing:** Performs duties such as analyzing, keying, converting, coding, copyreading, editing, merging, rendering, loading, or validation of data.
* Supports team publishing goals by meeting deadlines.
* **Quality Control:**Responsible for accuracy and completeness of work product. All work will be checked until competent process knowledge is developed.
* **Individual and Team Skills:**Attends and participates in team meetings, prioritizes own work, and participates in the performance management process (e.g. peer reviews, self-evaluation).
* **Content acquisition**: Duties may include acquisition of manuscripts or core content, analysis of manuscripts and electronic files, coding (mark-up of data) and resolving coding errors, manuscript editing, compiling and editing of content, proofreading and copy reading, quality control and verification.

**About You**

You're fit for the role of Associate Content Technical Specialist if you're background includes:

* Bachelor's degree holder (required)
* Strong English language skills, including college level vocabulary, spelling, punctuation and grammar and sentence structure
* Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with internal and/or external contacts.
* Skilled in the use of personal computers and familiarity with multiple software packages, including word processing and file management applications
* Ability to prioritize and stay focused while dealing with multiple assignments
* Detail-oriented with an aptitude for analysis and problem solving on an individualized level and within the context of a team environment
* Ability to successfully work in a team environment
* Candidates must be willing to work Mckinley Hill Taguig – HYBRID SET Up (2days in the office and 3 days at home)
* Must be willing to work on any shift and shifting schedule. (morning / mid / night shift)
* Open to Fresh Graduates

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Content Technical Specialist
description:
**Responsibilities**:

* Creates books/booklets using InDesign and/or Illustrator. Content for layout would mostly be in word (or) xml. Familiarity with both types of content (word/xml) would be desirable, but not mandatory.
* Creates images, basis editorial requests and other imaging tasks which may include retouching/preparation, depending upon editorial requirements
* Ensure internal expectations are met. Work with colleagues to identify and improve processes and communication to help the fulfilment of books/ image designs requested.
* Would need to collaborate/work extensively with Product owners, in ensuring that key requirements are properly communicated to the design team (or) in certain instances, take upon the said role of communication.

**Technical / Professional Skills & Competencies**

* Strong working knowledge of Adobe products (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator).
* Ability to work on Windows platform and/or MAC, using the above software(s).
* Ability to convert designs between the two platforms (Windows/MAC) is highly desirable.
* Strong detail orientation towards design and content requirements.
* Strong organization and time management skills.
* Good written and verbal communication, considering that this person would be a collaborator between the design members and the Product owners.

**Relationships: Internal / External**

* May work with a range of internal contacts including but not limited to Editorial teams (stakeholders), Manufacturing, Technology and possibly Product Development teams.

**Behavioral Competencies**

* Focusing on Customers. Collaborating across Boundaries. Thinking Globally.

title: Associate Content Technical Specialist
description:
**Associate Content Technical Specialist | Content Operations**

The Associate Content Technical Specialist participates in a Content Operations team and assists in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an Associate Content Technical Specialist, you will:

* **Publishing:** Perform duties such as analyzing, keying, converting, coding, copyreading, editing, merging, rendering, loading, or validation of data.
* Support team publishing goals by meeting deadlines.
* **Quality Control:**Responsible for accuracy and completeness of work product. All work will be checked until competent process knowledge is developed.
* **Individual and Team Skills:**Attend and participate in team meetings, prioritize own work, and participate in the performance management process (e.g. peer reviews, self-evaluation).
* **Content acquisition**: Duties may include acquisition of manuscripts or core content, analysis of manuscripts and electronic files, coding (mark-up of data) and resolving coding errors, manuscript editing, compiling and editing of content, proofreading and copy reading, quality control and verification.

**About You**

You are a fit for the role of Associate Content Technical Specialist if you:

* Bachelor's degree holder
* Strong English language skills, including college level vocabulary, spelling, punctuation and grammar and sentence structure
* Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with internal and/or external contacts.
* Skilled in the use of personal computers and familiarity with multiple software packages, including word processing and file management applications
* Ability to prioritize and stay focused while dealing with multiple assignments
* Detail-oriented with an aptitude for analysis and problem solving on an individualized level and within the context of a team environment
* Ability to successfully work in a team environment
* Candidates must be willing to in Mckinley Hill Taguig (HRBIRD SET UP 2days in the office and 3 days at home)
* Must be willing to work on any shift and shifting schedule (Morning / Mid / Night Shift)

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Technical Lead - Adobe Experience Manager
description:
*As a Technical Lead, you will be responsible for the analysis, definition, architecture, design, construction, testing, installation, modification, and maintenance of properly engineered information systems to meet agreed business needs:* 

* **Design and  Implement**– by understanding the business needs, defining solution architecture/design, conducting functional validation, reviewing construction and executing full Agile from design through release. Ensure completed modules provide all functionality described by application experts and operation ready meeting all non-functional requirements.
* **Be a Technical Leader:**effectively contribute to Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) enterprise-level ecosystem in development, technical oversight, and enterprise systems integrations. Design and develop technical approaches and solutions and provide recommendations on building effectively on the AEM platform. Provide coaching and technical oversight to the development team around analysis, development and unit testing of modules & artifacts developed on AEM.
* **Be a Team Player** – work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, interact with customer, partner with cross functional and remote teams. Provide analysis and design reviews to other members and groups within the department to avoid duplication of efforts in solving the same application problem within different products.
* **Be Curious & Innovative –** continuously update yourself with next generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices. Evaluate new technologies and software products to determine feasibility and desirability of incorporating capabilities within the company's products.
* **Be an Agile Person** – with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, drive backlog planning and scrums
* **Be an Effective Communicator –**articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews/design review boards, and exhibit strong listening skills
* **Focus on Continuous Improvement and Technical Standards –**Drive improvements in productivity, architecture for software development, prepare technical specifications and, leverage development best practices as a part of daily responsibilities like code review, build and release etc.
* **Take Ownership** – responsible for E2E delivery, develop estimates from delivery/architecture, lead geographically distributed teams, create and maintain project documentation, monitor risks/mitigation strategies with stakeholders and strive for improving efficiency of the solutions

**About You** 

*You are fit for the role of a **Digital  Technology Lead - Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)**if you have:* 

**Basic qualifications:** 

* 6+ years of experience handling and leading development projects involving Adobe Experience Manager – recent experience with AEM 6.5 or higher versions.
* Strong Knowledge of architecture & infrastructure considerations for AEM Sites and AEM Assets
* Proficiency in using modern AEM artifacts for content and experience exchange leveraging Content Fragment Models, Content Fragments and Experience Fragments
* Strong technical foundation of AEM and web content management design and development including AEM Sites, AEM Assets, Web Components in HTL, Editable Templates, Sling Models, Workflows , Backend Java OSGI Services , JCR and JCX
* Experience in multiple front-end web technologies including HTML/5, CSS, JavaScript, and Responsive Web technologies
* Knowledge of developing on AEM following principles of ReactJS Framework and leveraging the AEM SPA Editor
* Strong working knowledge with Analysis, Design, and Implementation including SOA, Web services, XML/HTTP, REST HTML, Servlets and APIs
* Proficiency in Apache Sling, JCR Repository and Apache Felix OSGi Framework
* Experience in using AEM Multisite Manager (MSM) for creating multilingual websites and store fronts
* Knowledge of Digital Asset Management (DAM) concepts to effectively leverage AEM Assets
* Experience in using AEM Translation framework
* Knowledge of functional, security and performance testing processes, tools and methods

**Preferred** **qualifications:** 

* Experience in working with Adobe Cloud Manager, XML DITA add-on (AEM Guides), Adobe Managed Services and Cloud (AWS)
* Experience building Customer service and support portals like Help center, Training etc..
* Adobe certifications

title: Digital Marketer
description:
**Digital Marketer, Operations Customer Service & Support**

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Digital Marketer, you will: 

* **Consult** **and develop** overarching digital marketing plans, process and implementation for all digital assets: website, email, blog, video, social media and app platforms
* **Identify** target audiences and devise digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
* **Create** digital assets with team including landing pages, emails that effectively support marketing plan tactics, campaign strategies, and follow brand standards
* **Analyze** data to help shape future marketing strategies
* **Contribute** to processes that help enhance structures and process improvements in digital marketing prioritization, measurement and deployment

**About You** 

You're a fit for the role of Digital Marketer if your background includes: 

* Having significant knowledge of Digital Marketing including SEO, social media, and local search.
* Familiarity with web analytics tools including: Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SpyFu, Screaming Frog.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Minimum of 2 years’ experience or equivalent education in Digital Marketing strategies and tactics.
* Bachelor's degree required. Business or Marketing preferred.

title: Event Specialist - Brand Marketing
description:
The Event Specialist role is a key support function for the Enterprise Sponsorship & Events team. Effectively supporting the Events team by coordinating attendee registration platform, financial, and meeting logistics and processes ensuring all aspects of the events are planned, defined, and executed to the highest of standards. The ability to work as an enterprise, global event team member is essential as the role involves supporting global colleagues to ensure visibility and sharing of best practices.  

**About the role:**

*As event specialist we do:*

* ### Manage online attendee registration database using the *Certain* platform; including the website build, managing changes, associated maintenance, reporting, and the Thomson Reuters Event support email inbox.
* ### Coordinate all Finance/Accounts Payable requirements; submit all invoices, POs, credit card transactions, and record/report in Smartsheet project management tool
* ### Tracking budget for all events and processing event invoice and expense reports in compliance with company policies.
* ### Mobile Event App (Spot Me and/or Certain Touchpoint); database management of the project plan and populate content for the mobile event app.
* ### Education/Training Session management for SYNERGY Conferences, and database management.
* ### Ability to plan and execute events with responsibility for end-to-end delivery and execution with (at times) little to no supervision.
* ### Ensure creative execution of meetings/events as directed by the event/program management committees. Establish the appropriate tools and processes to meet project goals. Influence event/program stakeholders to make the appropriate decisions and modifications in response to external influences on the event/program.
* ### Researching event venues and costs for proposed events, researching branding items and gifts for guests.
* ### Creation of event project plans and run of events for all associated events. Comfortable using technology tools, such as event registration software, internal websites, and social media to allow for better team documentation, collaboration, and knowledge exchange.
* ### Participate in or conduct event debriefs following each event and ensure written feedback is documented back to the teams and participants to improve future events.
* ### Perform other assignments as requested by manager.

**About you:**

*You are a good fit if you have:*

* ### Bachelor’s degree preferred. Equivalent applicable experience may be considered.
* ### 1-3+ years of events experience with either a corporate or business events team.
* ### Proficiency in reading, writing and speaking English
* ### Experience working in a fast-paced, complex, and dynamic environment.
* ### Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel and other MS (Microsoft) Office Tools (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* ### Experience with event technology and tools (i.e., Smartsheet project management tool, Certain/CVENT attendee registration platform, Spot Me/Certain Touchpoint mobile event apps).
* ### Solid experience with logistics involved with event planning and ability to drive and manage projects to the satisfaction of multiple stakeholders.

###

title: Marketer, Campaign Management - Marketing Corporates
description:
As a Marketer, Campaign Management, you will help the team test, activate and optimize digital-first marketing programming to fuel continued growth in Thomson Reuters.  The Campaign Management team owns a wide range of essential activities necessary to execute on acquisition, retention, cross-sell, upsell, and pipeline acceleration programs, while keeping TR customers front and center.  

**About the role:**

*As a marketer, campaign management you will be responsible of**:***

* Collaborate with campaign planning teams on activation and optimization of quarterly campaign plans to meet retention, upsell, cross sell and acquisition targets.
* Audit lead flows and programming to ensure streamlined processes and increased speed.
* Conduct campaign analysis and package data pulls to fuel optimization and best practices.
* Evaluate and report on campaign and channel/tactical performance, continually optimizing to hit KPIs
* Closely monitor and measure programming to ensure we are achieving highest possible ROI
* Creatively problem solve and dig into all areas of demand gen workflow to ensure smooth and timely program execution
* Act as liaison with US central and partner teams to ensure consistent processes, accountabilities, and deliverables.
 

**Accountability** 

* Delivery of effective marketing funnel, from lead to closed sale
* Manage SLAs across US central teams
* Maintain or exceed quality expectations

**About you:**

*You will be an excellent fit if you have:*

* BA or BS degree required
* 2+ years of experience in marketing and campaign coordination
* Strong digital marketing experience and knowledge, especially in B2B and e-commerce space
* Strong project management skills; outstanding communicator
* Ability to manage multiple campaign plans and stakeholders simultaneously
* Strong analytical/data-gathering background, using tools such as Salesforce, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, etc. to determine performance
* Strong collaboration, teamwork and relationship building skills
* Skilled at learning and leveraging new tools, processes, and systems (e.g. Workfront and Anaplan)
* Good understanding of modern demand generation technologies and systems
* Passion for accurate follow-through of program details (while still maintaining team speed)
* Team player with track record of proactively helping teams achieve objectives
* Experience in a matrixed organization or agency experience preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

*You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:*

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Director, Global Sales - Global Large Law Firms
description:
The Director of Global Sales for GLLF is responsible for effectively leading and executing go-to-market sales strategy across the Practice of Law teams, including content and software. This individual will lead and coach a direct sales team of Senior Sales Executives and the Manager, Global Sales. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of Thomson Reuters products, sales techniques appropriate for shortening sales cycles in an enterprise selling environment, and the needs of legal professionals in order to bundle information solutions to meet broader firm needs.

**About the Role:**

In this role as **Director of Global Sales** you will:

* Reinforce and model a collaborative, innovative and bold culture across GLLF teams globally and removes obstacles
* Develop talent and hold team accountable
* Influence and drive change

**About You**

You're a fit for the **Director of Global Sales** if you have:

* Proven sales leadership with management experience across content, software and technology teams
* Strong negotiation skills and a track record of executing sales process, with a focus on prospecting, discovery and tactical
* Effective coaching skills for lead generation, opportunity creation and pipeline management and proven success at shortening sales cycles
* Ability to lead teams across complex deal structures, as well as serve in customer-facing capacity, when needed
* Strong communication and commercial and financial acumen
* Demonstrable knowledge of attorney workflow, global law firm strategies and org structure & overall legal market

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Madison WI)
description:
**Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!**

**What You’ll Do:** As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/mid-sized firms. You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

**About the Role:** 

* Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
* Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
* Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling.
* Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships.

### About You:

### 

**Experience:**

* 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
* Experience in outside sales in a professional B2B environment.
* Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
* Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment a plus.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
* Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
* Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently

**Travel:**

* Ability to be actively in the field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

·       **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

·       **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

·       **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

·       **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

·       **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

·       **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-JP1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

***Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings [click here](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/content/dam/ewp-m/documents/careers/en/pdf/onboarding/fake_job_posting_scam_careers_site.pdf) to know more.***

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on [thomsonreuters.com](https://thomsonreuters.com).

title: Executivo de Vendas - Segmento Varejo
description:
**Executivo de Vendas – Segmento Varejo** 

 

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Executivo de Vendas em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!* 

 

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios. 

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão. 

 

 

**Sobre a Posição** 

 

Nesta oportunidade, como Executivo de Vendas, você irá: 

* Construir relacionamentos com clientes com contas novas e atuais. Orquestra as vendas e renovações
* Essa posição geralmente gerencia um conjunto de contas nomeadas e é responsável pelo aumento da receita e pela maximização da satisfação do cliente
* Desenvolve e mantém relacionamentos com clientes para impulsionar o crescimento da receita
* Profissional Hunter responsável pelo segmento de varejo
* Gestão da carteira de clientes território nacional
* Gestão de grandes contas
* Trabalhar com metas de vendas
* Gerenciamento de contas e parceiros

 

**Sobre Você** 

 

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:  

* Graduação completa
* Experiência com vendas de soluções (Preferencialmente fiscal)
* Desejável experiência no segmento de Varejo/Retail
* Disponibilidade para trabalhar híbrido em São Paulo – Capital

 

**O que iremos te oferecer** 

 

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de: 

 

·       **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19. 

·       **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais. 

·       **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro 

·       **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters 

·       **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global. 

·       **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.   

 

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.* 

#LI-KN1  

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

***Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings [click here](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/content/dam/ewp-m/documents/careers/en/pdf/onboarding/fake_job_posting_scam_careers_site.pdf) to know more.***

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
**Associate Sales Executive**
-----------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

We’re looking for experienced Sales Reps to join our sales team. As an Associate Sales Executive, you will be responsible for inbound and outbound calls in your respective territory to find new business through targeted campaigns.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **Associate Sales Executive**, you will: 

* Sell TR Legal products and services to new prospects.
* Discuss the use of products, emphasizing product features based on analyses of customers' needs and technical knowledge of product capabilities
* Maintain activity level of 70+ customer calls/emails per day
* Continuously work with management to refine sales strategy to optimize efficiency and results and initiate sales campaigns to meet sales expectations
* Learn and thoroughly understand our products and services.
* Learn and thoroughly understand our target market and prospect’s profiles
* Understand how Legal (OLI) products are used in the corporates small and medium business market to better present and sell our Legal products to meet the customers' needs
* Negotiate and close new business
* Meet or exceed assigned monthly & yearly quotas
* Ensure an accurate and timely process for maintaining customer account information and closing pricing transactions
* Maintain accurate and timely customer information with Sales Operations, Customer Service, and Technical Support groups.
* Load and manage customer and lead data in CRM tools

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree or 2+ years of successful professional sales experience in a related environment:  Business-to-business preferred // Sales to U.S.A or Canada preferred (not a MUST)
* Ability to utilize effective selling skills
* Must be driven, competitive, passionate and achievement-oriented, and motivated by success
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quota target
* Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Ability to quickly learn technical content in nature and be able to explain and communicate value propositions in English effectively
* Effective CRM tools usage knowledge
* Effective time management skills
* Legal background preferred (not a MUST).

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-ZM1**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

  
 

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
