title: Engenheiro de Dados Sênior
description:
**Data Engineer**  
 

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como* **Data Engineer** *em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nessa oportunidade, como Data Engineer, você irá:

* Defina, manipule, agregue e use “big data” estruturados e não estruturados para oferecer suporte a análises descritivas e preditivas em todos os negócios.
* Tornar-se especialista em determinados domínios de conhecimento e em determinadas ferramentas/técnicas.
* Usar várias abordagens para se desvencilhar quando o progresso da pesquisa diminui.
* Identificar e corrigir rapidamente erros mais sutis em dados e análises.
* Garantir que os resultados sejam reprodutíveis, corretos e acionáveis.
* Detectar problemas de qualidade de dados com a capacidade de detectar problemas de dados, pipeline e modelo.
* Aprender a lidar com desafios típicos - encontrar fontes de dados, alinhá-las, lidar com quaisquer problemas de direitos, manter gerentes de produto a bordo, trabalhar em estreita colaboração com desenvolvedores para acelerar o processo de desenvolvimento e garantia de qualidade, escrever whitepapers e pesquisas coerentes e claros notas.
* Desenvolver relacionamentos com colegas de análise em toda a empresa.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Experiência comprovada como Data Engineer;
* Experiência em projetos de ingestão e transformação de dados
* Experiência prática com linguagens de programação como Python;
* Conhecimento em sistemas de processamento de dados distribuídos (ex. Spark, Dask, Kafka, Hadoop etc.);
* Bancos de dados SQL e NoSQL;
* Conhecimento em sistemas de automação de pipeline de dados (Airflow, Glue etc.); Semelhante
* Ferramentas ETL (Serviços de integração e ou outros)
* Inglês

**O que iremos te oferecer**  
 

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.

title: Senior Manager, Campaign Management - Marketing Corporates
description:
**About us:**

As the Sr Manager of the Campaign Management team, you will manage and coach a team of marketers responsible for activating, measuring, and optimizing integrated marketing campaigns and programs to support acquisition, retention, cross-sell, upsell, and pipeline acceleration programs, while keeping TR customers front and center.

**About the Role**:

* **Accountabilities**
* Lead a team of passionate, revenue-driven, analytical marketers that have the detail-oriented abilities to coordinate, execute and deliver marketing programs across Tax, Legal and Corporates customers.
* Responsible for activating marketing programming to generate QLs, pipeline and strong ROI.
* Manage lead enrichment, data analysis and list pulls to support demand generation programs and ensure strong time to contact on qualified leads.
* Audit lead flows and programming to ensure streamlined processes and increased speed.
* Conduct campaign analysis and package data pulls to fuel optimization and best practices.
* Act as liaison with US central and partner teams to ensure consistent processes, accountabilities, and deliverables.
* **Key Deliverables**
* Lead the team of marketers to deliver integrated marketing programs that achieve pipeline, strong ROI and marketing attributed sales targets
* Delivery of effective customer engagement and qualified leads, from marketing qualified lead to closed sale based upon goals
* Deliver sales growth through high lead generation rates and digital sales

**About You**

* BA/BS required
* 8+ years in marketing, campaign planning or demand generation
* 2+ years of people management experience
* Expertise and understanding of key martech tools that influence integrated campaign planning (Marketing Automation Platforms, Digital Analytics tools, Webinar tools, CRM systems)
* Strong people leader with experience managing team of marketers
* Self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
* Team player with the ability to foster strong relationships across multiple levels and functions within the organization
* Entrepreneurial ‘can do’ approach with an adaptable, change-oriented mindset
* Highly analytical approach with ability to analyze performance data
* Experience in a matrixed and agile environment preferred
* Experience leveraging customer insights to drive strategy
* Strong organizational and project management skills

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Graphic Designer (Digital) - Enterprise Brand Marketing
description:
**About us:**

Are you excited by the opportunity to bring your design skill and experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?  
  
Would you like to join an organization that is consistently recognized as a 'Top   
Employer to Work For’ across various categories, such as Culture, Work-Life Balance, Diversity & Inclusion, Opportunities for Women, Social Impact, and Volunteerism.  
  
As a graphic designer within our new Content Marketing Center of Excellence (COE), you will get to design, create and deliver best-in-class digital marketing assets for our various marketing teams and campaigns.

**About the Role:**

* Plans and illustrates concepts by designing rough layouts of art and copy regarding arrangement, size, type size and style, and related aesthetics.
* Coordinates with internal teams, including marketing, in the design concept phase through the completion of a project.
* Obtains approval of concepts by preparing rough layouts for review.
* Prepares final layout by marking and pasting up finished copy and art.
* Ensure projects are completed with high quality and on schedule
* Establish creative direction for the company as well as brand guidelines
* Advise on best practices and optimizations throughout design projects
* Prioritize and manage multiple projects within design specifications and budget restrictions
* Perform retouching and manipulation of images
* Implement feedback and changes when appropriate
* QA designs for errors
* The ability to work in a fast pace environment with other teams in the US, CN, and ENG.

**About You:**

* Bachelor's degree in graphic arts, design, communications, or a related field
* 3-5 years of experience in graphic design
* Knowledge of layouts, graphic fundamentals, and typography, specifically related to digital assets
* Familiarity with social media design principles and best practices
* An understanding of A/B testing and using data to influence design and layout
* Knowledge of Adobe PhotoShop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign, and other graphic design software (motion graphics a benefit)
* Compelling portfolio of work over a wide range of creative projects
* Strong analytical skills,
* Excellent eye for detail

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture**: You will have the opportunity to work for a that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* **Learning & Development**: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology, various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series. As well as access to Hackathons, Unconferences, LinkedIn Learning and more
* **Benefits**: Vacation Bonus, Christmas Bonus, Life and Disability Insurance, Major medical expenses insurance, Grocery Coupons, IMSS, INFONAVIT, and SAR
* **Social Impact**: Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising

title: Sales Operations Manager (Hybrid)
description:
This **Sales Operations Manager** influences and supports business operations and planning activities within an SBU, function or region.  This role supports and guides the work of the Legal subsegment.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Sales Operations Manager**, you will:

* Support operations initiatives in a region or other group in order to build a high-performing, world class sales and service capability.
* Partner closely & direct teams of support across different companies & time zones.
* Leverage, enhance & develop world-class reporting capabilities to provide visibility to business performance & opportunities.
* Support the management team and the management team's process.
* Create, apply and support common capabilities in the group.
* Coordinate the implementation of change programs.
* Manage, motivate, coach and develop project team members.
* Represent regions to global functions or vice versa.
* Contribute to business planning.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Sales Operations Manager** if your background includes:

* 5+ years of sales operations or sales related experience preferred
* JD preferred
* Experience supporting or working in the legal industry required

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: Gerente de Serviço Criativo
description:
**Gerente de Serviço Criativo**

 

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Gerente de Serviço Criativo em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!* 

 

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios. 

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão. 

 

 

**Sobre a Posição** 

 

Nesta oportunidade, como Gerente de Serviço Criativo, você irá: 

 

·       Gestão do time Brasil e México

·       Participar da diagramação de texto e gerenciar ações das redes sociais

·       Estabelecer parceria times internos e garantir a entrega imediata de materiais de marketing alinhados aos principais objetivos de negócios

·       Definir soluções de curto e longo prazo, incluindo avaliações de risco e recomendações para a liderança de negócios

·       Desenvolver planos de projeto abrangentes para serem compartilhados com clientes e outros membros da equipe

·       Planejar o trabalho atribuído à equipe, incluindo detalhamento do trabalho, estimativa precisa e identificação de possíveis opções de solução.

·       Determinar se os projetos recomendados devem ser implementados como uma solução comercial viável/apropriada com base nos recursos disponíveis

**Sobre Você** 

 

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência: 

 

·       Experiência em agência (Conhecer a rotina)

·       Experiência com gestão de pessoas

·       Experiência com diagramação de texto e redes sociais 

·       Espanhol avançado – mandatório

·       Habilidade de comunicação.  

  

**O que iremos te oferecer** 

 

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de: 

 

·       **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.

·       **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters 

·       **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global. 

·       **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. title: Consultor ERP
description:
***Consultor ERP*** para ***Thomson Reuters Argentina***

¡Queremos que seas parte de nuestro equipo de **Professional Services** en Thomson Reuters Argentina!

Para personas del area de Ciencias Económicas o Sistemas de Información

- **Puesto**: Consultor Funcional: Realizará tareas de capacitación e implementación de nuestro software

- **Carrera / Profesión**: Ciencias Económicas o Sistemas de información o afines

- **Nivel de estudios**: avanzado o graduado

- **Conocimientos requeridos:** Circuitos administrativos / Contables

**Aptitudes requeridas**

* Muy buena predisposición para atención a clientes y trato con otras áreas de la organización
* Capacidad de comunicación / transmisión de conocimientos, tanto oral como escrita
* Actitud proactivo en la búsqueda de soluciones
* Disponibilidad para viajes al interior

**Se valorará**

Experiencia en manejo de base de datos SQL

Experiencia en el uso o implementación de sistemas de gestión

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad) 

🏥 Pre paga para vos y tu grupo familiar primario

🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)

⌨ Allowance Home Office (one time) – compra de equipamiento 

🌅 Viernes flex de verano

💻 Equipamiento de trabajo

Nos diferenciamos por tener una **cultura centrada en la diversidad e inclusión**, gran compromiso en el **respeto & bienestar** de los colaboradores, y por sobre todo, un **excelente clima laboral** para que disfrutes la experiencia de trabajar en Thomson Reuters. **¡Súmate a nuestro equipo!**

title: Manager, Business Development
description:
The Business Development Representative (BDR) Manager will be responsible for managing a team of BDRs qualifying inbound/outbound marketing leads. This person will also be responsible for meeting and exceeding qualified appointment and converted appointment metrics.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as a BDR manager you will:

* **Manage and coach a Business Development Team** to meet (and exceed) targeted KPIs and Quotas.
* **Continually monitor the activities of direct reports** and provide guidance and direction as needed to achieve (and exceed) daily, monthly, and yearly targets.
* **Manage work rates of marketing leads** to ensure that BDRs are prioritizing marketing leads appropriately per established SLAs.
* **Provide regular assessment of BDR’s productivity and effectiveness** to both the individual BDR as well as BDR leadership team.
* **Build and administer coaching, development plans, and training opportunities** for all direct reports as needed.
* **Educate staff on best practices in sales and marketing tactics** and techniques via weekly meetings and other ad hoc methodologies (e.g. team meetings, activities, etc.).
* **Maintain a leadership role with sales leaders** and attend sales leadership meetings as requested.
* **Maintain a leadership role with marketing partners** and attend marketing leadership meetings.
* **Share insights and trends with stakeholders** in marketing and sales.
* **Develop and implement motivational incentive programs****.**
* **Assist with BDR policy procedure development**.
* **Manage individual and team forecasts** and pipeline.
* **Maintain a solid understanding of products and services being offered**. Know how they are being used in the relevant profession, to the degree in which you can assess the applicability of the products/programs to our customers/prospects.
* **Maintain a strong competency in all databases, tools, and processes** used in the BDR process.
* **Create training documentation and best practices** to replicate success.
* **Retain new hires and create coaching and mentoring program** to prepare top talent for next opportunity in the organization.

**About You:**

You are a fit for the role of Business Development Manager if you:

* Bachelor’s degree.
* 3+ years management experience or experience in a sales leadership role or appointment setting role.
* Proven track record of consistently achieving and exceeding objectives, revenue targets, and product sales targets.
* Demonstrated understanding and successful history of needs-based selling.
* Strong interpersonal, conflict resolution, persuasion and negotiating skills.
* Excellent leadership skills.
* Ability to communicate and influence others over the phone and in person.
* Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
* Demonstrated success in a changing and high paced environment.
* Working knowledge of PCs, Windows, Microsoft Office, networks, and Internet.
* Ability to apply competitive information in the sales process.
* Demonstrated abilities in using sales tools including sales pipelines, sales campaigns/lists, sales forecasts, and call center metrics.
* Some travel is required.
* Amenable to work onsite for the first 3 months and on the days the business will require you to do so.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-KD1

At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Customer Success Manager**
----------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to be responsible to support the Customer Success Team in operational activities and the renewal process. 

**About the Role:** 

In this opportunity as a **Customer Succes Manager****,** you will:

* Be an internal focal point to support Customer Success Managers (Support for operational processes):
* Provide an explanation of the internal processes, understanding of different scenarios, and development of internal and external relationships at all managerial/operational levels.
* Survey requirements, and understand the scenario for contractual negotiations, application of readjustment indexes, and, when necessary, risk mapping and reversal actions for retention.
* Review and control the accounts in Salesforce: Completing and updating the system (Accounts and Opportunities).
* Review KPIs and Closing Periods.
* Direct monitoring of the general billing process, from completing the system to guaranteeing billing confirmation.
* Follow-up on the contract team on documents and other requests involving customer demands:
* Be the guidance on approvals and follow-ups on various requests involving changes to documents (contracts, amendments, and others);
* Map and monitor customer demands directed by the Customer Success Manager, reducing impacts on the commercial flow: Internal support focused on the desired objectives/results through interactions with internal teams.
* Develop internal and external relationships at all managerial/operational levels; Direct contact with external customers and monitoring of various demands (when necessary).
* Manage and follow up on (operational) implementation processes for the new ERP (SAP).
* Manage and monitoring of (operational) product implementation processes.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* BA/BS Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience within or supporting Customer Success or sales teams
* Salesforce experience and knowledge of enterprise SaaS tools
* SAP experience and knowledge preferred
* Strong analytical ability and be able to prioritize multiple projects
* Clear communicator with excellent written, verbal, and listening skills
* Excellent problem-solving, project management, interpersonal and organizational skills
* Proven ability to work cross-functionally to understand business requirements and translate them to effective use of applications
* Excellent critical thinking skills; is able to break down ambiguous problems into concrete, manageable components and think through and effectively communicate solutions
* Deep data and analytics skills
* Self-motivated and self-learner with the ability to work under minimal supervision
* SaaS and B2B experience preferred
* Experience with agile tools is a plus
* Fluent Spanish and Fluent English Desirable. Portuguese is a differential, not a must.

**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-ZM1**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

title: Senior Consultant -Business Analysis
description:
El consultor de soluciones de software brindará consultoría y soporte operativo al equipo. Su principal responsabilidad será lograr una presentación exitosa de las soluciones de la empresa en el mercado.

Responsabilidades:

* Presentar el valor agregado de los productos TR a una variedad de audiencias, desde los tomadores de decisión hasta los usuarios finales y niveles intermedios.
* Contribuir al equipo de Ventas y Marketing mediante la calificación de clientes y segmentos potenciales.
* Responder solicitudes de información (RFI) y solicitudes de propuestas (RFP) en un nivel detallado y profesional.
* Elaborar y entregar a los clientes presentaciones y demostraciones de productos basados ​​en soluciones.
* Impulsar la fase de preventa mediante la introducción de la oferta de productos / servicios TR y proporcionar demostraciones (funcionalidad, arquitectura del sistema, etc.) interactuando con clientes potenciales y actuales (tanto a nivel comercial como técnico).
* Comprender el negocio y los objetivos operativos que tiene el cliente potencial y recomendar una solución que garantice el uso y la utilización óptimos de los productos y servicios.
* Tener un conocimiento detallado de la funcionalidad y tecnología de la gama de productos.
* Asegurarse de que todos los materiales, como presentaciones y demostraciones, se mantengan actualizados.
* Aprovechar su conocimiento de TI para respaldar y ofrecer excelentes presentaciones a clientes y prospectos.

Requerimientos del perfil:

* Profesionales graduados de la carrera de derecho (con orientación comercial y servicios al cliente)
* Conocimiento de Legaltech, CLM, Legal Desing Thinking y tendencias de mercado Legal.
* Buen conocimiento de las aplicaciones Saas.
* Habilidades de comunicación y presentación para articular claramente el valor del producto, interpretación de la necesidad del cliente.
* Inglés avanzado (excluyente).
* Habilidades interpersonales, incluida la capacidad de presentarse a una audiencia de alto perfil (desde tomadores de decisión hasta el usuario final).
* Mentalidad de aprendizaje y mantenerse al día con los cambios.
* Capacidad para trabajar de forma remota como parte de un equipo y en forma autónoma, demostrando iniciativa y proactividad.
* Debe ser abierto, flexible y creativo con respecto a la gestión y programación del tiempo.

title: Senior Manager PMO, Professional Services
description:
**Senior Manager PMO, Professional Services**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?   If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and be responsible for managing the Project Management Team within Professional Services, and Corporates. This will include overseeing implementation activities, customer escalations, and employees working on Implementations.

**About the Role:** 

In this opportunity as a **Senior Manager PMO, Professional Services**, you will:

* Perform Project Management Leadership function on projects of all sizes ranging from smaller projects servicing SMB markets to large international enterprise projects. Must be able to right size project implementation methodology across customer segments, product segments and industry including scoping, project planning, budgets, Statement of Work creation.
* Ensure operational requirements, standards and best practices are factored into plans.
* Accountable for customer satisfaction within remit/territory.
* Develops departmental plans and determines long term priorities for the team.
* Build, develop and lead a highly effective and motivated work force with clearly defined mission and aligned objectives
* Can successfully ramp up entry level consultants and develop and engage senior team members to encourage career growth.
* Responsible for ensuring own staff and contractors have adequate skills and knowledge to perform their duties.
* Ability to oversee Tax and Legal Software Solution delivery, allocate project resources, review project budgets with PMs, act as the 1st escalation point for active implementation projects.
* Must possess strong cross team/group/org collaboration skills; ability to foresee and analyze project risks, develop risk management plan and mitigate subsequent issues
* Must have high-powered analytical skills and the ability to understand concepts and situations that pass by many others
* Must understand to a high-level product implementation methodology, functional & technical components.
* Identifies and develops upsell opportunities within assigned customer projects, brings qualified upsell opportunities to regional manager for closure.
* Strong commitment to customer excellence ensuring their success.
* Can lead technology decisions and facilitate and articulate alternatives and direction to Customer’s Senior IT and Business Management.
* Must be able to manage a project lifecycle without additional support.
* Must have excellent communication skills, strong project management skills, and demonstrated success in adult learning and training principles/skills
* Must have the ability to achieve objectives by successfully interacting and collaborating with:
	+ Management level team members in Engineering, Product Management, Customer Support, and Sales.
	+ Management level resources at Partners.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, computer science or related.
* Business English Proficient
* 10 years of project management, professional services, software development, consulting experience or related experience. With at least 2 years of experience delivering enterprise software in a SAS or Cloud environment.
* Any of the following skills or experience factors will be preferred in the ideal candidate for this position: Project Management Certifications. Experience Implement Enterprise Software including ERP, Ecommerce, and/or bolt on solutions.​
* Deep experience as a PM or Analyst in enterprise software products/services/applications (e.g. Oracle, Microsoft, SAP, NS, etc.)

The position requires up to 35% travel annually. There may be time periods where the travel requirement exceeds 50% in a given month.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-YS2

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: Associate Quality Assurance & E-File Analyst
description:
•    Candidate should be working on the Quality Assurance of Ultra tax product in terms of QA.   
•    Should be working on the testing of Forms and post issues in the issue tracker.   
•    Should follow up with the developers and see that the issue is resolved in a timely manner.  
•    Should retest the issues and close them accordingly.  
•    Should work on testing the MTB’s and post issues accordingly on each release.   
•    Should test assigned states thoroughly within the timelines and make sure to maintain the quality percentage.   
•    Should keep up to date with the knowledge on testing by regularly going through with the state given instructions and product changes.   
•    Should be able to assist the seniors/AL’s in cross product training or new hire training.   
•    Should be able to take the ownership of the work given and make sure all the issues are posted.  
•    Should be able to create their own scenarios for testing the product and save them for future references.   
•    Should be able to effectively utilize the down time and complete the eLearning courses and all other mandatory courses.  
•    Should participate in Team building activities and should work on process improvements.   
•    Should be a good team player and assist the Team and Team leader wherever required.   
•    Should be able to learn and work with quality on the adhoc projects assignments.   
•    Should be able to use all the testing techniques to maintain the quality of issues posted in the issue tracker.   
•    Should be able to analyze the data in the locators/scenarios to test the software for correct tax calculations.   
•    Candidate must be independently able to analyze and resolve complex tax software problems, document software deficiencies and understand the business/customer requirements.  
•    Candidate would be working on support to US developers on Support calls by assisting on heat cases.  
•    Should be able to do the critical regression (MTB’s) before/after each release to the clients in the production.   
•    Should be able to contact states/developers to get the proper information for the software development.  
•    Candidates need to test the software on various releases in maintenance and production phases.   
•    Should be able to work in pressure-oriented atmosphere and multi-tasking.   
•    Should be able to meet the deadlines given and simultaneously report to the seniors and Team lead.   
•    Should have strong communication skills, knowledge on compliance return preparation is needed   
•    Should be proficient in US Tax technical’ s.   
•    Should be Graduate or postgraduate in any field.

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
**Associate Sales Executive**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience retaining and growing existing accounts?  Are you motivated by uncapped commissions?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and be responsible for helping both, new and existing customers make informed business decisions to better manage the ever-changing business ecosystem through our highly specialized information-enabled software and tools. Our software products drive productivity, data, content, and research capabilities through world-class.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **Associate Sales Executive**, you will:

* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basisr
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completely CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by an assigned account team consisting of a Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You:**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Fluent English is a must.
* +3 years of successful sales experience with consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience is a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Ability to win new customers as well as cross sell/upsell existing customers
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.

-------

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**Sales Development Representative (SDR)**
------------------------------------------

 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities.

 

**About the Role:** 

In this opportunity as a **Sales Development** **Representative**, you will:

* Prospect for new sales opportunities, develop a pipeline, & closes opportunity or may not execute renewal contracts.
* Identifies upsell and cross-sell opportunities and passes to an appropriate resource.
* Hit or exceed your monthly and annual targets and maintain consistently strong performance at 100% of your YTD goals
* Hit or exceed your daily contact targets and activity metrics.
* Actively engage in the coaching process, partnering well with managers and individuals on your teams to share ideas and learn from each other.
* Accurately, and in a timely manner, log all activities and customer contacts in Salesforce.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:  

* Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience in lieu of a bachelor’s degree.
* 1 – 3 years of experience working as a Sales Representative.
* Excellent verbal and written communication (Spanish & English)
* Strong interpersonal skills (personable and professional)
* Ability to conduct self in a professional manner
* Agile learners – Ability to learn something new
* Commitment to a schedule that coincides with the customer’s workday
* Intermediate computer skills and ability to navigate software programs such as Microsoft
* Experience in CRM preferred
* Motivated competitive with a positive attitude.
* Demonstrate the ability to rapidly learn new knowledge and acquire new skills
* Maintain stable performance under pressure (such as time pressure or job ambiguity); handle stress in a manner that is acceptable to others in the organization.
* Display determination, persistence, and patience and be resilient in the face of adversity.

title: Partner Governance
description:
**Partner Governance**
----------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to deliver value to all our customers by project managing and/or implementing solutions projects for pre-sales and implementation of replicable and scalable packaged solutions to customer business workflow challenges in order to gain new business, win market share, and increase customer satisfaction.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Partner Governance**, you will: 

* Project delivery - provides specialized consulting activities in the delivery of projects, with particular regard to the following project phases: Customer requirements gathering and analysis; Design of Architectures; Project implementation; Quality Assurance.
* Bid Development - Be involved in the preparation of a complex technical proposal, contributing to the related key tasks such as customer requirements analysis, design of solutions architect high-level project plan, and estimation of professional services effort required for implementation.
* Expertise - subject matter expert in one or more customer business workflows and related solutions packages and products, providing domain expertise to our customers relative to solution propositions.
* Client Technical Training - Contributes to the design and preparation as well as delivers technical training to our customers on products and technology related to our offering.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Fluent English is a must.
* Previous experience implementing technology projects or systems such as Oracle, SAP, among others.
* Previous experience coordinating partner operations.
* Previous experience aligning partner's operations to internal global policies.

title: Channel Manager
description:
**Channel Manager**
-------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth working through partners? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions?  If yes, we're looking for you.

 

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities through partners.

**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as a **Channel Manager,** you will:  

* This position typically manages a set of named accounts (versus a geographic territory) and is responsible for and growing revenue and maximizing customer satisfaction.
* Develops and maintains client relationships to ultimately drive revenue growth.
* Develops and executes account strategy collaborating with account team and/or other business units to deliver a comprehensive product offering to meet overall customer needs.
* Prospect new customers independently, using LinkedIn and/or another database.
* Coordinate meetings with decision-makers.
* Make a commercial proposal.
* Present monthly results.
* Leads important projects, programs, and business initiatives, demonstrating creativity and ingenuity.
* Determines work priorities based on the general direction of managers.
* Manage the budget for projects or programs within the area.
* Contributes to the development of new principles and concepts and strategy of the Business Unit.
* Provides specialized advice to middle and upper management to solve complex problems.

  

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:  

* +5 years of experience as a HUNTER, recruiting new partners, making consultative sales of SaaS Technology solutions in the corporate/enterprise segment.
* Consistent performance about the delivery of sales targets. (Achiever/Overachiever)
* Negotiation and communication skills needed to be able to influence Decision Makers (Directors/VPs/CEO's)
* English Proficiency is a Must.
* University Degree/ Desirable MBA

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success 

**Location: CDMX**

-------

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Lead Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Lead Business Systems Analyst**

**Position overview**

The role is within Corporate Tax and Trade group for Onesource Statutory Reporting product. The Lead Business Analyst function works as a liaison between application developers, content developers, business stakeholder and clients to determine requirements for the application and Line management and leadership of a small team of Business analysts. The development team adopts an agile approach and preferably candidate should have prior experience working in Agile environment.

**Role and responsibilities**

* Support content teams

Recommend best practice regarding development of localised content using the global platform. Liaise with content teams in various global locations to assist with understanding of the software capabilities, identification of defects and solutions.

* Support development team

Communicate with developers to assist with understanding the requirements for a new feature or defect solution. Testing new features and solutions.  Feedback further requirements and defects.

* Requirements analysis

Work with the global asset manager and other business analysts to analyse requests from content teams and end users. Design and propose software changes to address these requests.

* Prioritise work items

Assist in the prioritization and scoping of work items for iterative development planning process. Work with Product managers and developers to detail out the requirements, create stories and analyze defects.

* Support QA team

Guide QA team in developing automated test functions to maximize test coverage of key software functions. Assist in identifying and clarifying issues with the software following automated test detection.

* Able to plan tasks necessary to lead to the production of adequate business and system functional requirements.
* Responsible for delivery by and management of a small technical team of engineers
* Leads and manages the day to day activities of their team including supporting career development of team

**Required skills**

* Excellent analytical skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Financial statements preparation experience
* Experience using accounting software
* Experience of business requirements analysis
* Experience of leading development team

**Preferred Skills**

* Experience of working with agile software development teams
* Experience of working within corporate finance teams
* Knowledge of XBRL requirements and technologies
* Exposure to SQL

------------------

title: Director Customer and Product PR
description:
Are you an experienced PR leader with a passion for technology?

Do you have knack for telling customers stories in a new and exciting way?

If so, then we may have just the role for you!

Thomson Reuters is looking for a Product PR Director to help share with our customers around the globe through the media, the strides we are taking to helping professionals to inform the way forward.

As part of a team of seasons product PR professionals, reporting into the senior director of Product PR you will be responsible for managing the external communications opportunities and risks for Thomson Reuters, specifically in relation to Thomson Reuters products, technology, and partnerships. The successful candidate will have deep communications experience in the tech and innovation industry and be confident in building bold and creative campaigns. They are as comfortable advising leaders as they are briefing journalists - working across the business to uncover proactive communication opportunities. They are well-versed in fast response, crises management and proactive communications common to a fast-growing SaaS-based organization, with a strong understanding of the levers that power successful global technology businesses.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Director Customer and Product PR, you will:

* Create, maintain, implement, and evaluate an effective and engaging communications strategy that raises the profile of our work, ensures we are engaging with the right stakeholders, delivers our key messages and helps to progress our ambitions.
* Constantly protect and actively position Thomson Reuters in a manner that supports and advances the corporate strategy in the right way.
* Lead the development and implementation of a compelling product, customer and partnership PR strategy and plan in lock step with Thomson Reuters technology vision and brand strategy on a quarterly and annual basis – reviewing the plan regularly to ensure effectiveness is maximized – course corrected where needed.
* Provide communications expertise, support, and advice to the executive team, including writing materials and/or securing appropriate input for speaker opportunities, opinion editorial, rapid response etc
* Partnerships are a large part of our technology strategy at TR – build and define the guardrails that allow us to both use them in our PR campaigns, as well as encourage them ( where appropriate and with the right guardrails) to mention TR in their PR and social activity.
* Leverage your extensive relationships with relevant journalists and analysts to communicate Thomson Reuters technology vision, products, and customer success.
* Drive relationships with PR agency partners used for product, customer and partnership PR or campaigns to maximize effectiveness
* Lead the team to project manage and implement at least one major product/launch campaign per quarter as appropriate to the wider business strategy.
* Lead the team to be able to report effectively against their KPIs, demonstrating value to the business as well as delivery against their objectives.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Director Customer and Product PR if your background includes:

* Experience building and leading product communication teams in global, technology-based, SaaS organizations
* Knowledge in driving results for technology product launches and thought leadership through use of media campaigns and effective content creation
* Proven experience in coaching spokespeople and in supporting media outreach program at a senior executive level
* Public company experience and familiarity in dealing with confidential/ material information
* Excellent communication skills, additional languages advantageous
* Must have strong relationships with business media
* Proven ability to coordinate a global media program in a matrixed organization (working with direct and non-direct reports)
* Experience in financial services, information services, media and or technology industries an advantage

*Whist the requirements and experience needed for this role are very much desired, we appreciate you might not meet all the criteria, or have alternative skills we didn’t list. If you feel this is a role you could be successful in, please drop us a line – we’d love to speak with you.*

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sr. Executive Assistant
description:
**Sr. Executive Assistant**
---------------------------

Do you have experience performing highly responsible and professional secretarial and administrative services? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your talent to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and work directly to the highest levels of senior executives to enhance the efficiency of the business

**About The Role**

In this opportunity as a **Sr. Executive Assistant,** you will:

* Provides professional secretarial and administrative support at the Executive Committee level, exercising confidentiality, tact, and diplomacy and providing a high level of service.
* In-depth knowledge of subject matter expertise of own area and company policies and procedures.
* Screens calls, manages calendars, arranges complex travel and meeting arrangements, manages expenses and mail, and deals with highly sensitive or confidential information.
* Prepares complex and confidential documents and presentations and works closely with finance teams on forecasting revenue and expense reports.
* Involved in conference and event organization.
* Trains another administrative staff requires strong computer and internet research skills along with the ability to train others on system usage.
* Requires flexibility, with excellent interpersonal skills.
* Interacts with the most senior executives across the Company on significant matters, anticipating and responding to requests by modifying procedures to individual circumstances.
* May work on ad-hoc projects.
* Requires specific industry or market experience.

**About You**

You're fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Excellent prioritization skills
* Demonstrates high level of interpersonal skills and professional acumen
* Demonstrates a high level of planning and organization skills
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills in English
* Exhibits a high degree of autonomy and decision-making discretion
* Proficient typing skills and knowledge of computer applications (i.e., Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Adobe) necessary
* Team-spirited, able to collaborate with the other assistants
* Previous experience working for senior executives in an international corporate environment
* MS Teams knowledge and experience preferred

**Location: CDMX**

title: Implementation Consultant - Global Trade (FTZ)
description:
Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are an enterprise software, content and services provider of Global Trade solutions – meaning, we build software to help companies manage international trade needs. Our ONESOURCE GTM software helps companies get their products across borders and into the hands of consumers like you. We’re looking for smart, creative, individuals to work directly with our customers and implement our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) software.

As an Implementation Consultant, specializing in our US Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) module, you will be provided with exciting opportunities to interface with customers & internal teams while supporting global corporations. Through this experience you will gain a greater understanding and appreciation for how corporations are being run in today’s markets.

Within this program we offer extensive training, mentoring, and guidance to start you on the path to a successful career in consulting at Thomson Reuters. You will be trained in best practices, methodologies, and gain the technical and functional skills required to participate in enterprise software projects focused on supporting  Global Trade and Compliance departments. These projects include implementation of enterprise software, content and services to our customers.  You will also be exposed to the ONESOURCE platform, and all services provided across our Corporates business.

As a member of the Professional Services team, you will strive to enable and simplify the work of professionals in Corporations focusing on Global Trade.

The Implementation Consultant will work closely with Project Managers to implement Global Trade software.  This position is part of the Corporates Professional Services department.  We deliver enterprise Global Trade, Compliance and software that provides critical information and software solutions to companies of all sizes. 

**About You**

**In this opportunity as Implementation Consultant - (US Foreign Trade Zones), you will:**

* Interact with client Global Trade professionals in Fortune 500 clients
* Assist in business and requirements sessions and formulate into design/solution documentation
* Engage with other key teams such as Product Management & Engineering within Thomson Reuters as appropriate to deliver end to end solutions
* Assist Project team to ensure all related requirements are met
* Explain system or tool related issues/problems and solutions to Global Trade & technical staff
* Work with clients to translate their policy into our Solutions
* Complete tasks with limited supervision
* Perform technical or functional roles on small, medium to large projects led by an Implementation Consultant or Project Manager
* Act as project lead on small projects with supporting project team member
* Support sales teams by providing scope feedback

**Mandatory Experience and Skills**

* Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills and know how to share information professionally and concisely
* Must be able to work effectively in a team environment
* Proficient in working with computers and standard business software like Microsoft Office
* Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently
* Ability to be a self-starter
* Creative problem-solving skills & motivated to drive innovation
* Ability to work in a diverse work environment

**About You**

**You’re a fit for the role of Implementation Specialist - (US Foreign Trade Zones), if your background includes:**

* 3 – 5 years relative work experience
* Exposure to Global Trade or Supply Chain Businesses, and/or Compliance processes
* Experience with process analysis, design & mapping
* Experience Implementing Enterprise Software including Cloud Solutions and third-party applications
* Licensed U.S. Customs Broker desirable, but not required

**Education Required**

**·Higher Education Degree or Diploma – Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain, International Business or Computer Science preferred**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Bangladesh Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for a highly motivated self-starting journalist to join the Dhaka bureau as a correspondent who will cover everything from Bangladesh’s surging needs for energy and commodities, to challenges and opportunities for its massive garments industry, and the plight of the nearly 1 million Rohingya refugees living in the country’s southeast.

As a correspondent in the small but densely populated country of nearly 170 million, the successful candidate will document the expansion of Bangladesh’s economy which has grown faster than most, but is now under pressure from rising energy prices. Its ties with regional powerhouses China and India will also be of immense interest.

**About the Role**

As a **Bangladesh Correspondent,** you will:

-- Stay on top of all major news and deliver it to Reuters clients in coordination with the South Asia Breaking News Hub.

-- Build contacts across government, industries and regional offices of global humanitarian and other agencies to deliver a rich initiatives file.

To be a **Bangladesh Correspondent,** you should have: 

-- A passion for news, speed and accuracy.

-- Excellent news judgment across the file. 

-- Very strong writing skills. 

-- Good communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues outside the country.

-- An ability to work calmly under pressure.

**What’s in it for You****?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

-- **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer you truly international career and progression opportunities.

**-- Learning & Development**: On-the-job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists.

**-- Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits including paid volunteering days.

**-- Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, colour, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. title: Chief Correspondent, Switzerland & Austria – Reuters
description:
**Chief Correspondent** **Switzerland & Austria (f/m/d),**

**based in Zurich, Switzerland.**

We are looking for an ambitious and creative journalist with strong news judgment and a passion for storytelling to lead our reporters in Switzerland and Austria.

In this job, you would lead a team of reporters based in Geneva, Zurich and Vienna, reporting in English and German to cover top stories and generate exclusives, ahead-of-the curve analyses and smart multimedia pieces for financial clients, media and dotcom readers. The region’s file is varied, ranging from the United Nations and the World Health Organisation to Swiss banks and pharma companies to the Vienna-based International Atomic Energy Agency.

As Chief Correspondent, you would also build your own source base in the region, develop and pitch story ideas and have an ability to frame stories from the region for an international audience. You would work closely with news editors, the region’s Breaking News Hub and visuals to hit the top stories hard, and would hire, develop and retain the best and most diverse talent for the team.

As our **Chief Correspondent for Switzerland & Austria,**you will:

* Ensuring a steady stream of story pitches to enrich the file out of Switzerland and Austria
* Working with correspondents to develop and execute story ideas
* Building and deepening a source base in Switzerland to generate scoops and exclusives
* Managing a team of reporters
* Writing and editing spot copy and trunks and helping to cover breaking news
* Liaising with visuals teams to ensure stories are multimedia
* Playing a key role in winning top timings by communicating quickly and clearly

To be**Chief Correspondent, Switzerland and Austria,**you will likely have**:**

* An understanding of how economies work
* Fluent English and strong German and/or French
* Strong writing and editing skills as well as news judgment
* An ability to work as part of a team across languages and media
* The ability to work under pressure

**What’s in it for You** 

At **Reuters**, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth: 

* An exciting work environment driven by the news
* A close-knit team that collaborates with Reuters journalists around the world
* Regular training offers on news subjects, technology and mental health issues
* Two mental health days per year
* Hybrid working options

**Please note, the deadline for applications is Friday 13th January 2023.**

**The successful candidate will report** **to Sabine Wollrab, co-Bureau Chief, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Balkans**

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news and sports news to professionals via the world's media organizations, desktop terminals, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: QA Engineer - Product Engineering
description:
**About the Role**  
In this opportunity as QA Engineer, you will:  

* Write new software, make modifications to existing software, or integrate software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications provided by others.
* Create and executes unit testing and integration testing ensuring module meets requirements.
* Execute on provided design.
* May provide technical support to operations or other development teams
* Create and maintain all required technical documentation / manual related to assigned components to ensure supportability.
* Make suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements, which will typically be reviewed by a more senior developer.
* Implement solutions as directed within standards.
* Participate in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
* Typically work on one project at a time and as a member of the project team(s) or as part of a specialist cross-project team on multiple developments.
* Work on smaller, minimally complex projects or a particular system or application within larger projects that requires a singular area of expertise.
* Provide status updates for own scope of work within projects.
* Participate in internal team and status meetings.
* Develop software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of QA Engineer if your background includes:  

* Integration testing
* Project planning
* Software development process
* Technical documents

title: Analyst - Global Trade Content
description:
​**Analyst - Global Trade Content** 

Are you looking for a new career opportunity in Trade Content? Are you passionate about the chance to bring your talent to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you,

Join our team to participate in an Editorial or Content Operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation, and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **Analyst - Global Trade Content**, you will:

* Participate in an editorial or content operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic).
* Be responsible for the production of a product line or process.
* ResearchTrade Content Online for various countries from authorized Government Websites.
* Interpret and convert government legislation related to DPS Sanctions and Embargoes  into Standard format/Software compatible format before loading in the system (Using MS Excel)
* Extract the DPS Content from source and convert into standard load file (Excel) and load them into system
* Track the daily regulatory changes from government websites for assigned Denied Party lists and update the data whenever applicable based on SLA
* Validate the DPS data by comparing source with system data
* Document the processes and work instructions
* Apply technology to client needs

**About You**

You're fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Fluent English is a must.
* Recent graduates/ 1 year of experience doing similar activities.
* Knowledge of HS and Customs regulations.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
* Analytical, interpretation, and translation skills.
* Strong MS Excel skills.
* Strong focus on delivery, including attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while at the same time fully participating in a team environment.

**Location: CDMX**

title: Project Manager, Professional Services
description:
Are you an experienced Technical Project Manager with strong client facing skills? Thomson Reuters provides world-class solutions of professional workflow, including Banks, Legal firms, Tax departments, Supply chain departments.

We are seeking a self-motivated member to join our team, focusing on managing software implementation and professional service projects in Asia Market.

**About the role**

In the role of Project Manager, Professional Services, you will

* Project management and lead consultants in implementation and integration of Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE software solutions at client sites in Japan, China, Korea and South East Asia.
* Support the pre-sales activities from professional service side to conduct product / technology due diligence and develop standard of work (SOW).
* Create/Review project scope, schedule, delivery plan; validate any requirements, identify project dependence, risk and issue with key project stakeholders.
* Proactively manage the changes of project scope and customers’ expectations.
* Lead functional & process requirement workshops with customers to define business, process, functional and data requirements, deliver Client trainings.

**About You**

In the role of the Project Manager, Professional Services, you should ideally possess:

* Strong project management skills, has 5-8 years of experience successfully managing complex client facing projects.
* Proven experience in enterprise software implementations, project life cycles and software implementation methodologies.
* Flexibility to travel 10~20 % to customer locations.
* Native level Japanese language skills and business proficiency in both written and spoken English.

**Education / Certifications Required**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Accounting & Finance or Project Management equivalent

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-DL2

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. title: Senior Conference Producer
description:
Senior/ Conference Producer

About the role:

* Managing the events assigned to you on a daily basis
* Researching and producing relevant, high quality conference agendas that appeal to various levels within the Legal industry.
* Speaker acquisition from the buy-side
* Event marketing – these are activities that promote the event to achieve commercial success and event attendance, including and not limited to, organising eDMs, building event microsite, liaising with sponsors, partnerships with associations, etc.
* Briefing sponsorship and telesales teams
* Onsite logistics – CP is responsible for onsite operations for all events assigned to you.
* Eventually, a Senior CP should be able to identify gaps in the market and developing events of various types in order to take advantage of these gaps
* Liaising with additional teams across Thomson Reuters Asia and cooperating closely with regard to both marketing for the events and event delivery

About you:

* Educated to degree level or higher
* Minimum 8 years conference production / research experience;  someone who may be mid-career and ready for further development into a Conference team manager in 2-3 years
* Able to demonstrate strong research abilities and quickly understand a wide range of topics
* Strong telephone and interpersonal skills
* Focus on time management and ability to focus on a number of different projects at any one time
* Ability to work independently; a self-starter who can navigate and multitask, across project and units
* Commercial acumen would be beneficial, some experience dealing with clients preferred
* Knowledge of the legal industry would be advantageous

Skills required:

* Strong research skills and experience in speaker acquisitions
* Ability to work with sponsors, and the sponsorship team to achieve commercial success of the events assigned
* Ability to bring along best practices and experience from previous roles
* Strong organisational, record keeping and time management systems
* Candidates with an open mind to pick up commercial acumen, ability to navigate in a complex and dynamic environment

**What’s in it For You**
