title: Systems Engineer
description:
Job Description

Thomson Reuters provides knowledge to act: we deliver information quickly and efficiently so professionals can make decisions that matter. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the legal, tax and accounting markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization. We aim to provide every one of our employees with a positive working environment, continued professional development and a commitment to work-life balance and equal opportunities. We are also part of a vast network of global career opportunities and actively encourage development of staff in the business.

OSP Operations is a part of Platform Organization supporting the Novus Suite, the underlying enterprise search and data retrieval platform that supports over 20 online applications across Thomson Reuters Professional and $1.9B in revenue.  The responsibility of this group is to deliver highly performing, highly available solutions that enable Thomson Reuters partners to drive continued growth of online revenue.

AMS Bangalore is a part of Novus operations team and provides support for various applications and services that come under the umbrella of Novus suite.  This team performs 3 critical support functions namely application management, incident management and change/release management. For application management function, it interfaces with application teams to ensure processes are in place to support the application, works on application configuration, facilitate creation of monitoring solution. AMS provides incident management by being primary contact for problem notifications, coordination, tracking and reporting. It utilizes diagnostic and debugging tools. It also aids in identifying problem areas within application and utilize post mortem process wherever applicable. AMS provides release management by performing feature and maintenance releases for Client and prod environments, does deployment checkouts, coordinates platform specific patches and upgrades.  

This position will provide you opportunities to collaborate with highly skilled peers in developing innovative technical solutions. The position applies industry standard requirements in a variety of technologies such as Tomcat, Coherence, Linux, Java and enterprise database technologies such as Oracle, IBM MQ etc,.

The ideal candidate will be:

* Keen to learn complex architectures and come up to speed quickly.
* A self learner, self driven and able to operate with minimal supervision.
* Able to demonstrate ownership on accountabilities.
* Able to successfully communicate with business partners, management and technical team members.
* Proactive in raising problems and identifying solutions.
* Strong sense of customer service.
* Able to work in a highly collaborative team setting.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Perform change management functions involving software deployment and server maintenance requests.
* Coordinate and plan changes with other technology teams involving servers within our environment.
* Respond and mitigate incidents as they occur within the environment.
* Contribute details to post incident review process.
* Communicate and escalate customer impacting issues according to department guidelines.
* Represent operations in a technical fashion to leadership and development teams.
* Lead projects and engagements that evolve the stability, scalability, and supportability of the Cobalt Services environment.
* Partner with development and other operations team to continue evolving our monitoring and operational procedures for the Cobalt Services architecture.
* Be a customer advocate ensuring service requests are completed and assigned with the appropriate priority within the operations teams.
* Update support documentation as needed as environment changes occur.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* College degree or technical certification.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in an enterprise level operations support role OR systems administration position.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong collaboration skills.
* Desire to work in a fast-paced, agile based environment.
* Working knowledge of Linux, Tomcat and Java applications.
* Familiarity of ITIL Change and Incident management processes.
* Familiarity with software development and QA practices (e.g. Agile)
* Familiarity of database and networking concepts.
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. title: Lead Software Engineer - Product Engineer
description:
Lead Software Engineers – Equipo de Ingeniería

¿Te apasiona la oportunidad de aportar tu experiencia técnica para impulsar a nuestro equipo de ingeniería utilizando las mejores prácticas de la industria en una empresa de clase mundial? Estamos contratando **100+ Ingenieros en Software Bilingües** con diferentes niveles de experiencia, para trabajar en nuestro centro de operaciones en Ciudad de México. Estamos expandiendo nuestra presencia global de Centros de Operaciones mediante el establecimiento de un nuevo Centro de Operaciones en la Ciudad de México para servir a todo el continente americano (América del Norte y LatAm) con posiciones que representan productos, tecnología, operaciones de ventas, ventas internas, servicio a clientes y finanzas. Este nuevo Centro de Operaciones se basará en los centros existentes establecidos en Asia (India y Filipinas), Europa (Polonia) y América (Costa Rica) 

Como **Ingeniero en Software en Thomson Reuters**, serás responsable de buscar continuamente la optimización de los sistemas y servicios de seguridad, la automatización, el desempeño y la disponibilidad, al mismo tiempo de garantizar que las soluciones desarrolladas, se apeguen a los estándares de arquitectura. Serás responsable de garantizar que los sistemas tecnológicos y los procesos relacionados se alineen con los valores organizacionales. Podrás [ofrecer soluciones innovadoras](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/artificial-intelligence/thomson-reuters-brings-the-human-touch-to-artificial-intelligence.html?trkcode=hero&trktype=internal)que tengan un impacto en los negocios de nuestros clientes todos los días y estar en contacto con compañeros de equipo a nivel mundial para desarrollar ideas innovadoras para los mejores productos disponibles en el mercado. ¡Estamos comprometidos con el crecimiento de nuestro equipo de Ingeniería y queremos gente que este igual de entusiasmada que nosotros! 

**Acerca de la posición**

En esta oportunidad como **Lead Software Engineer** tendrás la oportunidad de:

* **Desarrollo y entrega**: Aplicar practicas modernas de Ingeniería, serás parte de todo el desarrollo, soporte operativo, monitoreo, automatización, creación, testing y proporcionar soluciones de alta calidad para el equipo de Ingeniería.
* **Trabajo en equipo**: Trabajar en un ambiente de equipo colaborativo, compartirás información, valorarás diferentes ideas y te asociaras con equipos multifuncionales y remotos.
* **Tendrás una mente Ágil:** Con un fuerte sentido de urgencia y un deseo de trabajar de forma rápida, en un ambiente dinámico, proporcionaras soluciones en plazos de tiempo estrictos
* **Innovador**: Tendrás la capacidad de probar nuevos enfoques y aprender nuevas tecnologías. Contribuirás con ideas innovadoras, crearas soluciones y serás responsable de las entregas de proyectos, de principio a fin.
* **Comunicación efectiva:** Por medio del compromiso activo, la comunicación con socios multifuncionales y miembros del equipo, comunicaras ideas de manera efectiva y colaboraras en desarrollos técnicos.

 **Acerca de ti**

Tu perfil se ajusta a nuestras funciones de **Lead Software Engineer** si tienes las siguientes:

* Licenciatura en Ciencia de la computación, Ingeniería, Tecnología de la información o experiencia equivalente
* 7+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.

**Nuestro perfil Ideal debe de ser experto en:**

* .Net/C#, ASP.Net **o** Java (tener experiencia en alguno de los lenguajes antes mencionados)
* AWS
* Desarrollo API
* Contenedores (eg Docker, Kubernetes)
* Desarrollo UI: Angular, JQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, HTML5, XML, JSON

**Las siguientes habilidades también son deseadas**

* Experiencia trabajando con relational databases y/o bases de datos NoSQL
* Experiencia práctica trabajando con desarrollo server-side JavaScript con conocimiento en creación de procesos en modern JavaScript (tests,linting,transpilation,bunduling, minification, deployment) y herramientas (Webpack, Babel, Eslint, Karma, Jasmine, Jenkins)

**Buscamos profesionales que tengan comunicación fluida en español e inglés, hablado y escrito.**

 **Lo que tenemos para ti:** 

En Thomson Reuters nuestro talento es lo más importante, aquí te compartimos algunos de los beneficios que ofrecemos para tu crecimiento personal y profesional. 

**Nuestra cultura**: Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en una [compañía líder](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/awards-recognition.html) en el mercado tanto en contenido como en tecnología y que está apasionada contribuir a la sociedad. 

**Aprendizaje y Desarrollo:** Oportunidad de trabajar con una [amplia variedad de tecnología de punta](https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=6HcPr8kgm3U), cursos de aprendizaje, conferencias, eventos de networking, pláticas in-house, así como acceso a Hackathons, LinkedIn Learning, Unconferences y más. 

**Paquete de Beneficios:** Seguros de vida, discapacidad, Gastos médicos mayores y menores, IMSS, SAR, Vales de despensa, Prima vacacional y Aguinaldo entre otros. 

**Impacto Social:** Red global de voluntarios, eventos virtuales de voluntariado, 2 días pagados de voluntariado al año, la empresa aporta para donaciones caritativas y recaudación de fondos. 

**#LI-DD3**

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

* Ingeniero en Software Sr. 5+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.
* Ingeniero Principal en Software 7+ años de experiencia en conocimiento practico en el entorno del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.
* Gerente de Desarrollo de Software 10+ años de experiencia relacionada con el desarrollo de tecnología y un sólido conocimiento del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software.

Nuestro perfil Ideal debe tener experiencia práctica en: 

* Angular
* .Net/C#, ASP.Net o Java
* JavaScript
* AWS  or Azure
* Desarrollo API
* Contenedores (eg Docker, Kubernetes)
* Desarrollo UI: Angular, JQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, HTML5, XML, JSON

Adicionalmente a la experiencia y habilidades mencionadas, el Manager de Desarrollo de Software, necesita tener la siguiente experiencia: 

* 2+ de años de experiencia de manejo de equipos.
* Experiencia administrando y lidereando proyectos de desarrollo de software.
* Amplio conocimiento y compromiso con los valores y principios de desarrollo de software y productos.
* Excelentes habilidades de trabajo en equipo y habilidad de negociar con las diferentes áreas y clientes dentro de la organización.
* Una persona activa y comprometida que tome la iniciativa y esté dispuesta a tomar decisiones cuando sea necesario.
* Un líder con excelentes habilidades de comunicación. Serás responsable de presentar de manera efectiva a una amplia audiencia como Lideres de Tecnología y socios comerciales.
* Abierto a escuchar y aprender de las ideas de otras personas, siempre dispuesto a compartir su punto de vista.
* Promotor de la innovación
* Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita, tanto en inglés como en español.

En Thomson Reuters nuestro talento es lo más importante, aquí te compartimos algunos de los beneficios que ofrecemos para tu crecimiento personal y profesional.

title: Software Engineer, Product Engineering
description:
* **Software  Development Engineer – Product Engineering**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring **100+ Software Engineers** with various experience levels for our Operations Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Operations Centers footprint by establishing a new Operations Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Operations Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica). 

As a **Software Engineer at Thomson Reuters**, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to [develop innovative solutions](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/artificial-intelligence/thomson-reuters-brings-the-human-touch-to-artificial-intelligence.html?trkcode=hero&trktype=internal) for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are! 

**About the Role**  

In these opportunities as a **Software Engineer (Software Engineer, Senior Software Engineer, Lead Engineer, and Software Development Manager**) you will:
* **Develop and Deliver:** Apply modern Engineering practices; you will be involved in the entire development, operational support, monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions for the Engineering team
* **Be a Team Player:** Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
* **Have an Agile Mindset:**  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines
* **Be Innovative:**You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
* **Be an Effective Communicator:** Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments
* **About You** 

You’re a fit our **Software** **Engineering**roles **(Software Engineer, Senior Software Engineer, & Software Development Manager**) if you have:
* A Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience
* **Software Engineer** 1+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment
* **Senior Software Engineer** 5+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment
* **Lead Software Engineer** 7+ years of working knowledge in software development lifecycle environment
* **Software Development Manager** 10+ years technology development related experience and strong knowledge of the software development life cycle.
* 
* The ideal candidate hands-on experience with:
* .Net/C#, ASP.Net or Java
* AWS
* API development
* Containerization (eg Docker, Kubernetes)
* UI Development: Angular, JQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, HTML5, XML, JSON
* The following skills are also desirable:
* Experience working with relational databases and/or NoSQL databases.
* Hands-on experience with server-side JavaScript development with an understanding of modern JavaScript build procedures (tests, linting, transpilation, bundling, minification, deployment) and tools (Webpack, Babel, Eslint, Karma, Jasmine, Jenkins)
* We prefer candidates to have strong written and oral communication skills in Spanish and English
* In addition to the above qualifications, the **Software Development Manager** will have the following experience:
* 2+ years of people management experience
* Experience in leading and managing projects in the software development
* Strong understanding of and commitment to lean product and software development values and principles
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to influence stakeholders at all levels in the   organization
* Strong bias for action, taking ownership and initiative and willing to take risks when appropriate
* Strong leadership presence and effective communicator. Must be able to present effectively to a wide range of audiences such as Technology leadership, business partners
* Active listening skills, open to learning and ideas from others; willingness to offer a point of view
* A strong advocate for innovation
* Strong inter-team communication, written and oral communication skills in Spanish and English
* **What’s in it For You?** 

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:
* **Our Culture**: You will have the opportunity to work for a [globally recognized company](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/awards-recognition.html) that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* **Learning & Development**: Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology, various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series. As well as access to Hackathons, Unconferences, LinkedIn Learning and more
* **Benefits**: Vacation Bonus, Christmas Bonus, Life and Disability Insurance, Major medical expenses insurance, Grocery Coupons, IMSS, INFONAVIT, SAR
* **Social Impact**: Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive technical experience to drive the Site Reliability Engineering team using industry best practices in a world class company? Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE Platform’s SRE team is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who will provide hands-on technical skills and share industry best practices with other team members on core SRE principles and tools. The Site Reliability Engineer will participate in end to end operational aspects of ONESOURCE Platform Applications by working closely with Architects, DevOps, Product and development teams to ensure we get the most out of the software on AWS platform.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a Site Reliability Engineer, you will: 

* **Develop and Deliver:** applying modern SRE operational & development practices, you will be involved in the entire operational support, Monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high quality solutions for SRE team.
* **Be a Team Player:** Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams
* **Be an Agile Person:**  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines.
* **Be Innovative:** you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
* **Be an Effective Communicator:** through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

**About you:**

You’re a fit for the role of Software Engineer if you:

* Have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science discipline and AWS Certification is a plus. (AWS Sysops Admin preferred)
* 2 plus years of experience as an SRE engineer or DevOps engineer on AWS Cloud platform.
* Ability to work with minimal guidance or no supervision from Senior Site Reliability Engineers.
* Demonstrate high-proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications.
* Ability to code in one of the programming languages (Java, C#, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
* Ensure highest level of uptime, up to date Server patching and SSL certificates and implement system wide corrections to prevent reoccurrence of issues.
* Triage, troubleshoot and resolve issues using golden signals and go past golden signals (Chaos Engineering/Gameday etc.,)
* Create and develop documentations on Application services, infrastructure details, Recovery Procedures, Root cause analysis.
* Proactive monitoring of the availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of all services
* Perform periodic on-call duty as part of the SRE team on a rotational basis.
* Experience with SQL, Windows Servers, Load balancers, Linux and AWS services such as AWS, Docker and Kubernetes, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CodeDeploy, DynamoDB, Lambda, SQS, Amazon FSX, Elastic Search and networking concepts are must.
* Working knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage, and networks)
* Experience with tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, Github, PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Datadog, CloudWatch are required.

**What’s in it For You**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Learning & Development**: On-the-job coaching & learning, tuition reimbursement, exposure to leading-edge technology
* **Benefits**: Flexible work arrangements, comprehensive health coverage that’s effective day one
* **Perks**: Social events & activities, employee discount programs through corporate perks

title: Senior Sail point Engineer - Operations Information Security
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring **100+ Software Engineers including** **Senior Sail point Engineer** with various experience levels for our Shared Service Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Shared Service Centers footprint by establishing a new Shared Service Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Shared Service Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica). 

As a **Senior Sail point Engineer at Thomson Reuters**, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to [develop innovative solutions](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/artificial-intelligence/thomson-reuters-brings-the-human-touch-to-artificial-intelligence.html?trkcode=hero&trktype=internal) for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are to join us a **Senior Sail point Engineer**! 

**About the Role**  

In these opportunities as a **Senior Sail point Engineer** you will:  

* **Develop and Deliver:** Apply modern Engineering practices; you will be involved in the entire development, operational support, monitoring, automation, building, testing and delivering high-quality solutions for the Engineering team
* **Be a Team Player:** Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
* **Have an Agile Mindset:**  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines
* **Be Innovative:**You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
* **Be an Effective Communicator:** Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

**About You** 

You’re a fit for our **Senior Sail point Engineer**roles if you have:   

* A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of working knowledge in Sail point​
* Provides a high level of technical and subject matter expertise in one or more technologies and serves as a point of escalation for technical issues related to specialty.
* Produces, delivers, and maintains appropriate documentation for systems in accordance document control standards and procedures.
* Provide input to records, quality systems and management reports as required
* Contributes to the definition and implementation of improved operability on new and current systems.
* Uses innovative methods including the redesign of process and providing technical solutions to reduce the volume and mean time to recover incidents in assigned business unit.
* Identifies risks & issues and takes ownership to deliver appropriate resolutions.
* Provides technical expertise for root cause analysis and problem management.
* Provides detailed implementation/project plans across multiple, complex work streams according to agreed standards and ensures project processes and timelines are understood and followed.
* Works and cooperates with internal and external groups when required in order to fully support environments and maintain service.
* Adheres to change management procedures in defining, planning and implementing change in such a way that ensures appropriate coordination with other teams, minimizes service disruption, and ensures adherence to Service Level Agreements.
* Improves change management processes and procedures to ensure the most efficient processing of change within appropriate service risk constraints.
* Provides specialist support during complex and/or major incidents.
* May be asked to lead recovery efforts during major incidents within business unit.
* Deputize for the team manager as required.
* Contributes to or author technical documentation such complex changes instructions.
* Reviews, and updates as appropriate, operations procedures, standards, and technical policies.
* May be asked to assist with production of white papers on technical R&D projects
* Collaborates with business, third party vendors, developers, application support and technical operations groups to determine appropriate hardware/software needed and to resolve any issues impacting the application processes.
* Stays abreast of recent developments in related technical community, including new technology and business news that may impact vendors’ ability to provide service.
* Responsible to seek out all information and to fully understand all aspects of each device’s technology configuration and uses all approved engineering tools available to implement conforming change.
* Leads the analysis and design of complex solutions and requirements definition, including translating technical and business requirements into physical installations, costing design elements, and obtaining agreement to proposed solutions.
* Reviews and coordinates the implementation of proposed modifications, and changes to the production environment.
* Provides direction into standards and procedures for monitoring, capacity planning, tuning, maintenance, performance optimization, backups and recovery; ensures infrastructure will meet capacity requirements to deliver projects on time.
* Database Engineer:
* Provides direction for: proactive health and performance monitoring of databases, indexes and logs, and troubleshooting of reported issues.
* Reviews implemented scripts, stored procedures, and reports generated by automated database maintenance scripts.
* Participates in the technical design process as it relates to database implementations, reviews technical documents, and communicates any risks or issues using the appropriate escalation procedures.
* Provides directions to Technical Recovery plans (Database Standby and Replication, Backup and Recovery).
* Platform Engineer:
* Packages company approved hardened versions of targeted operating systems.
* Ensures stack of agents for management systems are properly installed and connected.
* Maintains patch levels in accordance with change management and security standards.
* Storage Engineer:
* Provides leadership for storage-related projects, including switch installations, disk consolidations, disk assignments, replication, and more.
* Works closely with architecture teams to set, communicate, and maintain storage standards.
* Network Engineer:
* Reviews the network infrastructure documentation/ run book for standards adherence.
* Complies with all routing and rules sets, sequences, defaults, and standards.
* Documents and maintains all applicable configuration standards.
* Assures all NIC and port speeds are appropriately locked down.
* Application Engineer:
* Fully familiarizes self with all aspects of the developed code.
* Recognizes design problems and errors and takes corrective action from a design perspective on the object code environment. Interfaces with development teams on system design enhancements and the elimination of intermittent hardware/software problems.

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

   
 

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Business Development Executive - Reuters Events
description:
**Business Development Executive - Reuters Events**

**This is a full-time position based in London with hybrid working available.**

Are you looking for a new challenge? Want to work with a range of global brands? Looking to be part of a friendly and inclusive sales team? If so, this might be the role for you! We’re looking for a **Business Development Executive** to join the **Sponsorship Sales** team at **Reuters Events**, a fast-growing conferencing and events business within **Thomson Reuters**.

Established in 1990 as FCBI, **Reuters Events** was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.

**Reuters Events** brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in a variety of specialized industry sectors (such as energy, pharmaceutical, automotive, insurance, finance, legal and many more!) to complement our extensive, in-depth content. Reuters Events exists to deliver strategic business intelligence and foster the relationships that safeguard success at leading organisations worldwide.

**About the Role** 

As a **Business Development Executive** you will:

* Work **collaboratively** with other executives in your sector to sell sponsorship packages across a varied and global event and conference portfolio.
* Be an **active listener** that's keen to offer appropriate solutions to our clients. We're **consultative** in our methods and are looking for someone who can thrive in this environment.
* **Enjoy learning** about new markets and stay up to date with industry trends (think current affairs, technological developments and changes across industries).
* Be **adaptable**. We don't need you to have sold sponsorships in the past but are looking for people who are eager to learn.
* Be comfortable speaking with a range of senior executives at some of the world's leading brands.
* Work closely and collaborate with our Conference Production team to **establish the best audiences** and maximize the success of our conferences and events.

**The Person**

To be our **Business Development Executive**, you will likely have:

* Have **excellent communication** skills. We're looking for someone who's comfortable representing the Reuters brand when engaging with other industry-leading businesses.
* Demonstrable B2B sales and business development experience.
* A **collaborative attitude**. We're team players at Reuters Events and are looking for someone who can succeed both individually and within a team-based environment.
* The desire to progress and **develop your skills** further. We have an excellent (uncapped!) commission scheme that rewards your achievements and are keen to grow and invest in our sales team.
* The ability to **adapt to changes** in markets and articulate potential solutions to a range of stakeholders over the phone, in person and on video calls.

**Please Note: completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 (GMT) on Sunday 22nd January 2023. Early applications are strongly encouraged.**

title: Tax Analyst (hybrid)
description:
**Tax Analyst  - 1041**

We are looking for an experienced Fiduciary Tax professional to join our development team. As a **Tax Analyst** with Thomson Reuters, you will make an immediate impact on how our customers accomplish their work and grow their advisory business. You will participate in design, development, and testing of our GoSystem Tax product line using in-house development tools.  In this role, you will collect, analyze, and prioritize requirements from various subject matter experts from our internal sources to define and make required changes to the GoSystem Tax software. It will require working closely with internal teams. The position requires a forward-thinking attitude to implement tax law changes in advance of a typical tax filing season.

  
**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Tax Analyst** you will: 

* Communicate with other internal teams to stay abreast of tax law changes per jurisdiction
* Monitor IRS and state taxing agency tax law changes by review of Checkpoint and other sources to stay current on impending tax law changes
* Implement changes to existing software
* Design the client interface for the tax planning software
* Write/and or communicate design changes for software engineers
* Test software products
* Write help documentation
* Train supporting help and answer questions

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Tax Analyst** if you have:

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or equivalent experience
* 0 - 2 years of Fiduciary (1041) tax preparation experience
* Knowledge of Fiduciary tax law - 1041
* Strong written and interpersonal communication skills
* Knowledge of ADO and tracking of work items through multiple teams

**Desired Experience:** 

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) OR Enrolled Agent (EA)
* GoSystem Tax ONESOURCE Tax a plus

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Assistant RH H/F (CDD 1 an)
description:
Reuters, la division actualités et médias de Thomson Reuters constitue la plus grande agence de presse indépendante au monde. Plus de 2 500 journalistes dans près de 200 endroits à travers le monde offrent une couverture médiatique nationale et internationale inégalée en 16 langues. Les journalistes de Reuters couvrent en temps réel l’actualité sur des sujets aussi variés que l’économie, la finance, la santé, les technologies. Reuters reste fidèle aux valeurs d’indépendance et d'intégrité en toute impartialité.

L’Agence Reuter recherche un(e) Assistant(e) Ressources Humaines H/F en contrat à durée déterminée d’1 an.

Il/Elle est le premier point de contact des salariés (près de 70 collaborateurs, principalement des journalistes, basés à Paris dans le 2ème arrondissement) et leur fournit des conseils, réponses et le support dont ils ont besoin. Il/Elle est rattaché(e) au Responsable des Ressources Humaines. Compte tenu de l’aspect international du groupe, il/elle est amené(e) à entretenir quotidiennement des échanges en français et en anglais par écrit et à l’oral.

**Missions principales**

* Intégration : suivi des intégrations de nouveaux collaborateurs : gestion du dossier administratif, préparation de l’arrivée, parcours d’intégration avec la conception d’un livret d’accueil ;
* Administration du personnel : aide à la preparation des promesses d’embauche, contrats, DPAE, attestations, gestion des visites médicales, des tickets restaurant et gestion des sujets de protection sociale (retraite, mutuelle et prévoyance), piloter la gestion des absences des collaborateurs dans l’outil de gestion Workday
* Paie : aide à la préparation des données de paie et collecte les éléments de variables
* Communication RH : conseiller et accompagner les employés dans leurs questions individuelles en soutien à la Responsable RH sur les orientations de l’entreprise et notamment les principaux accords et politiques locales en vigueur
* Elaboration des rapports RH
* Aide à la professionnalisation des processus RH pour gagner en efficacité opérationnelle
* Participation, en soutien à l’équipe RH, aux projets transverses
* Classement / archivage des données RH

**Compétences clés/profil**

* Diplômé(e) d’une formation supérieure en Ressources Humaines (BAC+2/BAC+3), vous justifiez de 3 ans minimum d’expérience en ressources humaines et plus particulièrement en administration du personnel au cours de laquelle vous avez été confronté(e) à des processus RH complexes qui vous ont inculqué(e) une certaine rigueur et méthodologie
* Justifier d’un niveau d’anglais professionnel voire courant à l’écrit et à l’oral
* Être doté(e) de solides compétences relationnelles et rédactionnelles
* Avoir une excellente maitrise du Pack Office et particulièrement Excel (tableau croisé dynamique etc)
* Être disponible, diplomate, ouvert d’esprit et facilement enclin à travailler dans un environnement multiculturel
* Être polyvalent(e), rigoureux(se), réactif(ve) et organisé(e)

title: Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters
description:
**Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters**

**This hybrid role will be based from our office in Canary Wharf, London.**

Do you like using data to tell stories? Are you great at analysing both quantitative and qualitative data? Keen to work as part of an inclusive global team? If so, this role as a **Reader Revenue Analyst** might be for you.

**Reuters** is seeking a **Reader Revenue** **Analyst** to work across a number of business areas within **Reuters Professional**. Reuters Professional is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news that has a tangible impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and we serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Reader Revenue Analyst**, you will:

* Build & interrogate a range of data analytics reports and dashboards for various business units within Reuters.
* Outline changes and trends in Reuters audience to ensure we're making the right decisions to serve our audience.
* Develop relationships across teams to gain understanding of organizational needs.
* Identify opportunities to improve customer products and services based on data.
* Support the larger team through problem solving and answering ad hoc requests as required.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Reader Revenue Analyst** if you:

* Are comfortable managing and analyzing large sets of both quantitative and qualitative data sets (including mapping analytics, tracking and performance measurement).
* Have experience of working with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude, Adobe Analytics)
* Are comfortable managing advanced Excel spreadsheets and presenting your findings to a range of senior stakeholders across the organization.
* Have a collaborative mindset, able to work across different departments and liaise with stakeholders based globally.
* Have an interest in - and an understanding of - mapping user journeys and segmenting audiences (experience of this is desired but by no means prerequisite).

**Please note: Completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 GMT on Sunday 22nd January 2023. Early applications are actively encouraged.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

title: Event Co-ordinator
description:
**About the role:**•Plan and execute the logistics for large and complex conference and industry awards events•Partner with Events Producer and Sponsorship Sales Manager to coordinate speaker travel and accommodation, sponsor deliverables and delegate registration•Sourcing of all event venues•Track and report on all event metrics including satisfaction surveys, post-event follow up, delegate sales figures, event costs and P&L•Manage the event process end-to-end, including managing a range of third-party vendors•Overseeing all communication with delegates, sponsors and event partners•Speaker management, including speaker bookings, flights and accommodation bookings, airport transfers, speaker gifts, speaker liaison, onsite speaker management•Onsite attendance at conferences and events, managing registration process for delegates, all event logistics, catering and general venue management•Sourcing and liaising with vendors, exhibitors and suppliers; negotiating with vendors and suppliers to achieve the most favourable terms•Maintaining event databases**About you:**

•Project management•Administrative and organizational skills•Events planning, coordination and management•Strong customer service focus•Financial reporting and analysis•Ability to work both within a team environment and independently**What’s in it For You**

title: Business Development Manager, SEA
description:
Are you a strong sales hunter who is keen on selling content-led enterprise solutions?

As a **Business Development Manager, SEA** you will be responsible for securing new sales of tax and accounting solutions across the Southeast Asia region. Working as part of a team, you will be responsible for end-to-end sales process management, from prospecting to negotiation and close.This will include giving a general overview about ONESOURCE, tax and accounting solutions from Thomson Reuters. Based in Singapore, you will be responsible for growing Thomson Reuters tax and accounting business in the region.

**About the Role**

As a Business Development Manager, SEA, you will:

* Drive new business to hit sales targets throughout the year.
* Respond quickly to new leads and working with urgency to progress deals through the sales cycle.
* Understand customer requirements / needs and find the best solution within Thomson Reuters Services capability to develop a suitable and strong proposal which can create difference from competitors.
* Develop winning market strategies that align with the business strategy
* Effectively plan, coordinate and control your territory.
* Keep up to date with news and changes in policy, regulations and activities of major players in the industry to have sufficient domain knowledge to lead discussion with customers and present expertise in public.
* Use CRM system to maintain customer and opportunity data with discipline to enhance customer insight and ensure accurate forecasting.

**About You**

As a Business Development Manager, SEA, you should possess:

* Proven track record in achieving sales targets and ability to prospect, develop and close strategic relationships and customer opportunities to achieve sales.
* Ability to engage with C-level decision makers.
* Strong presentation skills both verbal and written.
* Tax/Accounting qualifications is preferred but not a must
* High level of proficiency in using SFDC, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
* Fluent English and ability to speak additional language is an advantage.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

title: Presales Global Trade
description:
Presales Global Trade
---------------------

Do you have experience in global trade solutions? Do you know about IMMEX, FTA, and the Global Trade processes? Do you have experience supporting the sales organization with a value proposition? Are you passionate about being a trusted sales consultant? Do you have experience working closely with high-performance team leaders and decision-makers? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join us to provide deep industry, solution or product expertise to sales process.  

**About The Role**

In this opportunity as **a** **Presales Global Trade**, you will:

* Serves as a primary resource for sales consultants, account managers, and sales management to understand content/product offerings, business policies, commissions, promotions, incentives, and procedures for all pre-sale issues relates a Global Trade.
* Develops data /content and recommendations for all exceptions to presentation to the exception committee
* Conducts monthly and ad-hoc operation reporting and analysis.
* Consults with Sales managers to resolve problems and interpret information/policies and procedures.
* When necessary and appropriate, communicates pricing and product information to customers directly.
* Monitors data and provides analysis to illustrate sales trends, identify weaknesses in current sales execution and support the future sales strategy.
* Manages the coordination and investigation of order processing activities, fulfillment, compensation, and other requests during and at end of the month.
* May provide logistical support for national and regional sales meetings and other events as needed
* Consults with management on the effect of policies and procedures on business goals and assist in developing and implementing policy and procedure.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* +5 years of experience in Global Trade.
* English Proficiency is a MUST.
* Experience working as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders.
* Experience monitoring and analyzing data information.
* University Degree.

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.


**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-ZM1**

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Tax/Legal Analyst (remote)
description:
The **Tax/Legal Analyst** is responsible for research, configuration, ongoing maintenance and testing to ensure that ONESOURCE™ applications and offerings comply with tax rules and laws. Experience in indirect taxes related to Leasing industry is desired.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Tax/Legal Analyst,** you will: 

* Research, analyze, interpret and document tax laws and regulations to enable accurate tax determination and/or compliance
* Monitor tax statutes, regulations, legislative activity, court decisions, compliance forms, geographic boundaries and/or publications on a continuous basis to stay informed of changes in laws and regulations
* Implement new content and content changes within applications; complete work within prescribed content deadlines
* Design and execute test scenarios to ensure content accuracy and functionality
* Correspond with tax authorities to obtain content requirements
* Research and respond to client inquiries in partnership with Customer Support

**Key Relationships:** 

* Customer Support

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Tax/Legal Analyst,** if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s Degree in tax, accounting, and/or finance is required
* JD, LLM, MBA or CPA/Chartered Tax Adviser
* Two (2) to Four (4) years’ relevant tax experience
* Detail-oriented with an aptitude for analysis and problem solving including ability to interpret, analyze and organize detailed legal, tax jurisdiction and/or geographic material
* Ability to utilize online research tools and/or data sources (e.g. Checkpoint, Tax Analysts, WestLaw)
* Ability to consistently meet rigid and recurring deadlines
* Superior written and verbal communication skills, including ability to write white papers on tax and/or geography technical subjects
* Superior organizational skills with ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks
* Intermediate to advance software skills (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word, Access)
* Ability to work and proactively learn independently with minimal supervision
* Written and spoken fluency in English

**Desired Skills:** 

* Experience working for a public accounting firm or corporate tax department
* Knowledge of Indirect Tax
* Experience with tax calculation and compliance software (e.g. ONESOURCE™)
* Experience communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Fluency in languages other than English

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Presales Global Trade
description:
Presales Global Trade
---------------------

Do you have experience in global trade solutions? Do you know about IMMEX, FTA, and the Global Trade processes? Do you have experience supporting the sales organization with a value proposition? Are you passionate about being a trusted sales consultant? Do you have experience working closely with high-performance team leaders and decision-makers? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join us to provide deep industry, solution or product expertise to sales process.  

**About The Role**

In this opportunity as **a Presales Global Trade**, you will:

* Serves as a primary resource for sales consultants, account managers, and sales management to understand content/product offerings, business policies, commissions, promotions, incentives, and procedures for all pre-sale issues relates a Global Trade.
* Develops data /content and recommendations for all exceptions to presentation to the exception committee
* Conducts monthly and ad-hoc operation reporting and analysis.
* Consults with Sales managers to resolve problems and interpret information/policies and procedures.
* When necessary and appropriate, communicates pricing and product information to customers directly.
* Monitors data and provides analysis to illustrate sales trends, identify weaknesses in current sales execution and support the future sales strategy.
* Manages the coordination and investigation of order processing activities, fulfillment, compensation, and other requests during and at end of the month.
* May provide logistical support for national and regional sales meetings and other events as needed
* Consults with management on the effect of policies and procedures on business goals and assist in developing and implementing policy and procedure.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* +5 years of experience in Global Trade.
* English Proficiency is a MUST.
* Experience working as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders.
* Experience monitoring and analyzing data information.
* University Degree.

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.

title: Government Affairs and ESG Internship
description:

* At Thomson Reuters, we provide information-enabled software to help our customers in the legal, tax, accounting, corporate, news, and media fields, to make decisions that move society forward. By joining us, you will make your mark in one of WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs of 2020, with opportunities for working with industry-leading products.

* We are seeking a motivated intern to work on government affairs, social impact and ESG related issues.  At Thomson Reuters we are focused on building an inclusive culture of world-class talent. title: Data Science Summer 2023 Internshp
description:
Thomson Reuters Special Services is looking for a talented and motivated technical intern with data science and programming skills to create, design, and build a data science project.

In this role, you will leverage Thomson Reuters data to help understand and address an important U.S. government related data project. You will receive mentoring and advice from an experienced team of data scientists, research scientists, and software engineers. At the end of the internship, you will present your ideas and progress to the company as part of a larger session of intern presentations.

**The internship dates are as follows: May 22, 2023 - August 18, 2023**

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Data Science Intern, you will:

* Work closely with a team of data scientists, research scientists, and software engineers to create, design, and build a proof of concept related to the field of national and global security
* Write well-designed, well-constructed, and well-tested code
* Perform statistical analyses or create machine learning models
* Present your progress at the end of the engagement\

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Data Science Intern if you:

* Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance
* Open to any of the following academic levels in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Basic/Applied Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field:


	+ Junior or Senior undergraduate
	+ Bachelor's degree
	+ Graduate student
* Experience coding in at least one of the following:


	+ Python, Java, R, Scala, C/C++
* Basic knowledge of statistics or machine learning principles (advanced knowledge is a bonus)
* Communicate effectively (verbal and written) to different audiences
* Problem-solving and critical thinking skills
* Continuously learning new skills and technologies
* Good team player

TRSS is a wholly US-owned, independent subsidiary of Thomson Reuters. Our analysts combine open-source research with the full suite of proprietary Thomson Reuters data holdings to deliver actionable intelligence to our clients.

title: Analysis Summer 2023 Internship
description:
Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) combines market-leading datasets and technology with expert insights to address and solve our customers’ diverse risk and security challenges. Our customers include various agencies within the federal government and members of both the public and private sector. Each summer, TRSS offers ambitious individuals an opportunity to enhance their professional skills and make a difference by developing solutions to solve complex issues. This internship program will involve hands-on training with TRSS’ unique resources, data science applications, and close collaboration with senior subject matter experts.

**The internship dates are as follows: May 22, 2023 - August 11, 2023**

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Analysis Intern, you will: 

* **Develop** an understanding of TRSS’ proprietary data and technology applications.
* **Complete** ad-hoc, analysis-based requests in an efficient and timely manner.
* **Develop and Present** a long-term research project using skills and data relevant to TRSS’s mission and focus areas (e.g. predictive analysis, trends, forecasting, and early warning detection).

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Analysis Intern if your background includes:

* Must, at a minimum, be in your senior year of undergraduate study. Preference will be given to those qualified candidates currently studying in, or recently graduated from a master’s degree program.
* Minimum GPA of 3.2
* Intern must be 18 years old and meet the same employment standards as permanent employees.
* Have an interest in national security concerns, emerging and/or dual-use technologies, exploiting datasets, due-diligence, open-source research, AML, counter-proliferation, or similar topics.
* ***Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance***

•   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

•   Excellent oral and written communication skills

•   Ability and experience developing formal presentations in a professional manner

•   Intermediate to advanced proficiency with MS Office suite

•   Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

•   Must be able to maintain a high level of confidentiality with sensitive information

•   Foreign language skills desirable

**Logistics**

* Monday - Friday, 40 hours a week

* In person or Hybrid opportunities available

**Compensation**

* Competitively paid internships

title: Sr. Legal Editor, Manufacturing & Supply Chain (remote)
description:
Thomson Reuters is the world's leading source of intelligent information for businesses and professionals. Practical Law, a Thomson Reuters business, is a leading online provider of legal know-how. We help lawyers practice more efficiently and deliver greater value to clients. As a full-time **Senior Legal Editor** on Practical Law’s team, you will have the opportunity to apply your practical experience in a highly professional environment with other experienced attorneys.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Senior Legal Editor, Manufacturing & Supply Chain**, you will:

* Develop content that is of national and global significance to be published as part of Practical Law’s online services.
* Write and edit legal resources, including standard form documents, practice guidance notes and checklists in accordance with Practical Law writing style.
* Assist in the editorial development of Practical Law or Thomson Reuters products.
* Establish and maintain relationships with external law firm contributors.
* Write and edit content for Practical Law’s companion magazine, Practical Law The Journal.
* Develop relationships with lawyers in private practice and in-house counsel and groups to ensure that the Commercial service’s content is topical and meets their needs.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Legal Editor, Manufacturing & Supply Chain** if your background includes:

* A minimum ten (10) years of experience working as a lawyer in a law firm or as in-house counsel and an understanding of the needs and priorities of law firm attorneys, in-house counsel, and compliance professionals. A mix of experience in both is preferred.
* Expertise with manufacturing and supply chain contracting and compliance, including:
	+ interpreting and negotiating commercial agreements;
	+ developing environmental, sustainability, or ESG compliance programs;
	+ supply chain auditing; and
	+ addressing legal risk in manufacturing and the supply chain.
* Skill and passion for writing, including:
	+ close attention to detail;
	+ impressive command of grammar, punctuation, and plain English; and
	+ the ability to write about complex legal issues clearly and simply.
* The ability to collaborate with and support team members.
* Flexibility in working on tasks other than writing legal resources, such as:
	+ supporting the product development and sales and marketing teams in their efforts to build and market Practical Law;
	+ giving presentations virtually, at conferences, and at the offices of potential subscribers; and
	+ responding to subscriber inquiries regarding Practical Law resources.

Candidates selected for a second interview will be required to submit a writing sample.

Practical Law provides a dynamic, energetic, and intellectual culture that encourages collaboration and creativity in producing the legal industry’s leading know-how product for attorneys. We value work/life balance, with our editors enjoying regular hours and uninterrupted vacations. We also devote substantial resources to the continued development of our employees, through extensive internal skills-building resources and trainings, as well as the opportunity to attend and participate in industry conferences. 

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the base compensation range for this position is $122,500 - $227,500. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

As required by local legislation for this remote based role, the base compensation range for this position is $108,500 - $201,500. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

title: Tax & Accounting Specialist Attorney (State Tax) (remote)
description:
As a Thomson Reuters **Tax & Accounting Specialist Attorney** working on Checkpoint Catalyst state content, you will create and maintain content for an exciting product line. This position is an excellent opportunity for tax attorneys who have expertise in state tax, strong analytical and writing skills, and significant practical experience.  Come join a team of talented tax professionals who leverage their subject matter expertise to provide trusted answers, insights, and solutions to our Checkpoint Catalyst customers.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Tax & Accounting Specialist Attorney** for Checkpoint Catalyst, State Tax, you will: 

* Interpret and analyze state tax developments across all jurisdictions that relate to your assigned topics
* Incorporate analysis into industry-leading tax research content on Checkpoint Catalyst
* Create practical, value-added editorial insights (observations, illustrations, cautions, and recommendations) to enhance our competitive edge
* Participate in enterprise-wide efforts to harness cutting-edge technological advances and take tax research to the next level
* Leverage industry knowledge in order to create an enhanced digital experience for our customers
* Support our sales, marketing, and customer-facing business partners

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Tax & Accounting Specialist Attorney** if you:

* Have a J.D.  (LL.M preferred)
* Have 3+ years of experience practicing tax law , including state tax experience
* Have excellent writing and research skills
* Can work quickly and accurately under deadline pressure
* Have technical acumen and an enthusiasm about the role of technology in the tax and accounting profession
* Are a team player with a positive attitude who gives and accepts feedback
* Can prioritize, independently manage workload, and work in an agile environment

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Tax Mgr Specialist Editor - Comp&Ben (REMOTE)
description:
Looking for an excellent work-life position outside the Big 4, large, mid-sized accounting firms or Industry?  
  
Desire a professional environment without the busy season hassle? Check this job out!

As a full-time editor in our fast-growing tax advisory and compliance team at Thomson Reuters, you will have the opportunity to apply your technical tax skills in a highly professional environment, without the headaches of public accounting or corporate tax deadlines. This is a dynamic job that allows you to fully utilize and continuously expand your technical skills, develop information and technology solutions for tax professionals in CPA firms or corporations across the U.S. and globally, while working with leaders in the profession and other highly expert tax professionals.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Tax** **Specialist Editor**, you will: 

* Design, develop, and update unique tax advisory and compliance solutions relied upon by accounting professionals in CPA firms or corporations throughout the U.S.
* Show direction on electronic tools that provide practical, step-by-step instruction for our customers and optimize customer retention rates.
* Apply technical expertise and exercise professional discernment in identifying significant topics and practice problems and providing practical guidance and practice insights.
* Contribute oversight for the efforts of other project team members, including outside authors and in-house content operations to ensure that deadlines are met.
* Collaborate with in-house customer service, tech support, and sales to bridge the gap so customers' needs are properly identified and supported.
* Communicate with customers (CPAs in public practice and in corporations) to understand their needs and ensure that our products are responsive to those needs.
* Assist with strategic development projects as requested.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Tax Specialist Editor** if you have:

* A CPA certification or Law degree.
* At least 5 years of practical experience (preferable as a Tax Manager or Senior Manager in Public Accounting or a Corporate Tax Manager/Director with prior public accounting experience).
* Broad-based technical tax knowledge with a deep understanding of Corporate Taxation and Compensation and Benefits (e.g., executive compensation, fringe benefits and health plans).
* Strong technical research and analytical skills.
* The ability to execute assignments in a timely, competent manner, and identify update features, practical insights, and other improvements to our products.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
