title: Scrum Master
description:
**Scrum Master**

Thomson Reuters is looking for a Scrum Master to coordinate and coach our software development and tax solution migration team.

**About the Role**  

* Manage a huge project development and migration scope and timeline, for big corporations and companies.
* Plan and facilitate sprint ceremonies including planning, refinement, demo, retrospective, and daily stand-up meetings
* Guide, coach and motivate the team to be highly effective, self-organized, productive and accountable, with an emphasis on achieving sprint commitments
* Partner with product owner/product manager to effectively create, maintain and refine the product backlog
* Facilitate communication channels for the Scrum/Kanban teams and associated business and technical stakeholders to ensure the vision, goals, progress and product delivery commitments are visible and well understood
* Identify and remove impediments and blockers that prevents the teams from delivering their sprint goals
* Teach, mentor, and facilitate Scrum and Kanban practices within the team as well as Agile Values and Principles
* Manage the team dependencies and coordinate work with other internal or external teams
* Set and continually manage expectations with team members and other stakeholders Monitor progress and team performance throughout the life of the project and monitor and manage project scope and deliverables
* Maintain relevant metrics and information radiators to guide the development teams and show their progress in meeting business objectives
* Manage a huge program including development and migration scope, for big corporations and companies.
* Helping software development and migration teams apply the Scrum framework

**About You** 

* Bachelor's Degree or diploma
* Demonstrable 3-5 years hands-on experienced with Scrum and Kanban methodologies
* Good interpersonal skills and ability work with a mentor and servant-leader mindset Former experience as a project manager and knowledge of software development processes and procedures to understand team needs
* Experience providing facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, team empowerment and motivational techniques regarding Agile and Scrum/Kanban
* Must be a certified Scrum Master, holding either a PSM or CSM
* Experience managing expectations and building trusting relationships/partnerships
* Ability to balance several projects across more than one team
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

**Desired Skills:**

* Be an energetic, self-starter, who is comfortable in a team-oriented environment including the ability to clearly articulate daily individual accomplishments and blocking issues.
* Demonstrated history of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrated history of good decision-making, conflict resolution, and follow through

**Related technologies to the project:**

* Oracle Database (SQL/PLSQL)
* SQL Windows
* Java
* ADO, Git; EasyBi, PowerBI, A-ha
* ABAP

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently many of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we have never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
 

*Optional* – compensation. Compensation may only be relevant for certain positions and is recommended for use primarily by Sales:    
 

**Compensation:** Base salary and variable compensation that is related to your success

title: Tecnico de Treinamento do Produto
description:
**Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto,**Legal

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição**

Nesta oportunidade, como **Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto**, você irá:

* Realizar treinamentos e prestar apoio ágil e de qualidade, sanando as dúvidas relacionadas ao funcionamento das nossas soluções jurídicas;
* Realizar reciclagem de treinamentos com os clientes/usuários e internos;
* Entender o negócio do cliente e apresentar melhores práticas de uso.

Horário de trabalho: De segunda a sexta-feira das 9h às 18h | Híbrido 2x por semana no escritório em São Paulo

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Desejável ensino superior em Direito, Administração, Comunicação ou áreas afins;
* Experiência em atendimento ao cliente, preferencialmente treinamento e capacitação ou implantação de sistemas;
* Desejável conhecimento na área jurídica;
* Inglês intermediário mandatório

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

**Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.

**Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.

**Wellbeing:**benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro

**Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos na empresa; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters

**Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.

**Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio , relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

**Remuneração**: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.

“Como empresa que estimula a Diversidade e Inclusão de seus talentos, reforçamos que todas as vagas da Thomson Reuters são elegíveis para **pessoas com deficiência**.”

title: Senior Sales Executive, Mid-Law (South East)
description:
The Medium Law Firm Senior Sales Executive is responsible for selling Westlaw, Practical Law, HighQ and other products to the legal community within an assigned territory. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Medium Law accounts. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of West products, sales techniques appropriate for a long sales cycle and the needs of the legal profession in order to bundle information solutions to meet broad firm needs.

**About the Role:**

* **Drive Results:** Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel; Support in developing and executing territory growth strategies
* **Closing**: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and drive deals to close
* **Relationship Management**: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals
* **Product Proposition**: Possess core knowledge across products within the sub-segment and engage Sales Specialists where deep product expertise is required to drive to close
* **Reporting**: Utilize an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals; KPI's include: Nurturing opportunities and moving more complex sales to close, i.e. New logo sales and existing ‘non-named’ account incremental sales
* **Client & Market Intelligence**: Understand specific customer archetypes and needs which are most prevalent within the sub-segment and territory

**About You:**

* Minimum 5 years successful sales experience in a consultative selling environment to C-level players
* 4 year college degree required
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Excellent communication skills and closing skills
* Effective time management skills
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
* Proficient in MS Office/Internet
* Working knowledge of West products, experience selling into large law accounts, and strong knowledge and background in the legal profession and/or legal publishing industry required
* High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting
* Proficient database management skills
* Law degree preferred
* Able to travel as required

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world

title: Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent, Reuters
description:
Reuters is looking for breaking news correspondents to cover Ukraine, delivering fast and excellent coverage of one of the world’s most important stories.

This is a role requiring reporters who can spot the most important news inside Ukraine whether it be the latest developments on the frontline of its war with Russia or a sudden change in monetary policy. 

It will be a fast-paced position filing news alerts on breaking news, writing swift updates and, sometimes, crafting quick sidebars.

The correspondents will form a virtual part of our Kyiv bureau - reporting into our Ukraine Chief Correspondent and working closely with the team there – but working from our large editorial centre in Gdansk, Poland.

**About the Role**  

As **Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent** you will:

* Work in a small team watching multiple news sources spanning Telegram channels and government news releases to Ukrainian TV stations and newspapers as well as speaking to Reuters’ reporters in the field
* Write news alerts, stories and quick sidebar stories on major events in Ukraine and, occasionally, Moldova
* Build relationships with key government departments, the military and companies to ensure Reuters gets the news first
* Be part of Reuters’ large editorial centre in Gdansk, which will give you exposure to the company’s broader global operations and opportunities for secondments elsewhere

**About You**

To be **Ukraine Breaking News Correspondent** you will have:

* Fluent English and Ukrainian language skills
* At least two years’ experience covering news in Ukraine or elsewhere in Eastern Europe
* A deep understanding of the Ukraine war, as well as Ukrainian politics and economics
* Ability to work calmly under pressure and maintain strict discipline on adhering to Reuters editorial standards
* Excellent news writing skills
* Good communication skills and the ability to work well in a team

**Please note, the deadline for applications is Sunday 8th January, 2023.**

**NB**: To be considered for this opportunity please ensure that you submit **BOTH** a CV and Cover Letter. Your Cover Letter should be addressed to “Whom It May Concern” and should detail your motivations for applying to the role.

**What’s in it For You?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcare and Multisport card
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Analyst - Global Trade Content
description:
* Research Trade Content Online for various countries from authorized Government Websites
* The trade Content includes Export control specifically Dual-use and Munitions List , Licensing and License exception related information, Trade Compliances including sanction related information, and Main and Supporting documents for exporting the controlled items
* Interpret and convert government legislation related to ECN (Export Control Number) into Standard format/Software compatible format before loading in the system (Using MS Excel)
* Extract the ECN data from source and convert into standard load file (Excel) and load them into system
* Daily track regulatory changes from government websites for assigned export control list and update the data whenever applicable based on SLA
* Validate the ECN data by comparing source with system data
* Document the processes and work instruction
* Apply technology to client needs

title: Head of Solution Center
description:
**Head of Solution Center**
---------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a**Head of Solution Center**, you will: 

* Drive the Proposition Sales Strategy from end-to-end development on feature/function specifications for new or legacy propositions, creating Go to Market strategies to meet our financial goals.
* Apply your knowledge about current industry trends to analyze and review diverse issues and demonstrates people leadership skills.
* Provide management and leadership to team leaders or supervisors.
* Assign work, allocate resources, monitor results, control costs, and manage staff.
* Interprets internal and external business issues and recommends solutions, applies a broad perspective to identify solutions to complex problems.
* Develop departmental plans, including business, production, and organizational priorities, which support overall business strategy.
* Implement complex or unusual technical, operational, and organizational problems that may be multi-disciplinary.
* Develops strong relationships and negotiate with key internal and external customers to identify future needs.
* Communicates difficult and complex concepts effectively, by altering communication style to the audience.
* Gathers analyses and presents complex concepts or sensitive information for discussion with more senior levels of management.
* Influences others to adopt a point of view for ideas and initiatives.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree
* Fluent English is a must.
* + 5 years of experience in similar positions.
* Experience in leading high-performance pre - sales teams.
* Strong knowledge of Global Trade
* Experiences working in a big four is preferred not a must.
* Strong commercial skills such as negotiation, active listening, business-oriented, and commercial awareness.
* commercial experience and knowledge of the Mexican market and other Latin American countries. ​

**Location: CDMX**

title: Sales Support Specialist
description:
**Sales Support Specialist**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience providing support to sales organizations about business policies and procedural issues?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and provide direct support to the Sales and Client Management organizations on order entry & order-related matters, commissions case assistance and acts as the primary triage point for order and case-related issues.  You will serve as the go-to resource for order-writing questions, order-processing steps, and assistance with problem-solving pre-sale issues and post-sale crediting and commissions cases.

**About the role**

In this opportunity as a **Sales Support** **Specialist,** you will:

* Responds to Sales and Client Management questions via inbound phone, email, and chat requests
* Identify order entry errors and trends by proactively comparing 1. quote to 2. Unison order to 3. Varicent sales and identify differences.
* Work with order processing and sales reps, as necessary, to fix order errors and communicate issues
* Consults with Sales, Sales Leadership, Commissions and Systems team to resolve problems in a timely and proactive manner
* Help sales professionals know where to go for data corrections (i.e., territory assignment issues, quota issues)
* Identify new products/product codes released throughout the year and inform Varicent team for inclusion as commissionable products
* Assist Sales Professionals with correct order entry into Salesforce and other systems
* Act as primary triage point for the TAP sales organization on order entry, quote and commissions case resolution
* Key goals include speed and quality of resolution, volume of tasks including customer interactions (individual and team-level) and customer satisfaction (individual and team-level)
* Supports one or more business channels, within a pool of Sales Operations Specialists.
* Provides guidance or specialized services that directly support or affect results within one functional area
* Works within area and uses professional procedures and practices to achieve objectives
* Exchanges straightforward information, asks questions and checks for understanding
* Free to determine the approach used to address routine professional issues.

**About you:**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* 1 - 3 years of experience doing similar activities.
* Confident, professional, customer-oriented phone presence required
* Strong communication skills (written, oral, presentation)
* Proven ability to take on multiple requests/projects concurrently and see them to successful completion
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to apply knowledge and creativity to resolve routine and unique user issues
* High degree of professionalism, able to competently address both senior leadership and entry-level user requests
* Organizational and prioritization skills with attention to detail
* Thrives in a high-volume, dynamic, and fast-paced work environment
* Ability to troubleshoot with limited information and make appropriate decisions based on knowledge of business objectives
* Comprehensive knowledge of Thomson Reuters products and business processes

title: Corporate Development Manager (MSP, DAL or Toronto)
description:
Thomson Reuters is seeking qualified candidates for a Manager, Corporate Development opportunity. This role can be based in either MSP, Dallas, or Toronto.

Reporting to the VP of Corporate Development, this individual will work closely with the rest of the Corporate Development team members to drive and execute the Corporation’s initiatives, focused on divestitures with opportunity to support acquisitions and Joint Ventures.

The Manager will partner closely with senior members of the team to assist with the management of transactions throughout all stages, with a heavy focus on due diligence preparation and coordination. This individual will lead executing and closing on M&A opportunities including supporting marketing, due diligence activities, financial modeling, and participation in negotiations.

This role provides strong opportunities for career progression within Thomson Reuters. This role is highly visible and provides an opportunity to demonstrate the ability to analyze and execute in a wide range of circumstances.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as Manager, Corporate Development, you will:

* Prepare financial models, stranded costs, and deal related costs
* Prepare marketing materials for assets to be divested
* Manage outside advisers, bankers, accounting firms and law firms
* Track deal related costs
* Manage due diligence processes
* Support development of divestment thesis
* Develop industry contacts and network of advisors
* Understand key drivers of divisional and shareholder value
* Facilitate the sharing of best practices across all business units with other members of the Corporate Development team
* Nurture a culture which fosters creativity, innovation and a self-motivated team to drive business forward

**Scope and Impact:**

* Support of divestitures, acquisitions, mergers, joint ventures, and any non-organic initiatives
* Participation in cross-business groups (made up of leaders of each business) across Thomson Reuters
* Develop strong relationships with both internal clients and third parties / advisors

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Manager, Corporate Development if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred
* 5+ years of experience in Finance, Corporate Development, Corporate Strategy and/or M&A is preferred
* Ability to quickly gain extensive knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ strategy, markets and competitive landscape.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills (company valuation, probability modeling, game theory etc.)
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task multiple deals concurrently
* Potential to communicate complex concepts to a broad audience, including senior management
* Customer relationship management skills and strong focus on delivering results.
* Strong team player with experience of working with virtual teams from different functions/regions.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Software Development Manager
description:
Join a team which has unique expertise combining the power of journalism and the law to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights.

Thomson Reuters Foundation is currently recruiting for a **Development Manager** to join our team in London. Reporting to the *Head of Technology* in Product & Technology Department, this role will be the lead of all development projects. 

The role will be responsible for delivery of product and technology development roadmap items working across all TRF and external stakeholders. The role will also operationally manage internal/external technology partners, contractors and vendors across transformational projects.

The Development Manager role requires in-depth understanding and proven track records of how to deliver in a Matrix environment.

We are looking for an individual who is passionate about software engineering best practices, including agile methodology and has people management experience.

**About the Role**

As a **Development Manager at the Thomson Reuters Foundation,** you will:

* Be managing an in-house front-end developer, maintaining existing sites and services, working in HTML/CSS/Velocity.
* Manage development all transformational projects from TRF product and technology roadmap on time and in budget, particularly new web-based projects
* Be migrating existing sites and services (as well as potential new ones) to a more robust React-based implementation.
* Be Working with our existing CMS, auditing Content Types, Templates etc. to begin designing a more headless CMS model of usage.
* Do greenfield work in designing and developing new, React-based web platforms using dotCMS in a headless paradigm.
* Be working on other integrations and modifications to existing products, including interfacing with other organizations and technologies.

**About You**

To be our **Development Manager,** you will likely have:

* Degree and/or Master in Computer Science or equivalent level of technical knowledge gained through an alternative qualification or experience. (software development/engineering, web development etc.)
* Ability to pick up new skills/frameworks quickly.
* Experience with version control software, preferably Git.
* Proficient with React and JavaScript in general.
* Familiarity with implementing front-end frameworks with HTML/CSS.
* Have experience with dotCMS (version 3 LTS onwards) or other CMS software (i.e. WordPress).
* Be comfortable working in a small team or alone, sharing responsibilities and communicating with non-technical users.
* Good deadline management and reporting on risks log and ways to minimize them
* Experience with digital projects dealing with any other CMS, Mobile Apps
* Management experience in digital media including experience in a digital marketing campaign role, digital branding, technical role as digital business analyst and in applications development/operations teams
* Comprehensive knowledge of website/mobile app building and delivery processes and systems, content delivery processes and content management systems
* Experience in building relationships on business, corporate and cross divisional basis - experience of "outsourcing" environment e.g. working with third party tech vendors
* Excellent communication and presentation skills for business requirements gathering
* Passion for online and media-rich, audio-visual products, KPI/ reporting frameworks, accessibility
* Knowledge on Amazon Web Services (preferred)
* Have experience of people-management with a junior front-end developer reporting to the role
* Be comfortable with problem solving outside of programming – for example, diagnosing DNS/caching/CDN issues (although only at a basic/intermediate level, expertise is not expected).
* Drive key development documentation
* Enforce Information and Application cybersecurity protocols
* Enforce P&T processes and procedures
* Drive improvements in TRF development practice of continuous delivery
* Have an advisory role to the *Director of Product and Technology* on existing/new code languages and its best-of-breed practices.

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development**: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work**: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Operations Project Manager
description:
The Thomson Reuters Foundation is the corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. As an independent charity, registered in the UK and the USA, we work to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique media and legal services to drive systemic change. 

**About the Role:**

Reporting to the Head of Operations, this role will be overseeing all aspects of a number of projects, from planning through completion to ensure that they meet requirements and objectives. As an Operations Project Manager at the Thomson Reuters Foundation, you will:

* Work with key stakeholders to determine project scope, timelines, and resourcing needs for all projects
* Managing the project schedules to ensure that deadlines and milestones are met
* Managing the project budget by monitoring expenditures to ensure costs stay within the allotted amount
* Coordinating with other team members to make sure that all aspects of the each project are completed on time
* Creating reports about project status and progress for senior management, including updates on issues that have been identified
* Identify, assess and manage risks to effectively inform and ensure the success of the projects.
* Collaborate and communicate extensively with senior leadership and other relevant stakeholders
* Adapt and update processes for ongoing changes in the project s

**About You:**

Required experience and skills:

* Demonstrable experience in project management and/or project coordination
* Excellent organisational skills and the ability to work with changing priorities and time pressures.
* Excellent communication, presentation and facilitation skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills – able to establish and maintain positive working relationships both internally and externally, with people from diverse backgrounds.
* Experience in using Salesforce and Monday.com is desirable
* Fluent spoken and written English
* Proven track record in designing, developing and implementing processes and workflows will be an added advantage
* Experience delivering technology-based projects is an advantage

title: Senior Manager, Campaign Planning - ThoughtTrace (Remote)
description:
ThoughtTrace, part of Thomson Reuters, empowers legal teams and business users to turn their documents and contracts into decision-driving insights. As a **Senior Manager, Campaign Planning** on the ThoughtTrace product marketing team, you will plan, execute, and optimize digital campaigns and programs to acquire, nurture, and convert leads into measurable and repeatable pipeline. This role is an open book and ready for a self-starter to fill the pages! 

We are looking for someone to bring full-funnel, omnichannel best practices to our marketing team, and help craft our repeatable demand generation playbook. 

**Note:** This is an individual contributor role with a **remote or hybrid** option with a preference that candidates are based near these areas: Greater Houston, Dallas Metro area (Carrollton, TX), Minneapolis Metro area (Eagan, MN), or Ann Arbor, MI for \*hybrid structure.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Senior** **Manager -** **Campaign Planning** you will: 

* Create and execute demand gen and digital marketing plans to focus on new logo acquisition and pipeline acceleration
* Orchestrate the ideal omnichannel customer journey touchpoints for various audience segments, incorporating channels such as YouTube, Google Ads, Social, ConnectedTV, Hulu, Direct Buys, Email nurtures, and beyond
* Advise and partner with the broader marketing team and content specialists to ensure that digital marketing strategies and programs fit within broader campaign plans and activities
* Develop deep understanding of the ThoughtTrace audience and the benefits of the solution to craft experiences and ads that convert.
* Design, plan, manage, and optimize integrated digital campaigns to generate pipeline for sales
* Test new channels and programs for buyer acquisition and nurturing, including but not limited to ABM, content syndication, virtual experiences, roundtables, or direct mail
* Monitor, assess and report on campaigns performance and provide strategic direction and guidance based on analysis of results
* Based on search and market data, Basic SEO understanding, content categorization and structure, content development, distribution, and measurement. Development of editorial governance so content is consistent with our brand voice, style and tone
* Integrate content programs with brand campaigns to drive brand to demand
* Executive presentations on the program approaches and results will be required
* Distribute content on multiple channels – including internal systems, the corporate website, social media, and more dependent on the material
* Work closely across functions, leveraging our internal experts, executives, and customer-facing teams to help identify and create relevant content

**About You**

You could be a fit for the **Senior** **Manager -** **Campaign Planning** role if your background includes:

* 5+ years of relevant experience (in high-growth, entrepreneurial environments preferred)
* Strong track record of driving successful ABM and demand gen campaigns, which result in rapid lead and revenue growth
* Proficiency in marketing tools such as WordPress, Google analytics, SlideShare, and the top social channels
* Proficiency in analyzing marketing data and making data-driven decisions or recommendations to supercharge conversions
* Experience with LinkedIn and Facebook advertising
* Experience with Google AdWords
* SEO Understanding
* An experimental mindset, and a keen interest in conversion optimization
* Expert knowledge of demand generation mix including digital marketing, ABM. and lead flow
* Strong analytical and communication skills
* Strong copywriting and editing skills
* Project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders in a complex environment and focus on the delivery of results in the form of engagement, leads and sales
* Bachelor’s degree (in Marketing preferred) or equivalent experience

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $105,500 - $195,900. The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following states (CA, CO, CT, NV, WA) and/or remote. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $95,900 - $178,100. title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
**Job Description – Senior Systems Engineer, Wintel/VMware**

**Job responsibilities:**

* Remote management of Windows and Vmware systems located in various datacenters across the world
* Level 2 and level 3 –systems administration
* Recovering incidents, implementing changes, participate in strategic projects
* Working on Remote office standardization projects.
* Creating and publishing reports regularly for the projects handled by team.
* Generating SNOW reports to publish team stats monthly.
* Communicate with Business and help them move to strategic solutions.
* Coordination with hardware vendors for hardware related issues
* Providing support and assisting other groups in problem resolution.
* Communicate status updates on incident resolution, Change execution and projects as appropriate.

**Required competencies:**

**Technical**

* Extensive (5+ years L3) Windows systems administration experience.
* Windows server OS knowledge: Windows 2012, Windows 2008.
* Experience with high availability and disaster recovery solutions and tools, including working knowledge of high availability (failover) clustering.
* Working knowledge involving volumes from SAN and NAS and clear understanding of CIFS.
* Understanding of iSCSI and Fiber Channel
* Experience with snapshot technologies such as NetApp Snapshots and SnapDrive
* Hands on experience in resolving system performance issues, root cause analysis and complex problems.
* Hands on experience with server hardware: HP & Dell Rack mount and Blade servers.
* Experience with enterprise patch management systems such as IBM Endpoint Manager (IEM).
* Scripting experience in PowerShell will be an added advantage.

**Non-technical** 

* Must have worked in an ITIL compliant environment, worked with change control, incident mitigation, knowledge and problem management processes
* Analytical, organization skills and ability to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines
* Must be detail-oriented, have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, strong communication and documentation skills.

**Work hours:**  – 24\*7 rotation including night shifts (9pm – 6am), shifts rotated on a monthly basis, total night shift not to exceed 50% of total months in a calendar year. Candidate is required to provide on-call support duties on a rotation basis with other team members.

**Education:**  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent

**Experience:**  4+yrs of relevant experience (see above)

**Desired Certifications:** MCP/ MCSE / MCSA/ ITIL foundation.

title: Editorial Associate - Content Create/Modify & Publishing
description:
We are seeking multiple Editorial Associates (EAs) to support the Practical Law editorial teams with the creation, publication, delivery, and presentation of content for Practical Law and to provide administrative support to facilitate the smooth running of the editorial teams.

**About the role**:

Working with fellow EAs in both Hyderabad and the UK and under the organization and supervision of two Hyderabad-based EA Managers, you will

* Create, code, and publish content assets and check that the published asset renders properly on the live site
* Compare and convert documents
* Compile and maintain internal lists and data
* Perform resource audits and coordinate bulk changes to content
* Review content for errors or broken links
* Review the content in document templates to ensure that the content renders properly on the live site and solve template usage problems as and when they arise
* Provide support to ensure that customer questions are answered and published appropriately
* Create visual content such as flowcharts and tables

Successful candidates are likely to have:

* Undergraduate degree
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Excellent attention to detail
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills
* Proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications
* Experience in working to deadlines and able to prioritize and manage own workload
* Previous experience working in a publish environment preferred
* Previous experience using technology to create and disseminate online content preferred

**What’s in it for you?**

You will work in a supportive, collegiate and flexible environment, with plenty of training, development and opportunities to explore new areas of law and practice. Thomson Reuters offer a competitive compensation package including a whole suite of benefits.

At Practical Law, you will work as part of a market leading team, using your experience and expertise to contribute to a market leading product.

title: Legal Editorial Associate - Practical Law UK, US - LLB/LLM
description:
We are seeking multiple Legal Editorial Associates (EAs) to support the Practical Law editorial teams with the creation, publication, delivery, and presentation of content for Practical Law.

**About the role**:

Working with fellow Legal EAs in both Hyderabad and the UK and under the organization and supervision of two Hyderabad-based EA Managers, you will:

* Proof-read content to ensure that there are no typographical errors or broken links on the live site
* Review the content in document templates to ensure that the content renders properly on the live site and solve template usage problems as and when they arise
* Assist with writing and copy-editing content
* Carry out legal and non-legal research as needed
* Help identify content that needs review and ensure the review process takes place, liaising where appropriate with colleagues and external contributors
* Respond to customer queries as appropriate and provide support to others to ensure questions are answered and published appropriately
* Help collate business intelligence data reports and other reports and spreadsheets related to content creation and management

  
**Successful candidates will have:**

* Legal qualifications: either a Bachelor of Laws or an Integrated undergraduate degree in law, or 3+ years' experience as a paralegal
* Experience with UK and US legal systems strongly preferred
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Excellent proof-reading skills
* Excellent attention to detail
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills
* Proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications
* Prior legal training and/or experience preferred
* Previous experience working in a publishing environment preferred

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world's businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization.

The Sr Software Engineer will form part of the Reuters News Agency Audio and Video systems development team.  You will be responsible for designing and developing code to work within the Reuters audio and video ecosystem, including live and file based content. This infrastructure comprises a number of mature and yet to be developed services, in a cloud native environment.  You will work as part of an agile team on various projects to meet the business needs

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Sr Software Engineer, you will:

* Be part of a collaborative development working on various projects across the Reuters News Agency
* Be responsible for the design and development of tools and applications within the Reuters organization
* Work closely with key stakeholders and various team members to establish priorities and update on progress of projects
* Assist in setting expectations and priorities throughout development life cycle; determining design methodologies and tool sets; completing programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests.
* Assist in coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems and operating platforms.
* Support users by developing documentation and assistance tools.
* Update job knowledge by researching new web/client technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
* Enhance organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if you possess:

* 3-5 years practical software development experience (Node.js, Python or Java preferred)
* Working knowledge of databases (SQL preferred)
* Ability to methodically troubleshoot/investigate problems in a timely manner
* Ability to learn on the job
* Good communications and team-working skills
* Knowledge of cloud computing concepts, AWS cloud and micro service / API design and development preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Senior Sales Executive, Corporate
description:
**Position Objective:**Covers new and/or existing accounts in assigned geography or territory. Prospects new customers or new business at existing customers and closes sales to Corporate Legal (and related) Departments.   Positions Thomson Reuters legal suite of products including, but not limited to, Westlaw, Practical Law, Practical Law Connect, Legal Tracker, HighQ and related products/services.  May or may not include retaining or renewing existing business. 

Location: Remote based role - based in Midwa

**About the Role**:

In this opportunity as a Sr. Sales Executive, you will:

* **Drive Results**: Meet new sales quota
* **Product Proposition:** Conduct pre-demo qualifying calls/conversations and short demos
* **Pipeline Management**: Maintain a pipeline of at least 1.5x quota
* **Sales Process**: Prospect, sell and build pipeline for Legal Tracker and HighQ
* **Build Relationships:** Establish and maintain strong sales partnership with Legal Tracker sales partners
* **Maintain Technology:** Update salesforce.com daily and regularly and utilize as only CRM tool; Conduct face-to-face/web-ex appointments

**Competencies – Skills:**

* Sales Skills: Ability to navigate complex software and solutions sales cycle
* New business mining, prospecting and cold calling skills: develop a high volume of new business opportunities
* Consultative Selling Skills: build credibility and trust in order to navigate a complex sales cycle
* Business Acumen: strong understanding of our customers’ business and industry
* Effective sales presentation skills: effectively present the product and value propositions
* Forecasting Skills: ability to forecast accurately
* Team Communication: collaborate and communicate regularly and effectively within team and cross-functionally with other departments
* Relationship and Influencing Skills: ability to build relationships with, and influence all levels within an organization, including senior management.

**Competencies – Culture:**

* Commitment to People: professional, courteous, respectful and friendly
* Collaboration/Partnership: team oriented, generous with sharing best practices and feedback; ability to be fluid and creative working with prospects and internally rather than within a rigid structure
* Customer first: customer-centric mentality
* Integrity: operates honestly and with high standard of ethics
* Delivering results: focused and able to take initiative, motivated, self-starter
* Positive attitude: enthusiasm, energy, passion, curiosity. Open and adaptable to change

**About You:** 

You're a fit for the role if you have:

* Minimum of 5 years direct field sales experience (sales experience in the corporate sector preferred) with proven, exemplary track record of sales quota over achievement.
* Experience and track record in software sales is strongly preferred
* 4 year college degree required, Law degree a plus
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations. 25-50% travel required.

**What's in it for you!**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: #3 Operator in Subscription Services - 1st shift
description:
We are hiring a #3 Subscription Services Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a #3 Subscription Services Operator**,** you will be responsible for reviewing job specifications, performing set-up tasks, monitoring the equipment and troubleshooting on our Core Publishing Solutions team. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months.  **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 1st shift - 6:30 am - 2:30 pm
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a #3 Subscription Services Operator, you will be responsible for:   

* Reviewing job specifications for material and set-up requirements
* Performing or delegating/overseeing set-up tasks
* Monitoring the equipment and product through the job run to ensure a high-quality product
* Performing moderately complex trouble-shooting related to product or equipment
* Communicating effectively during shift and at shift hand-off
* Evaluating mechanical condition of equipment, completing preventative maintenance, involving Maintenance as needed
* Using computer-based workflows applications to manage files
* Accurately documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, etc
* Accurately marking, verifying and tagging loads correctly to ensure inventory accuracy
* Providing work direction to others, whether direct crew or other individuals in the workstream
* Actively participating in company safety programs and contributing to a safe culture
* Performing training as needed
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures
* Generating, implementing, performing and sustaining continuous improvement ideas as well as housekeeping procedures to maintain work area
* Participating in project teams as needed
* Providing backup for other operators to cover absences or breaks
* Recommending and implementing process improvements

**About You:** 

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Experience leading and training others
* Experience working in an industrial setting with a wide range of production machinery
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot, make decisions and resolve machine issues
* Experience with Lean and continuous improvement
* Competent with rulers and measurement
* Good communication skills
* Able to run multiple pieces of equipment
* Experience on Perfect Binders with up to 40 station collators, 3-knife trimmers, inline boxing and palletizing
* Experience with hard-cover casing-in lines, collating/kitting lines with up to 30 stream feeder stations, packaging/cartooning lines, Sitma mail lines, Aster sewing equipment and hot foil stampers
* Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Can regularly stand, walk, crouch, bend, reach and kneel
* Can wear Personal Protective Equipment including steel toe shoes and ear protection

**What’s in it for you:**

* **Compensation:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year, bonus plan
* **Learning & Development:** On-the-job coaching & learning, leadership capability development, Harvard Management Courses, key talent programs, tuition reimbursement
* **Benefits:** Comprehensive health coverage with benefits are effective day one, 3 weeks vacation, 6 sick days, 9 company holidays, 3 float days, uniform and laundry service, 401(K)
* **Perks:** Social events & activities, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, gym reimbursement, cell phone discounts
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

  **Bonus:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Delivery Manager
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your management and leadership experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to successfully implement large and complex sales and ensure client satisfaction? If you’re a team player with excellent client and project management abilities, then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Delivery Manager, you will:

* **Be** responsible for ensuring that contract deliverables are met to the satisfaction of the client and to the high standards of Thomson Reuters Special Services.
* Provide strong leadership in the execution of complex deals to ensure successful implementation across territories.  You’ll provide thought leadership across the Department of Defense territory on how to leverage TRSS solutions to most effectively support TRSS client objectives.
* **Leverage** your experience to proactively identify, communicate, and resolve customer issues that threaten the success of the project both internally and at the customer site.
* **Focus** on meeting or exceeding established project metrics, identifying risks/potential issues and risk mitigation strategies.
* **Collaborate** closely with the Analyst Managers and Technical team to problem-solve optimal solutions
* **Ensure** high-quality delivery of new and existing contracts in the territory. The quarterback for delivery. The centerpoint for the client and the TRSS team. Responsible for the holistic “customer experience”.
* **Understand** the client’s mission and how to leverage TRSS solutions to most effectively support their objectives
* **Own** the management and oversight of day-to-day customer needs and interactions for large and/or complex projects (i.e., client kickoff, regular status meetings, trainings). Large and/or complex projects include, but are not limited to, the following: deals that include services from multiple TR business units, require customized deliverables, have detailed security requirements, and are strategic within the client base.  Work with the Client Relationship Manager (CRM) to prepare quality Monthly Status Reports (MSRs) for select projects, capturing major success stories, customer challenges, and future opportunities.
* **Direct** and manage pre-sales activities and Proof-of-Concepts (POCs) with prospective clients in close coordination with the analysis and product/technical teams.
* **Serve** as extension of Sales, Analysis, and Product/Tech team on the ground; has a strategic view of customer challenges and regularly identifies opportunities to funnel back to the Territory Lead/BDD, Analysis, and Product teams.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Delivery Manager if your background includes:

* Have a minimum of 5-10 years of client related experience in the Department of Defense, Federal Law Enforcement, or National Intelligence Community            .
* Are a US Citizen possessing a Top Secret Security clearance (SCI Preferred)
* Have completed a Bachelor’s Degree
* Have extensive experience with Program/Project management (PMP Cert preferred)
* Work well with teams and drive disparate groups toward common client goals.
* Communicate effectively and relate to multiple levels of a client's organization.
* Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders demonstrating strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Are a self-starter, highly motivated, team player with strong business acumen, superior organizational skills and the ability to follow through.
* Possess Excellent writing and presentation skills.
* Are proficient in web-based demo platforms, MS Office/internet

You’ll also need to be able to

* travel to customer locations and company meetings (car and limited airplane travel).carry company materials (to include laptop, marketing material, etc.).
* Sit for long periods of time in front of a computer.
* Use the phone.

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture:** You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* **Learning & Development:** You are will be joining a growing sales team that has the commitment of the company to prioritize organic growth and has made investments to expand the sales team capability
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
* **Benefits:** Extraordinary benefits package
* **Social Impact:** Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising

ABOUT THOMSON REUTERS SPECIAL SERVICES

TRSS is a wholly US-owned, independent subsidiary of Thomson Reuters. Our analysts combine open-source research with the full suite of proprietary Thomson Reuters data holdings to deliver actionable intelligence to our clients.

We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world’s businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise, and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science, and media markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization.

As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
**Inside Sales Representative**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **Inside Sales Representative**, you will: 

* Reaching out to prospects and actively acquiring new clients bringing a positive customer experience.
* Initiates and answers sales inquiries directly from/to prospective and/or existing customers to promote product offerings, services, and capabilities.
* Monitors/follow up on sales activities throughout the process to meet or exceed customer requirements from initial contact to order fulfillment.
* Partnering with internal stakeholders to make recommendations for customers to adopt and use our services and solutions

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* At least 3 years of experience as an Inside Sales Representative.
* Have experience in meeting daily, weekly and monthly targets, and proven consultative sales skills and quota achievement.
* Customer focus: this implies an interest in the customer and knowledge of their needs.
* Self-management
* Multitasking
* Assertiveness.
* Work for planning and organization.
* Negotiation skills, such as effective listening.
* English - Intermediate level.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-MR2

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Sr Financial Analyst
description:
Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) has an exciting opportunity to join the finance and accounting team. This role will have the opportunity to build the structure needed for accurate profitability and performance tracking and to assist leadership with decisions that will continue to drive our organizational growth. As a **Senior Financial Analyst**, you will spearhead the development, implementation, and management of processes related to budgeting, forecasting, reporting, profitability analysis, and pricing.Thomson Reuters Special Services, LLC delivers a comprehensive suite of solutions designed to help customers achieve mission objectives, address uncertainty, and identify and manage risk. We leverage Thomson Reuters’ market-leading solutions to help our clients perform intelligence collection and analysis on cyber security, supply chain risk, insider threat detection, and risk management issues.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Senior Financial Analyst**, you will:

Budgeting & Reporting

* Prepare monthly departmental budget to actual reporting – which includes interacting with Departmental Leaders to ensure budgets are reported accurately and on-time, and variances to plan are researched and analyzed
* Develop structure and consistency around corporate and departmental reporting initiatives
* Lead the implementation and automation of the budgeting and forecasting process within Unanet
* The ability to accurately track and forecast headcount against regularly fluctuating contract and operational needs
* Develop new and effective reports from Unanet to assist with profitability analysis and ad-hoc requests from senior leadership
* Liaise between TRSS and parent company Finance and Accounting teams regarding periodic and ad-hoc reporting requests

Pricing Support

* Prepare initial pricing model and analysis for Financial Manager review
* Spearhead the development and standardization of contract pricing
* Prepare, manage, and improve pricing models for existing and new lines of business and contracting initiatives
* Analyze and improve pricing processes and procedures
* Develop and manage tracking system for historic and existing pricing initiatives

Forecasting and Analysis

* Collect and review financial data from various sources to prepare corporate profitability analysis
* Develop a formal process for the measurement of profitability and business plan feasibility
* Provide budget-to-actual analysis and business decision support
* Create, maintain, and update financial databases and spreadsheets, and generate various financial reports as required
* Drive the development and management of capital business case initiatives and strategic initiatives

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Financial Analyst** if your background includes:

* Ability to obtain and hold a U.S. security clearance
* 3+ years of experience with emphasis in providing financial analysis, tracking, and reporting
* 2-4+ years of Accounting/Finance/Business experience with a government contractor (preferred)
* Knowledge of FAR (Federal Acquisition Regulation) and experience with (T&M) Time and Materials, (FFP) Fixed Price contracts
* Advanced proficiency with Excel spreadsheets
* Comfortable managing large sets of data across multiple platforms and systems
* Experience in process improvement and project management
* Strong quantitative skills and core financial competency and the ability to create financial models
* Conscientious, self-directed and entrepreneurial with the ability to work both independently as well as collaboratively with teams
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, and excellent written and oral communications skills
* Deadline driven and detail oriented
* Strong analytical skills

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Gerente de Projetos
description:
**About the Role**

The **Professional Services Project Manager  – Latin America** is accountable for delivering professional services projects to Customers with best standards of quality and governance. He/she is the main point of contact for PS for customer satisfaction. Responsibilities include:

* **Deliver successfully quality professional services projects to customers, in partnership with customer.** The role will interact with all levels of the organizations.
* **Keep a healthy and seamless governance on projects and metrics: scope, margins, risks, schedule and project related KPIs**

**Accountabilities**

* Be the interface of TR to the clients and manage the clients’ expectations during the project execution stage.
* Manages one or more projects related to critical business goals for the global business partners
* Develops and tracks to detailed project plans, including scope, schedules, resource plans, communication plans, risk mitigation plans and issue resolution plans
* Manage the financial aspects of the project to ensure profit
* Tracks and resolves issues across multiple TR and client work streams involved in the project.
* Proactively identifies and provides mitigation plans for any potential risks to the project’s overall success.
* Develops a professional rapport with the internal and client project teams that interfaces with client and maintain an excellent level of client satisfaction.
* Reports status of the projects using TR selected tools to present the appropriate level of detail based on the target audience.
* May act as primary interface with the client regarding deliverables, change requests, and sign-off on status and requirements.
* Keeps healthy governance and successful project metrics and reports to the company
* Keeps project’s revenue forecast and revenue realization according the revenue plan

**Key Deliverables**

* Achieve Professional Services objectives within role of responsibility
* Orchestrate all deliverables within a client project, attaining to all successful aspects: customer satisfaction, scope, quality, profitability, margins and schedule.
* Maintain all projects attributes up to date and with a seamless governance
* Timely response and project related KPIs and reports on time
* Manage and report risks accordingly to the correct escalations level
* Efficient, clear and timely communication with project team, partners and key stakeholders
* Document efficiently and with quality all project documentation and ensure that the project team is doing the same

**About You**

* Strong organization, interpersonal, & communication skills
* Proven ability to engage a wide range of stakeholders in a matrix organization
* Excellent analytical problem solving skills
* Experience in Software Development Life Cycle(s), Agile development experience is a plus
* Proactive personality and proven leadership skills
* Experience in partnering with internal & external stakeholders
* +5 years of Project Management experience in customer on-site implementations..
* Advanced English (Speaking, Writing, and Listening)
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* BS/BA required;  Preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Business,  or a combination of equivalent education and experience
* PMP Certification strongly desirable]
* Be aware that business trip is part of the role

**What’s in it For You?**

title: Support Analyst
description:
**Support Analyst**
-------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

Join our team and work with us to provide comprehensive administrative support and project coordination within a function.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Support Analyst**, you will: 

* Providing complex administrative services and coordination for departmental projects that involve learning their internal systems.
* Collecting and compiling data, conducting research and analysis, preparing confidential reports, and presenting results.
* Writing documents, composing correspondence, and department communications.
* Updating manuals, maintaining logs, and department files.
* Some secretarial or administrative assistant duties, including organizing facilities for meetings, managing team calendars, travel, expenses, and mail, and dealing with sensitive or confidential information.
* Compliance with general office, departmental, and company policies and procedures.
* Managing departmental invoice and purchasing processes.
* Working well with internal management and departments, as well as outside clients and suppliers.
* Use of various computer databases and applications.
* Understanding and support of financial reporting.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* At least 1 year of experience doing similar activities.
* Customer focus: this implies an interest in the customer and knowledge of their needs.
* Multitasking.
* Assertiveness.
* Work for planning and organization.
* Negotiation skills, such as effective listening.
* English - Intermediate level.
