title: Legal Market Researcher (Remote)
description:
Thomson Reuters is hiring a Remote Legal Market Researcher.  As a Legal Market Researcher, you’ll be primarily responsible for interviewing senior legal decision-makers and clients on a variety of issues.  You will join our team of in-house experts and develop into a Legal Market Researcher with the skills to conduct professional interviews and transcribe to a high quality.  

What we can offer you:

* Understanding and presenting our knowledge-based incentives
* You will become familiar with Thomson Reuters’ research incentives, and be able to confidently explain these to respondents to encourage participation in our research.
* Become efficient in the use of Salesforce
* You will undergo a week of training during your first week and learn how to input data and update our internal database.
* Develop and improve skills in qualitative interviewing
* You will learn to conduct a professional telephone interview and capture key insights that are used within our published reports.
* Opportunities to develop skills.  For example, digital analytics walkthroughs, Linkedin training for corporate use, and assisting Custom Insight projects. (Subject to passing probation and completing monthly individual targets)

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Legal Market Researcher, you will: 

* Outbound call Recruiting legal decision-makers for our bespoke client projects and work towards a monthly target and yearly completion.
* Secure and conduct telephone interviews.  You will be responsible for conducting high quality calls to support a project-based quota of interviews each month.
* Maintain consistent and accurate recording of respondents’ answers, both during an interview and with the use of call recordings.
* Manage your own schedule of interview appointments and provide clear communication to respondents.
* Keep Thomson Reuters database accurate and up-to-date with the latest information from/about respondents using computer systems
* Need to have a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office. You will also receive training to operate our CRM database via Salesforce.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Legal Market Researcher if you have:

* Good literacy, numeracy and spoken communication skills will be essential
* Outbound calling experience (e.g. sales, market research)
* Experience dealing with clients / customers in a professional, courteous manner
* The ability to work to targets – setting goals and working to individual or team targets
* A background or interest in the legal market or research is beneficial, but not essential
* HS diploma or equivalent

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until January 2022. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

#LI-DA1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Media Sales Support Representative
description:
Reuters is seeking a talented and experienced **Media Sales Support Representative** to join our Sales Support team in North America. Reuters Agency is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news with impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

The **Media Sales Support Representative** role is accountable for supporting the Reuters Sales organization on general sales-related matters, business policy and procedural issues.

**About the Role:**

As our **Media Sales Support Representative**, you will:

* Serve as a primary resource for sales and account management teams to understand content/product offerings, business policies, order processing, credits, and procedures and assists in problem solving on all issues
* Permission prospect clients for trials
* Fill in and update regulatory documentation for governmental clients
* Support for administrative tasks relating to order fulfilment (new sales, cancellations, renewals etc.)
* Input billing information (i.e. products, pricing, billing address etc.) into relevant systems, supporting the quote to billing processes
* Escalate and follow up on client’s billing and invoicing issues
* Maintaining client data (such as contacts, addresses, service changes etc.) in relevant systems
* Ensure pipeline accuracy and support monthly forecast processes
* Engage with Commercial Policy team to support contract fulfillment and compliance
* Responsible for ensuring procedure changes are supported, implemented and followed to maximize efficiency, delivering quality services to customers for all order to cash processes
* Train or interact with customers (via phone, email) on an as-needed basis
* Serve as a consultant on best practices and knowledge sharing related to new products, sales process best practices
* Provide logistical support for regional sales meetings and other events as needed

**About You**

You are a fit for the **Media Sales Support Representative** if you have:

* Language skills: Fluent in English with business level language skills in other European languages desirable
* Experience with Salesforce, and SAP a plus

* Strong communication skills (written, oral, presentation)
* Customer-oriented
* Organizational and prioritization skills with attention to detail
* Ability to adapt to dynamic and fast paced work environment
* Ability to troubleshoot and make appropriate decisions based on knowledge of business objectives
* Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
Inside Sales Representative
---------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading or both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **Inside Sales Representative**, you will: 

* Reaching out to prospects and actively acquiring new clients bringing a positive customer experience.
* Initiates and answers sales inquiries directly from/to prospective and/or existing customers to promote product offerings, services, and capabilities.
* Monitors/follow up on sales activities throughout the process to meet or exceed customer requirements from initial contact to order fulfillment.
* Partnering with internal stakeholders to make recommendations for customers to adopt and use our services and solutions

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* At least 3 years of experience as an Inside Sales Representative.
* Have experience in meeting daily, weekly and monthly targets, and proven consultative sales skills and quota achievement.
* Customer focus: this implies an interest in the customer and knowledge of their needs.
* Self-management
* Multitasking
* Assertiveness.
* Work for planning and organization.
* Negotiation skills, such as effective listening.
* English - Intermediate level.

**Location: CDMX**

title: Indirect Tax Implementation Consultant
description:
**Indirect Tax Implementation Consultant**, Professional Services

We are currently seeking a self-motivated **Indirect Tax Implementation Consultant**. The Implementation Consultant will work closely with ONESOURCE Indirect Tax Project Managers to implement ONESOURCE Indirect Tax Determination at client sites in Brazil and Global Implementations.  
  
The PS TAX Consultant is accountable for maintaining the relationship with the end user (i.e. Business Team/Customer) for small to medium scale projects. They are responsible for eliciting requirements/user stories and representing them to the Enterprise Solutions Delivery and Enterprise Sustain Services teams throughout the development cycle. Will lead requirements elicitation and documentation for projects and work as part of a Professional Services team on larger tax projects under the supervision of more senior colleagues.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as ***Indirect Tax Implementation Consultant*** you will:

* Interact with client tax and technology professionals
* Lead and perform technical or functional roles on small to medium/large projects led Project Manager.
* **Perform process requirements** **(OTC, PTP)** and analysis workshops with clients to define business, process, functional requirements, and data element requirements.
* Consult and provide guidance with best process, project scheduling, resource availability for successful tax automation implementations
* Lead project teams consisting of TRTA project teams, Partner project teams and Client project team members.
* Manage project schedules, budget allocations, define statements of work, manage change control and change requests
* Engage with other key teams within Thomson Reuters as appropriate to deliver end to end Indirect Tax solutions
* Assist Project team to ensure all Indirect tax related requirements are met
* Explain ONESOURCE Indirect Tax Determination related issues/problems and solutions to Tax & technical staff
* Ensure all Indirect tax related requirements are met
* Troubleshoot software and implementation issues; provide workaround and functional implementation guidance
* Work with clients to translate their tax policy into ONESOURCE Solutions
* Configure ONESOURCE Indirect Tax Determination Engine
* Completes tasks with limited supervision

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of ***Indirect Tax Implementation Consultant*** if your background includes:

**Mandatory Experience and Skills**

* Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
* Must be able to work effectively in a team environment
* Must have working knowledge of Determination functional knowledge in BRAZIL taxes Technical and Functional Expertise (must meet at least 1 category requirement)
* Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently
* Creative problem solving skills
* Ability to work in a diverse work environment

**Highly Desirable Skills/Experience**

* 3 – 5 years consulting experience
* Multilingual (English)
* Experience with process analysis, design & mapping.
* Experience Implementing Enterprise Software
* **Experience with integrating or working with third party enterprise tax products (e.g. ONESOURCE Determination, ONESOURCE Compliance, Abacus, Sabrix, Taxware and/or Vertex) is highly desirable**
* **Functionally proficient with at least 1 Thomson Reuters Indirect tax products**

**Education Required**

* Higher Education Degree CIS or Business (Finance or Accounting) required

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sales Specialist, Legal Software
description:
**Sales Specialist**

**Legal and Compliance - Growth**  
 

**Role Purpose/ Summary:**

The Sales Specialist is responsible for new business growth in existing accounts in his/her assigned account territory. The Sales Specialist carries a monthly and annual sales quota based on new business sales through targeted upsell and cross sell campaigns of Thomson Reuters Legal and Compliance products which includes the market leading HighQ, Legal Tracker, Thought Trace, Practical Law, Westlaw, and Regulatory Intelligence. We are looking for an individual that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals.

The role will form part of the Corporate Europe business line, working with major Corporates, many of which are FTSE  250 and FTSE 500.  These organisations have long term, significant relationships with Thomson Reuters, not just in our Legal and Compliance business, but also in our Tax and Accounting businesses which can be leveraged.  The role will be office based, with significant face to face client interaction expected driving new business revenue growth.

**About The Role:** 

Manage a territory covering a specific sector, which includes a portfolio of existing customers, focusing on the Thomson Reuters Legal and Compliance portfolio of products

* Drive new business from targeted outbound activity, networking and referrals
* Build a strong sales pipeline to give 3x coverage to annual target
* Consistently overachieve monthly and annual quota through effectively managing pipeline, prioritising the right deals and creating urgency to buy.  Strong metric & KPI driven sales responsibility
* Feedback valuable market and product intelligence to our Product and Proposition teams
* Develop and maintain territory plans
* Working in Salesforce CRM environment throughout deal progression
* Reporting, analysis and meeting involvement as required by Sales Leadership team
* Actively engage in the sales coaching process, partnering well with managers and your peers to share ideas and learn from each other.
* Accurately, and in a timely manner, log all activities and customer contacts in Salesforce CRM.
* Pursue individualized development to improve performance not only in your current role, but for future career opportunities within Thomson Reuters.

**About You:** 

Experience and success working in a targeted and KPI driven sales environment

* Experience of all elements of sales process, client management and CRM tools
* Strong sales presentation and proposal building skills
* Customer centric focus
* Proven negotiator with C Suite, with strong opportunity qualification & client needs analysis skills
* Proven success of lead generation, pipeline development, up selling and cross selling within complex, online content and/or software products
* Experience of successfully managing complex accounts/client relationships
* Ability to navigate large organisations
* Ability to build internal network and manage multiple internal stakeholders to reach successful outcomes
* Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
* Self-motivated & driven
* Excellent face to face presentation and communication skills
* Knowledge and experience of selling to Legal and Compliance roles preferred but not essential
* Salesforce.com familiarity

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We have an outstanding opportunity for an Executive Assistant/Business Operations Executive to provide a high standard of confidential, personal and efficient administration, communication and project support to our Head of Department for Asian Legal Business.

This is a fast-paced role that will focus on a broad range of core support tasks to ensure a seamless and effective operation of the business and see you demonstrate a high degree of proactivity, prioritisation and flexibility in your approach. You will also be taking the lead with a number of internal communication and project initiatives in this role involving stakeholder management across various geographies and functions.

You will be a skilled communicator, planner and people person with a hands-on approach to all tasks, ensuring a high standard of professionalism and continuous improvement. 

**About the role**

As an Executive Assistant/Business Operations Executive supporting the Head of Department for Asian Legal Business, your key responsibilities will include (but not be limited to) the following:

* Diary / Meeting management including scheduling, agendas, minute taking and hospitality
* Comprehensive domestic and international travel management
* Expense, invoice, and general financial account management
* Client liaison and internal stakeholder liaison across all levels of the organisation
* Supporting managers in the operational onboarding of new personnel and other logistical matters as part of calendar/event management.
* Organising events including: conception, promotion, venue selection, catering, entertainment, accommodation and guest co-ordination
* Leading employee and team internal communications on an as needs basis
* Preparing presentation packs including coordinating resources and creating, summarizing and reviewing content
* Support documentation for Head of Department’s proposals
* Leading periodic project work such as marketing projects and providing support in website upgrade/content
* Providing additional administrative and diary support to managers in regional locations as needed

**About you** 

To be successful in the role as an Executive Assistant/Business Operations Executive, you should possess:

* Minimum 2 years + of working experience in a commercial or sales environment
* Ideally experience supporting busy executive in the APAC region
* Excellent organisational skills with an ability to successfully prioritize
* Excellent people skills, with the ability to work effectively across all levels of the organisation
* Strong written, verbal and visual communication presentation skills
* Diplomatic with a high level of respect for confidentiality
* Ability to work both autonomously and in a team environment
* Strong use of initiative, proactivity and resourcefulness
* A high level of accuracy and insightful attention to detail whilst working at an efficient pace
* A flexible, pragmatic and collaborative working style, able to learn quickly
* Willing to go the extra mile to support the Head of Department where urgency is required.
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Microsoft Teams

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Presales Global Trade
description:
**Presales Global Trade**
-------------------------

Do you have experience in global trade solutions? Do you know about IMMEX, FTA, and the Global Trade processes? Do you have experience supporting the sales organization with a value proposition? Are you passionate about being a trusted sales consultant? Do you have experience working closely with high-performance team leaders and decision-makers? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join us to provide deep industry, solution or product expertise to sales process.  

**About The Role**

In this opportunity as  **a** **Presales Global Trade**, you will:

* Serves as a primary resource for sales consultants, account managers, and sales management to understand content/product offerings, business policies, commissions, promotions, incentives, and procedures for all pre-sale issues relates a Global Trade.
* Develops data /content and recommendations for all exceptions to presentation to the exception committee
* Conducts monthly and ad-hoc operation reporting and analysis.
* Consults with Sales managers to resolve problems and interpret information/policies and procedures.
* When necessary and appropriate, communicates pricing and product information to customers directly.
* Monitors data and provides analysis to illustrate sales trends, identify weaknesses in current sales execution and support the future sales strategy.
* Manages the coordination and investigation of order processing activities, fulfillment, compensation, and other requests during and at end of the month.
* May provide logistical support for national and regional sales meetings and other events as needed
* Consults with management on the effect of policies and procedures on business goals and assist in developing and implementing policy and procedure.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* +5 years of experience in Global Trade.
* English Proficiency is a MUST.
* Experience working as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders.
* Experience monitoring and analyzing data information.
* University Degree.

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.


**Location: CDMX**

title: #3 Operator in Press - 3rd shift
description:
We are hiring a Press Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a **#3** **Press Operator****,** you will be responsible for working as a member on our Core Publishing Solutions team providing operational management and technical support. You will be operating state of the art offset and digital web presses. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees).   We have also increased the shift differential for 3rd shift to $5 per hour.**Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 3rd shift – 10:30 pm – 6:30 am
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a #3 Press Operator, you will be responsible for:   

* Assisting the crew on the press, performing setup and production activities, typically on the back-end of the presses to ensure the press is running smoothly
* Preparing for upcoming jobs by reading the DSR and job specifications, as well as staging materials
* Quality checking products for our customers, completing transactions, bundling and tagging products
* Filling in for Lead and Mid-Level Operators as needed including covering absences or breaks
* Monitoring equipment and product quality, housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment, documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues and troubleshooting when necessary
* Using safety equipment to comply with state and federal regulations, reporting all safety and environmental hazards and attending safety and environmental training programs to ensure compliance and culture of safety

**About You:** You’re a fit for the role of #3 Press Operator if your background includes:

* Possess a High School Diploma or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Some experience working in an industrial setting in a maintenance and troubleshooting capacity with a wide range of production machinery is strongly desired
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, competent with rulers and measurement
* Thorough understanding of electrical safety and safe work practices such as the use of personal protective equipment and following machine instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Regularly standing walking, crouching, bending, reaching and kneeling

**What’s in it for you:**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees), shift premium of 3rd shift - $5.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Tax & Foreign Trade Analyst
description:
**Tax & Foreign Trade Analyst**
-------------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we’re looking for you.

Join our team to provide legal interpretation in the form of research, analysis, and writing to support the development and maintenance of Thomson Reuters information in all media and ensure that published information contains and delivers premium content.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Tax & Foreign Trade Analyst,** you will: 

* Review and analyze legal information in the form of headnotes, historical notes, abstracts/synopses, titles, analyses, indexes, highlights, and other text.
* Review and edit legal information created by authors, freelancers, and others.
* Identify key legal issues in editorial materials.
* Check own required work for accuracy, completeness, and quality and ensures that information is presented and organized correctly.
* Maintain and develop legal knowledge and skills training as necessary to complete the job and stay current on legal trends and developments related to the employee's editorial responsibilities.
* Participate in the employee evaluation process implemented by the company.
* Perform online document reading/review and analysis input within Thomson Reuters editorial systems.

**About you:**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Law Degree.
* Fluent English.
* 6 months to 1 year of experience working on research projects.
* Excellent writing skills.

**Location: CDMX**

title: Partner Account Manager
description:
**Partner Account Manager**

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Partner Account Manager* *em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como Partner Account Manager, você irá:

* Trabalhar na expansão de todos os nossos relacionamentos com parceiros dentro do nosso ecossistema.
* Suporte às oportunidades contínuas de vendas e crescimento da empresa, fornecendo um suporte de parceiro ao nosso portfólio.
* Responsável por manter relacionamentos com parceiros existentes e entender as necessidades de negócios para cross-sell e up-sell dos produtos da empresa.
* Coordenar com a nossa empresa e parceiros as expectativas de resultados de crescimento.
* Atuar como uma ponte para a comunicação entre a Thomson Reuters e a equipe de parceiros. Acompanhar e desenvolver os canais de vendas da base.
* Desenvolver relacionamento entre o Parceiro e os times de vendas da Thomson Reuters.
* Responsável por grandes contas.
* Acompanhar e aumentar o pipeline comercial de cada um dos seus canais.
* Gerir ações de geração de demanda com os parceiros.
* Objetivo da vaga: Fazer gestão de parceiro de negócios e identificar oportunidades.
* Gestão de ponta a ponta.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Graduação completa
* Experiencia em: planejamento, marketing, gestão comercial e conhecimento em gestão de canais de mercados dinâmicos.
* Habilidade para atuar com grandes contas.
* Excelente habilidade de comunicação
* Habilidades efetivas de gerenciamento de tempo

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Bem-estar**: benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Aprendizagem e Desenvolvimento:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Dez mil cafés Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: Product Manager - Partner Systems (Salesforce Sales Cloud)
description:
Do you love challenges and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment? Are you a collaborative learner who wants to make a lasting impact on our company’s success? Do you think of creative solutions to complex problems and solve them? Do you have experience managing complex, transformative, and innovative technology products, and programs? If so, this role is for you.

We are looking for a product manager specializing in Partner Operations systems preferably with hands on **Impartner and/or Salesforce Partner Community experience** to join our Go-to-Market systems team with the primary objective of managing Thomson Reuters Partner systems product backlog & prioritization, design, governance and adoption. 

  
In this role, you will partner with our Partner Operations, Partnership & Alliances and Commercial Engineering teams to lead the global product strategy and roadmap. 

**What You Will Do In This Role:**

* Create the product vision and roadmap for TR Partner Systems that meets and aligns with business objectives and goals
* As the solution subject matter expert, be the liaison between delivery teams and business partner and lead the gathering, organizing, and documenting of business needs in a shareable, actionable, standardized framework
* Assess the current state of TR Partner Relationship Management Systems implementation, identify ways to transform existing solutions while evaluating innovative new solutions through the lens of wait/built/buy
* Identify opportunities, create business cases, and champion your vision to build organizational alignment across business & technology stakeholders
* Own product requirements and specifications and drive the product development schedule from design to release with a high-quality bar.
* Establishing OKRs to ensure your products achieve their goals
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams across engineering, operations, data &analytics, design, and finance to deliver on the product roadmap and vision while allocating resources appropriately.
* Championing the “voice of the customer”; establishing one-to-many internal customer forums for product feedback; engaging deeply and personally with internal customers/end-user
* Translate the business needs into actionable requirements by getting enough information to make a solution possible; helps drive clarity to make rational decisions
* Provide visibility to program(s) status (key decisions, dependencies, issues, risks, metrics, etc.) on an ongoing basis
* Manage and communicate product releases

**What You Need To Be Successful:**

* Experience Required: 10+ years
* Extensive and demonstrable experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner, Solutions Architect or Business System Analyst
* Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field or relevant industry experience
* Hands-on experience delivering solution on **Impartner and/or Salesforce** **Sales Cloud and Community Cloud** in a dynamic and automated environment
* Top notch written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to executive leadership, participating in the sales cycle, and handling stakeholders’ escalations
* Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming product requirements into an actionable product roadmap
* Experience working and delivering product or services in an agile/lean environment
* Track record of successfully building relationships with teams in a matrix environment
* Thorough understanding of enterprise software development and infrastructure processes and lifecycle; ability to adjust and apply this knowledge in a dynamic environment using agile or similar methodologies
* Comfortable with being on large-scale projects, whose implementations, issues, requests, or projects have greater scope, complexity and require change management
* Experience driving full lifecycle projects
* Knowledge of the Force.com platform, Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Frameworks are a strong plus

title: Lead Identity & Access Management Engineer - Ping & MFA
description:
* Proven leader in the Identity and Access Management operations space with excellent communication and presentation skills to negotiate security’s viewpoints with key stakeholders
* Deep technical understanding of Identity platforms, RBAC, Cloud.
* IAM architecture, solution design and development
* Creating roadmap, strategy and technology fitment
* Design of customer life cycle use cases
* Defining IAM risk framework and implementing IAM prevention solution
* IAM Platform establishment in on-prem and cloud en
* Application integration to IAM platform
* Implementing advance technologies as FIDO2, Identity Proofing, Passwordless authentication
* Designing and implementing Third Party integration
* Implementing customized use cases and solution
* Customer data and credential migration strategy, implementation
* IAM policy set up, audit compliance and implementing governance framework
* Providing technical expertise to complex relevant problems
* Leading technical deliveries and service offerings
* Maintaining client relationship and guide to success
* Coordinates, manages, and drives continuous improvement for all IAM services in partnership with engineering and operations teams.  These solutions will span Thomson Reuters data centers and cloud services worldwide to support our diverse set of users and businesses.
* Ensures that IAM plans, controls, processes, standards, policies and procedures are aligned with IAM standards and overall IS and cyber security.

title: Manager - Technology
description:
* **Essential Day-to-Day Responsibilities:**
* Develop, manage and prepare best Support/Operations team.
* Guide, coach and mentor support engineers.
* Provide project management and technical leadership for every aspect of support lifecycle.
* Supervise architecture plus lead efforts to develop technical roadmap of all projects.
* Establish and stimulate support standards and processes along with best practices for maintenance of scalable and high quality software.
* Perform closely with Engineers, Developers and Product Management throughout organization to influence product development assisting or improving products.
* Involve in strategic plans to accomplish technical as well as business with leadership chain, team and with customers.
* Evaluate projects, develop and update schedules plus supervise project status.
* Collaborate effectively with all team members as well as hold regular team meetings.
* Follow up and provide timely reporting on issues to management
* At least 10 years of large scale software development support or application engineering

**About the Role**

*In this opportunity as a Associate Manager - Technology, you will:*
* **Be a People Leader**: Build and manage a DevOps/SRE/L1.5/L2 Team with varied skills and experience level. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible to proactively identify individual training needs, conduct performance reviews and maintain a healthy team culture
* **Be a Project Leader:** Train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design and implement monitoring to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* **Be a Technical Leader:** Implement best practices as knowledge expert in DevOps methodology.
* **Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager**: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management and support team in defining priority issues and refining processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues.
* **Be a Decision Maker**: Make quick and effective date driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills.
* **Focus on Continuous improvement and technical standards –** Drive improvements in productivity, monitoring, tooling and set industry best practices.
* **Required experience:**
* Take ownership of customer impacting issues, organize cross functional teams to work the issues end to end and provide updates to leadership.
* Mentoring members of the team to up skills in required areas.
* Asses and prioritize work, understanding both tactical and strategic goals.
* Assist in development, design and training to implement process improvement.
* Self-starter, methodical, collaborative, comfortable taking ownership, adapting to change and learning quickly in a fast-paced team with minimal supervision
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Deep enthusiasm for building automation and tooling with technologies such as ansible.
* Understanding of configuration management architecture.
* Java Web Application development / support background
* Windows Server 2016, Powershell, Azure, ADO
* Apache HTTP Web Server; installation, configuration, troubleshooting. SSL Certificates.
* MS SQL Server 2016; understanding of SQL queries, maintenance plans, alerting
* Exposure and working knowledge of networking concepts
* Ability to analyse application and server logs, error interpretation
* To work well under pressure, both autonomously and as part of a team
* Proven problem-solving ability
* Excellent written and oral communication
* **About You**

*You’re a fit for the role, if you:*
* Have expertise in driving technology strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against product requirements
* Are an effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners
* Possess strong knowledge of current technologies, with proficiency in the areas of automation, DevOps, cloud native architecture, and system monitoring
* **REQUIREMENTS:** 

Education  

A four-year degree in computer science or a related field is required.

Knowledge and Skills

Technical knowledge should include hands-on support of enterprise class applications along with experience with trouble shooting and maintenance activities. Must be able to Effectively balance and prioritize multiple projects and tasks concurrently

Candidates should possess:

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
* We are looking for energetic, competent and committed individual to work within the Data & Insights team. The role of a **Full Stack Developer** will include, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
* Build, enhance and support critical sales enabling web applications
* Build robust and scalable custom integrations with internal systems and/or third-party APIs
* Build, optimize and support data processing workflows
* Ensure that all assigned tasks are completed on a timely basis
* Efficiently analyze new requirements and delivering timely solutions
* Conduct independent research and proactively suggest improvements/recommendations
* As our **Full Stack Developer,** you:
* Will be a self-starter with an initiative to tackle complex business problems
* Should have worked in a role where he/she has carried out web development in any field including (but not limited to) media sales & marketing and customer analytics
* Is energetic, willing to learn, capable to keeping open lines of communication and eager to work in a team
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, detail-oriented with strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work both independently and as a team player
* Flexible and able to meet the changing demands of the business and projects
* Sound knowledge of news and current affairs
* **Required Skills:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or any related technical field
* Minimum 2-4 years of experience in **Laravel** web application framework
* Proficient in **JavaScript** and **CSS**
* Experience working on **Java** (Spring framework)
* Experience with Amazon Web Services - **AWS** (S3, Sagemaker, ECR etc.)
* Proficient in **SQL** (or any other querying language)
* Experience with deploying web solutions using Docker
* Working knowledge of Apache Oozie
* **Preferred Skills:**
* Experience in shell scripting, Python or C#
* Experience/Knowledge of AWS AppFlow and DataSync
* Familiarity with Apache AirFlow
* Experience in Tableau/Highcharts/MetaBase,/AWS QuickSight
* Exposure to financial, media and/or news industries a plus

title: Core Publishing Solutions Business Development Intern – Summer 2023
description:
Are you looking for an internship that provides real-world-project experience, networking with employees and executives worldwide, while growing your talents on a supportive and inclusive team? If so, we want to connect with you! 

At Thomson Reuters Core Publishing Solutions, we provide quality book printing and distribution services for our clients throughout Minnesota, the United States and around the world. With a range of printing, warehousing, and fulfillment services to offer, we provide clients with timely, cost-effective solutions to their printing and distribution needs.

Our 1.3 million square foot manufacturing facility in Eagan, Minnesota, is one of the largest printing, warehousing, and fulfillment facilities in the United States. We have a strong history of creating quality products for businesses within Thomson Reuters and for external customers around the globe.

We are looking for a Business Development Intern for Summer 2023 on the Core Publishing Solutions team that will make an impact by driving sales through lead generation, calls, and campaigns. This is a hands-on, **hybrid work** opportunity in our **MSP campus in Minnesota**.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Business Development Intern, you will: 

* Assist with the development, execution and measurement of sales campaigns designed to increase target market leads and drive sales for Thomson Reuters Core Publishing Solutions
* Sell Thomson Reuters’ Core Publishing Solutions services on outbound calls using a consultative and solutions-based sales approach
* Actively coordinate with the Business Development Manager to maintain, develop, and grow a rigorous pipeline, with accurate forecasting
* Actively prospect for new sales opportunities with tools such as LinkedIn and HubSpot Marketing system and Google Analytics through our dedicated website.
* Capture and record customer information and sales activity data into Salesforce.com (CRM)
* Assume other responsibilities as required by management

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Business Development Intern if you:

* Are a 3rd or 4th year (preferred) student in business, sales & marketing or a related field
* Have previous sales experience
* Have proven oral and written communication skills
* Exhibit strong analytical and quantitative skills (Experience with Google Analytics, Sales Force, HubSpot, WordPress a plus)
* Planning and project management skills
* Ability to take direction on projects
* Ability to adapt well to change in a fast-paced environment
* Working knowledge of MS Office and MS Teams

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. We offer an enriched internship program that focuses on developing the next generation of talent.  Bringing your whole self to work is at our core. Here’s how we support your growth:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, our interns are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Campus Culture:**WayUp’s [Top 100 Internship Programs](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nationalinternday.com%2Ftop100-2021&data=04%7C01%7CKaleigh.Peters%40thomsonreuters.com%7Cd09c0c3c2729464a513208d977cb330e%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637672536878100986%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=c2MUvQNOdq8cYMVBf%2F1q9ijLdNRHnf5PXTKWxZoZNDA%3D&reserved=0) for 2021, intern-focused events, weekly social hours, a dedicated intern appreciation day, Fireside Chats, partnerships with [Business Resource Groups](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/careers/careers-blog/thomson-reuters-employee-networks.html), & recognized company culture [awarded for our diversity and inclusion](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/awards-recognition.html)
* **Learning & Development:**Project-based internship related to your degree, networking with colleagues and executive leaders across the globe, intern alumni panels, Executive Speaker Series, Thomson Reuters University and LinkedIn Learning skills academies, mentorship from managers and teams.
* **Compensation:**Competitively paid internships, full-time hours Monday to Friday, with company-designated holidays
* **Social Impact:** Intern volunteer days, local volunteer events impacting your community
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**Learn more at:**  [**https://corepublishingsolutions.com**](https://corepublishingsolutions.com)    
or [**https://thomsonreuters.com**](https://thomsonreuters.com)

title: Director, Product Management (FindLaw)
description:
Within Thomson Reuters, FindLaw's product portfolio is the leading provider of business development solutions for law firms and home to the largest online destination for people with legal needs ([www.findlaw.com](http://www.findlaw.com)).  Our integrated marketing solutions help law firms grow their practice through strategic marketing approaches that drive results.  The growth and success of our business is the direct result of our diverse teams of talent that are creative, dynamic, and just plain knowledgeable.  We recruit and retain the best professionals from across the country that bring an array of expertise to the table, including legal experts, tech talents, marketing wizards, data geeks, and digital strategists. 

**Position Overview:**

As a Director of Product Management within our FindLaw business, you will play a critical role in helping our law firm customers achieve their marketing and business development goals. FindLaw products drive new business for our law firm customers, via websites, search engine optimization (SEO), pay-per-click (PPC), social media and other marketing solutions.

In this role, you’ll lead a Product Management team and be responsible for strategically managing a product portfolio, applying & embedding customer/market feedback to identify, prioritize, and champion new product/enhancement initiatives. You will directly drive financial results, through effective go-to-market planning, pricing strategies, and by working cross functionally with stakeholders to deliver new sales, retention, profitability and revenue growth targets. You will help us build a best-in-class Product Management function, driving success with iterative and agile development processes, ongoing product road mapping, and nurturing of a culture of high customer focus.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as Director, FindLaw Product Management, you will:

* Attract, develop, lead and empower a team of 10+ Product Management professionals to achieve goals
* Leverage market, industry and customer knowledge to deliver digital marketing and software products to market; maintain an active 12-18 month pipeline for assigned product portfolio
* Develop & maintain a longer-term, compelling product vision
* Manage product portfolios to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction, customer retention, and ensure premium value delivery and differentiation in a highly competitive market
* Identify, prioritize and champion new product/enhancement business cases, working cross functionally with business stakeholder groups
* Support near and long-term financial growth objectives of assigned product portfolios, including market share, sales, revenue, profit and return on investment.
* Partner with stakeholder groups to develop, deliver, and manage go-to-market strategies for new products/ enhancements, working cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Finance, Operations, and other stakeholder groups
* Influence pricing strategies in accordance with market environment, in depth customer understanding, and product value
* Apply best-in-class Product Management tools and principles to champion improvements in applied customer/market feedback, concept testing, agile/iterative delivery, and service-design concepts
* Manage assigned capital expense, maximizing value to customers, while delivering projects on time and on budget

**About the You:**

You’re a fit for the role of **Director of FindLaw Product Management** if you have:

* A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Operations, Marketing, or equivalent; or a Bachelor’s degree in another discipline plus substantial Product Management experience, training and/or certification; MBA a plus
* 8+ years of progressively accountable product strategy, product lifecycle, product commercial management experience, with demonstrated results of success
* Experience leading Product Management professionals to achieve high degrees of customer satisfaction, and attaining commercial product goals
* Product leadership experience in serving either our core market (lawyers, small businesses) and/or our product verticals (digital marketing solutions – SEO, paid search, social; cloud-based small business applications)
* Experience identifying and implementing best in class Product Management tools/principles to efficiently manage and optimize a product portfolio
* Ability to synthesize multiple qualitative and quantitative inputs to develop, recommend, and pursue product strategy
* Exceptional story teller abilities; able to present and communicate complex information to various audiences and levels within the organization, including senior executives
* Ability to prioritize work, make tradeoffs, drive deadlines, and deliver projects on time, on budget
* Demonstrated experience nurturing a culture that celebrates diversity of thought, risk-taking, openness to new ideas, and a fail-fast mentality

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Desenvolvedor de Software Sr. Full Stack 100% Remoto
description:
**Desenvolvedor de Software Sr. Full Stack - 100% Remoto,** Tax & Accounting Professionals

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Desenvolvedor de Software Sr. Full Stack em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como **Desenvolvedor de Software Sr. Full Stack**, você irá:

* **Missão principal do cargo:**

Desenvolvimento de soluções Web voltadas à gestão de relacionamentos com o cliente e gestão integrada da operação do negócio.

* **Responsabilidades:**

Analisar e implementar melhorias e correções no Sistema de Gerenciamento do Negócio, conforme requisitos do negócio, utilizando a linguagem Java (Web) e banco de dados Sybase SQL Anywhere.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* **Formação / Certificações**

**​**Formado ou cursando fases finais de Sistemas de Informação, Ciência da Computação, Engenharia da Computação ou áreas correlatas.

* **Requisitos/Qualificações:**

**​**Desenvolvedor Full Stack a partir de 5 anos de experiência

* **Indispensável (obrigatório):**

Conhecimento avançado\experiência em alguma linguagem Web.

Conhecimento avançado do framework JSF (JavaServer Faces) 

* **Desejável (ideal, porém não obrigatório):**

- JavaEE

- Hibernate

- JSP

- JSF

- Javascript

- HTML

- CSS

- Bootstrap

- Banco de dados Sybase SQLAnywhere

- Banco de dados PostgreSQL

- Git

* **Outros conhecimentos /idiomas/ habilidades desejáveis ao cargo:**

- Inglês técnico (leitura e conversação)

- Disponibilidade para horas extras, avisado sempre com antecedência

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos na empresa; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio , relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior SRE Engineer to join our Global Site Reliability team. We provide innovative team collaboration and social networking software to some of the world's leading law firms, investment banks and corporations.   We are leaders in legal digital transformation around the world. 

<https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/highq> 

As a Senior SRE Engineer you will be part of the core Platform Operations function that is responsible for security, delivery, and availability of our HighQ platform. 

You will also be expected to participate in the on-call rotation which supports our maintenance, scheduled work, support and release/deployment requirements. 

  

**About the Role** 

*In this opportunity, you will:*  

* **Be a Technical Leader:**Implement best practices as knowledge expert in SRE methodology.
* **Be a****Project Leader:** Strategically plan, design and implement Operations projects to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* **Be an efficient Stakeholder**: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management and support team in defining priority issues and refining processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues.
* **Be a Decision Maker**: Make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills.
* **Focus on Continuous****improvement and technical standards –**Drive improvements in productivity, monitoring, tooling and set industry best practices.

**About You** 

*You’re a fit for the role of Senior SRE, if you:* 

* Have experience working with three-tier web applications, running in public and/or private cloud.
* Have experience using Apache Tomcat, scaling database technologies like MS SQL.
* Have experience with DataDog Cloud Monitoring tool.
* Project and Release lifecycle experience.
* Have expertise in driving technology strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against product requirements.
* Are an effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners.
* Possess strong knowledge of current technologies, with proficiency in the areas of automation, DevOps, cloud native architecture, and system monitoring.

**What’s in it For You**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Manager, Data Center Operations
description:
**Manager Data Center Operations, Legal Technology**  
 

The Legal Technology Infrastructure and Operations group is seeking a Manager, Data Center Operations to join our team in Toronto, Canada. This role is expected to empower and coordinate a skilled technical team of individuals towards delivering enterprise technology solutions.  
This operational team is responsible for the HighQ product, a modern adaptable legal work solution.

  
This position will oversee the Platform Operations team, that is responsible for the day to day security, delivery and availability of our platform. This team also carries out platform project work to continually develop and improve our service as well as responding to monitoring systems as the 2nd line support - ensuring we meet or exceed our customers’ expectations, contracted and agreed SLAs.  
 

This role will be reporting into the Director of Product Reliability and Operations and will be a critical part of the HighQ Operations teams.  
 

https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/highq

**About the Role** 

In this opportunity as **Manager Data Center Operations**, you will:

* **Be a People Leader:**manage a team of technologists with varied skills and experience levels. Coach and mentor current and future leaders within the team, be responsible for proactively identifying individual training needs, conducting performance reviews, and maintaining a healthy team culture
* **Be a Project Leader:**train/coach team members in project delivery. Strategically plan, design, and implement software to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously
* **Be a Technical Leader:** HighQ operates in a public cloud and private cloud.
* **Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager:**collaborate and engage with stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, and project management in defining the roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
* **Be a Decision Maker:**make quick and effective data-driven decisions with good problem solving and analytical skills, and roll-out strategy that aligns with company goals
* **Be an Effective Communicator:**Effectively articulate complex problems, concepts, and solutions to varied audiences
* **Focus on Continuous Improvement and Technical Standards:**drive improvements in productivity, software quality, and reliability. Foster a continuous learning culture and curiosity about emerging technologies

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Manager Data Center Operations** if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required, Computer Science or related technical degree preferred
* Broad understanding of technology stacks used to build distributed application systems
* Hands-on experience using the Agile project management methodology
* Hands-on experience with programming and scripting languages
* Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Comfortable in a fast-paced environment and motivated by complex technical and business challenges

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Lead Platform Engineer
description:

We are looking for a Lead Platform Engineer to join our Global Platform Operations team. We provide innovative team collaboration and social networking software to some of the world's leading law firms, investment banks and corporations.   We are leaders in legal digital transformation around the world. 

<https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/highq>   
 

As a Lead Platform Engineer you will be part of the core Platform Operations function that is responsible for security, delivery, and availability of our HighQ platform. You will also be expected to participate in the on-call rotation which supports our maintenance, scheduled work, support and release/deployment requirements. 

  
This is a role focused on supporting the delivery and service improvement of a leading software platform, prior experience working for a SaaS provider would be desirable.

Successful candidates must be able to demonstrate an ability to take total ownership of issues. You will need to be a quick learner, can think on your feet and a proven problem solver. We are looking for candidates with unbridled enthusiasm for improvement who will ask questions and suggest better ways of operating.

  
**About the Role** 

*In this opportunity, you will:*  

* **Be a Technical Leader:**Implement best practices as knowledge expert in SRE methodology.
* **Be a Project Leader:** Strategically plan, design and implement Operations projects to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously.

* Take ownership of customer impacting issues including root cause analysis, organize cross functional teams to work the issues end to end and provide updates to leadership.
* Mentoring members of the team to up skills in required areas.
* Assess and prioritize work, understanding both tactical and strategic goals.
* Assist in development, design, and training to implement process improvement.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Willingness to travel to Data Centers which are located across the globe.
* Technical skills in the following areas:
	+ High Density Virtualization using Hyper-V

title: Analyste - Administration et Facturation
description:
**ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS**

DT Impôt et comptabilité, une filiale de Thomson Reuters à Montréal est présentement à la recherche d’un analyste en administration des commandes et facturation talentueux travaillant à distance de la maison et/ou de nos bureaux situés dans la Cité du Multimédia au centre-ville de Montréal.  Il s’agit d’un contrat d’une durée d’un an à temps plein.  La personne retenue recevra plusieurs semaines de formation et un soutien continu qui lui permettra de se familiariser avec l’entreprise et de progresser dans ses fonctions.

Le poste d’analyste, administration et facturation consiste à s’assurer que les processus nécessaires sont mis en œuvre à partir du moment où une nouvelle commande client est reçue d’un représentant, à s’assurer que la vente est transformée en revenus récurrents. L'analyste effectue la configuration initiale du dossier client dans les systèmes financiers et veille au respect des politiques et des procédures de facturation pour l'ensemble du portefeuille professionnel.

**Il s'agit d'un travail à domicile à 100 %, avec des visites occasionnelles à nos bureaux du centre-ville.**

**Le poste**

* Assister l’agent principal des comptes débiteurs et de l’exécution dans la mise en place de nouveaux clients sur les systèmes comptable.
* Maintenir et accéder à des données sur plusieurs systèmes tels qu’Incident Monitor, Moneris (Paiements par carte de crédit) et Onvio Tools.
* Recevoir des demandes par l’entremise de Salesforce, Microsoft Teams, courrier électronique et télécopie numérique.
* Préparer une liste quotidienne des licences pour la délivrance des codes utilisés pour l’activation du produit.
* Vérifier et traiter les commandes client et préparer de nouveaux rapports de ventes.
* Facturer et traiter les paiements sur Avantage et préparer les dépôts bancaires quotidiens.
* Tenir à jour le dossier de vérification postdaté et résoudre les demandes des clients concernant les modalités de paiement.
* Coordonner et programmer la facturation manuelle et par lots et exécuter les processus nécessaires à l'émission numérique des factures, des relevés et des demandes de paiement.
* Collaborer avec l’équipe de la comptabilité et veiller à ce que la facturation soit correcte pour la clôture du mois et la réconciliation des comptes clients.
* Travailler sur des projets ad hoc et interagir avec tous les membres de l'équipe des finances et des opérations, les départements locaux et l'équipe mondiale de traitement des comptes fournisseurs de Thomson Reuters.

**À propos de vous**

* Bilingue (anglais et français)
* Solides aptitudes pour la communication et les relations interpersonnelles.
* Axé sur le client, organisé et capacité d’effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
* Capacité de travailler avec Microsoft Office, Excel et tableaux croisés dynamiques.
* Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires de préférence en administration, en comptabilité ou en sciences sociales et en vue d’obtention d’un diplôme ou d’un grade désigné en administration des affaires.

**Quels sont les avantages pour vous ?**

Vous rejoindrez notre culture inclusive de talent de classe mondiale, où nous nous engageons à votre croissance personnelle et professionnelle à travers :

- **Une culture** : Une réputation mondialement reconnue et primée pour l'égalité, la diversité et l'inclusion, la flexibilité, l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, et plus encore.

- **Impact social :** Huit groupes de ressources d'entreprise dirigés par des employés; deux jours de bénévolat payés par an; initiatives environnementales, sociales et de gouvernance (ESG) pour un impact local et mondial.

- **Travail axé sur les objectifs :** Nous avons un super pouvoir dont nous n'avons jamais parlé avec autant de fierté que nous le devrions : nous sommes l'une des seules entreprises de la planète à aider ses clients à rechercher la justice, la vérité et la transparence. Avec les professionnels et les institutions que nous servons, nous contribuons à faire respecter l'état de droit, à faire tourner les roues du commerce, à attraper les mauvais acteurs, à rapporter les faits et à fournir des informations fiables et impartiales aux personnes du monde entier.
