DT Tax and Accounting, a subsidiary of Thomson Reuters in Montreal is currently seeking a talented, Order Administration and Billing Analyst working remotely from home and/or the individual’s choice of various weekdays from our offices situated in the Cité du Multimedia in downtown Montreal.  This position is on a one-year renewable full-time contract basis.  The successful candidate will be given several weeks training and ongoing support to allow the individual to learn the business and progress into the position.

The administration and billing analyst function ensures the necessary processes are implemented from the time a new sales order is received from a sales representative to ensuring sale is transformed into recurring revenue.  The analyst effects initial client setup on financial systems, ensures policy adherence and billing procedures are carried out for the whole professional portfolio.

**This is a 100% work from home position, with occasionnal visits to our downtown offices.**

**About The Role**

* Assist the Primary Accounts Receivable and Fulfillment agent in setting up new customers on Accounting Software systems.
* Maintain and access data on several systems such as Incident Monitor, Moneris (Credit Card Payments), and Onvio Tools.
* Receive requests via Salesforce, Microsoft teams, e-mail, and digital fax.
* Prepare daily license listing for issuance of codes used for product activation.
* Verify and process sales orders and prepare new sales reporting.
* Invoice and process payments on Avantage and prepare daily bank deposits.
* Maintain post-dated check file and resolve customer inquiries relating with payment terms.
* Coordinate and schedule manual and batch invoicing and carry out processes required for digital issuance of billings, statements, and cash applications.
* The analyst will work with accounting and ensure proper billing for month end cut-off and accounts receivable reconciliation.
* Work on ad hoc projects and interact with all members of the finance and operations team, local departments, and TR global AP processing team.

**About You**

* Bilingual (English and French)
* Solid communication and interpersonal skills.
* Customer oriented, organized, and able to multi-task.
* Able to work with Microsoft office, excel and pivot tables.
* College or University degree preferably in administration, accounting or social sciences and working towards a diploma or designated business degree.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

**Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Media Sales Support Representative
description:
**Media Sales Support Representative, Reuters News Agency Sales**

#LI-JA1

Are you interested in a position where you can support internally the sales operations of one of the largest media companies in the world? Are you savvy on Sales Force?

Reuters is seeking a talented and experienced Media Sales Support Representative to join our Sales Support team in Costa Rica. Reuters Agency is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news with impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

The Media Sales Support Representative role is accountable for supporting the Reuters Sales organization on general sales-related matters, business policy and procedural issues.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity, as our Media Sales Support Representative, you will:

* Serve as the primary resource for sales and account management teams to understand content/product offerings, business policies, order processing, credits, and procedures and assist in problem solving on all issues
* Permission prospective clients for trials
* Complete and update regulatory documentation for governmental clients
* Support for administrative tasks relating to order fulfilment (new sales, cancellations, renewals etc.)
* Input billing information (i.e. products, pricing, billing address etc.) into relevant systems, supporting the quote to billing processes
* Escalate and follow up on client’s billing and invoicing issues
* Maintaining client data (such as contacts, addresses, service changes etc.) in relevant systems
* Ensure pipeline accuracy and support monthly forecast processes
* Engage with Commercial Policy team to support contract fulfilment and compliance
* Responsible for ensuring procedure changes are supported, implemented and followed to maximize efficiency, delivering quality services to customers for all order to cash processes
* Train, interact and provide analytics (usage) with customers (via phone, email) on an as-needed basis.
* Share best practices and knowledge related to new products, sales process best practices
* Provide logistical support for regional sales meetings and other events as needed.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Media Sales Support Representative if your background includes:

* Advanced English proficiency (candidates will be tested before setting up an interview). Other European languages desirable
* Experience with Salesforce is a must, and SAP a plus.
* Organizational, prioritization, attention to detail and high degree of accuracy is a must
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to apply knowledge and creativity to resolve standard and complex client issues
* At least 3 years of experience in a business operation, sales support, order management or customer service function
* Strong communication skills (written, oral, presentation)
* Customer-oriented
* Comfort with working in a complex and dynamic environment, juggling multiple priorities, interacting with people at different levels of the organization and across multiple functions.
* Ability to troubleshoot and make appropriate decisions based on knowledge of business objectives
* Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· COVID-19 Response: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

· Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

· Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

· Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

· Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
You will join the team of around 12 colleagues based in Gdansk. You will deliver services in a manner that is service oriented and consistent with established payroll policies, processes and business requirements.

The jobholder is responsible for providing quality service to our customers and partner groups including employees, payroll providers, local authorities and internal stakeholders.

Please note, it's a fixed term role for 18-24 months. 

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Payroll Specialist, you will:

* Processing EMEA Payroll data input via the payroll provider platform
* Extracting data from HR system of record & data input on to the Payroll Platform directly including: New Starters, Leavers, One Time Payments, Overtime, Salary Changes, etc.
* Ensuring Payroll is processed accurately within agreed deadlines
* Liaising with key business stakeholders
* Resolving all queries from employees via Helpdesk in a timely manner
* Sending Statutory forms to Payroll Vendor within agreed deadlines
* Responding to HR and employees' requests and queries
* Performing ad hoc activities related to assigned payroll group

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Payroll Specialist if your background includes:

* Language skills - fluent **English and Russian, Ukrainian**
* BA or MS degree preferred in finance, business management, HR or analytics
* Interest in payroll processes, general understanding of payroll environment
* At least intermediate level of Excel
* Strong problem solving, decision making and analytical skills
* Strong written and verbal communication, both oral and written
* Proven ability to sustain strong customer relationships, an understanding of customer focus and service delivery
* Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail
* Drive & self motivation with the ability to work independently

**What’s in it For You?**

title: Analyst - Global Trade Content
description:
**Analyst - Global Trade Content - Product Content**

Are you looking for a new career opportunity in Trade Content? Join the exceptional Product Content department of Thomson Reuters.

As an **Analyst - Global Trade Content,** you will be responsible for the accurate compilation and in-depth understanding of Harmonized Schedule (HS) with a focus on sourcing, verification, conversion, and quality assurance.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an Analyst - Global Trade Content, you will

* **Research** Global Trade Content for various countries from authorized government websites.
* The trade content includes HS, import-export duties, documents required to be filed while paying various duties, trade compliance, licensing requirements including procedures and documents required to obtain those licenses.
* **Interpret** and **convert** government legislation related to global trade into standard format/software compatible format before loading in the system.
* **Track** regulatory and **monitor** changes from government websites for assigned tariffs with timely updates.
* **Seek** opportunities to grow regulatory data for assigned tariffs.
* **Document** the processes and work instructions.

**About You**

You're fit for the role of Analyst - Global Trade Content if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree Holder
* Strong MS Excel skills (have had prior experience with vlook up, pivot, etc.)
* An iclination to reading
* Excellent English
* Exceptional attitude towards customer service
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Knowledge of HS and Customs regulations
* Analytical and interpretation skills
* Strong focus on delivery, including attention to details
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while at the same time fully participating in a team environment
* Open to Fresh Graduates

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Senior Technical Solutions Consultant
description:
**Senior Technical Solutions Consultant** 

Thomson Reuters is looking to hire an experienced Senior Technical Solutions Consultant. We require a highly motivated, goal-oriented individual who will be responsible for managing a team that builds software solutions to meet client needs. Ideal candidates will have technical experience including object-oriented programming, RDMBS knowledge, and experience in the professional service industry. Candidates should be excellent team players, capable of leading development resources, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously. 

**About the Role**  

Technical Solutions Consultant are responsible for the specification, design, development, and implementation of custom software projects for our customers using our 3E products.  Candidate should possess knowledge of several development languages, databases and technologies.  Has the ability to

understand a customer’s business requirement and advise customer with the most compelling solution available within the 3E software. In addition to this the Technical Solutions Consultant is responsible for managing development resources, both on and offshore to ensure a quality product is delivered to the customer.

In addition:

* Thinks strategically and anticipates client needs in relation to solution delivery
* Considers the strategic direction of Thomson Reuters when providing designs and consultancy
* Directs the resolution of complex or unusual customer requirements.
* Responsible for development of custom solutions.

This role reports to the Technical Consultant Services Manager.

**About You** 

You are a fit for the role of a Technical Consultant if your background includes:

**Mandatory Skills and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or Mathematics required, master’s degree preferred.
* 7+ years’ experience in the complete SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle).
* 7+ years’ experience with SQL Server.
* 7+ years’ experience developing in API’s, C#, XSLT, .NET and/or ASP.NET.
* 7+ years’ experience of integrations using Microsoft BizTalk, Web Services, or equivalent technologies.
* Can consistently and successfully demonstrate, (with minimal supervision):


	+ Clear communication capabilities on projects, including project documentation
	+ Comprehensive analytical skills and ability to formulate client-specific solutions
	+ A solid understanding of the various database structures
	+ Positive track record for customer satisfaction
	+ Strong team player capabilities, i.e., willing to help others as appropriate, without being asked
	+ Desire for self-improvement i.e., taking advantage of CE classes, self-study on own initiative
	+ Participation in both client facing and internal projects
	+ Ability to work under tight schedules and under pressure
	+ Ability to work on multiple tasks within same time frame
	+ Ability to work well across departments and skill levels
	+ Able to work occasional weekend and holiday assignments

**Desirable Skills and Experience:** 

* Ability to demonstrate knowledge and experience in the Legal finance sector or similar financial systems environment (prior Thomson Reuters experience highly desirable)
* Prior knowledge and awareness of Thomson Reuters products

**Education/ Certifications Required:** 

* Educational requirements: Computer Science/Mathematics or equivalent
* Experience in field requirements: Experience in similar role with similar responsibilities
* On the Job educational requirements: Experience with delivering software solutions and strong understanding of software development and delivery.
* Technological requirements: As above

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

**Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

**Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Key Account Executive
description:
**Key account Executive** para **Thomson Reuters Chile**

**¡Que tus próximos pasos sean en TR!**

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de profesionales con ambición, motivación y experiencia interesados en desarrollarse en el rol de Key Account Executive del área de Tax & Accounting.

**El responsable de la posición…**

* Cubre las cuentas nuevas y/o existentes en la región o territorio asignado.
* Busca nuevos clientes o negocios en clientes existentes y cierra las ventas. Estos roles prospectarán nuevos clientes y cerrarán las ventas para una geografía asignada
* Impulsa la retención, la mejora y la renovación de las cuentas existentes.
* Dirige y es responsable de proyectos sencillos y equipos asociados.
* Proporciona información para los objetivos y metas del área o equipo
* Participa en proyectos complejos que integran unidad de negocios o área regional.
* Entrenamiento o mentoría de sus colegas.

**¿Qué requisitos buscamos?**

* Profesional graduado o avanzado en estudios como Ingeniería comercial, Administración de empresas o a fines
* Experiencia de mínimo 3 años en posiciones tales como KAE, Ejecutivo de Ventas, KAM Jr., Asesor Comercial…
* Deseable: idioma inglés intermedio/avanzado
* Manejo de paquete office y experiencia en uso de CRM (Sales Force, Bull Horn …)

Por, sobre todo, personas motivadas, con ganas de superarse día tras día, logrando tomar el control para salir a ganar demostrando ser los mejores en su juego.  
 

**Te Proponemos**

* Ser parte de una compañía multinacional totalmente comprometida en el respeto y cuidado de sus colaboradores
* Ser protagonista de tu desarrollo en un ambiente de aprendizaje, oportunidades y proyectos desafiantes.
* Formar parte de un equipo de excelentes profesionales, quienes serán tu guía y apoyo en todo desarrollo.
* Herramientas y recursos adecuados a tu disposición para identificar, priorizar y cerrar oportunidades.
* Gran clima laboral, de super importancia para tu formación y para que disfrutes la experiencia.

title: Customer Success Executive, Corporate - Remote
description:
Customer Success is not only a function or a team at Thomson Reuters, but also our reason for doing business. We measure our success based on that of the prioritization of our customer needs and goals. The relationship that we create with our customers determines the future benefits for both, the customer, and our company. The **ONESOURCE Customer Success Executive (CSE) for Corporate Large Accounts** will be responsible for customers within our *Ind**irect Tax*. To begin, the CSE will participate in a virtual on-boarding program to learn the respective specialized product lines, as they acquire their book of business. The CSE is assigned a book of business by geographical territory and will be responsible for the development of customers knowledge on their suite of offerings. The CSE will manage these customers to drive performance towards Thomson Reuters' strategic objectives and retention goals. This will require the management of multiple projects and strong business acumen to remove obstacles interfering with growth and retention of customers.

**Remote based position - can be based anywhere in the US.** 

**About the Role**:

In this opportunity as a Customer Success Executive, you will:

* **Understand** “what success looks like” for our customers and partner with them to define their business outcomes. Deliver educational activities across the customer lifecycle including onboarding, adoption, and long-term commitment and track against targets over time
* **Tracking customer health** – Identify, track, and escalate components of our customer health; raise critical customer concerns internally and mobilize resources to resolve issues. Monitor usage data, health gauges and growth opportunities to build useful insights and strategically adjust when needed
* **Growing value** – Assess the maturity of deployed offerings and functionality to make recommendations for improvement. Work closely with the commercial team to activate those opportunities
* **Drive Customer value**: Ensure customers derive maximum value from their investment and collaborate with other Thomson Reuters partner teams that result in retention, growth, and education, tailored to their workflow
* **Leverage Technology:** Leverage technology tools (e.g., Gainsight and Salesforce) to keep all client information updated, manage team pipeline, and forecast financial projections accurately
* **Present:** Lead business plan presentations of your book of business which account for planning, preparation, and execution of how to maximize efficiency, retention, and growth within your customer base

**Key Deliverables**

* Develop relationships and optimize enterprise customer accounts
* Delivery of target financial and customer experience objectives for the Corporates segment (e.g., client renewal rate and value growth through increased customer adoption)
* Forecast monthly renewal and growth targets
* Reporting on market and competitor activities
* Presentations across internal meetings with other company functions necessary to perform duties and aid business development
* Ensure key metrics are tracked such as active users, user logon, usage metrics and overall retention rates
* Liaise between the customer and Thomson Reuters teams such as, customer support, professional services, technology, and product management teams, as needed

**About You:** 

You're a fit for the role of Customer Success Executive if you have:

* 8+ years of professional experience in Accounting or US Taxation, with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in client management
* 4-year college degree required, master’s degree or equivalent preferred
* Experience in ONESOURCE™, Gainsight and Salesforce, a plus
* Functional/technical skills in SaaS implementations and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) applications, a plus
* Experience working in and around cloud software solutions and cloud delivery models
* Strong business acumen and communication skills; can manage a customer journey, conflict resolution and problem-solve

**What's in it for you!**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $112,000 - $208,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

As required by local legislation for this remote based role, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $101,500 - $188,500. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

title: Client Manager, Inside - FindLaw
description:
The Client Manager- SLF, FindLaw is responsible for developing and maintaining ongoing client relationships in order to achieve client and revenue retention goals within an assigned, territory or team.  This will be done by proactive and reactive management for each assigned account, close partnership with Field Consultants, and working cross functionally with all areas of FindLaw and across other Thomson Reuters departments that support our business.  The position will be based out of Eagan, MN.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Client Manager- SLF, FindLaw, you will:

* **Drive Results:** Secure contract renewals for assigned portfolio of customers and meet monthly renewal volume and revenue requirements by providing first class customer care for all clients
* **Consultation:** Ensure client retention and satisfaction with a select portfolio of accounts by proactively identifying problem areas, trends and opportunities, and recommend plan of action to client and/or stakeholders
* **Communication:** Provide account analytics and insight and recommend a plan of action and provide timely and proactive status updates to clients/stakeholders for all projects in process
* **Collaboration:**  Act as primary, internal, point of contact for assigned accounts and establish strong working relationships with clients, Field Consultants and other internal partners/stakeholders

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Client Manager- SLF, FindLaw if you:

* Four-year degree required
* Minimum of 2 years client management and/or sales and marketing experience
* Proven success with retention of client population and associated revenue
* Well-developed negotiation skills and ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts required
* Strong communication and presentation skills, especially via telephone, required
* Ability to multitask, prioritize, and follow through in accordance with service level agreements.
* Understanding of digital marketing concepts and processes preferred
* Understanding and/or experience working with the legal industry preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

·       **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

·       **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

·       **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

·       **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

·       **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

·       **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto (Software Jurídico)
description:
**Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto (Software Jurídico),** Legal

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como **Técnico de Treinamento ao Produto (Software Jurídico)**, você irá:

* Realizar treinamentos(remotamente) e prestar suporte ágil e de qualidade, sanando as dúvidas relacionadas ao funcionamento dos sistemas Legal One (jurídico);
* Entrar em contato com o cliente para alinhar os agendamentos e/ou reagendamentos dos treinamentos;
* Realizar reciclagem de treinamentos com os clientes/usuários;
* Realizar webinar (online) de forma pontual para os clientes.

​Horário de trabalho: De segunda a sexta-feira das 9h às 18h | Híbrido 2x por semana no escritório

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Ensino superior em Direito, Administração, Comunicação ou áreas afins;
* Experiência em atendimento ao cliente, preferencialmente suporte, treinamento e capacitação ou implantação de sistemas;
* Desejável conhecimento na área jurídica.

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos na empresa; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio , relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.
* **Remuneração**: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.

“Como empresa que estimula a Diversidade e Inclusão de seus talentos, reforçamos que todas as vagas da Thomson Reuters são elegíveis para **pessoas com deficiência**.”

title: Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters
description:
**Reader Revenue Analyst - Reuters**

**This hybrid role will be based from either our New York or Toronto offices. Applications from other locations will also be considered.**

Do you like using data to tell stories? Are you great at analyzing both quantitative and qualitative data? Keen to work as part of an inclusive global team? If so, this role as a **Reader Revenue Analyst** might be for you.

**Reuters** is seeking a **Reader Revenue** **Analyst** to work across a number of business areas within **Reuters Professional**. Reuters Professional is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news that has a tangible impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and we serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Reader Revenue Analyst**, you will:

* Build & interrogate a range of data analytics reports and dashboards for various business units within Reuters.
* Outline changes and trends in Reuters audience to ensure we're making the right decisions to serve our audience.
* Develop relationships across teams to gain understanding of organizational needs.
* Identify opportunities to improve customer products and services based on data.
* Support the larger team through problem solving and answering ad hoc requests as required.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Reader Revenue Analyst** if you:

* Are comfortable managing and analyzing large sets of both quantitative and qualitative data sets (including mapping analytics, tracking and performance measurement).
* Have experience of working with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude, Adobe Analytics)
* Are comfortable managing advanced Excel spreadsheets and presenting your findings to a range of senior stakeholders across the organization.
* Have a collaborative mindset, able to work across different departments and liaise with stakeholders based globally.
* Have an interest in - and an understanding of - mapping user journeys and segmenting audiences (experience of this is desired but by no means prerequisite).

**Please note: Completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 ET on Sunday 22nd January 2023. Early applications are actively encouraged.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the base compensation range for this position is $60,200 - $111,800. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

title: #1 Operator – Mac in Prepress - 3rd shift
description:
We are hiring an experienced **Pre-Press/****Mac Operator** for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a Mac Operator,you will join a culture where safety and continuous improvements are a priority, and employees are expected to work collaboratively to serve our customers and support the business. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months, and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees). The shift differential for 3rd shift has also increased to $5 per hour.  **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 3rd shift – 10:30 pm – 6:30 am
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Pre-Press/****Mac** **Operator**, you will be responsible for:   

* Retrieving electronic customer files from network storage locations.
* Inspecting files and templates for proper imposition, trim, bleeds, trap, fonts, and images.
* Editing and creating PostScript, EPS, and PDFs as required.
* Preflights and/or troubleshoot customer files to ensure efficient and cost-effective production.
* Using application software to edit and adjust files, calculate and impose page layouts, and/or build templates.
* Using computer-based workflow applications to manage files.
* Troubleshooting general hardware, software, and network problems
* Identifying solutions to non-standard requests from customers.
* Work results are not typically checked by others

**Equipment includes:**

* Graphic Imposition/Mac

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Pre-Press/Mac Operator** if your background includes:

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Ability to read, interpret and explain documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and production orders
* Experience with Lean and continuous improvement
* Good communication skills including experience sharing information across shifts and departments
* Proven success as a trainer
* Competence with rulers and measurement
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull, and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Regularly standing walking, crouching, bending, reaching, and kneeling

**What’s in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Bonuses:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees), shift premium of 3rd shift - $5.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: #3 Operator in Press - 2nd shift
description:
We are hiring a Press Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a **#3 Press Operator****,** you will be responsible for working as a member of our Core Publishing Solutions team providing operational management and technical support. You will be operating state-of-the-art offset and digital web presses. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months, and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees).  We have also increased the shift differential for 2nd shift to $4 per hour.  **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 2nd shift – 2:30 pm – 10:30 pm
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **#3** **Press Operator**, you will be responsible for:   

* Assisting the crew on the press, performing setup and production activities, typically on the back-end of the presses to ensure the press is running smoothly
* Preparing for upcoming jobs by reading the DSR and job specifications, as well as staging materials
* Quality checking products for our customers, completing transactions, bundling and tagging products
* Filling in for Lead and Mid-Level Operators as needed including covering absences or breaks
* Monitoring equipment and product quality, housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment, documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, and troubleshooting when necessary
* Using safety equipment to comply with state and federal regulations, reporting all safety and environmental hazards, and attending safety and environmental training programs to ensure compliance and culture of safety

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **#3 Press Operator** if your background includes:

* Possess a High School Diploma or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Some experience working in an industrial setting in a maintenance and troubleshooting capacity with a wide range of production machinery is strongly desired
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, competent with rulers and measurement
* Thorough understanding of electrical safety and safe work practices such as the use of personal protective equipment and following machine instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull, and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Regularly standing walking, crouching, bending, reaching, and kneeling

**What’s in it for you**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Bonuses:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees), shift premium of 2nd shift - $4.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
#LI-JK3

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

title: Latin America Mining Correspondent
description:
Reuters is seeking an experienced reporter with a proven track record of breaking news and developing enterprise stories to cover the important and sprawling mining sector in Latin America. The role would involve covering a key mining region that is home to the world’s top producers of copper and vast reserves of lithium, key metals for electrification, as well as Brazil-based iron ore and nickel giant Vale. The race to secure metals for the energy transition makes Latin America a crucial story where geopolitics, corporate maneuvering and resource nationalism meet.

 

We want someone who can drive our coverage in the region, coordinating with other beat reporters, to ensure we are fast and accurate on key breaking news, as well as spearheading ambitious story ideas to take our coverage deep inside the sector from business strategies to impacts on the environment and indigenous tensions. The successful candidate would be based in Santiago, Chile or Lima, Peru, but would have a mandate for travel to other regional mining hotspots. We are seeking someone with an ability to develop sources, breaking regular exclusive news and who has a flair for writing.

TheCorrespondentshould have the attention to detail and speed to cover fast-paced breaking stories – and the ability to deliver insightful big-picture stories, explaining complex topics to readers around the world.

**In the role, you will:**

* Have the writing and reporting ability to deliver deeper stories swiftly and cope with fast-paced breaking news
* Develop sources to break news on mining in Chile, Peru and Brazil as well as building up networks in Bolivia, Argentina, Colombia and beyond.
* Have the ability to elevate copy from stringers and mentor more junior members of the team
* Work closely with visuals colleagues in identifying and delivering strong story packages for reuters.com and media clients

**The preferred candidate to be our Latin American Mining Correspondent will have:**

* At least 5 years in journalism
* Fluent spoken and written English; and strong to fluent Spanish
* Portuguese would be a plus, but not mandatory
* Experience in covering business and economics
* The enthusiasm, drive and ability to think outside the box
* The skills to produce deeply reported, impactful enterprise journalism that illuminates complex topics
* The capacity and ambition to help lead a team

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

**Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities

**Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists

**Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days

**Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world’s media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. title: TEMPORARY JOB (1 YEAR) Contract Specialist
description:
**Contract Specialist, Reuters Technology**

#LI-JA1

Are you interested in an opportunity involved in the life cycle management of contracts worldwide?  
We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world's businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization.

**Abuot the role**

In this opportunity as a Contract Specialist, you will:  

* Be responsible for the life cycle management of News Agency contracts worldwide with specialist knowledge of products and contracts and are key in ensuring media Commercial Policy and Compliance protocols are applied.
* Work with Account Managers globally, this role manages the life cycle of contracts and related business functions. The role requires a good knowledge of compliance protocols, commercial policy and sound understanding of contract issues and rights.
* Draft contracts, permissioning services, ensuring commercial and compliance policy is followed and working in collaboration with Legal and others for bespoke deals.
* Maintain contract data from which reports will be generated to inform strategic business decisions.
* Work as part of a global team, the post requires a good organizational skill, a high level of attention to detail and accuracy, capable of self-motivated task management, working to deadlines, good communication skills across cultures and the ability to work as part of a team as well as taking initiative in a dynamic environment.

**About You**

* You’re a fit for the role of Contract Specialist if your background includes:
* Good contract experience and familiarity with legal language
* Knowledge of compliance and other standard business protocols
* Strong communication skills to suit a global business
* Experience of operational technologies and databases
* Attention to detail
* Good written English language skills (for drafting legal documents)
* Good organizational skills
* Ability to prioritize work under pressure
* Ability to self-motivate and meet targets
* Team player

Desired Skills:

* Experience of the news and media industry
* Additional languages

Education/ Certifications: (Specific degrees and/or certifications required or preferred)

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Correspondent - Maternity Cover (12 month contract)
description:
**Reuters** is seeking a Danish-speaking reporter to join our **Nordic and Baltic breaking news team** for a **12-month assignment**. Writing in English for a global audience, the successful candidate will work closely with journalists at our Copenhagen office and with colleagues in the Nordic and Baltic countries and beyond. While the primary emphasis is on Danish news, the reporter will be involved in coverage from around the region.

**About the Role** 

As our **Correspondent,** you will cover:

* major economic events,
* changes to the government,
* earnings reports or takeovers at big companies.

To be our **Correspondent** you will likely have:

* Experience from working as a journalist
* A good understanding of Danish society, including the country’s politics, economy, and general news
* Solid news judgement and a desire to work on tight deadlines
* Fluent Danish, spoken and written
* Fluent English, spoken and written
* Basic understanding of other Nordic or Baltic languages would be a plus
* Experience from working with breaking news is also a benefit

**Please note, the deadline for applications is 1 January 2023 at 11.59pm UTC.**

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days

title: Software Engineer - Java
description:
**Software Engineer, Court Management Solutions**  
 

Are you passionate about solving challenging problems by building outstanding software as part of a small, collaborative team? If you enjoy being exposed to various new technologies, can multitask and have a strong desire to succeed, our team is a perfect fit for you!  
  
Thomson Reuters Court Management Solutions is the leading provider of enterprise software for trial and appellate courts nationwide. Our C-Track solutions enable courts to efficiently manage caseloads, improve collaboration across justice platforms, and transform courts into modern examples of efficiency and effectiveness. Judges, clerks and IT personnel depend on C-Track to alleviate bottlenecks and tedious tasks within their complex workflows, enabling staff to manage increased caseloads with fewer resources. The suite of C-Track products includes case management, electronic filing and document management solutions.  
  
In addition to the exciting opportunities available in the Thomson Reuters Court Management Solutions group, you will have all the opportunities that come with being part of the larger Thomson Reuters organization. For additional information on C-Track and Thomson Reuters - the world’s leading source of intelligent information for businesses and professionals

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Software Engineer**, you will:

* Our Software Engineers work on multiple projects developing web-based applications using Java and open-source technologies (Spring, Hibernate, Struts, SQL, Web Services, Tomcat, Maven, etc.).
* Develop and maintain quality code, create unit tests, and fix bugs
* Create solutions across all layers of a web application, from the UI to the database
* Design and document solutions in collaboration with team members, project management, and customers
* Research and provide recommendations for new technologies
* Drive continuous improvement in our software and development process

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Software Engineer** if your background includes the following:

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field is required
* Working knowledge of object-oriented design and development (ideally with a focus on Java)
* Working knowledge of SQL with basic query experience
* Working knowledge of basic web applications from the UI to the database
* Proven ability to adapt well to a fast-paced environment
* Strong communication skills

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people worldwide.

title: Senior Engineer - Integrations
description:
Other key aspects of this role will be Integrations Support, API implementation, SSO implementations and ongoing technical support for customers. The Senior Integrations Engineer will interact with regulatory bodies, tax authorities, product and technology teams across Thomson Reuters to gather use cases and ultimately define the deliverables and requirements for e-filing Manager. title: Business Development Representative
description:
**Business Development Representative (BDR)**
---------------------------------------------

 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team and work with us on our expansion project in Mexico, prospecting new sales opportunities, developing pipelines & closing opportunities.

 

**About the Role:**

* Prospect for new sales opportunities, develop a pipeline, & closes opportunity or may not execute renewal contracts.
* Identifies upsell and cross-sell opportunities and passes to an appropriate resource.
* Hit or exceed your monthly and annual targets and maintain consistently strong performance at 100% of your YTD goals
* Hit or exceed your daily contact targets and activity metrics.
* Actively engage in the coaching process, partnering well with managers and individuals on your teams to share ideas and learn from each other.
* Accurately, and in a timely manner, log all activities and customer contacts in Salesforce.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:  

* Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience in lieu of a bachelor’s degree.
* 1 – 3 years of experience working as a Business De Representative.
* Excellent verbal and written communication (Spanish & English)
* Strong interpersonal skills (personable and professional)
* Ability to conduct self in a professional manner
* Agile learners – Ability to learn something new
* Commitment to a schedule that coincides with the customer’s workday
* Intermediate computer skills and ability to navigate software programs such as Microsoft
* Experience in CRM preferred
* Motivated competitive with a positive attitude.
* Demonstrate the ability to rapidly learn new knowledge and acquire new skills
* Maintain stable performance under pressure (such as time pressure or job ambiguity); handle stress in a manner that is acceptable to others in the organization.
* Display determination, persistence, and patience and be resilient in the face of adversity.

title: Sales Executive, Tax & Accounting - Large Firms
description:
**About the Role** 

The **Sales Executive** in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Large client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 30+ professionals. 

The **Sales Executive** position is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.   
 

The successful **Sales Executive**:  

* Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.
* Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.
* Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.
**What You Will Do:** 

In this opportunity as a  **Sales Executive**, you will: 

* Attain sales quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Client Executive and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required
* Manage open territories in the event we have them
 

**About You:** 

You may be a fit for the role if you have/are: 

* Minimum 3 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics
**What’s in it For You?** 

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:              

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
 

#LI-D2E

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following states (CA, CO, CT, NV, WA) and/or remote. The target total cash compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $126,000 - $234,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive. Pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay and any target sales incentive are part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

title: Manager, Project Management
description:
The Senior Project Manager will define, scope, initiate and manage large company projects of high risk, complexity, and visibility while supporting the business. May manage project management staff. Typical scope of the projects will be greater than 12 months, involve more than 10 FTEs which are cross functional and be a project that is critical to the company meeting its objectives. Team members in a Project Manager role are expected to display core competencies such as Project Delivery, Financial Management, Risk Management, and Estimating and Planning. Expected expertise in each of these areas will vary based on job level.

**Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Project Management - Actively manage S&R and Customer Markets projects/initiatives.
	+ Assigns work, allocates resources, monitors results, controls costs and manages staff
	+ Defines project scope and objectives
	+ Manage RAID items and high-level timelines
	+ Manages the change control procedure gaining agreement for revisions to the project from project stakeholders and ensure full impact of significant changes are understood by project stakeholders.
	+ Ensures all parties are aware of project scope and milestones. Highlights divergence from that scope, and adjusts it where necessary to reflect changing circumstances, acts a communication liaison.
	+ Ability to create business cases or business analysis to outline problem statement, resolution options and cost/benefit trade-offs
	+ Communicates difficult and complex concepts effectively, by altering communication style to the audience
	+ Influences others to adopt a point of view for ideas and initiatives
	+ Decisions are guided by resource availability, business unit or functional business plans, impacting support and funding of projects, products, services or technologies
	+ Implements processes to produce desired changes
* In-depth business and managerial knowledge of a department or sub-function
	+ Ability to identified interdependencies among systems, processes, and people though process analysis
	+ Interprets internal and external business issues and recommend solutions
	+ Facilitate discussions around defining business requirement
	+ Gathers analyses and presents complex concepts or sensitive information for discussion with more senior levels of management
	+ Ability to document business processes and reporting processes
	+ Directs the resolution of complex or unusual technical, operational and organizational problems which may be multi-disciplinary
* Good knowledge and understanding of related functions
* Applies understanding of current industry trends to analyze and review diverse issues
* Demonstrates people leadership skills

**Qualifications:**

* **Self-starter – able to prioritize actions among multiple teams to drive decisions and progress**
* Strong presentation skill – ability to report program status to high level executives
* **Strong analytical skill – ability to investigate and understand requirements from a business perspective**
* **Strong critical thinking skill – ability to “connect the dots” within complex systems and business processes**
* Have a basic understanding of finance and accounting rules
* Strong communication skill
	+ Conflict resolution – ability to manage multiple competing priorities and teams, and adapt and flex with projects as needed
	+ Able to build effective relationship among multiple groups inside and outside of Customer Markets
* Financial Management
* People Leadership
* Stakeholder Relationships
* Education: Bachelor's Degree

title: Westlaw Japan - Customer Success specialist
description:
**※※本ポジションは ウエストロー・ジャパン株式会社 における募集となります※※**  
  
ポジション：   カスタマーサクセス スペシャリスト

レポート：     カスタマーサクセス　アシスタントディレクター直属

**概要：**  
ウエストロー・ジャパン　カスタマーサクセススペシャリストは当社で取り扱う法務情報オンラインサービス製品（Saas型 ）について、ご契約いただいた顧客へ、導入サポート、活用支援、利用推進提案、契約更新などをはじめとする能動的な顧客ケア・フォローを行います。  
  
既存顧客の顧客生涯価値（Life Time Value）の最大化、解約防止を目的とし、既存顧客とのコミュニケーション（オンライン・メール・電話・訪問）をベースとしたカスタマーサクセスの活動を実行していただきます。

  
特に、当社の取り扱う製品の中でも、海外法に関するサービスである”Practical Law”や”Westlaw海外製品”を中心に、弁護士 及び 企業セグメントをご担当いただきます。

  
 

**遂行職務**

：年次営業目標（契約更新率）の達成  
：更新時の顧客への価格上昇交渉 既存顧客に対するオンボーディングやユーザートレーニングなどのCXプログラムの実行と使用する説明資料の作成  
：既存顧客への継続利用の促進と関係性の向上  
：既存顧客からのフィードバックの収集とそれに基づく製品開発の提案 既存顧客からの問い合わせ対応  
：アップセル、クロスセル機会の創出・発掘とそのプランニング トムソン・ロイター社に対して、製品に関する情報収集や各種問い合わせ業務  
：ワークフローの改善と効率化 Salesforce.comを利用した顧客管理と自身の業務管理

**要求される能力**

：法曹・法務関係者への献身と、ビジネス上の良好な関係性を構築する意欲。  
：製品･サービスの強みや、製品を利用することで得られるメリットを伝える高いコミュニケーション能力。

：顧客が抱える課題に対する適切なソリューションとして、製品が重要な役割を担えることを伝えられる能力。  
：目標達成に対する強い意思と実現する能力。

：セルフスターター且つチームプレーヤーであること。

：臨機応変で柔軟な思考と姿勢。

：タイムマネジメント、プライオリティをつけて業務が遂行できること。

**歓迎マインド**

：顧客志向、結果志向 変化、成長を楽しむマインド

**必須スキル・経験**

：日本語：堪能（お客様と日本語で商談ができること、資料を日本語で作成できること）

：英語：上級以上（トムソン・ロイターグローバルチームに対して説明・交渉ができること）

：最低３年以上のオンライン製品、情報コンテンツ等の営業、カスタマーサクセス、あるいはコンサルタント経験。  
：４年生大学卒もしくは同等以上の学位の取得。（法律学位または法曹・法務への従事・勤務経験があれば尚可）  
：PC (Windows)及び MS Office製品(Teams, Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point)の使用・操作に支障が無いこと。

**歓迎スキル・経験：**

：SaaSビジネスでのカスタマーサクセス業務経験。  
：CRM/SFAの使用経験。（Salesforce.comの使用経験があれば尚可）
