title: Strategic Sales Executive, Tax & Accounting - Large
description:
Are you looking for the next challenge on your sales journey, and have what it takes to sell into the largest accounts in the **Tax & Accounting Professional** space? 

 

Primarily focused on new logo sales, with a secondary focus on driving expansion in existing accounts (upsell/cross-sell). May have a renewal quota as well. Covers the most complex deals, primarily those which are ‘omni first’. Travel as required.  

 

**In this opportunity** as Strategic Sales Executive, you will:  

 

* Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel.
* Prospect new customers and close sales for an assigned geography.
* Validates customer needs, shapes product plans and drives deals to close
* Supports in developing and executing territory growth strategies.
* Focuses on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals.
* Possesses core knowledge across products within the subsegment, and engages Sales Specialists where deep product expertise is required to drive to close.
* Understands specific customer archetypes and needs which are most prevalent within the subsegment and territory.
* Uses an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals. Including: New logo sales  and Existing ‘non-named’ account incremental sales

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of Strategic Sales Executive if your background includes: 

 

* 3+ Years in selling the CS Professional Suite
* 3+ Years selling Checkpoint Tax & Audit Research
* 5+ Year of selling experience
* Experience in organizing and running Quarterly Business Reviews with customers
* Record of achieving and exceeding quota for multiple years

**What’s in it For You?** 

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

               

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: Réviseuse / Réviseur
description:
**Division :** Éditions Yvon Blais

**Lieu :** 1010 rue Ste-Catherine ouest, Montréal - Travail hybride, possibilité de travail de la maison

**À propos du poste**

Dans le cadre de cette opportunité en tant que Réviseur, vous allez être responsable d’effectuer la révision de textes de doctrine juridique et de législation.et devrez notamment:

* Apporter ou recommander des modifications au contenu, au style et à la structure des textes.
* Lire et réviser le contenu pour repérer les fautes d'orthographe, de grammaire et de syntaxe.

**À propos de vous**

Compétences et expérience: 

* Un diplôme universitaire en droit (baccalauréat ou certificat), un diplôme d'études collégiales en techniques juridiques ou une expérience équivalente
* Une excellente maîtrise de la langue française, tant à l’égard de la révision de base (orthographe, grammaire, conjugaison et syntaxe) que d’une révision plus approfondie comme la ponctuation et les reformulations
* Une connaissance d’Office 365
* La connaissance de l’anglais est un atout, pour interagir avec une partie de l’équipe en Ontario et ailleurs dans le monde

**Quels sont les avantages pour vous ?**

Vous rejoindrez notre culture inclusive de talent de classe mondiale, où nous nous engageons à votre croissance personnelle et professionnelle à travers :

- **Un modèle de travail hybride** : Actuellement, la majorité de nos employés travaillent dans un environnement hybride comprenant du travail sur place et à distance, et suivant les règlements et les directives locales de COVID-19.

- **Une culture** : Une réputation mondialement reconnue et primée pour l'égalité, la diversité et l'inclusion, la flexibilité, l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, et plus encore.

- **Bien-être** : Régimes d'avantages sociaux complets ; avantages flexibles et favorables à l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée : journée de congé pour la santé mentale dans l'entreprise ; abonnement à l'application Headspace ; retraite, épargne, remboursement des frais de scolarité et programmes d'incitation des employés; ressources pour le bien-être mental, physique et financier.

- **Formation et développement :** Accès à LinkedIn Learning ; marché interne des talents avec des possibilités de travailler sur des projets inter-groupes.

- **Impact social :** Huit groupes de ressources d'entreprise dirigés par des employés; deux jours de bénévolat payés par an; initiatives environnementales, sociales et de gouvernance (ESG) pour un impact local et mondial.

- **Travail axé sur les objectifs :** Nous avons un super pouvoir dont nous n'avons jamais parlé avec autant de fierté que nous le devrions : nous sommes l'une des seules entreprises de la planète à aider ses clients à rechercher la justice, la vérité et la transparence. Avec les professionnels et les institutions que nous servons, nous contribuons à faire respecter l'état de droit, à faire tourner les roues du commerce, à attraper les mauvais acteurs, à rapporter les faits et à fournir des informations fiables et impartiales aux personnes du monde entier.

title: Senior Sales Executive, Tax & Accounting
description:
**What You Will Do:**

In this opportunity as a **Senior Sales Executive**, you will:

* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You:**

You may be a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Minimum 5 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:             

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Programa de Estágio Thomson Reuters (Vagas Afirmativas para Pessoas Negras)
description:
A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

O nosso Programa de Estágio é aberto para estudantes de diversas áreas e é a escolha ideal para quem deseja dar o primeiro passo no caminho de uma carreira de sucesso. Buscamos talentos curiosos e dispostos a aprender.

A Thomson Reuters possibilita a oportunidade de ser agente de transformação, tanto dentro da companhia quanto em ações de voluntariado para ONGs. Desde o início da sua jornada você terá autonomia nas suas entregas para poder fazer a diferença. Aqui suas ideias são valorizadas e você poderá colocar em prática seus conhecimentos e aprender com a sua equipe para se tornar o profissional que você deseja ser.

Temos também um plano de desenvolvimento pensado para você. Temos de maneira recorrente workshops de desenvolvimento, nos quais você terá contato com executivos da companhia, se conectando com os demais estagiários e desenvolvendo conhecimentos sobre o mundo corporativo. Tudo isso faz parte de uma jornada gamificada onde, quanto mais participativa cada pessoa é, mais pontos soma para si e para sua equipe, pontos estes que podem ser trocados por uma série de prêmios. Na Thomson Reuters, o engajamento, a curiosidade e o aprendizado são recompensados!

Se você deseja atuar em um ambiente dinâmico e com muito aprendizado, o nosso programa é a melhor escolha para você.

O processo seletivo será feito em parceria com a consultoria Bettha e para participar você deve se inscrever no site -bettha.com/estagiothomsonreuters2023

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo.  
Headspace; reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro.
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso gratuito ao Linkedin Learning com +16.000 cursos; acesso à ferramenta de mentoria da companhia; possibilidade de trabalhar em projetos internacionais; participação na TR League, comunidade de estagiários voltada ao desenvolvimento de habilidades.
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos:** Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

title: Core Publishing Solutions Manufacturing and/or Distribution Interns – Summer 2023
description:
Are you looking for an internship that provides real-world-project experience, networking with employees and executives worldwide, while growing your talents on a supportive and inclusive team? If so, we want to connect with you! 

At Thomson Reuters Core Publishing Solutions, we provide quality book printing and distribution services for our clients throughout Minnesota, the United States and around the world. With a range of printing, warehousing, and fulfillment services to offer, we provide clients with timely, cost-effective solutions to their printing and distribution needs.

Our 1.3 million square foot manufacturing facility in Eagan, Minnesota, is one of the largest printing, warehousing, and fulfillment facilities in the United States. We have a strong history of creating quality products for businesses within Thomson Reuters and for external customers around the globe.

We are looking for Manufacturing and/or Distribution Interns for Summer 2023 on the Core Publishing Solutions team supporting various departments, i.e., Press/Prepress/Digital Print, Bindery, Subscription Services, and Distribution. This is a hands-on, **in-person** intern opportunity in our **MSP campus in Minnesota.**

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a Manufacturing Operations Intern, you will: 

* Contribute to the manufacturing & distribution organization in optimizing business processes through continuous improvement in the areas of Safety, Quality, Talent Development, Productivity & Cost Control.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of a Core Publishing Solutions Intern if you:

* Are a 3rd or 4th year student in the following degree programs:
* Operations Management
* Graphic Communications Management or related program
* Manufacturing Engineering
* Industrial Engineering
* Supply Chain Management
* Logistics
* Business (operations focus)
* Have proven oral and written communication skills
* Exhibit strong analytical and quantitative skills
* Planning and project management skills
* Ability to take direction on projects and work both autonomously and with a team
* Ability to adapt well to change in a fast-paced environment
* Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint) and MS Teams
* Previous internship experience a plus

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. We offer an enriched internship program that focuses on developing the next generation of talent.  Bringing your whole self to work is at our core. Here’s how we support your growth:

* **Campus Culture:**WayUp’s [Top 100 Internship Programs](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nationalinternday.com%2Ftop100-2021&data=04%7C01%7CKaleigh.Peters%40thomsonreuters.com%7Cd09c0c3c2729464a513208d977cb330e%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637672536878100986%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=c2MUvQNOdq8cYMVBf%2F1q9ijLdNRHnf5PXTKWxZoZNDA%3D&reserved=0) for 2021, intern-focused events, weekly social hours, a dedicated intern appreciation day, Fireside Chats, partnerships with [Business Resource Groups](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/careers/careers-blog/thomson-reuters-employee-networks.html), & recognized company culture [awarded for our diversity and inclusion](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/awards-recognition.html)
* **Learning & Development:**Project-based internship related to your degree, networking with colleagues and executive leaders across the globe, intern alumni panels, Executive Speaker Series, Thomson Reuters University and LinkedIn Learning skills academies, mentorship from managers and teams.
* **Compensation:**Competitively paid internships, full-time hours Monday to Friday, with company-designated holidays
* **Social Impact:** Intern volunteer days, local volunteer events impacting your community
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**Learn more at:**  [**https://corepublishingsolutions.com**](https://corepublishingsolutions.com)    
or [**https://thomsonreuters.com**](https://thomsonreuters.com)

title: Project Manager
description:
**Project Manager**
-------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join our team to define, scope, and manage one or more projects of medium size/complexity and will work with senior project and other management to ensure technical and/or business objectives are achieved.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Project Manager**, you will:

* Be the interface of TR to the clients and manage the client’s expectations during the project execution stage.
* Manages one or more projects related to critical business goals for the global business partners
* Develops and tracks detailed project plans, including scope, schedules, resource plans, communication plans, risk mitigation plans, and issue resolution plans
* Manage the financial aspects of the project to ensure a profit
* Tracks and resolves issues across multiple TR and client work streams involved in the project.
* Proactively identifies and provides mitigation plans for any potential risks to the project’s overall success.
* Develops a professional rapport with the internal and client project teams that interfaces with client and maintain an excellent level of client satisfaction.
* Reports the status of the projects using TR-selected tools to present the appropriate level of detail based on the target audience.
* May act as primary interface with the client regarding deliverables, change requests, and sign-off on status and requirements.
* Keeps healthy governance and successful project metrics and reports to the company
* Keeps the project’s revenue forecast and revenue realization according to the revenue plan

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor’s degree.
* Fluent English is a Must.
* +5 years of Project Management experience in customer on-site implementations.
* Strong organization, interpersonal, & communication skills.
* Proven ability to engage a wide range of stakeholders in a matrix organization.
* Excellent analytical problem-solving skills.
* Experience in Software Development Life Cycle(s), Agile development experience is a plus
* Proactive personality and proven leadership skills.
* Experience in partnering with internal & external stakeholders
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Basic knowledge of Direct and Indirect Tax concepts and processes (desirable)

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-YS2

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Corporate Events Planner - Greater Houston area
description:
ThoughtTrace, part of Thomson Reuters, empowers legal teams and business users to turn their documents and contracts into decision-driving insights. As a **Campaign Management Marketer**, you will play a critical role in delighting customers and supercharging ThoughtTrace’s awareness in the various markets we serve. We host a variety of events, so we’re looking for people who thrive in a dynamic environment and can jump from planning the best tradeshow booth experience to leveraging the latest technology to host online user groups!

**Note:** candidates must be based near **Greater Houston** (Houston–The Woodlands–Sugar Land) to be able to support events in that area. 

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Campaign Management Marketer**, you will: 

* Define an event marketing strategy (from tradeshows to customer-conferences to digital and beyond) aligned with marketing goals – lead generation, awareness, pipeline acceleration, customer advocacy
* Run integrated Event Campaign for each show incorporating sales enablement, pre-conference communications, digital marketing, lead capture best practices onsite, and post-event data capture and reporting.
* Maintain budgets, calendars, checklists, run-of-shows required to plan and execute multiple regional and national events through the calendar year
* Ensure marketing and event briefs are shared with key stakeholders
* Refine the ThoughtTrace Event Marketing playbook
* Work cross-functionally with sales, marketing, human resources, community, and customer success teams to ensure event needs and plans come to fruition within budget
* Develop and execute on new and creative event activation ideas at tradeshows, user-groups, digital events, and beyond.
* Coordinate closely with sales leadership and regional teams to identify key accounts and audience segments for invitations
* Work with cross-functional teams to project manage all elements of regional programs including customer-facing events and digital marketing activities
* Responsible for tracking and managing project plans and budgets for specific events and activities
* Sources and manage third party vendors and partners

**About You**

You could be a fit for the **Campaign Management Marketer** if your background includes:

* 3+ years of marketing campaign and event planning, coordination, and execution
* Bachelor’s degree (in marketing preferred) or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated success managing tradeshows, hotels, and vendors – this is a “hands-on” role
* Out-of-this-world project management skills with the ability to multi-task and complete projects flawlessly under time-sensitive deadlines
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
* Highly motivated, self-starting nature; respond positively to moderate guidance yet capable of and comfortable with independent critical thinking and problem-solving
* Agility is key – Adapt well to a quickly changing environment!
* Stellar interpersonal skills and ability to work and communicate with a wide array of people
* A passion for executing amazing in-person experiences, and a data-driven mindset to see the fruits of your efforts!
* Ability to manage several projects simultaneously
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Detail-oriented
* Available for **business travel - approx. 20 to 25%**

**What’s in it For You?**

* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.

Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Video Producer, Mexico
description:
**Video Producer, Mexico**

Are you an enthusiastic and globally-minded video producer with experience in video editing, translation, and journalism? Do you want to be part of our newsroom in Mexico City? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join our team and work closely with our global video teams in the UK, US, and Singapore, delivering unbiased, real-time news coverage to more than 1,000 broadcasters and hundreds of digital outlets around the world. We have a dynamic newsroom including pictures, text, data, and graphics journalists who collaborate to produce a compelling professional news product unavailable anywhere else. We are the first to know the news.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Video Producer**, you will:

* Work as part of our video team ensuring our scripts are fast, accurate, and unbiased.
* Have a keen eye for visual storytelling and the ability to produce compelling video within tight deadlines.
* Pitch fascinating story ideas that work for both broadcast and digital platforms.
* Work as part of a global team covering events starting from the planning phase through to production work.
* Action client queries quickly and efficiently.
* Keep our clients updated with latest developments on breaking and developing stories.
* Work as a team with pictures, text, video and on-line colleagues to ensure integrated multimedia news coverage and production

**About You:**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Excellent English, written and oral -- fluency in any other languages a plus.
* A love for all forms of journalism and an obsessive-level interest in current affairs
* 3 to 5 years of professional journalism experience – bonus points if in broadcast, digital, or agency video.
* Excellent news judgment and a passion for breaking news.
* Amazing video editing and script writing skills.
* Unflappable interpersonal and organizational skills even when under pressure.
* A desire to work with colleagues dedicated to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias.

This is a full-time, desk-based role, that requires flexibility. You must be willing to work as part of a global 24/7 rotating shift system, including weekends and public holidays, with occasional night shifts.

**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-JA1**

title: Process Improvement Manager (Sales Channel Focus)
description:
This role contributes to the financial performance, operating efficiency, and customer satisfaction by implementing or operationalizing the Company's strategic business plans. As the Process Improvement Managers (Sales), you will drive both the creation of standardized sales processes and improvement of existing channel processes within the Small Law business.  You will on focus the processes and activities of quota carrying sales reps. 

Potential projects include:

* Identifying ways to shift repetitive work from sales team to lower cost resources
* Standardizing hand-offs between channel teams: appointment setting reps, sales team, client managers, etc.
* Alignment of pipeline management processes, implementation of training program and tracking compliance

We will measure success through:

* Financial success and sales growth
* Reduced employee attrition and burnout
* More efficient and simplified processes

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Process Improvement Manager, you will:

* Document system and process details including collection of data about current procedures, outputs and metrics to develop a baseline and measure improvements.
* Identify issues, root causes and drivers of “waste” within sales processes
* Model potential outcomes including cost and benefits for different improvement options and prepare business case for approval
* Perform in-depth analysis and provide recommendations into key performance metrics and goals.
* Develop implementation plans for approved recommendations
* Track and measure progress to determine how well a new system works, then use that information to make changes over time.
* Contribute to the business's strategic planning process. Plans may require operations involvement in the development of new products; pursuit of new business opportunities; execution of product launches; coordination of marketing and sales campaigns, design of sales training and compensation plans, alignment of sales channels, establishment of customer service and support models, and more.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Process Improvement Manager if your background includes:

* Bachelor degree in finance, engineering or analytic domain
* 4+ years of experience in process improvement oriented roles which potentially could include management consulting or sales operations
* Track record of leading multiple successful process improvement projects moving through the full cycle from identification, measurement, improvement and tracking
* Experience driving process improvements within large sales channel operations. Certification within at least one of the following: Six Sigma, Lean, or TQM, preferred
* Must be an action-oriented individual and able to work independently
* Proven analytical and quantitative skills
* Strong intellectual curiosity and problem-solving aptitude
* Ability to deal with ambiguity, manage multiple projects, succeed in a fast paced, changing environment and meet deadlines
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience
* Experience working in large matrixed organized

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

             

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: VP, Finance Systems
description:
* This includes the development, design, and optimization of information technology and systems functions supporting enterprise finance processes and Finance technical information systems platforms
* The VP of Financial Systems is a technical and business leader that can demonstrate an ability to build relationships with the different business units across the organization and will thoroughly understand the business needs and opportunities required to achieve business goals in alignment with corporate goals and priorities
* The selected candidate is responsible for the continuous improvements and the evolution of TR finance IT systems with a multi-year vision, strategy, and scope
* Demonstrate solid experience building teams capable of developing detailed requirements for the implementation of new financial systems
* Establish current state and target state architecture
* Establish product governance and management for Finance technology platforms
* Establish and manage trust based relationships with Finance and IT business partners
* Establish and manage trust based relationships with strategic vendor partners.
* Ability to lead teams in the development and execution of plans to build, integrate or implement systems solutions to meet business needs as defined in the requirements of the business units
* Ensure that all projects follow existing or evolving infrastructure architecture standards, maximize systems and operational efficiencies, protect data, and support platform compatibility
* Define processes related to the evaluation and selection process of third-party systems/applications including the development and writing of RFIs, RFPs, and RFQs as well as the evaluation process through demonstrations, POCs, pilots, and/or cook-outs
* Coordinate delivery of services to user groups and ensure IT service is uninterrupted
* Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the functions required to deliver and maintain internal systems
* Ensures the security of all internal systems including among S4 Hana and all integrated systems
* Manages the development, deployment, and execution of controls and defenses to ensure the security and risk mitigation of company infrastructure technology, and information systems
* Identify cybersecurity architecture, goals, objectives, and metrics
* Defines business needs and priorities for the protection of critical systems
* Ensure necessary monitoring and alerting systems are in place to ensure continuous operation
* Development and implementation of cloud-based disaster recovery and business continuity plans for all Finance IT systems

title: Tax Research, Lead Business Analyst
description:
Working as part of Thomson Reuters’ Corporates business, you will be part of the Product Content team developing and maintaining global tax compliance modules on our ONESOURCE tax platform.

While your work is primarily with the local Gdańsk team, you will work closely with the wider global product and content teams. Gdańsk team will form part of our Global Tax Compliance and Statutory Reporting team, based in the UK,  India, Asia, Australia, currently supporting compliance in over 50 countries across Corporate tax, Indirect tax and Statutory Accounting.

ONESOURCE is designed to provide tax software solutions for multinational corporations and Accounting professionals. ONESOURCE solutions cover a broad range of taxes including Direct Tax Compliance and reporting (formerly Abacus), Indirect Tax Compliance, Tax Planning and Workflow Management.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Tax Research, Lead Business Analyst, you will:

* Research tax requirements for new and existing jurisdictions/features: review tax documentation, tax authority websites and other source documents to create clear and succinct change requirement specifications for the tax content development team to follow
* Write test case scenarios that are comprehensive and easy to follow with expected outcomes, supporting change requirement specifications, enabling the software changes to be fully tested and validated
* Monitor the local tax regimes for upcoming changes and developments that may impact the software
* Test new developments in the platform ensuring they meet the local content business requirements
* Work with external tax content providers and revenue authorities to ensure all products meet current legislative requirements
* Work with the country leads on establishing scope and planning releases and updates
* Work with content design experts where necessary, to ensure the software is designed correctly to deliver the tax functionality required for each country content set
* Work with other Content teams in different geographic locations, including country leads, content designers, support, product management, client services and quality assurance. Providing tax assistance on support, training and client queries and opportunities
* Provide 3rd line support, escalated from the ONESOURCE product support teams and Professional Services
* Monitor and assisting the QA team with the execution of test plans when required, ensuring the process aligns to requirements from a tax perspective

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Tax Research, Lead Business Analyst if your background includes:

* Experienced tax professional of 5 years (and around 1 year supervisory experience would be a bonus) with practical experience in tax compliance and / or advisory, ideally across more than one country
* Exposure to tax compliance in one of the following countries would provide a distinct advantage: UK, Ireland, The Netherlands
* Good understand and experience of creating and reviewing tax accounting calculations and reconciliations
* Strong tax research skills, ideally with experience of reviewing a wide variety of complex tax returns
* Fluent English, knowledge of other languages would be an advantage
* Interested in technology with a demonstrable knowledge of software systems, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
* Organized and methodical approach to work, especially attention to detail, adept at all aspects of technical communications, including using presentations technologies (e.g. WebEx, PowerPoint) and software demonstrations
* Good communication skills, team-player
* The ability to work virtually with people in different locations including London, India, Australia
* Professional Tax or Accountancy qualification

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Visuals Journalist, Milan - Reuters
description:
Reuters News & Media is looking for a dynamic and talented Visuals Journalist to join our Italy team based in Milan. You will be a talented photojournalist with proven ability to shoot and edit video. We are looking for a team player and a self-starter with plenty of initiative to generate story ideas and inject a creative approach to storytelling. You will have a good understanding of the news agenda in Italy  – from politics and religion to sport and entertainment, to culture and new business.

You will have excellent communication skills, an unflappable temperament, and a passion for newsgathering and visual storytelling. An ability to network and develop relationships with officials and important contacts that will result in access and fair treatment is crucial.

The scope of the role ranges from the delivery of the fastest, differentiated images of breaking news and events in the most competitive circumstances, to the creation of structured pictures or multimedia stories, either as an individual or as part of a wider regional or global team.

A commitment to preserving the Thomson Reuters Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias is essential.

**As our trusted Visuals Journalist, you will:**

* React fast to breaking news, including an ability to provide live video coverage, and a willingness to travel on assignments, sometimes at short notice
* Be proactive in identifying, pitching and producing in-depth stories around the news, through pictures and video, with an awareness of trends in and requirements of digital audiences
* Produce top quality coverage in Italy, working in close collaboration with Reuters photo and video staff as well as editors on the Global Pictures Desk, to contribute highly competitive pictures and video to the Reuters News wire for global subscribers
* Be responsible for coverage of planned events, sports and news,  and maintain and update the client-facing news diary
* Coordinate assignments with multimedia teams
* Ensure safety newsgathering protocols are followed

**To be our Visuals Journalist, you will likely have:**

* A proven track record of winning the big stories
* Excellent photojournalism and editing skills proven by at last 5 years work experience as a full-time photojournalist
* Experience in sports photography
* A sharp eye for visual elements that are needed to make a good pictures and video story
* Basic knowledge of shooting and editing video material
* An understanding of wire service clients and market needs both domestically and internationally
* Excellent news judgment as well as a good knowledge of Italian politics and government
* The ability to tell stories through multimedia, producing picture/video packages and picture stories as well as capturing individual defining moments
* A thorough understanding of the latest digital visual technologies for photographing, filming, editing, transmitting, and sharing
* A unique "eye" able to compose interesting pictures on the fly and produce a well-rounded report of pictures during fast changing news events
* Experience and ability to compete at the highest level working under high pressure against tight deadlines, transmitting photos on the run via wifi, cellular modems and satellite phones
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in team environments
* Ability to write clear, error-free captions and video scripts
* Basic experience with flying drones is also preferred (but not essential)
* Italian language skills are preferred (but not essential)

**NB**: To be considered for this opportunity please ensure that you submit **BOTH** a CV and Cover Letter. Your Cover Letter should be addressed to “Whom It May Concern” and should detail your motivations for applying to the role.  

**Please note, the deadline for applications is Friday 13th January 2023.**

**What’s in it For You?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career:** As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcare
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news and sports news to professionals via the world's media organizations, desktop terminals, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Sports Correspondent
description:
Reuters is seeking a **Correspondent** for its **Bangalore Sports Desk.**

The sports team in Bangalore is an integral part of the global Reuters sports file and delivers breaking news across geographies with the accuracy, speed, context and freedom from bias our clients expect.

The ideal candidate is an excellent storyteller, writer and reporter with sound news judgment and the ability to multi-task. A familiarity with North American sports and prior editing experience are advantages, though not prerequisites.

You should be someone who is comfortable working in a diverse team and flitting between sporting disciplines. You could be asked to write stories on anything from soccer and golf to basketball and the Olympics on a given day. The team is often the first point of contact for breaking sports news, so a calm head, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with colleagues who are spread across the world are all essential.

**Responsibilities:**

* Monitoring of U.S. and other global sports events, news sources, websites and media outlets
* Reporting and writing stories for the Reuters global newswire
* You will report across the sports file and should be a strong writer with a broad interest in sports and a passion for delivering news fast. The ability to write lucid, engaging copy is essential
* You will work daily with colleagues in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Africa to write and report out stories and set the news agenda each day
* You will also be expected to jump fast on hints of breaking news and build a file of initiative stories
* The Sports team in Bangalore runs seven days a week. Team members are entitled to two days off per week and the job will often involve late nights and/or early starts
* The willingness to work across different shifts is vital. Shifts can change at short notice for extended periods to focus coverage on sporting events around the globe

If you are interested, please email a copy of your résumé and a brief covering letter to hiring manager Simon Jennings before Feb. 28.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Senior Software Developer - Product Engineer
description:
Senior Software Developer

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your technical experience to drive our Engineering team using industry best practices in a world-class company? We are hiring **100+ Software Engineers including Senior Software Engineers** with various experience levels for our Shared Service Center in Mexico City. We are expanding our global Shared Service Centers footprint by establishing a new Shared Service Center in Mexico City to serve the Americas (North America and LatAm) with roles representing product, technology, sales operations, inside sales, customer service and finance. This new Shared Service Center will build on the existing established Centers in Asia (India and The Philippines), Europe (Poland) and Americas (Costa Rica). 

As a **Senior Software Developer at Thomson Reuters**, you will be responsible for continually looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, performance and availability, while ensuring solutions developed, adhere and align to architectural standards. You will be responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values. You’ll be able to deliver innovative solutions that impact our customers business every day and partner with teammates globally to [develop innovative solutions](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/artificial-intelligence/thomson-reuters-brings-the-human-touch-to-artificial-intelligence.html?trkcode=hero&trktype=internal) for the best products in the market. We are committed to the growth of our Engineering teams and want people who are just as excited by this as we are to join us a **Senior Software Developer**! 

* **About the Role**
* Writes new software, makes modifications to existing software, or integrates software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications, created in partnership with others
* Creates and executes unit testing and integration testing ensuring software meets requirements.
* Contributes to the creation of design. May lead the design of less complex components.
* May provide technical support to operations or other development teams.
* Creates, reviews, and maintains all required technical documentation/ manual related to assigned software to ensure supportability and reuse.
* Reviews work of peers and more junior developers.
* Provides wider feedback into performance
* Assists in identification and implementation of short-term and long-term solution options, including risk assessments.
* Assists with improvements to prevent problems, including problem resolution workflow.
* Participates in remediation solutions.
* Participates in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
* Provides work breakdown and estimates for small software development tasks.
* Provides timely status updates for areas of individual responsibilities within projects to supervisor
* Actively participates in team and status meetings.
* Demonstrates software as requested
* Develops software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.

* **Technical Skill**
* Experience in working with enterprise level applications
* Tech stack being c# .
* Angular
* .Net core
* Azure Cloud

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
   
 

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
**About the Role**

The **Associate Sales Executive** in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Small-Mid client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 1-30 professionals.

The **Associate Sales Executive** position is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.

  
The successful **Associate Sales Executive**: 

* Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.
* Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.
* Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.

Note: This is an inside sales \*hybrid role (\*mix of working 2 days 'in-office' and 3 days from home/remote each week) that can be based in any of these corporate Hub office locations: Ann Arbor, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Dallas/Carrollton.

**What You Will Do:**

In this opportunity as a **Associate** **Sales Executive**, you will:

* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Client Executive and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You:**

You may be a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Minimum 3 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:             

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

#LI-D2E

title: Sr. Manager, Small Law Revenue Management
description:
The Sr. Manager, Revenue Management, Small Law Firms is charged with growing the Small Law sub-segment through strategic customer retention initiatives, ongoing customer experience improvement, and management of policies that support revenue retention. The successful candidate will bring strong analytical experience, customer/market knowledge, and passion for customer experience to bear in this highly visible role reporting to the Director, Revenue Management.

​

**KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:**

* **Support strategic customer retention initiatives** that are differentiated by service levels, i.e., High Value Accounts (HVAs) through to very small spend clients and in partnership with Digital Transformation lead
* **Facilitate data driven activities** to further drive sales and revenue generating opportunities
* **Ensure we are maximizing key proposition growth** through quarterly review of financial and operating measures and a bias toward action (“interlocks”)
* **Support a step-change in Small Law NPS** through ongoing involvement in customer experience improvement projects and by leveraging NPS data in partnership with the CX team

**EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:**

* 4+ years of finance, customer retention, corporate/business strategy, or similar experience
* MBA preferred
* Analytical mindset, using data to inform improvement opportunities
* Demonstrated understanding of Net Promoter Score (NPS) insights and how they can be applied to improve customer experience and revenue retention
* Self-starter, with the ability to build and prioritize a pipeline of work
* Proven ability to drive multiple complex initiatives simultaneously and at pace
* Clear evidence of ability to influence in a matrixed environment.
* Outstanding verbal and written presentation skills

**What’s in it For You?**

title: Sales Executive, Tax & Accounting - Large Firms
description:
Our team is responsible for helping both new and existing customers make informed business decisions to better manage the ever-changing business ecosystem through our highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for Tax & Accounting professionals. Our software products drive productivity, data, content and research capabilities through world-class AI and machine learning. We measure our success by achieving new sales and retention targets as well as achieving high customer and employee satisfaction scores.

If you want to be a part of a high performing sales organization and have an immediate impact, apply today!

The **Sales Executive** in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Large client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. The SE has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry. He/she will tailor the client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Sales Executive**, you will:

* Consult with customers to understand their needs, growth goals and partner with them to identify opportunities to meet/exceed customer needs and provide the right solutions to address those needs, improve operations and grow revenue.
* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Minimum 5 years' successful sales experience
* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Ability to sell Ultratax new, and cross sell/upsell to current client base
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics
* Willingness to travel

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Inside Sales - Account Manager
description:
*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Inside Sales em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como *Inside Sales*, você irá:

* Prospectar novos clientes e fechar vendas para uma região e/ou para leads designados
* Validar as necessidades dos clientes, moldar planos de produtos e conduzir negócios para conclusão da venda.
* Apoio no desenvolvimento e execução de estratégias de crescimento do território.
* Foco na aquisição de novas marcas e oportunidades de vendas cruzadas
* Usar um fluxo de trabalho automatizado e orientado por insight para progredir nos negócios.
* Estimular oportunidades e auxiliar no ciclo de vendas mais complexas

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Graduação completa.
* Experiência com vendas (Hunter e Farmer)
* Desejável experiência no segmento ou produto fiscal
* Disponibilidade para trabalhar híbrido em SP Capital (Escritório Vila Olimpia)

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: Order Management Specialist
description:
* **Responsible for the implementation of the entire order to billing process and for providing ongoing order management support for sales and clients.**
* Aligned to a designated client base and is accountable for building relationships with internal and external customers, playing a key role in improving service results.
* Confirms all client orders are correct for sales and financial reporting and is accountable for adhering to SOX compliance controls and 3rd party guidelines.
* Manage the entire end to end order life cycle, including order preparation, order monitoring, permissioning and billing/credits/cancellations for new and renewal orders.
* Obtain information required to process orders (user data, product reference details, installation details, exchange requests, billing dates, sales codes, billing account contacts).
* Ensure appropriate technical and commercial approvals are in place.
* Provide research and support for billing disputes, ensuring issues are resolved according to departmental guidelines (which may include Service Level Agreements).
* Ensure any off-line pricing calculators and/or product-specific checklists are completed.
* Verify equipments needs, communication requirements and general client needs, making sure to provide time-frames and set client expectations accordingly.
* Manage backorders with internal partners, escalating all delays where interaction is required.
* Make sure forecasted install and billing effective dates are accurately uploaded into tracking tool (based on local tools).
* Implement release of billing for all services and charges.
* Maintain accurate client site billing & location details, and contact/user records on internal systems.
* Reconcile out of date Opportunities to orders.
* Provide timely support and resolution regarding Data and Compliance issues.
* Process order adjustments, applying appropriate commercial policies and guidelines.
* Establish key client and sales relationships in order to facilitate improved administration and customer satisfaction.
* Assist in annual renewals processing, including analyzing pricing, reviewing amendments and invoicing.
* Manage and resolve external & internal queries relating to quote/order status, billing, client account information/permissioning, and compliance issues.
* Lead ad hoc initiatives with relevant groups, ensuring customer requests are successfully implemented.
* Complete UAT testing and regression testing.
* Spot trends and make recommendations for enhancing systems and procedures.
* May review Free Trial expiration notices with account teams.

**Experience : 3+ years**

**Shift timing : 4pm to 1am**

title: Multimedia News Producer
description:
**DESCRIPTION:**

We are looking for a multimedia journalist to join the 24X7 digital operations of Reuters, which operates one of world's largest and most credible news websites and an online business serving a variety of digital clients worldwide. The successful candidate must have clear-sighted news judgment to arrange, select and package from the hundreds of news stories hitting the wires every hour. The multimedia news producer will work closely with Reuters' main editorial services in deciding what the top stories will be on every topic from politics and policy, business, markets, sport, entertainment and lifestyle. At Thomson Reuters, we deliver intelligent information quickly and efficiently, so professionals have knowledge to act. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the financial, legal, tax and accounting, scientific, healthcare, and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization. 

Location: Bangalore

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
The multimedia news producer will be part of the tight-knit team manning the Global Online desk in Bangalore, sub-editing/localising and filing stories with relevant pictures for the Reuters Online Reports (OLR) and the revamped [reuters.com](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Freuters.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7CRavi.Lakhwani%40thomsonreuters.com%7Cbe6cf48c2d2347688cfd08d91b59afc0%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637570894271425261%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5X4%2BVUZPktuH%2FX4z1nD4Deylm9HMWnSq9CDJ0w%2Fjjbg%3D&reserved=0) website. The producer should have a keen eye for detail and keep our target sophisticated news consumer business audience in mind while ensuring the website is updated with the latest and best stories, photos, slideshows and videos curated from the Reuters wires, photo and video service.

   
**QUALIFICATIONS:**  
Degree in Journalism/Mass Communication from a reputed university/institute.

  
**REQUIRED SKILLS:**

* At least three-year experience in a news agency, newspaper or TV newsroom
* Impeccable writing
* Strong news judgement
* Knowledge of economy, policy, markets, technology, sports and entertainment
* Multimedia experience

**DESIRED SKILLS**

* High level of creativity, providing excellent packaging ideas for the web and thinking beyond the obvious
* Strong team player, good communication skills
* Fast and accurate editing and packaging for the web
* Good at using editorial technology
* Solid understanding of legal risks and strong ethics

 **APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:**

* Send a cover letter explaining why you believe you are qualified for this position
* Include a CV

 The Global Online Desk in Bangalore is a 24X7 operation and the team members work on 8-hr shifts that go round the clock. Night duties fall on rotation, once every 5-7 weeks.

title: Store Seller - Global Print
description:
Store Seller para ***Thomson Reuters Argentina***

***¡Sumate a nuestro equipo de Print LatAm!***

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de profesionales con *ambición, motivación y experiencia* interesados en desarrollarse en el rol de Store Seller del área Print LATAM. 

Esta posición se caracteriza por un marcado perfil comercial, de oratoria y empatía enfocado en el cliente. El rol estará caracterizado por la atención al público en las librerías oficiales de Thomson Reuters La Ley, ubicadas en microcentro/recoleta, y la venta consultiva telefónicas.

* Realizar venta consultiva de nuestros productos, tanto de forma telefónica y presencial
* Prospección y generación de nuevos negocios
* Gestión comercial con foco en segmentos profesionales
* Capacidad para atender y desarrollar clientes estratégicos
* Orientación y foco en resultados

Si te apasionan las ventas, la tecnología y el marketing digital esta es tu oportunidad de un nuevo desafío en una compañía Tech en pleno crecimiento. Aportar conocimiento e ideas, ser parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento y crecer profesionalmente junto a personas que aman lo que hacen.

**Requisitos:**

* Estudiantes o graduados de carreras universitarias (preferentemente administraciones/sociales)
* Tener mínimo 2 años de experiencia en el área comercial/ventas/Retail y/o telefónica
* Manejo de CRM (Preferentemente Salesforce)

***¿Qué te ofrecemos?***

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad)  
🏥 Pre paga para vos y tu grupo familiar primario  
💰 Subsidio internet mensual  
🚀 Flex my way (trabajá desde donde quieras dentro del pais – 8 semanas al año)  
🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)  
🎁 Day off cumpleaños  
🍴 Servicio de vending in office  
🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)  
⌨ Allowance Home Office (one time) – compra de equipamiento  
🌅 Viernes flex de verano  
💻 Equipamiento de trabajo

En **Thomson Reuters** nuestra misión es crear un lugar de trabajo seguro e inclusivo al tiempo que nos mantenemos alineados con los objetivos de la organización.

***Escuchamos y celebramos lo que es común y diferente, convirtiéndonos en una empresa más sabia e inclusiva. La diversidad de pensamiento y participación equitativa fortalece nuestra capacidad innovadora, libera el potencial de los colaboradores y contribuye directamente con nuestro éxito comercial.***

Te propones ser parte de una compañía multinacional totalmente comprometida en el respeto y cuidado de sus colaboradores

Ser protagonista de tu desarrollo en un ambiente de aprendizaje, oportunidades y proyectos desafiantes.

Formar parte de un equipo de excelentes profesionales, quienes serán tu guía y apoyo en todo desarrollo.

Herramientas y recursos adecuados a tu disposición para identificar, priorizar y cerrar oportunidades.

Gran clima laboral, de super importancia para tu formación y para que disfrutes la experiencia.
