title: Software Engineer Internship – Summer 2023
description:
**Software Engineer Internship – Summer 2023**

Are you looking for an internship that provides real-world-project experience, networking with employees and executives worldwide, while growing your talents on a supportive and inclusive team? If so, we want to connect with you!

At Thomson Reuters, we provide information-enabled software to help our customers in the legal, tax, accounting, corporate, news, and media fields, to make decisions that move society forward. By joining us, you will make your mark in one of WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs of 2021, working on industry-leading products with opportunities for networking, volunteering, and social events!

We are looking for a **Software Engineer Intern** pursuing a degree in Information Technology, Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related discipline for the Summer of 2023.

  
**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Software Engineer Intern** you will have some of the following opportunities:

* **Develop Web-Based Solutions:** Design and develop web-based research solutions for use by national and international customers using programming languages such as Java, C#, Ruby, and Groovy.
* **Develop CMS and Database Systems:** Develop large content management systems including data repositories, web-based data access and user interfaces
* **Automated Testing:** Design, develop, and execute tests in multiple phases of the software development cycle using Selenium and other tools
* **Collaboration in Large Scale Agile Environment:** Collaborate with multiple teams to ensure technology solutions meet business needs
* **Networking:** Interns will learn and refine the art of networking on a daily basis to build their portfolio of possibilities for their future career aspirations.
* **Performance Analysis:** Accomplish performance analysis and tuning of application servers
* **Analysis and Investigation:** Investigate system operational issues and perform root cause analysis
* **Cloud Platforms:** Gain exposure to AWS or Azure Cloud platforms and technologies
* **Big Data:** Apply Big Data mining techniques
* **AI/NLP/ML:** Work with Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods, including Natural Language Process (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML)

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Software Engineer Intern** if you are/have:

* Currently are pursuing a degree in Information Technology, Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline meeting program academic requirements
* Strong desire to learn new technologies
* Strong problem analysis, problem solving and issue resolution skills
* Ability to communicate effectively and professionally to both technical and non-technical users
* Strong organization skills and attention to detail
* Ability to prioritize work and communicate issues in a timely manner
* Ability to work independently or as part of an agile development team

**What’s in it for you?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. We offer an enriched internship program that focuses on developing the next generation of talent.  Bringing your whole self to work is at our core. Here’s how we support your growth:

* **Campus Culture:** WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs for 2021, intern-focused events, weekly social hours, a dedicated intern appreciation day, Fireside Chats, partnerships with Business Resource Groups, & recognized company culture awarded for our diversity and inclusion
* **Learning & Development:** Project-based internship related to your degree, networking with colleagues and executive leaders across the globe, intern alumni panels, Executive Speaker Series, Thomson Reuters University skills academies, mentorship from managers and teams
* **Compensation:** Competitively paid internships, full-time hours Monday to Friday, with company-designated holidays
* **Social Impact:** Intern volunteer days, local volunteer events impacting your community

\*We are hiring for this position in our Carrollton/Dallas,TX office only.

title: #3 Operator in Subscription Services - 2nd shift
description:
We are hiring a Subscription Services Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a **#3 Subscription S****ervices Operator** for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a #3 Subscription Services Operator**,** you will be responsible for performing set-up tasks, monitoring the equipment and troubleshooting on our Core Publishing Solutions team. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months.  

**Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 2nd shift – 2:30 pm – 10:30 pm
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a **#3 Subscription Services Operator**, you will be responsible for:   

* Reviewing job specifications for material and set-up requirements
* Performing set-up tasks
* Monitoring the equipment and product quality; obtaining maintenance support for equipment as needed
* Performing simple to moderately complex trouble-shooting related to product or equipment
* Communicating effectively during shift and at shift hand-off
* Evaluating mechanical condition of equipment, completing preventative maintenance
* May use computer-based workflows applications to manage files
* Accurately documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, etc
* May perform feeding, catching off, stacking, bundling or physical inventory cycle count activities
* Actively participating in company safety programs and contributing to a safe culture
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures
* Generating, implementing and sustaining continuous improvement ideas
* Participating in project teams as needed
* Providing back up for other operators to cover absences or breaks
* Recommending and implementing process improvements

**About You:** 

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Good mechanical and technical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot, and work independently and as part of a team to resolve issues
* Knowledge of Lean concepts and continuous improvement
* Competent with rulers and measurement
* Good communication skills
* Experience on Perfect Binders with up to 40 station collators, 3-knife trimmers, inline boxing and palletizing
* Experience with hard-cover casing-in lines, collating/kitting lines with up to 30 streamfeeder stations, packaging/cartooning lines, Sitma mail lines, Aster sewing equipment and hot foil stampers
* Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Can regularly stand, walk, crouch, bend, reach and kneel
* Can wear Personal Protective Equipment including steel toe shoes and ear protection

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year, shift premium of 2nd shift - $4.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

  

**Bonus:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success 

 #LI-PK1

title: Campaign Planning & Management
description:
**Campaign Planning & Management,** Marketing

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Campaign Planning & Management em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**About the Role**

This function is mainly in charge of supporting the company throughout the regions with a strong relationship with US, by controlling the Latam marketing campaigns, industry preparation and campaign execution, which includes strategic and tactical plan to increase penetration inside new places, by delivering need and sales targets.

We are looking for a strategic, creative, and results-oriented person to join our team in Latin America. This is a newly created multifaceted role with scope to grow. You will focus on campaigns and projects that deliver both short term brand awareness growth and long term brand affinity and campaign management.

In this opportunity as ***Campaign Planning & Management*** you will:

**Responsibilities:**

* Share all the briefings with all segment teams and inputs specific requirements for Demand Gen Execution team
* Drives innovation to take advantage of new features/ capabilities
* Design end-to-end journeys and multichannel campaigns (always-on and full funnel campaigns) aligning to customer pain points and business priorities
* Creates and drives omnichannel campaign plans in alignment with business priorities
* Designs customer nurture journeys, onboarding and retention programs
* Owns end-to-end campaign operations
* Be subject matter expert on above-the-line media planning and campaign execution.
* Develop marketing plans and manage media budgets to maximize effectiveness.
* Develop internal and external media and creative briefs for campaigns, product launches, and other projects.
* Work cross-functionally with other marketing teams and other marketing partners to build the brand and deepen customer engagement.
* Analyze and report
* Develop a deep understanding of customer mindsets, attitudes, & behaviors.
* Leading and Supervising Campaign and Planning Team
* Day-to-day decision making upon strategies
* Take responsibility for the management of the agency hours and the new build marketing
* Department budget Management
* Needs to work in a flexible setting with many reporting lines.
* Execution of the brand new constructed strategy to allow for the objectives completion.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of ***Campaign Planning & Management*** if your background includes:

**Experience & Skills**

* Business knowledge (region/ segment)
* Digital experience
* Analytical approach
* Project management
* Great relationship and folks skills experience in dealing with multiple internal as well as outside stakeholders.
* Concise and clear communication and management skills.
* High attention to detail.
* Good comprehension of the Principles of Marketing.
* Channel Marketing.
* 4+ years of work experience in a similar position.
* Experience working with large cross functional teams across multiple locations.
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
* The ability to work well with others, build trust within a team, and work effectively in a highly collaborative and global team environment.
* Strong organizational skills and can manage multiple projects (and associated stakeholders) simultaneously.
* Experience in B2B, B2C and e-Commerce
* Advanced English and Spanish

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world

title: Manager Software Development
description:
• Guide the scrum team and product owner, and ensuring all agile practices are followed by team members   
• Lead the Scrum teams in using Agile methodology and scrum best practices   
• Help the scrum teams identify and fill in the gaps in Agile implementation to achieve higher levels of scrum maturity   
• Help the teams commit to a plan to achieve iterative delivery milestones   
• Remove impediments and coach the scrums team on removing impediments   
• Communicate data-based status, Risks and Issues to stakeholders   
• Support the Scrums team to use Agile tools; Own the Agile metrics reporting and ADO Dashboards   
• Own and champion the Agile mindset   
• Manage stakeholder expectations and support engineering excellence   
  
Qualifications / Experience  
• Prior experience of developing as part of a scrum team a must   
• Experience with ADO to enable data-based planning, tracking, and reporting   
• Ability to work with and lead a team   
• Knowledgeable in techniques to fill in gaps in the scrum   
• Strong communication, interpersonal and mentoring skills   
• Ability to adapt to a changing environment   
• Self-motivation and Ability to analyze and think quickly and to resolve conflict

* Proven back-end or full-stack development experience, proficient in any of the following:
	+ Javascript (esp. Node.js framework)
	+ Python 3.x
	+ Java

title: Correspondent, Markets
description:

title: Legal counsel
description:
We are currently seeking a lawyer with a proven record of customer service and a practical, problem-solving approach to providing commercial legal services in a technology-enabled, data-driven corporate, legal department. The successful candidate needs to be a hands-on commercial lawyer with exceptional communication skills, capable of providing sound legal and business advice and counsel to sales professionals, product management, and other internal customers. The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying and analyzing legal issues, drafting and negotiating documents, presenting commercially viable recommendations, and assuring legal compliance. When dealing with internal or external customers, the successful candidate will seek to enhance the customer experience and simplify the customer’s interaction with the legal function.

This opportunity is with Thomson Reuters based in Bangalore. The role sits within the Customers & Commercial team of the Thomson Reuters General Counsel Office, a highly collaborative team focused on enabling business growth and mitigating risk for the customer-centric commercial group. To be successful in this role you should have the experience and capability to handle a broad range of legal and compliance matters.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Legal Counsel, you will:

Review, draft, and negotiate a wide range of customer facing and partner agreements, primarily complex software (including SaaS) and information licensing agreements, re-distribution, hosting, content acquisition, consulting and professional services agreements, non- disclosure agreements and other commercial agreements relating to sales of Thomson Reuters products and services.

Work within the Customers & Commercial team identifying legal, regulatory and compliance requirements and risks associated with various business initiatives and developing and implementing appropriate mitigation strategies. Work with members of the General Counsel Office on enterprise- wide legal issues and projects.

Operate within policy guidelines and requirements set for Thomson Reuters lawyers to ensure compliance and consistency.

Research and respond to general legal inquiries from Thomson Reuters internal customers that relate to corporate, commercial, intellectual property and compliance matters, including privacy-related matters, and advise business on appropriate legal action to be taken.

Contribute know-how to the group’s Knowledge Management initiatives and help to build an open knowledge sharing culture.

Provide practical and insightful business and strategic advice, leveraging experience in the practice of law and the legal profession.

Undertake other reasonable duties as requested.

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Legal Counsel if your background includes:

3-5 years post qualification experience in private practice and/or as in-house legal counsel advising on the sell rather than the buy side

* An interest in commercial contracting and a desire to build a legal career within a large corporate setting.
* Excellent technical legal knowledge in contract and commercial law, particularly with SaaS products and solutions.
* Excellent negotiation and drafting skills.
* Excellent written/verbal communication skills. Ability to positively influence behavior of multiple stakeholders.
* Ability to think strategically and creatively, to identify and resolve legal issues.
* Excellent communication, organization, and analytical skills, and an aptitude for problem-solving Ability to think strategically and creatively, to identify and resolve legal issues, desire and ability to quickly learn about Thomson Reuters’ products and services, and its internal processes and organizational structure.
* Ability to successfully work in a team environment and in a matrixed organization and ability to build rapport and trust with both internal and external stakeholders. Ability to juggle multiple matters at once and work independently in a fast-paced environment and prioritize accordingly. Ability to exercise good judgement on when to seek help and where to find appropriate resources to solve problems.
* Authorized to practice law.

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

COVID-19 Response: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.

Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: work

form anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually;

Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as

we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Regional Sales Manager, Find Law (West)
description:
The Regional Sales Manager for the FindLaw Channel is responsible for leading a team that will drive channel revenue growth via acquisition of new customers, as well as up selling and retaining existing customers.  This position will be responsible for maintaining fully staffed territories and supporting related recruiting and hiring activities. This position is responsible for providing effective coaching, training and performance management to Account Executives in the areas of new products, sales skills, productivity tools as well as professional development.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Excellent Leadership skills with a proven track record of sales success, creative and adaptable with the ability to effectively coach and lead in a changing environment.
* Excellent knowledge and understanding of products and services for the Small Law Channel. Strong understanding of the market.
* Adept at forecasting monthly goals
* The ability to use financial tools to assist in planning, forecasting and productivity improvement.
* Skilled in coaching effectively, managing overall performance; ability to demonstrate and teach related job skills to optimize employee’s performance
* Exemplifies a strong understanding of the law firm’s overall business; ability to listen effectively and obtain necessary information on law firms.
* Uses appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with employees, customers and internal partners; interacts with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in one’s intentions.
* Demonstrates strong negotiation skills by effectively exploring alternatives and positions to reach outcomes that gain the support and acceptance of all parties.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication skills: verbal, written and presentation

**Responsibilities**

* Achieve new sales quotas and renewal targets to reach set growth goals. Drive online revenue growth goals by incorporating the Client Management associates in a partnership role that enhances the customer’s experience.
* Ensure that all territories are fully staffed. Participate in all related recruitment efforts for assigned territories.
* Responsible for hiring qualified employees with strong skill sets in sales, product and market knowledge.  Help maintain a qualified sales bench of candidates to expedite the hiring process and to minimize open territory coverage impact
* Provide performance coaching and job training to direct reports to assist in meeting and exceeding sales quotas. Participate in field rides and provide guidance through on the job training.
* Manage regional territory effectively and efficiently. Maintain monthly reports on pipeline activity, field rides, expenses and employee performance.
* Team with Inside Sales, NPD, Strategic Marketing, Central Marketing, SAM Training and other organizations in order to optimize achieving sales revenue and growth responsibilities as well as Pilot participation.
* Responsible for ensuring positive and effective relationships are established and maintained with customers. Assists in customer escalation issues and provides customer relationship support as needed.
* Participation with and partnering with the Quality Assurance team to assure that our customers experience is without compromise

**Qualifications**

* Four-year degree or equivalent experience; MBA and or JD a plus
* 5-7 years’ experience with successful leadership sales in Business to Business marketplace, digital marketing experience preferred
* Sales management experience, preferably in the legal market
* Experience with Coaching Sales Process, product training and professional development.

**Financial Responsibility**

* Travel & Expense budgets for manager and all direct reports
* Regional budget

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Latam News Hub Chief
description:
**Latam News Hub Chief**

Do you have experience leading multicultural teams? Are you passionate about the whole news world? Do you want to be part of the most important News Leader around the world? If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to coordinate a team of reporters and editors in Mexico, Brazil, and Chile producing short spot stories in three languages and making quick decisions that will shape our crucial corporate, economics, and political coverage region-wide.

**About the role:**

As our **Latam News Hub Chief**, you will:

* Lead a diverse and growing team
* Apply news judgment and give overall direction to the region’s breaking news coverage so that the file meets the needs and performance standards of our financial customers, media clients, and Reuters.com’s audience
* Ensure we publish news alerts and urgent stories clearly, accurately, and quickly to deliver the news first to our subscribers
* Work closely with local language service colleagues on developing and strengthening the Spanish and Portuguese language arms of the breaking news team
* Be fluent in at least one of those languages in addition to English
* Be skilled at working across disciplines to oversee the seamless integration of stories in multiple formats
* Work under pressure in a very fast-paced environment
* Help to drive innovation and generate smart ideas
* Deliver strong team performance in a positive environment
* Take an active interest in training new staff and continuous coaching.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's degree.
* +10 years of experience leading multicultural Breaking News teams.
* Strong leadership skills, impeccable corporate news judgment, and a track record of helping promising staff fulfill their potential.
* Fluent English & Spanish.

**Location : CDMX**

title: Senior Digital Analyst (DAL, MSP, AA or Toronto)
description:
Are you excited by the opportunity to bring your strong digital analyst experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?

Would you like to join an organization that is consistently recognized as a **'Top** **Employer to Work For’** across a broad range of categories, such as Culture, Work-Life Balance, Diversity & Inclusion, Opportunities for Women, Social Impact, Volunteerism?

As a **Senior Digital Analyst** within our awesome Marketing Operations team, you will get to design and deliver web analytics insights across a variety of client segments. 

**Note:** This role has **Remote or Hybrid** option, with a preference that candidates are based near **any** of these corp. office locations: Dallas metro area (Carrollton, TX), Minneapolis metro (Eagan, MN), Toronto, CA for \*hybrid structure (\*mix of working from home and in-office).

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Senior Digital Analyst**, you will:

* Use web analytics/data to recognize patterns and trends to understand user behavior and identify improvement opportunities

**Design Tracking Strategy**

* Co-own digital feature wishlist(s) and roadmap with product managers, nurturing strong data-driven decision making; continuously draw insights to drive (or challenge) digital backlog
* Partner with marketers and digital product managers to establish measurement plan and then work with developers/platform architects to deploy relevant analytics solutions to ensure right metrics, journeys, and events are captured
* Collect business requirements and ask probing questions to fully understand business needs and how it relates to key performance measurements.
* Develop the analytics, measurement, and tracking strategy for the website and digital campaigns.

**Deliver Insights**

* Produce reports and digital dashboards to track website and campaign performance, business trends, customer behavior and other key success indicators for various operating units and management.
* Leverage business knowledge and analytical skills to translate complex results into clear insights and recommendations for decision-makers that will support continuous improvement to campaigns and website.
* Investigate data anomalies to identify root cause and find opportunities for either optimization or clean-up.

**Serve as Thought Leader**

* Collaborate with team to ensure consistency of information and reports, share best practices, and develop systems knowledge.
* Serve as a trusted consultant for digital analytics strategy

**About You**

You could be a fit for the role of **Senior Digital Analyst**, if you background includes:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Economic, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Management Information Systems, Computer Science Engineering, or similar data centric disciplines
* 5+ years’ experience in marketing or digital analytics roles
* 3+ years of hands-on web analytics experience with **Adobe Analytics**
* Experience analyzing digital data including analyses such as customer journey mapping, website flow analysis, audience profiling/segmentation, cohort/mix analysis, digital channel analysis
* Understanding of various concepts such as agile/scrum, A/B or multivariate testing, tag management, journey mapping, and segmentation
* Strong work ethic, attention to detail, ability to own and drive work forward, communication
* Positive attitude, adaptable to change

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist)
description:
Reuters is seeking a focused, driven journalist with a passion for breaking news to join our U.S. team covering the global energy supply crisis, the impact of sanctions on Russia on global crude and fuel markets as well as the United States’ role as the world’s top consumer of oil and one of its biggest producers. This is a position for a reporter who can move effortlessly from covering physical cash and futures energy markets and industry spot news, to long-term enterprise stories on international energy flows, trading strategies, boardroom upheaval and investment trends across the sector.

Energy policy is evolving rapidly as many countries move toward cleaner fuels and as governments seek to contain the political impact of high oil prices and tight fuel supplies on inflation and consumer spending**.** The successful candidate will need to play their part in ensuring Reuters wins the biggest stories impacting the trade flows of the world’s most traded commodity. You will deliver breaking news on oil production, consumption, transportation, storage, exports and imports.

We need a reporter who can produce enterprising scoops, shed light on the opaque energy market, and develop deep sourcing in a secretive industry. The candidate should have strong team skills and be keen to turn their hand across the entire range of commodities coverage as part of a strong, competitive reporting squad that has a hard-won reputation for producing agenda-setting coverage for both our core energy and commodity market users, as well as for our media, investor and financial professional audience. Our regional energy correspondents are based in New York, Houston, Canada and Latin America so the ability to work in a virtual team is essential.

**About the Role**

As our **U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist)**, you will:

* Provide top-quality coverage of physical and future oil markets and break the most important news in those markets
* Bring original ideas for initiative stories
* Be a strong all-round journalist comfortable breaking news and filing at speed as well as working on long-form pieces
* Work closely with the global oil markets team
* Be based in New York or Houston

**About You**

To be our **U.S. Energy Market Reporter (Level 1 Journalist)**, you will ideally have:

* At least two years of experience covering energy, preferably with experience in physical crude or fuel market coverage
* A proven ability to break news
* A track record developing deep sources, and reporting and writing both long- and short-form stories
* Strong news judgment, ability to write with speed, clarity and accuracy
* The ability to clearly explain complex industry subjects to a wide audience as well as to a financially sophisticated reader
* Proven ability to work closely and collaboratively as part of a diverse, driven team spanning multiple regions. Reporters preferring to strike out alone need not apply for this position

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

(Internal candidates: Please note this position is incorrectly listed as being in the EIC job family).

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Manager, IAM
description:
**Manager, IAM.  Information Security and Risk Management** 

Would you like to be an IAM leader in a world-class organization, leveraging industry-leading tools?  Thomson Reuters’ Information Security Risk Management team seeks a high-energy, motivated individual who combines solid technical credentials with a high degree of business acumen for the position of IAM Manager within our Identity and Access Management team.     

 

In this role, which will focus on identity governance and identity data management, you will collaborate with technology peers and business partners to plan and design solutions surrounding Identity Access Management (IAM).  

Holistic identity governance has been defined as a strategic direction for Thomson and a cornerstone of security for the enterprise.  A successful candidate for this role will provide design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of Identity and Access Management programs to support the company’s strategy.  

This vision will be implemented in Thomson data centers, in cloud services world-wide, and will be leveraged by a diverse set of enterprise technologies across all business units. 

 

**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as Manager, Identity and Access Management , you will:  

* Lead a small delivery team of SailPoint engineers; provide mentorship and technical guidance.
* Analyze, engineer, and implement highly complex enterprise level (global) cloud integrations within SailPoint IIQ on the following platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Oracle Cloud.
* Develop SailPoint integrations utilizing SCIM and web services.
* Lead the enhancement pipeline for our enterprise Identity Management tool, EnterWorks.
* Design and Implement standards and process for access enforcement, access governance, authentication, application authorization.
* Design and implement identity governance workflows with the concepts of audit and attestation in mind.
* Provide input on new technology and ensure effective integration with other pieces of the technical infrastructure.
* Seek opportunities for process improvements, recommending and contributing to solutions by developing risk and opportunity plans.
* Partner with IAM/Directory Services operations & architecture, as well as architects and engineers from connected technical teams.
* Coordinate with OS/App teams and provide guidance and support for issue resolution as needed.
* Participate in capacity planning, monitoring, and maintenance to ensure high availability of identity & directory services.
* Act as a project lead or project team member on projects involving Identity & Directory services.
* Deliver process improvements utilizing SailPoint.
 

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of Manager, Identity and Access Management if your background includes:  

* Real world experience with Identity Management & Directory platforms and authentication technologies such as SailPoint, Microsoft Active Directory, EnterWorks, SAML, LDAP, Kerberos, NTLM, IBM ISIM.
* Experience onboarding applications hosted on cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, Google, and Oracle.
* Experience leading IAM delivery teams.
* Identity Management familiarity in one or more of the following areas:
* Access Certification
* Provisioning/De- Provisioning
* Application On-boarding
* Single Sign On
* Identity Federation
* Privileged Access Management
* Multi-factor authentication
* General understanding of ITIL process
* Strong issue resolution and conflict resolutions skills
* 5+ years plus experience in documenting, developing, or implementing IAM systems.
* 5+ years plus with technical experience integrating identity management, access management and access governance software into clients' infrastructure and applications.
* 5+ years plus experience with installation, integration and deployment of technology products (Security and/or IAM would be a bonus)
* 7+ years IT or IT Security experience
* CISSP, CCSP, CISM, and/or ITIL certification in good standing highly preferred.
* General understanding of process improvement.  Six sigma experience desired.
 

 

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Editor-in-Charge, U.S. Energy Markets
description:
Reuters is seeking an experienced journalist to drive coverage of energy markets in the United States, the world’s top oil consumer and one of the biggest producers. This is an exciting time to take the helm in one of the most important regions for global oil coverage on a team with a hard-earned reputation as the go-to news service for the sector. The global energy supply crisis has hit the pockets of U.S. consumers in the world’s largest economy and caused political damage to the administration of President Joe Biden. The country is an important exporter of crude and fuel and also a big importer. Domestic supplies are tighter than they have been for a generation and the global industry is in tumult as it deals with the fallout from war in Ukraine and the accelerating energy transition. 

This is an opportunity for an experienced journalist to show their strength as a lead writer setting the agenda for coverage and producing stories that cater to the needs of both screen clients and a wider audience hungry to read about the broad implications of the news we break. The successful candidate would be comfortable leading reporters on the nuts and bolts of cash market price discovery as well as on breaking the biggest stories that impact those markets. You should be as adept at publishing market moving headlines as writing investigative stories, in-depth analysis and exploring new ways to deliver high-value, specialized content to our clients. 

The **U.S. Energy Markets Editor** needs to be hands-on in framing, pitching and editing a range of stories from reporters in a specialist team in New York and Houston as well as a wider group of reporters across the Americas.  The successful candidate will have a proven track record driving and publishing breaking news, writing and editing the biggest news stories in the sector, and managing a team of journalists. Exceptional candidates without management experience but a clear idea of how they would grow into the role are also encouraged to apply. 

**About You**

As our **U.S. Energy Markets Editor**, you will:

* Set the agenda for U.S. energy markets coverage for the regional team, in line with global editorial goals
* Drive a team of experienced correspondents to report and write first-class cash market and futures market reports, to break exclusive news and publish the most insightful stories on the markets and industries they cover
* Ensure depth and quality in everything we publish: from market reports through to investigative work
* Edit to the highest level before sending stories to the publishing desk
* Spearhead initiatives to develop the best sources across the industry to ensure we maintain our position as a leading provider of energy news
* Adapt quickly to changes in markets and policy to ensure we deliver outstanding coverage on the most important regional energy stories
* Drive development and career progression across the team

 

**About the Role**

To be our **U.S. Energy Markets Editor** you will likely have:

* At least five years of experience editing and reporting on a real-time financial news file
* At least two years of experience managing a team of journalists
* At least two years of experience reporting on physical oil or commodity markets
* A proven track record of framing, pitching and editing both breaking news and initiative stories, identifying trends and delivering agenda-setting big-picture stories ahead of the competition

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories
* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Fresno, CA)
description:
**Sales Executive Job Description:** 

**Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!**

**What You’ll Do:** As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/solo (1-10 attorney) firms.  You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

**About the Role:** 

* Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
* Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
* Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling.
* Create and maintain sales pipeline status ongoing by maintaining accurate and complete information in selected CRM database including activity, closing, project forecast, close ratios and market intelligence.
* Maintain in-depth knowledge of complete line of products/services and customers business issues and needs.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships.
* Communicate product and service opportunities, information or feedback gathered through client activity to appropriate internal resources, including relevant business issues and industry information for utilization in development of market specific action plans and sales strategy.
* Participate in marketing events, trade shows and Company events.

**About You:**

**Experience & Experience:**

* 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
* Experience in outside sales in a professional B2B environment.
* Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
* Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment a plus.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
* Proven track record of developing new customer accounts requiring heavy prospecting, cold calling, appointment setting and closing ability.
* Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
* Ability to develop and deliver effective presentations.
* Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently
* Demonstrated ability to learn a complex product line quickly through self-initiative and discipline.
* Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).

**Travel:**

* Ability to be actively in the field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Materials Management Associate - Receiving (1st shift)
description:
We are hiring a **Materials Management Associate** for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a Materials Management Associate, you will be responsible for working as a member on our Core Publishing Solutions team. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees).

**Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* Monday - Friday from 6:30 am - 2:30 pm

**About the Role:** 

In this opportunity as a **Materials Management Associate****,** you will be responsible for:   

* Driving a powered industrial vehicle (PIV) equipped with lifting devices such as forklift, clamps, or trailer hitch, to safely push, pull, lift, stack, tier, or move products, equipment, or materials.
* Unloading trucks and boxcars, performing goods receipts, cycle counting, and order delivery.
* ERP (SAP) and/or radio frequency (RF) equipment to obtain information or enter transactions regarding material/product movement activities.
* Actively participating in company safety program to ensure compliance and contribute to safety culture.
* Providing data to internal departments as requested.
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures.
* Implementing, performing and sustaining housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment.
* Recommending process improvements; implementing process improvements.
* Participating in project teams as needed.
* Other duties as apparent or assigned.

**About You:** 

You’re a fit for the role of **Materials Management Associate** if your background includes:

**Education:** (minimum requirements)

* High School Diploma or general education degree (GED) required.

**Experience:**

* Ability to read and interpret documents such as load tags, purchase orders, safety rules, operating & maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
* Work history demonstrating good work attendance.
* Previous Forklift certification preferred--will train non-certified applicants according to the latest OSHA rules through classroom and behind the wheel instructions.
* Basic computer skills, knowledge of SAP preferred.

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees)
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

title: #3 Operator in Press - 3rd shift
description:
We are hiring a Press Operator for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a **#3** **Press Operator****,** you will be responsible for working as a member of our Core Publishing Solutions team providing operational management and technical support. You will be operating state-of-the-art offset and digital web presses. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months, and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees).   We have also increased the shift differential for 3rd shift to $5 per hour.     **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 3rd shift – 10:30 pm – 6:30 am
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a **#3** **Press Operator**, you will be responsible for:   

* Assisting the crew on the press, performing setup and production activities, typically on the back-end of the presses to ensure the press is running smoothly
* Preparing for upcoming jobs by reading the DSR and job specifications, as well as staging materials
* Quality checking products for our customers, completing transactions, bundling and tagging products
* Filling in for Lead and Mid-Level Operators as needed including covering absences or breaks
* Monitoring equipment and product quality, housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment, documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, and troubleshooting when necessary
* Using safety equipment to comply with state and federal regulations, reporting all safety and environmental hazards, and attending safety and environmental training programs to ensure compliance and culture of safety

**About You:** You’re a fit for the role of **#3 Press Operator** if your background includes:

* Possess a High School Diploma or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Some experience working in an industrial setting in a maintenance and troubleshooting capacity with a wide range of production machinery is strongly desired
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, competent with rulers and measurement
* Thorough understanding of electrical safety and safe work practices such as the use of personal protective equipment and following machine instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull, and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Regularly standing walking, crouching, bending, reaching, and kneeling

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees), shift premium of 3rd shift - $5.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: #2 Operator in Press - 3rd shift
description:
We are hiring Press Operators for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a **#2** **Press Operator****,** you will be responsible for working as a Mid-Level Operator on our Core Publishing Solutions team. You will be operating state of the art offset and digital web presses. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees). We have also increased the shift differential for 3rd shift to $5 per hour.**Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 3rd shift – 10:30 pm – 6:30 am
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **#2** **Press Operator,** you will be responsible for:   

* Reviewing job specifications for material and set-up requirements
* Performing or delegating set-up tasks
* Monitoring the equipment and product through the job run to ensure a high-quality product
* Performing moderately complex trouble-shooting related to product or equipment
* Communicating effectively during shift and at shift hand-off
* Evaluating mechanical condition of equipment, completing preventive maintenance; involving Maintenance as needed
* Using computer-based workflow applications to manage files
* Accurately documenting activities on Tier Boards and in relevant systems (MII, SAP), i.e., material usage, equipment issues, etc
* Accurately marking, verifying, and tagging loads correctly to ensure inventory accuracy
* Providing work direction to others, whether direct crew or other individuals in the workstream
* Actively participating in company safety programs and contributing to a safe culture
* Performing training as needed
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures
* Implementing, performing and sustaining housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment
* Participating in project teams as needed.
* Recommending and implementing process improvements
* Filling in for other Operators as needed including covering absences or breaks

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **#2 Press Operator** if your background includes:

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Experience leading and training others
* Experience working in an industrial setting with a wide range of production machinery
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot, and work independently and as part of a team to resolve issues
* Solid understanding of Lean concepts and continuous improvement
* Competent with rulers and measurement
* Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Regularly standing walking, crouching, bending, reaching and kneeling

**What’s in it for you**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees), shift premium of 3rd shift - $5.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

 #LI-JK3

At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Canada Economics Reporter
description:
Reuters is looking for an energetic and enterprising reporter to cover the Canadian economy. Based in Ottawa, the successful candidate will be a detail-focused journalist able to move deftly from coverage of the central bank and finance department to economic indicators. The role requires an ability to execute original initiative stories on the Canadian economy at a time when the central bank is battling persistent inflation and the economy facing a potential recession. 

Speed and accuracy are vital as is the ability to sift through data to write authoritative stories that capture changing trends in the economy. This is a great opportunity for a self-directed individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is quick on their feet and adept at spotting smart trends in economic data.


**About the Role**

As our **Canada Economics Reporter,** you will:

* Cover everything from the impact of rising interest rates on the housing market and consumers to trade relations and changing global supply chains in the aftermath of the COVID 19 pandemic
* Coordinate with Canadian and global colleagues to produce ahead of the curve and insightful stories

**About You**

To be our **Canada Economics Reporter**, you will likely have:

* Strong writing and reporting skills
* Strong source building skills
* Proven ability to break news and set the news agenda
* The ability to execute original initiative stories
* Five to 10 years' experience
* Fluent French preferred

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

**Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities

**Learning & Development**: we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employees

**Benefits**: we offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits

**Perks**:  Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.

Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Web content management editor
description:
We are looking for a Web content management editor to join us.

**P****lease note this is a maternity leave cover till end of October 2023.**

In this role you will work across project, product and editorial teams that are based in the UK and US to build web content widgets, advanced search templates and Pro Plan (subscriptions) as part of the deliverables for the Legal business.

Websites that you will be working on include: Practical Law UK /US/Canada and Global. An online legal know-how service providing peer reviewed resources created by our team of expert editors who have major experience gained in the worlds leading law firms.

Westlaw UK/US- the world’s most advanced legal search engine, supplying legal materials including analytical materials and the largest online collection of litigation resources.

**About the role**

Major Responsibilities include:

* Work with business stakeholders to understand the requirements
* Work with development teams to build new templates and functionality
* Build and configure widgets using WCMS (Web content management system)
* Taking our content collections and building a widget that takes a subset of that content and displays it with metadata to our customers
* Test that the widgets on our web pages meet the business requirements
* Using ADO (Azure devops)/MS Planner – issue tracking
* Write/Amend XML and also write HTML and very occasionally some CSS (Cascading style sheets)
* Make new or edit existing Advanced search templates, create workspace in PAC (Publishing Authority for Cobalt). PAC is a tool for managing and publishing configuration files that manage some website behaviors
* Pro Plan release note checking, using SAP for portal requests

**About you**

To be considered for the role, you will need:

* Experience using Content management systems
* Excellent English language skills written and spoken

title: News Reporter with Norwegian, Swedish, Danish or Finnish
description:
**You and your team:** 

Reuters is seeking candidates who can speak fluent English and one of the Nordic languages to join its real-time news operation in Gdansk. The reporters will work in fast-paced, international environment and get to produce headlines and write stories about companies from Europe’s biggest economies and become part of Reuters global network.  

**Why is this job important?** 

Trading desks, hedge funds and asset managers at major multinational banks use our services to base their investment decision. Your stories for Reuters will also be seen by our media clients, on Reuters.com and other extensions available to read for everyone. Reuters news and information reaches one billion people every day. 

**In your role you will be responsible for:**

* Scanning press releases from companies and regulators in English and Nordic languages to quickly identify key information, accurately write headlines and news summaries with high standards of credibility, in accordance with Reuters principles and operating standards
* Identifying market-moving figures and comments to filter out news stories from sources including electronic news releases, conferences calls, Webcasts
* Explaining reasons behind stock moves in form of short stories
* Writing short alerts on Nordic macroeconomic data such as GDP and inflation

   
**Qualifications - What do you need to bring?** 

* Fluency in English and one of the Nordic languages (Norwegian, Swedish, Danish or Finnish)
* Strong translation skills
* Strong news judgment
* Ability to write with speed, clarity, accuracy and freedom from bias
* A sound command of grammar, spelling, punctuation
* Comfort with handling financial data and facts accurately and quickly
* Knowledge of corporate activity, stock markets and financial vocabulary, or an ability to gain such knowledge quickly
* An ability to work under time pressure

**What’s in it For You?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcare and Multisport card
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. title: Insights Analyst
description:
* Explore large volumes of data to present data-driven insights to internal stakeholders
* Help analyze performance of various products and platforms and track and report KPIs and OKRs
* Help analyze customer behavior data and extract actionable insights that help improve product offerings
* Take ownership of specific tasks and be responsible for maintaining and enhancing the output of such tasks
* Will identify, assesses and review data with a view to presenting strategic insights to senior management
* Help team conduct quality checks of the data to ensure its accuracy and help the team with keeping documentation on processes and workflows
* Provide new ideas on types of analysis that can be carried out on a given data set
* Ensure that all assigned reports/tasks are completed on a timely basis

**About You**

To be our **Insights Analyst**, you:

* Should be a self-starter with a curiosity to explore large volumes of data and work with teams across the organization
* Should have worked in a role or have done internships where they have carried out data analysis in any field including (but not limited to) web analytics, customer analysis and product performance metrics
* Should possess knowledge of various statistical methods and tools to analyze the data – experience or schooling in Python, Machine Learning, Predictive Analysis strongly preferred
* Ability to conceptualize and build interactive dashboards to represent data
* Have a keen eye to spot data irregularities and perform ongoing data sanity checks
* Flexible and able to meet the changing demands of the business priorities
* Are energetic, willing to learn, capable to keeping open lines of communication and eager to work in a team
* Sound knowledge of news and current affairs. Knowledge of financial news would be an added advantage
* A demonstrable ability to assimilate new information thoroughly and quickly

title: Lead IAM Engineer - SailPoint
description:
**Primary Responsibilities:** 

* Analyze, engineer, and implement highly complex enterprise level (global) cloud integrations within SailPoint IIQ on the following platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Oracle Cloud.
* Develop SailPoint integrations utilizing SCIM and web services.
* Design and deploy enhancements for our enterprise Identity Data Management tool, EnterWorks.
* Design and Implement standards and process for access enforcement, access governance, authentication, application authorization.
* Design and implement identity governance workflows with the concepts of audit and attestation in mind.
* Provide input on new technology and ensure effective integration with other pieces of the technical infrastructure.
* Seek opportunities for process improvements, recommending and contributing to solutions by developing risk and opportunity plans.
* Partner with IAM/Directory Services operations & architecture, as well as architects and engineers from connected technical teams.
* Coordinate with OS/App teams and provide guidance and support for issue resolution as needed.
* Participate in capacity planning, monitoring, and maintenance to ensure high availability of identity & directory services.
* Act as a project lead or project team member on projects involving Identity & Directory services.
* Deliver process improvements utilizing SailPoint.
