title: Sr Software Engineer
description:
* Writes new software, makes modifications to existing software, or integrates software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications provided by others
* Creates and executes unit testing and integration testing ensuring module meets requirements
* Executes on provided design
* May provide technical support to operations or other development teams
* Creates and maintains all required technical documentation / manual related to assigned components to ensure supportability.
* Makes suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements, which will typically be reviewed by a more senior developer.
* Implements solutions as directed within standards
* Participates in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
* Typically works on one project at a time and as a member of the project team(s) or as part of a specialist cross-project team on multiple developments.
* Works on smaller, minimally complex projects or a particular system or application within larger projects that requires a singular area of expertise
* Provides status updates for own scope of work within projects.
* Participates in internal team and status meetings.
* Develops software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
* Writes new software, makes modifications to existing software, or integrates software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications provided by business teams for Reuters.
* Executes on provided design
* The key area of focus for this position is serving as a Technical Lead for a multi-year project to deliver new systems using AWS and its capabilities with excellent proficiency in  Java, and Python. Full-stack development
* The ideal candidate will possess strong organization, communication, and problem-solving skills. They must also possess effective oral and written communication skills, as well as strong interpersonal skills. A history of meeting aggressive deadlines in uncertain environments and maintaining strong customer relationships are key selection criteria.

**Essential Day-to-Day Responsibilities:**
* A four-year degree in computer science or a related field is required.

Knowledge and Skills

Technical knowledge should include hands-on design and development of enterprise-class applications including design analysis, and implementation, and testing along with experience with troubleshooting and maintenance activities. Must be able to Effectively balance and prioritize multiple projects and tasks concurrently

Candidates should possess:
* 5+ years of background in software development with Java &/or Python technologies
* 3+ years of experience in OOA and OO Design and Development using Design Patterns
* 1+ years of background in software development using AWS capabilities like S3, lambdas, step functions, cloud formation etc..
* 1+ years of experience with XML, Node.JS technologies
* Understanding of TDD, iterative, use case driven development
* Develop efficient and high-quality code while meeting product release deadlines
* Ensure adherence to coding, design and architectural standards
* Assist leads to prepare time estimates for projects and software design plans
* Write good lean technical design documentation and technical approach
* Design all test cases to provide support to all systems and perform unit tests.
* Individual must be proactive, self-motivated with ability to prioritize multiple project tasks.
* Production Support & Maintenance activities:
* Respond quickly to support issues and follow up till resolution
* Conduct thorough troubleshooting and provide quick resolution to production problems

title: Product Support Associate
description:
We have an exciting opportunity at Thomson Reuters as a **Product Support Associate** - a role that blends technology with tax and accounting.

Upon joining our business, you will undergo an **intensive product training bootcamp**. You will also have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from a variety of teams within the business.

**About the Team**

We are a Team of application support based in Gdańsk that focuses on providing a quality service to customers of **Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE and DIGITA suites.**

Thomson Reuters ONESOURCE and DIGITA suites are tax and accounting compliance software solutions that enable professional firms and corporate organizations to remain compliant with tax and accounting requirements. Our software solutions help our customers achieve increased automation and accuracy within their workflows, while maximizing efficiencies within their organisations.

The team will provide support to primarily EMEA based customers with a big focus on UK market.

These positions will operate in an 8-hour long shift pattern (Monday to Friday) with some scheduling flexibility between 9:00 to 18:30 (Poland Time).

**About the Role**

The **Product Support Associate** role sits within our front-line technical support organisation, which is tasked with assisting customers to successfully utilize our software solutions therefore meeting their firm’s business objectives.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Responding to and solving queries raised by our customers during their use of our applications, responding to customer by phone, e-mail or case comments.
* Concisely and accurately document support request information, paying particular attention to problem description, resolution, user reaction and follow up action.
* Interact with colleagues to resolve customer issues effectively and timely.
* Use internal resources as needed and escalate issues to Technical Team Lead or Manager.
* Maintain up to date product knowledge of all supported products.
* Maintain correct contact details for our client base on our internal systems.
* Ensure common queries have a Knowledge Base Article.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Product Support Associate** if your background includes:

* An excellent level of English (C1 or C2 level).
* Problem solving skills.
* Strong customer service/people skills.
* Able to work as part of a Team.

**Desired (not required) Skills**

* Tax/Accounting/Audit background.
* XML basic skills.
* Good software navigation skills.

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Product Manager
description:
We are seeking a Product Managerto join the Confirmation team. The qualified candidate will be responsible for helping define and execute the overall product strategy, work directly with stakeholders and customers, and drive growth and adoption of new and existing product lines. The Product Manager will have responsibility for a fast growing and market leading web application used by customers around the globe. This particular role is focused on APIs and integration services between the Confirmation platform and its customers, partners, and third parties.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Product Manager, you will:

* Analyze market and competitive conditions to create and execute on a product vision that delivers unique value to our customers.
* Manage the backlog and feature prioritization process for the product line in collaboration with numerous stakeholders.
* Facilitate backlog refinement and story creation with the scrum/agile team(s)
* Engage customers for sales and implementation support related to technology requirements (especially API-related requirements)
* Understand the trends shaping your markets, relevant user personas, and developing technologies within the space.
* Collaborate with sales, support and marketing teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market, sales, pricing and communication strategies.
* Work with the technology and product teams to ensure business requirements are captured, executed and sequenced effectively.
* Track and report effectiveness of product features, go-to-market, sales, and communication strategies for senior management.
* Cultivate and manage mutually beneficial partnerships within the product/market category.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Product Manager if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required
* 3-5 years of experience in Product Management, Product Strategy or Brand Management
* Demonstrated proficiency working with engineering teams on technical requirements
* Agile/Scrum experience desired
* Background in B2B SaaS products, financial services/Fintech preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

title: Business Development Manager - Reuters Events
description:
**Business Development Manager - Reuters Events - London**

**This full-time role will be based in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.**

Are you a collaborator? Someone who can get the best out of their team whilst delivering sales targets? Looking to take your sales career to the next level? If so, this might be the role for you! Reuters Events are seeking a new **Business Development Manager** to generate both new and existing business opportunities with some of the world's leading brands in the Downstream and Petrochemicals markets.

Established in 1990 as FCBI, **Reuters Events** was acquired by Reuters in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.

**Reuters Events** brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with our domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in highly specialized industry sectors. We deliver knowledge and foster relationships that shape business strategies and safeguard success at leading companies across the globe.

**About the Role**

As our **Business Development Manager,** you will:

* Lead the sale of sponsorship opportunities within Reuters Events’ flagship downstream and petrochemical conference portfolios.
* Sell multi-product, tailored to a range of clients in the downstream industry as part of our year-round activations (knowledge of the downstream energy industry a plus, but by no means mandatory!).
* Identify, profile and engage both new and existing clients in the energy sector.
* Develop and maintain long-term relationships with a network of internal and external C-suite stakeholders.
* Share your expertise by leading a small team of two salespeople to success and managing future sales strategies.

**The Person**

To be our **Business Development Manager**, you will likely have: 

* Demonstrable experience of selling in a B2B environment (it doesn't have to be conferences!).
* The desire to keep learning, with a can-do attitude.
* An understanding of tele-sales etiquette, with demonstrable experience of generating new business opportunities.
* The ability to motivate others as part of a collaborative and inclusive sales team and spot new opportunities for growth.
* A team-orientated mindset. We're team players at Reuters Events and are looking for someone that shares our collaborative ethos. We reward individual performance and celebrate our successes as a team. If this sounds like an environment that suits you, we want to hear from you!

**Please Note: completed applications must be completed by 23:59 on Sunday 8th January 2023. Early applications are strongly encouraged.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sales Specialist, Tax Solutions
description:
Do you have knowledge on tax & accounting methodology and keen to take on a client-facing sales role? 

We are looking for a Sales Specialist to develop new businesses for our ONESOURCE corporate tax solutions business segment. The successful candidate will be working alongside a supportive and growing team within a global company.

**About the Role**

As a **Sales Specialist, Tax Solutions**, you will:

* Sell tax software solution in Japan to a pre-defined territory of accounts market segment and white space.
* Build on expert knowledge to target client base, recognize client needs and propose solution.
* Generate new business opportunities by taking qualified leads from multiple sources including marketing, BDRs and self-identified leads.
* Prospect and demonstrate Thomson Reuters’ capability to new customers, develop proposals, negotiate contracts and ultimately close new business
* Collaborate with Client/Strategic Account Managers to deliver sales within existing accounts
* Build competitor knowledge, maintain accurate customer contact and opportunity data in our CRM system, and conduct win/loss analysis plus maintain strong awareness of external market, to identify business opportunities.

**About You**

As a **Sales Specialist, Tax Solutions**, you should ideally possess:

* Tax qualifications and/or experience working in Tax/Accounting professions or B2B sales to professionals.
* Track record in a professional field sales or SaaS business development role is a plus
* Demonstrated understanding of the Japanese Corporate market
* Commercial acumen and ability to identify opportunities in white space
* Ability to partner effectively with the wider sales team and internal stakeholders
* Proficiency in native Japanese and business level English. Those who are keen to improve their English speaking in an international environment are welcomed to apply.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

title: Automation Engineer – Reuters Technology
description:
* **Roles and Responsibilities**
* Own large and complex technical projects that interact with several other systems
* Participate and contribute to requirements analysis
* Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
* Write clean, scalable, and testable code using modern programming languages to support application frontends
* Test and deploy applications and systems
* Revise, update, refactor and debug code
* Help recruit, hire, and mentor your peers and other engineers as we grow
* **Requirements**:
* You are curious, want to know how things work, and learn new skills
* 3+ yrs. experience with NET Core (preferably in Linux)
* AWS knowledge (SNS/SQS, ECR/ECS, EC2, S3 minimum demonstrable programmer knowledge especially in .NET and/or Python)
* Docker containerization/microservice architecture in cloud environments
* Experience with websockets, REST
* Detailed understanding of webpages at a source level, DoM (xpath, css selectors), basic javascript
* Agile development and delivery
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability and passion to learn modern technologies quickly
* Team player and self-starter
* **Desired**:
* Natural Language Processing techniques
* Machine Learning techniques (e.g. SVM, word2vec/doc2vec, Random Forest, BERT)
* Experience with Selenium

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
* Provides input for the planning, integration, casing, scripting, and execution of all testing required of a single software change or a small module/component. (Note – AQA provides input for planning and estimates)
* Reviews business requirements and designs specifications for less complex changes/systems for completeness and testability.
* Develops test scripts for automation whereas AQA’s are not expected to develop the scripts. (Note - AQA provides input into test plans.)
* Conducts testing using company-specific, manual or automated processes.
* Executes test scripts/cases and communicates the results of testing with guidance if required.
* Tests modules of medium software products or smaller stand-alone software products to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects.
* Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or problems of low complexity
* Works on smaller, minimally complex projects/issues that require a singular area of expertise
* Typically works as a member of a single QA or Process team.
* Works on projects/changes of minimal to medium complexity.
* Reports progress on problem resolution to management.
* Performs work flow analysis and recommends quality improvements.
* Experience in writing Automation scripts unsing  Python, postman, javascript is essential.

title: HR Administrator
description:
**HR Administrator, People - Regional HR / HR Management**

Are you looking for a new career opportunity in the Human Resources department? Join the exceptional HR team supporting Thomson Reuters' offices in North Asia now! As a Human Resources Administrator, you will provide generalist or specialist operational support and day-to-day advisory on clearly defined HR policies and processes to employees and first line managers. You will also be responsible of upkeeping documents and records, and deliver relevant HR administrative/operational activities within SLAs. As a member of the Regional HR, you will be part of the team who will help the HR leadership across the Asia Pacific Region.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as HR Administrator, you will:

* **Draft** standard template letters (reference, visa application, employment certification, promotion, transfer) and contracts across all business functions
* **Ensure** the smooth administrative onboarding of new starters, including collecting new starter paperwork, benefit enrolment, etc.
* **Coordinate** other administrative aspects of off-boarding of employees including sending of the leaver paperwork, terminating benefit coverage, etc
* **Generate** of weekly, monthly, quarterly reports on joiners and leavers across AEM
* **Be responsible** for tracking vendor contracts, managing contract/subscription renewals, invoice payments, maintaining trackers
* **Respond** to requests and complete annual required employee information spreadsheets for insurance vendors including workers compensation, salary continuance, benefits providers etc
* **Support** annual employer tax filing activities
* **Provide** routine reporting, data gathering exercises as needed
* **Complete** government forms using standard WD reports
* **Provide** routine Workday support as needed
* **Support** employee engagement activities as directed
* **Maintain** employee records electronically
* **Assist** with EAD/payroll as needed
* **Update** and **maintain** the HR policies page
* **Continuously improve** to drive administrative/operational efficiency, implementation of SLAs

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of HR Administrator if your background includes:   

* Excellent organizational skills
* Strong focus on quality/accuracy/speed of delivery
* Strong understanding of administrative process flow
* Experienced using multiple IT systems/tools e.g., Workday, CORA, Ariba, ServiceNow
* Well developed knowledge of HR databases, MS Word, Outlook, Excel
* Collaborative and excellent communication skills
* Good analytical skills and high initiative
* Customer service mindset
* Ability to handle multiple tasks at once and be flexible and resilient in a changing environment
* Ability to work with, maintain and keep confidential information secure
* Previous experience in a HR administrative role

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Digital Marketer
description:
**Digital Marketer, Operations Customer Service & Support**

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Digital Marketer, you will: 

* **Meet or exceed** the on-time task percentage established for the team.
* **Uphold FindLaw**’s Digital Marketing fulfillment quality standards.
* **Maintain an ongoing understanding** of the Digital Marketing industry’s changes and trends.
* **Identify and remediate** on and off-site performance issues.
 

**About You** 

You're a fit for the role of Digital Marketer if your background includes: 

* Having significant knowledge of Digital Marketing including SEO, social media, and local search.
* Familiarity with web analytics tools including: Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SpyFu, Screaming Frog.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Minimum of 2 years’ experience or equivalent education in Digital Marketing strategies and tactics.

title: Pasante | HR Intern
description:
**Pasantía | HR Intern** para Thomson Reuters Argentina

¡Que tus próximos pasos sean en TR!

Dentro del equipo de **People | HR Regional** nos encontramos en búsqueda de estudiantes con ganas y motivación de comenzar a dar sus primeros pasos en el mundo profesional ocupando la posición de ***Pasante de Recursos Humanos***,

Su contribución al equipo va a ser fundamental para brindar soporte y asistir al área de selección y reclutamiento.

***¿Cuales son las principales tareas del rol?***

- Brindar soporte en el proceso de operaciones de HR a nivel regional

- Dar apoyo en proyectos para la región: employer branding | Onboarding

- Process | Trainings| Facturación| Preparación documentación laboral| lega

- Tareas de back office del área

***¿Que requisitos buscamos?***

Estudiante avanzando de la carrera universitaria de Relaciones del Trabajo, Recursos Humanos, Administración de Empresas o afines.

Conocimiento del idioma inglés (deseable)

***Por sobre todo buscamos a una persona con muchas ganas de aprender, curiosa y proactiva para proponer nuevas ideas, con actitud positiva y predispuesta a trabajar en un gran equipo!***

***¿Qué te proponemos?***

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad) 

🏥 OSDE 210

💰 Subsidio internet mensual

🚀 Flex my way (trabaja desde donde quieras dentro del país – 8 semanas al año)

🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)

🎁 Day off cumpleaños 

🍴 Servicio de vending in office

🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)

💻 Equipamiento de trabajo

Nos diferenciamos por tener una **cultura centrada en la diversidad e inclusión**, gran compromiso en el **respeto & bienestar** de los colaboradores, y por sobre todo, un **excelente clima laboral** para que disfrutes la experiencia de trabajar en Thomson Reuters. **¡Súmate a nuestro equipo!**

title: Senior Insights Analyst
description:
Job Description: 

Are you passionate about data and believe that analytics should be a key input to shaping the future of a company? Do numbers speak to you, and do you like to dig for trends and patterns in whatever you observe? Then write to us. The Data & Insights team at Reuters, the world’s largest News Agency, is looking for a **Senior Insights Analyst** that is energetic and focused. They should be willing to boldly explore data, question assumptions while being an excellent team player.  Candidates should possess excellent statistical training, be skilled at applying statistics to business problems and communicate clearly. Their work will inform the editorial team on news coverage, product team on customer insights and the sales team on opportunities. Candidates interested in finance/business and familiar with Media business preferred but it is NOT a requirement, especially if you can demonstrate willingness and capacity to learn. 

**About the Role & Responsibilities:**

As our **Senior** **Insights Analyst**, you: 

* Will take ownership of exploring and analyzing large volumes of data to present data-driven insights to internal stakeholders including senior management
* Help analyze news output to guide Reuters newsroom on news coverage and efficient deployment of resources
* Help editorial and business leaders track content commitments to various client segments
* Help formulate and track KPIs and OKRs and present them in a easy-to-read format to internal stakeholders
* Provide new and original ideas on types of analyses that can be carried out on a given data set with an eye toward providing predictive and actionable insights to stakeholders
* Lead customer behavior data review and analyses and extract actionable insights that help improve product and editorial offerings
* Take ownership of specific tasks and be responsible for maintaining and enhancing the output of such tasks
* Be efficient at analyzing new requirements, build processes and deliver timely solutions
* Help team conduct quality checks of the data to ensure its accuracy and help the team with keeping documentation on processes and workflows

As our **Senior Insights Analyst**, you: 

* Should be a self-starter with a curiosity to explore large volumes of data and work with teams across the organization
* Should have worked in a role where they have carried out data analysis in any field including (but not limited to) web analytics, customer analysis and product performance metrics
* Possess knowledge of various statistical methods and tools to analyze the data – experience or schooling in Python, Machine Learning, Predictive Analysis strongly preferred
* Ability to conceptualize and build interactive dashboards to represent data
* Be able to provide new ideas on types of analyses that can be carried out on a given data set
* Be capable of providing concise and actionable insights that can be presented to senior management
* Is energetic, willing to learn, capable to keeping open lines of communication and eager to work in a team
* Have a keen eye to spot data irregularities and perform ongoing data sanity checks
* Flexible and able to meet the changing demands of the business priorities
* Sound knowledge of news and current affairs. Knowledge of financial news would be an added advantage

**Required Qualifications**

To be our **Senior Insights Analyst**, you will likely have:

* Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Engineering or any related technical field
* Minimum 5 years of proven experience in data analysis, building dashboards and extracting actionable insights for senior management
* Comfortable writing SQL queries and experience in working with AWS
* Experience in Tableau/Qlik View/Power BI
* Intermediate/Advanced MS Excel skills (pivots, charts, functions etc.) and PowerPoint
* Familiarity working with data wrangling tools such as Alteryx

**Preferred Qualifications:** 

* Experience/Knowledge in Big Data or Data Warehousing tools
* Experience working on Regression, Classification, Text mining, Text Classification, Forecasting, and Clustering

title: Conferencing and Events Manager - Reuters Events
description:
**Conferencing and Events Manager - Reuters Events**

**This full-time position will be based in our office in London with hybrid working available.**

Are you highly organized? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same? Keen to share the success of our global portfolio of events? If so, this might just be the role for you.

We're looking for an ambitious, highly organized and collaborative **Conference and E******vents Manager**** to join **Reuters Events**. As part of this role, you'll be based in London (working on a hybrid basis) and will play a key role in ensuring that our busy portfolio of physical and virtual events are planned and delivered effectively across a range of global locations.

Established in 1990 as FCBI, **Reuters Events** was acquired by **Reuters** in 2019. We deliver world-class conferences and content across the globe, and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.

**Reuters Events** brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in highly specialized industry sectors to complement our extensive, in-depth content. Reuters Events exists to deliver the intelligence and foster the relationships that shape strategy and safeguard success at leading companies worldwide.

**About the Role**

As an **Conference and Events Manager** you will:

* Plan and project manage the end-to-end logistics for a collection of B2B conferences and events.
* Source the best venues and external suppliers for our conference's needs, ensuring that we're delivering great experiences to our delegates whilst keeping a close eye on budgets.
* Work closely with our production, sales and marketing teams to ensure that we're covering all bases in the setup and delivery of our industry-leading events.
* Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to bring the events to life and ensure their commercial success.
* Work closely with our Event Coordinators and deploy their skillsets where necessary.

  
**About You**

To be our **Conference and E******vents Manage**r** you will likely have:

* Demonstrable experience of project managing B2B conferences, events or exhibitions.
* A collaborative attitude, with the ability to develop relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Great communication skills (written and interpersonal), with the ability to liaise with a range of senior stakeholders.
* Experience of sourcing venues (desirable, but by no means pre-requisite!)
* A keen eye for detail and the desire to deliver the best events possible.

  
**Please note, the deadline for applications is 23:59 (GMT) on Sunday 15th January 2023. Early applications are strongencouraged.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Technology – Service Management**

We are looking for a Senior SRE to join our Global Site Reliability team. We provide innovative team collaboration and social networking software to some of the world's leading law firms, investment banks and corporations. We are leaders in legal digital transformation around the world. 

<https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/highq> 

As a Senior SRE Engineer you will be part of the core Platform Operations function that is responsible for security, delivery, and availability of our HighQ platform. 

You will also be expected to participate in the on-call rotation which supports our maintenance, scheduled work, support and release/deployment requirements. 

  

**About the Role** 

*In this opportunity, you will:* 

* **Be a Technical Leader:**Implement best practices as knowledge expert in SRE methodology.
* **Be a Project Leader:** Strategically plan, design and implement Operations projects to deliver value to customers, managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* **Be an efficient Stakeholder**: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management and support team in defining priority issues and refining processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues.
* **Be a Decision Maker**: Make quick and effective data driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills.
* **Focus on Continuous improvement and technical standards –**Drive improvements in productivity, monitoring, tooling and set industry best practices.

**About You** 

*You’re a fit for the role of Senior SRE, if you:* 

* Have experience working with three-tier web applications, running in public and/or private cloud.
* Have experience using Apache Tomcat, scaling database technologies like MS SQL.
* Project and Release lifecycle experience.
* Have expertise in driving technology strategy and execution, while establishing strategic partnerships and delivering against product requirements.
* Are an effective communicator with relevant experience leading and influencing others, demonstrating an ability to partner effectively with internal and external partners.
* Possess strong knowledge of current technologies, with proficiency in the areas of automation, DevOps, cloud native architecture, and system monitoring.

  
**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Markets Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for an experienced, ambitious journalist to help drive coverage of financial markets from Japan, the world’s third-largest economy and a critical market for global investors.

The successful candidate will cover Japan’s huge – and hugely important – stock, currency and bond markets, and work as part of an Asia-wide finance and markets breaking news team responsible for covering moves and flows of regional markets, as well as the people shaping them.

This is a fast-paced job that requires quick and creative thinking, excellent news judgement and a keen eye for a great story. We are looking for someone who will be able to go beyond the daily ups-and-downs to zoom in on what is being bought and sold, and why, teasing out stories about the broader implications behind big market moves.

The successful candidate will be able to use data to illustrate what’s happening in the markets, and the implications for the broader economy. This is a great opportunity for an ambitious reporter to break news and tell insightful, complex stories through the people and businesses involved in and impacted by financial markets.

**About The Role:**

As our **Markets Correspondent** you will:

* Help drive our coverage of markets in Japan, a key market for our financial clients
* Work with colleagues across the region to tell broad, Asia-wide markets stories
* Serve as part of a roster of reporters covering international markets during Asian hours
* Ensure we are delivering fast, comprehensive and insightful coverage that goes beyond the numbers
* Build sources at banks, brokerages and asset managers to break news and keep our readers ahead
* Work closely with colleagues on the Japanese language service

**About You:**

To be our **Markets Correspondent**, you will likely have:

* Excellent knowledge of financial markets and the drive to always learn more
* Strong Japanese language skills and excellent writing in English
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritise workflow
* Experience building sources, using data to tell stories and using social media for newsgathering and monitoring
* A desire to look for innovative and interesting ways to tell market stories to a broad audience

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Business Operations Consultant
description:
**Business Operations Consultant**

Do you want to be part of global teamwork? Do you have experience helping an organization's management to maintain and improve standard operating processes? If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to drive process improvement efforts across the business unit to achieve significant financial, operational, customer satisfaction, and/or employee satisfaction impact.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as a **Business Operations Consultant**, you will:

* Be responsible for supporting critical operational areas for professional services including, but not limited to, order processing, time entry and billing, access requirements, quality assurance, reporting, and governance
* Contributes to or directly prepares timely, accurate, and complete operational reporting (historical and forecast) including analysis and recommendations on actions for the business
* Performs analytic analysis on operational KPIs to identify and resolve business risks/issues, evaluate performance/results, and evolve business processes; provide decision support
* Work with global counterparts to maintain smooth workflow and support daily business operations
* Identify opportunities for improved business and operational performance at all levels and beyond the broader Professional Services organization, across all customer segments
* Creativity and willingness to provide feedback and make suggestions is expected
* Produce, review and maintain operational documentation and communications
* Participation as assigned team member to triage, route, respond or manage OpCOE information channels at specific points in time including e-mail, roundtable, verbal, or other flows as needed
* Active and timely entries to Operations conversations, tools, and resources
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Participating in special projects that are critical to OpCOE or business enhancements

**About you** 

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor’s degree.
* +2 years of experience in similar positions.
* Fluent English is a Must.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (Word, PowerPoint)
* Strong Excel skills
* Experience in Financial Reporting
* Strong interpersonal and presentation skills
* Proven track record of results from the application of process improvement
* Strong project management skills
* Strong understanding of professional services business including back-office processes and/or operations and technologies
* Proficient at developing specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-ZM1

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model****:** Currently, most of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Breaking News Correspondent, Korea
description:
Reuters is seeking an energetic and versatile journalist to join the Breaking News Hub in the Seoul bureau. The Hub is at the Centre of a very busy newsroom handling unpredictable breaking news from North and South Korea on politics, business and the economy. The successful candidate will work with editors and other correspondents in Seoul to issue news alerts and write fast-updating stories for Reuters' global audience of decision-makers.

**About the role**:  
•    Be the first to issue breaking news alerts on major news stories from Korea and write updates  
•    Report and write stories following up on the initial news break   
•    Monitor key sources of news, major economic indicators and regulatory filings in Korea  
•    Work with editors and correspondents on stories that span multiple countries and regions  
•    Develop and work on initiative story ideas under your own byline

**About you**:  
•    At least two years of journalism experience  
•    The ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced newsroom environment   
•    Experience covering North Korea and South Korea’s politics, society and business for a news organisation  
•    The personality and communication skills to work closely with colleagues with different backgrounds and expertise  
•    The ability to write fast and clearly in English and fluency in Korean

title: Lead Implementation Consultant
description:
**Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities:**

* Client Service  - working with clients on a range of different projects, delivering excellent client service’
* Project Management - plays a visible role in project planning sessions with team members. Works on, moderately complex projects/issues that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
* Communications/Status Reporting - effectively communicates findings and solutions to client. Prepares status updates for projects and regularly communicates and shares knowledge with the client and the team.
* Leadership -may provide direction and training to junior staff. May function in a team lead role, mentors across team.
* Makes recommendations for process improvement and ideas to immediate manager.
* Monitors costs of own work in alignment with project plan and may manage budgets for small projects or programs.
* Accountable for the quality of own work, delivered within agreed procedures and timeframes and focused on internal and/or external customer needs.
* Accountable for determining the approach used to address routine professional issues.

  
**Key Relationships:** 

* May serve in team lead role for small teams, this may include responsibility for training/supervision of junior staff and having direct responsibility over the project team or sub team.
* Work with Thomson Reuters Sales and Solution Consultants across products to provide insight and first-hand expertise around integrated product solutions; this may mean leading or participating in client-related pitches or workshops.
* Where necessary, contribute to global assignments and leverage on relationships with TR employees outside of the UK to ensure a consistent and standardized global services solution.
* Foster good client relations as part of the services work undertaken and champion externally the Thomson Reuters brand and family of products and in so doing assist the Client Service Management internal team to promote additional revenue-generating services.
* Act as a conduit with TR Product and Content teams to cultivate pro-actively product improvements based on actual client feedback and experience.

**Technical /Professional Skills & Competencies:**

**Essential Skills:** 

* Relevant subject matter expertise and industry knowledge of OneSource direct tax products (OTP, OCT, etc.)
* Experience of working on technology implementations including solution design, deliverables, stakeholder management and project communication.
* A strong focus on customer service, collaboration and a desire to exceed customer expectations.
* Good understanding of principles, theories, practices and techniques for managing project work load and analysis needed for key deliverables.
* Can visualize and communicate more than one technical solution to a problem or an issue.
* Adaptable and flexible in juggling workloads across multiple products or work streams.
* Good communication skills, oral and written, are considered key due to the client-facing nature of the role.
* Shows signs of leadership skills and the ability to influence others. Ability to work as part of a team or independently, if required.

**Desired Skills:** 

* Some understanding of programming languages, such as Visual Basic would be advantageous plus a working knowledge of XML. Strong Excel skills would be desirable.

**Education/ Certifications:** 

* Good academic track record and educated to degree standard
* CA Inter or CA qualified, MBA(Finance), PGDM (or similar recognized professional qualification)

title: Rédacteur juridique en fiscalité
Banco de Talentos Afirmativo para Pessoas Negras
description:
**Banco de Talentos Afirmativos para Pessoas Negras**

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

Somos mais de 25.000 pessoas colaboradoras trabalhando em mais de 75 países em uma empresa reconhecida por seu ambiente de trabalho inclusivo, flexível e que celebra sua diversidade e como uma empresa global, investimos em ações para promovermos um ambiente de trabalho cada dia mais diverso e inclusivo na Thomson Reuters. Acreditamos que a diversidade de nossos talentos, ideias e experiências é a nossa verdadeira força e é por meio de um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo, que todas as pessoas são felizes, valorizadas e têm a oportunidade de atingir seu potencial.

Sendo assim, lançamos este banco de talentos para pessoas negras, a fim de aumentar nossa conexão com esses talentos e poder aumentar a sua presença nos nossos processos seletivos e contratações. Temos também programas internos para o desenvolvimento profissional das pessoas negras colaboradoras, possuímos programas de carreira que contam com ferramentas de aprendizado, networking, mentorias e conteúdo para líderes para desenvolver as mentalidades de ser referência, cuidar e orientar os nossos colaboradores.

Para conhecer nossas iniciativas de Diversidade & Inclusão, acesse: <https://www.thomsonreuters.com.br/pt/sobre-nos/diversidade.html>

title: Senior Sales Executive, Mid-Law
description:
The Medium Law Firm Senior Sales Executive is responsible for selling Westlaw, Practical Law, HighQ and other products to the legal community within an assigned territory. This individual will leverage their expert consultative sales approach and honed professional demeanor to effectively manage complex relationships, while capitalizing on opportunities within Medium Law accounts. This is accomplished through an in-depth understanding of West products, sales techniques appropriate for a long sales cycle and the needs of the legal profession in order to bundle information solutions to meet broad firm needs.

**About the Role:**

* **Drive Results:** Identifies the best channel for engagement with customers, defaulting to virtual for the majority of deals where value is insufficient to warrant travel; Support in developing and executing territory growth strategies
* **Closing**: Prospect new customers, validate their needs, shape product plans and drive deals to close
* **Relationship Management**: Focus on new logo acquisition and mid-contract upsell/cross-sell opportunities and renewals
* **Product Proposition**: Possess core knowledge across products within the sub-segment and engage Sales Specialists where deep product expertise is required to drive to close
* **Reporting**: Utilize an automated and insight-driven Salesforce workflow to progress deals; KPI's include: Nurturing opportunities and moving more complex sales to close, i.e. New logo sales and existing ‘non-named’ account incremental sales
* **Client & Market Intelligence**: Understand specific customer archetypes and needs which are most prevalent within the sub-segment and territory

**About You:**

* Minimum 5 years successful sales experience in a consultative selling environment to C-level players
* 4 year college degree required
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Excellent communication skills and closing skills
* Effective time management skills
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
* Proficient in MS Office/Internet
* Working knowledge of West products, experience selling into large law accounts, and strong knowledge and background in the legal profession and/or legal publishing industry required
* High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting
* Proficient database management skills
* Law degree preferred
* Able to travel as required

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $136,500 - $253,500. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

As required by local legislation for this remote based role, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $132,300 - $245,700. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

title: India M&A and Deals Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for an experienced, driven and scoop-hungry journalist with a passion for breaking news and writing ahead-of-the-curve stories on India’s booming M&A and deals landscape. Based in Mumbai, Delhi or Bangalore, the reporter in this role will focus on cultivating sources with bankers, regulators, lawyers and company voices to break news on fund raises, deals and IPOs, as well as big-picture corporate stories. The position is a key role in a country where startups are clocking sky-high valuations as India is increasingly becoming a sought-after destination for foreign investors. The role will extend beyond breaking news to writing insightful, analytical and in-depth stories about trends in India’s corporate and deal-making landscape.

The successful candidate will have a proven track record in building sources, getting the inside scoops and a desire to work on deeply-reported stories. They will be part of a team of top-notch journalists who write about foreign and domestic companies, financial institutions, deals and regulations in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.

This is a terrific opportunity for a talented and ambitious journalist to make an impact on a competitive and high-profile beat with the world’s largest independent multimedia news organisation.

**About the Role**

As our **India M&A and Deals Correspondent,** you will:

-- Work closely with colleagues across the company news team in India and around the world to break news about upcoming deals, big mergers, investment banking trends and wrongdoings. 

-- Try and differentiate reporting by spotting trends, legal developments and regulatory problems that may affect deal-making. Dig deeper into how companies maneuver around such issues.

-- Be able to build a strong network of sources in India and abroad. 

-- Work on insightful and high-impact stories within the wider corporate finance news file.

-- Be able to take a global view to provide insights on the trends shaping financial services businesses in countries such as India and China. Closely track how big foreign investors  are eyeing the Indian market and companies.

-- Be able to work with multimedia teams including pictures, graphics and video to develop 360-degree storytelling.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **India M&A and Deals Correspondent** if you have:

-- Excellent source-building and writing skills, and a passion to own and lead big news developments.

-- Deep understanding of the business of financial services and companies, and the ability to explain it to a global audience.

-- A strong work ethic, and are a team player willing to collaborate with tips and ideas.

-- Fluency in English.

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

**-- Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities.

**-- Learning and Development**: We have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists.

**-- Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.

**-- Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team that provides unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organisations, industry events and directly to consumers. **Reuters: The Real World in Real Time**

title: Análista de Negócios
description:
**Analista de Negócios** 

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Analista de Negócio em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como Analista de Negócio, você irá:

* Essa posição normalmente gerencia um conjunto de contas nomeadas (em relação a um território geográfico) e é responsável por aumentar a receita e maximizar a satisfação do cliente.
* O colaborador cuidará de demandas de projetos específicos.
* Responsável por controlar contratos, garantindo o compliance e realizando as solicitações de pagamentos e recebimentos junto aos parceiros.
* Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com a unidade de negócios para criar processos de negócios novos ou aprimorados.
* Participar das principais reuniões de liderança e forneça atualizações.
* Planejar o estudo de problemas e procedimentos de trabalho, como fluxo de informações.
* Apresentar descobertas e soluções para a unidade de negócios e facilitar o acordo para seleção e implementação de soluções.
* Trabalhe com vários grupos para implementar soluções alinhadas com os objetivos estratégicos e que melhorem especificamente o fluxo de trabalho.
* Coordenar os esforços de teste e validação para garantir que as alterações de processo/sistema se integrem efetivamente ao processo geral de negócios.
* Consulte o pessoal envolvido para garantir o funcionamento bem-sucedido de sistemas ou procedimentos recém-implementados.
* Divulgue informações relevantes do projeto e colete feedback do usuário.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Graduação completa.
* Inglês Intermediário.
* Conhecimento em SQL, análise de dados e Excel avançado.
* Experiência com solicitações de pagamentos e recebimentos.
* Habilidade com números, análise de dados e cálculos.
* Disponibilidade para atuar híbrido em SP - Capital.

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: Ejecutivo de Ventas Senior
description:
***Territory Manager*** para ***Thomson Reuters Argentina***

¡Queremos que seas parte de nuestro equipo de **SMB** **Sales** en Thomson Reuters Argentina!

Buscamos una persona proactiva acostumbrada a trabajar por objetivos individuales y grupales. Que use su experiencia para conducir conversaciones exploratorias que le permitan identificar las necesidades del usuario.

Si te apasionan las ventas, la tecnología y el marketing digital esta es tu oportunidad de un nuevo desafío en una compañía tech. Aportar conocimiento e ideas, ser parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento y crecer profesionalmente junto a personas que aman lo que hacen.

**¿Cuáles son las principales responsabilidades?**

* Desarrollar nuevos negocios
* Realizar venta consultiva de nuestros productos intangibles tanto de forma telefónica o presencial
* Brindar demostraciones de los productos
* Prospección de nuevos clientes para ampliar cartera asignada
* Manejo y mantenimiento de cartera de clientes asignada

**Requisitos de la posición:**

* Poseer experiencia en ventas consultivas / intangibles (mínimo 2 años)
* Conocimientos de procesos administrativos
* Manejo de CRM (Salesforce deseable)
* Graduados de Cs. Económicas / Sistemas (deseable)
* Conocimientos de Office, especialmente Excel
* Idioma inglés (deseable)

***¿Qué te proponemos?***

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad)   
🏥 Pre paga para vos y tu grupo familiar primario  
💰 Subsidio internet mensual  
🚀 Flex my way (trabajá desde donde quieras dentro del pais – 8 semanas al año)  
🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)  
🎁 Day off cumpleaños   
🍴 Servicio de vending in office  
🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)  
⌨ Allowance Home Office (one time) – compra de equipamiento  
🌅 Viernes flex de verano  
💻 Equipamiento de trabajo  
 

Nos diferenciamos por tener una **cultura centrada en la diversidad e inclusión**, gran compromiso en el **respeto & bienestar** de los colaboradores, y por sobre todo, un **excelente clima laboral** para que disfrutes la experiencia de trabajar en Thomson Reuters.

**¡Súmate a nuestro equipo!**

title: Senior Event Coordinator - Thomson Reuters Foundation
description:
**Senior Event Coordinator – Thomson Reuters Foundation** 

**This full-time position will be based from our office in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.**

Are you highly organised? Looking for a role that grants responsibility from day one? If so, this may be the role for you. We're looking for a Senior Event Coordinator to join the Thomson Reuters Foundation's small but dynamic operations team and assist with the running of a series of exciting events. You'll be working across a unique organisation that combines the power of journalism and the law to advance **media freedom**, foster more **inclusive economies**, and **promote human rights**.

 

As a **Senior Event Coordinator**, you'll lead the planning and delivery of the organisation’s key events throughout the year, such as the **Trust Conference** and the **TrustLaw Awards** (as well as other key events throughout the year). Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, this is a great opportunity to land a hands-on role in a fast-growing corporate Foundation working on some of the world’s most pressing issues.

**The Role**

As a **Senior Event Coordinator** at the Thomson Reuters Foundation, you will: 

* Source venues and work closely with new and existing suppliers to run our events from conception to delivery (this could include organising catering, AV equipment and any other event collateral as required).
* Work with our Finance team to create and maintain events budgets (up to £200,000), ensuring that events are delivered within budget and that invoices are submitted efficiently.
* Communicate with speakers, tracking their logistical requirements, booking flights and accommodation and working with internal and external stakeholders as needed.
* Work with our Head of Communications to develop and deliver our event marketing strategies and creative content. This includes updating our website, managing our ticketing strategy and working with our Legal team to ensure our contracts are compliant and effective.
* Ensure our events run smoothly on the day. This includes managing volunteers, project managing our workflows and working closely with our CEO to establish the best and most effective Trust Conference content and speaker acquisition.​
To be our next **Senior** **Event Coordinator**, you will likely have: 

* Demonstrable experience in coordinating in-person and/or virtual events.
* Excellent organisational skills with the ability to prioritise effectively, work efficiently and juggle competing priorities; strong project management skills are desirable.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You'll also be comfortable liaising with a range of senior stakeholders both inside and outside the Thomson Reuters Foundation.
* An understanding of budget management and the importance of accurately reporting on expenditure.
* The ability to solve problems, work collaboratively with others and ensure deadlines are hit.​
* Experience in website management would be advantageous, as would experience with Cvent, Salesforce, Eventbrite & Zoom (advantageous). If you don't have experience with all of the above, we're still keen to hear from you!
 

**Please note: the deadline for applications is 23:50 (GMT) on Sunday 8th January 2023. Early applications are encouraged.**  
  

**What’s in it For You?**

At the Thomson Reuters Foundation, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth: 

* **Global Perspective and Impact**: Interested in working for a dynamic global organisation with a focus on social impact? With hubs all over the world from Bangkok to Madrid to Rio de Janeiro, join a truly international team with a shared goal of helping to build societies around the world that are free, fair and informed.
* **A Unique Approach**: Our expertise in media and the law is world class; we combine the power of both to address the critical issues faced by humanity.
* **Our Relevance**: With a focus on advancing media freedom, fostering more inclusive economies and promoting human rights, our work has never been more needed than right now.
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.
* **Learning & Development**: We are dedicated to the continual professional development of our employees and offer access to both in-house and external training opportunities.

**About the Thomson Reuters Foundation**

The [Thomson Reuters Foundation](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.trust.org%2F&data=02%7C01%7CJoanna.Uttley%40thomsonreuters.com%7C67c82a1ef32748f2655508d81f70a313%7C62ccb8646a1a4b5d8e1c397dec1a8258%7C0%7C0%7C637293915919654511&sdata=VY7pCJKJcDNw6oyawB26rbdNCfYjjw%2FGq8FiR74mRHk%3D&reserved=0) is corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. As an independent charity, registered in the UK and the USA, we work to advance media freedom, foster more inclusive economies, and promote human rights. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique media and legal services to drive systemic change. 

#LI-JB2
