title: Lead Implementation Consultant
description:
* **Client Service**  - working with clients on a range of different projects, delivering excellent client service
* Serve as a primary interface with client technical professionals.
* Perform process requirements (OTC, PTP) and analysis workshops with clients to define business, process, functional requirements and data element requirements.
* Consult and provide guidance with best process, for successful tax automation implementations.
* Partner with TRTA project resources, Partner project teams and Client project team members.
* Troubleshoot software and implementation issues, provide workaround and functional implementation guidance.
* Support customers in defining Indirect Tax use cases
* Performs technical or functional roles on projects led by a Thomson Reuters Project Manager, Partner Firm, and/or Customer.
* Engage as project lead/contributor on varying complexity type projects pertaining to the implementation of  Indirect Tax products.
* **Project Management** - plays a visible role in project planning sessions with team members. Works on, moderately complex projects/issues that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
* Manage project scope alignment, budget allocations, and build project documentation for configuration approvals, production cutover, and knowledge transfer; manage change documentation
* **Communications/Status Reporting** - effectively communicates findings and solutions to client. Prepares status updates for projects and regularly communicates and shares knowledge with the client and the team.
* **Leadership** -may provide direction and training to junior staff. May function in a team lead role, mentors across team.
* Lead analysis and delivery of ERP specific implementations that reflect an in-depth understanding of the client’s tax requirements and compliance process
* Makes recommendations for process improvement and ideas to immediate manager.
* Monitors costs of own work in alignment with project plan and may manage budgets for small projects or programs.
* Accountable for the quality of own work, delivered within agreed procedures and timeframes and focused on internal and/or external customer needs.
* Accountable for determining the approach used to address routine professional issues.
* Ability to work closely with technical staff to define and document user requirements and functional specifications
* Set-up, organize and lead business and user requirements sessions and formulate into design/solution documentation.
* Engagement with other Thomson Reuters teams as appropriate to deliver end to end Indirect Tax solutions
* Explain ONESOURCE Determination related issues/problems and solutions to Tax & technical staff
* Self-manage and complete assigned tasks working within a controlled project management environment

Qualifications
--------------

* Bachelor’s in CIS or Business (Finance or Accounting)
* Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
* Must be able to work effectively in a team environment
* Proficient in working with computers and standard business software like Microsoft Office
* Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently
* Creative problem solving skills
* Ability to work in a diverse work environment
* Fluent in English

Highly Desirable Skills/Experience
----------------------------------

* 6-8 years consulting experience.
* Experience implementing Enterprise Software
* Experience with process/software gap analysis and resolution
* Knowledge of APIs, Webservices (SOAP & REST), xml
* Experience integrating or working with third party enterprise tax products (e.g. ONESOURCE Determination, ONESOURCE Compliance, Abacus, Sabrix, Taxware and/or Vertex) is highly desirable
* Up to 10% of travel is expected.

title: Sales Operations & Excellence Manager
description:
**Sales Operations & Excellence Manager, LATAM Corporates**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience leading successful teams? If yes, we're looking for you.

Join our team to work with different business segments on sales-related matters, business policy, and procedural issues.

**About the Role** 

In this opportunity as a **Sales Operations and Excellence Manager,** you will: 

* Be a people leader role to support our sales Operations activities.
* Ensure consistent sales and account management communication and general support regarding proposal concepts, special offer negotiation, contract issues, pricing issues, and general sales/account management related matters, ensuring business policy and procedures are followed.
* Coordinate a team that will execute activities to support the Sales Team in contracts/addendum discussions/negotiations being the connection with the Legal area.
* Partner with Sales and Account Management leadership to determine overall operations needs and may represent Sales Operations on sales/account management related task forces.
* May assist in the development, administration and communication of the sales compensation plans and special incentives.
* Coordinate territory analysis, quota setting and compensation planning with Sales leadership.
* Build constructive relationships across the organization with key business partners including sales teammates, other sales teams, and other internal company departments.
* Support the Sales leadership in sales discussions and decisions using Sales Data / Business Intelligent.
* Be accountable for, with Sales leadership, to improve pipeline management

**About You:**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* +5 years of experience in similar positions.
* Excellent English, written and oral. Candidates will be tested before setting up an interview.
* Previous experience leading Sales Operations / Commercial Excellence structure and teams on multinational companies.
* Previous experience working in Technology Industry is highly desirable.
* Experience running SAP and SFDC is a must. Previous experience in SAP and SFDC implementation is highly desirable.
* Work experience using and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data (Sales Data).
* Previous experience pushing Sales Forecast supporting the business to go beyond their goals.
* Degree completed is mandatory and MBA/Post Graduation is desirable.
* Behaviors: Autonomy, Agile, Results orientation, People and Process oriented and compliance champion.

**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-JA1**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Manager, Corporates Legal Professional Services
description:
**Manager, Corporates Legal Professional Services**

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have experience driving software implementations and consulting services?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to ensure the provision of the best implementation and support for our information and profitably selected productized solutions offerings.  You will create and implement tools, processes, and working practices to improve staff effectiveness and efficiency and enable staff to deliver best-in-class service.

**About the Role**

In this role as a **Manager, Corporates Legal Professional Services**, you will:

* Provide leadership and management to team members.
* Mentor, develop, and retain existing team members by developing career opportunities and expanding responsibilities.
* Manage resource allocation across the Legal Tech implementation portfolio to ensure project delivery and staff utilization.
* Expand current materials, methodologies, and artifacts
* Evaluate and collaborate with partners for training delivery
* Contribute to ongoing refinement and development of operational requirements and standards.
* Collaborate with engagement managers, solution engineers, technical delivery, and senior leadership to ensure efficient implementation delivery, identify risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure customer satisfaction and project profitability
* Support the development of post-implementation offerings around business solutions consulting, ongoing training, and configuration consulting services to continually drive and improve customer usage and ensure customer operating efficiency
* Lead discovery efforts for new projects and provide support and escalation for team members on their specific projects as needed.

**About You**

You're a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience
* 5+ years’ experience within the Legal or Software Implementation field or a similar role
* Experience documenting and translating business requirements into functional specifications
* Demonstrated knowledge of the data requirements and workflows of business activities and their relationship to processing functions
* Excellent communication (oral / written) skills and the ability to interact with multiple teams and customers in a diverse setting encompassing both technical and non-technical users.
* Willing to work independently and/or as part of a team in an energetic, team-oriented environment managing implementations of varying size/complexity with a fast turn-around time.
* Ability to apply innovation, creativity, and improvement to the Legal Tech implementation process and to be able to manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Experience supporting the onboarding and mentorship of new team members
* Willing to travel to customer locations both domestically and internationally
* Ability to work under pressure while maintaining composure and professionalism and effectively manage multiple priorities
* Experience building and maintaining effective relationships with internal and external customers
* Experience in the Legal Industry, ideally with software implementations
* Team leadership experience
* Mentoring experience
* Experience in supporting or partnering with Sales or Customer Success/Support teams

**Location: CDMX**

title: Screening Support Specialist (Contract)
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your analytical experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to perform adverse media and negative news screening, research, and disposition activities to identify and act on potential risks? If you’re a team player with attention to detail and excellent customer service skills, then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

**About the Role**

In the opportunity as a Screening Support Specialist, you will

* Be responsible for maintaining the highest standards of compliance in support of our customers. You will contribute to a variety of areas including:
* High-volume screening, research, and disposition work related to risk affecting our customers (financial, legal, reputational, and more)
* Submitting model feedback to provide consistent performance over time
* Applying independent judgment in the identification and escalation of key BSA/AML risks
* Aiding in the creation of document procedures, policies, and processes as necessary
* Maintaining thorough documentation of the screening process and results
* Aiding in departmental reporting and tracking
* Manage screening cases in a timely and efficient manner
* Provide well-written and concise summations of investigation and analysis results
* Professionally assess and store sensitive information and analyses

**About You:**

You’re a fit for the role of Screening Support Specialist if your background includes:

* Strong ability to collaborate with a dynamic team and work independently in a production-driven environment
* Sound judgment that is based on all relevant and documented facts and considerations
* Ability to see through gray areas and assess AML-related risks
* Can recommend improvements to processes in areas of efficiency, control, and work product
* Ability to determine false positives and true matches with minimal supervision
* Can independently use organizational skills to prioritize workload under evolving deadlines
* Remains up to date on current legal and regulatory AML/BSA requirements
* Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance
* Excellent ability to multi-task and prioritize projects
* Ability to make decisions with ambiguous information in a timely manner
* Certified high school diploma or GED

Preferred Qualifications

* Certifications in any of the following or similar: Anti-Money Laundering Specialist Certification (CAMS), Transaction Monitoring Associate (CTMA) Certification, Fraud Examiner (CFE) Certification, Financial Crimes Specialists (CFCS) Certification
* One year of experience in the banking, insurance, accounting, fraud, and/or AML/BSA industries
* One year of investigative techniques experience within financial crimes/risk
* Public records content and/or screening experience
* Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree in Criminal Justice, Fraud Prevention, Finance, or a related field

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - Product Engineering
description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.   
  
As a  **“Senior DevOps Engineer”**  you will be responsible for building and supporting AWS  infrastructure used to host a platform offering audit solutions. This engineer is constantly looking to optimize systems and services for security, automation, and performance/availability, while ensuring solutions developed adhere and align to architecture standards. This individual is responsible for ensuring that technology systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values.

**About the Role :**

*As a Sr. DevOps Engineer, you will:* 

* **Develop and Deliver:** The person will also assist Developers with technical issues in the initiation, planning, and execution phases of projects. These activities include: the definition of needs, benefits, and technical strategy; research & development within the project life cycle; technical analysis and design; and support of operations staff in executing, testing and rolling-out the solutions.
* **Be a Team Player:** Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
* **Have an Agile Mindset:**  With a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines
* **Be Innovative:**You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
* **Be an Effective Communicator:** Through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

**About you:**

*You’re a fit for the role of Sr. DevOps Engineer if your background includes:* 

* Strong understanding of AWS cloud
* Strong understanding of CI / CD and Software Release Management concepts
* Ability to independently research and implement services on cloud platform and support the development teams as needed
* Strong understanding of scripting and experience with any CI/CD platform
* Strong understanding of monitoring with some exposure on setting up Production grade monitoring tools
* Available for on-call support as needed ( on rotation basis ) to ensure business continuity

**Must Haves:**

* Knowledge of AWS cloud platform – s3,cloudfront,cloudformation, RDS, Opensearch, Active MQ.
* Knowledge of CI/CD, preferably on AWS Developer tools
* Scripting knowledge, preferably in Python / Bash
* Have contributed as a DevOps engineer responsible for planning, building and deploying cloud-based solutions

**Good to have:**

* Experience with build and deploying dotnet core / java-based solutions
* Strong understanding on API first strategy
* Knowledge on building and deploying containers / Kubernetes. ( also, exposure to AWS EKS is preferable )
* Knowledge and some experience implementing testing strategy in a continuous deployment environment
* Have owned and operated continuous delivery / deployment.
* Have setup monitoring tools and disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Plan, deploy, and maintain critical business applications in prod/non-prod AWS environments
* Design and implement appropriate environments for those applications, engineer suitable release management procedures and provide production support
* Influence broader technology groups in adopting Cloud technologies, processes, and best practices
* Drive improvements to processes and design enhancements to automation to continuously improve production environments
* Maintain and contribute to our knowledge base and documentation
* Provide leadership, technical support, user support, technical orientation, and technical education activities to project teams and staff
* Manage change requests between development, staging, and production environments
* Provision and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements
* Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of automated processes
* Perform ongoing performance tuning, infrastructure upgrades, and resource optimization as required
* Provide Tier II support for incidents and requests from various constituencies
* Investigate and troubleshoot issues
* Research, develop, and implement innovative and where possible automated approaches for system administration tasks

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work**: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer, Commercial Excellence - Analytics**

Are you excited by the prospect of wrangling data, helping develop information systems/sources/tools, and shaping the way businesses make decisions? The Go-To-Market Data Analytics team is looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer who is motivated to deliver top notch data-engineering solutions to support business intelligence, data science, and self-service data solutions

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Data Engineer, you will:

* Design, develop, optimize, and automate data pipelines that blend and transform data across different sources to help drive business intelligence, data science, and self-service data solutions
* Build workflows that source, transform, and load data that’s both structured and unstructured keeping in mind data security and access controls
* Code, test, and document new/modified systems to create robust solutions for data analysis
* Contribute to the strategy and architecture of data management systems and solutions
* Proactively troubleshoot issues to help data engineers, data scientists, and data visualization experts
* Design reports and dashboards for management with confidence and accuracy
* Seamlessly work with various business stakeholders, understand their needs, and design custom solutions

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Data Engineer if your background includes:

* Strong skills in querying languages like SQL and relational databases is required
* Graduates in data analytics, data science, computer science, information systems, mathematics, or other data centric disciplines
* 1+ years’ experience in data engineering, database administration, or similar data centric disciplines
* Experience using Alteryx, AWS Glue, AWS DataBrew, dbt or similar ETL and data blending solutions
* Experience using on-prem data warehouse solutions such as Oracle or SQL Server or Cloud based solutions such as Snowflake and Redshift
* Has built data pipelines and other custom automated solutions to speed the ingestion, analysis, and visualization of large volumes of data

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Regional Sales Manager, Mid-Size Law Firms
description:
The Regional Manager, Sales for the MLF Channel is responsible for leading a team that will drive channel revenue growth via acquisition of new customers, as well as up selling and retaining existing customers. This position will be responsible for maintaining fully staffed territories and supporting related recruiting and hiring activities. This position is responsible for providing effective coaching, training and performance management to Account Executives in the areas of new products, sales skills, productivity tools as well as professional development.

****About the Role****

As the **Regional Sales Manager**, you will:

* Achieve new sales quotas and renewal targets to reach set growth goals. Drive online revenue growth goals by incorporating the Client Management associates in a partnership role that enhances the customer’s experience
* Ensure that all territories are fully staffed. Participate in all related recruitment efforts for assigned territories
* Hire qualified employees with strong skill sets in sales, product and market knowledge; Help maintain a qualified sales bench of candidates to expedite the hiring process and to minimize open territory coverage impact
* Provide performance coaching and job training to direct reports to assist in meeting and exceeding sales quotas. Participate in field rides and provide guidance through on the job training
* Manage regional territory effectively and efficiently. Maintain monthly reports on pipeline activity, field rides, expenses and employee performance
* Team with Inside Sales, NPD, Strategic Marketing, Central Marketing, SAM Training and other organizations in order to optimize achieving sales revenue and growth responsibilities as well as Pilot participation
* Ensure positive and effective relationships are established and maintained with customers. Assists in customer escalation issues and provides customer relationship support as needed
* Participate with and partnering with the Quality Assurance team to assure that our customers experience is without compromise
* Manage travel & expense budgets for manager and all direct reports, as well as the regional budget; Tracking monthly growth goals, renewal and revenue

****About You****

You're a fit for the role if you have:

* Four year degree or equivalent experience; MBA and or JD a plus
* 5-7 years experience with successful sales in Business to Business marketplace
* Sales management experience, preferably in the legal market
* Experience with Coaching Sales Process, product training and professional development

Our ideal candidate will also possess:

* Excellent Leadership skills with a proven track record of sales success, creative and adaptable with the ability to effectively coach and lead in a changing environment; Adept at forecasting monthly goals
* Excellent knowledge and understanding of products and services for the Small Law Channel. Strong understanding of the market.
* The ability to use financial tools to assist in planning, forecasting and productivity improvement
* Effective coaching abilities, managing overall performance; ability to demonstrate and teach related job skills to optimize employee’s performance
* A strong understanding of the law firm’s overall business; ability to listen effectively and obtain necessary information on law firms
* Ability to utilize appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with employees, customers and internal partners; interacts with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in one’s intentions
* Strong negotiation skills by effectively exploring alternatives and positions to reach outcomes that gain the support and acceptance of all parties
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills: verbal, written and presentation

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Solution Architect - AWS/GCP & Java/Python & Data Engine
description:
Must have Skills
----------------

* Cloud Solution Architecture (Data focused apps)
* Data Lake (experience building and working with)
* Big Data (BigQuery, Hadoop etc.)
* Advise/Consult/Mentor
* APIs, REST, OData
* POC
* Python/Java/SQL
* Communication

Good to have
------------

* Familiar with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI)
* Operational Data Processing Systems (ONESOURCE Data Hub)
* Data Governance (fundamentals)

**Description**

* Provides technical oversight while writing new software, making modifications to existing software, or integrating software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications, often created with their leadership.
* Defines and leads overall testing requirements and strategies ensuring software fully meets business, technical and operational requirements.
* Explores design options and leads the creation of design and accountable to ensure business and technical requirements are met.
* May provide technical support to customer or operations teams.
* Accountable for the creation, review, and maintenance of all required technical documentation/ manual related to assigned software to ensure supportability and reuse.
* Gives advice to middle management on functional matters, or on the interpretation of policies and practices.
* Reviews work of peers and more junior developers
* Provides technical or general guidance to team members as well as across teams in area of subject matter expertise by possessing in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline or area.
* May act as point of contact or a subject matter expert for technical issues for a specific work stream within a larger project.
* May lead and manage the day-to-day activities of their team including supporting career development of team (objective setting, performance management, etc.)
* Assigns and monitors results of members of their team.
* Participates in employment decisions and salary recommendations as appropriate.
* May be responsible for day-to-day management of one or more outsource team and may have some responsibility for managing third party deliveries.
* Provides wider feedback into performance with a special focus on technical competencies
* Provides technical mentorship and coaching to junior members of the technical staff.
* Assists in identification and implementation of short-term and long-term solution options, including risk assessments, and recommendations to business and technology leadership.
* Proactive identification of change or assists with improvements to prevent problems, including problem resolution workflow.
* Leads or participates in remediation of solutions.
* May drive and implement recommended solutions and follows up with business leaders and/or customers to ensure expectations are met.
* Accountable for immediate response to problems and sets expectations and timeframe for resolution with customers or groups managing customers.
* May lead a small project.
* Provides technical leadership, and may lead project planning sessions with team members to define and analyze development requirements, provide design option, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
* Provides work breakdown and estimates for complex software development tasks.
* Develops milestones and dependencies for realistic estimates required for own work, and may validate other team members' estimates.
* Coordinates and supports related groups, such as but not limited to documentation teams, quality assurance teams, customer support teams or operations/deployment teams.
* Provides timely status updates for areas of team responsibilities within projects to management potentially including senior leaders, initiating escalation when necessary.
* Facilitates discussions, actively listens, identifies, and communicates issues.
* Adept at all aspects of technical communications, including using presentations technologies (e.g. WebEx, PowerPoint) and software demonstrations.
* Designs and delivers demonstrations of software to business and technical stakeholders.
* Creates and delivers presentations with guidance as directed.
* Encourages two-way communication with staff, peers, and business partners
* May contribute to, or create, and execute communication plan.
* Ensures self and team develop software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.
* Researches and identifies standards and best practices as appropriate for discipline

title: Sustainable Business Officer - Thomson Reuters Foundation
description:
**Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer- Thomson Reuters Foundation**

**This 2-year FTC will be based at our office in Canary Wharf, London with hybrid working available.**

**About the Thomson Reuters Foundation**

Are you passionate about sustainable business? Interested in the ways in which technology can change society? Are you keen to make a difference to societies on a global scale? If so, this may be the role for you.

The Thomson Reuters Foundation is the corporate foundation of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information services company. We believe that societies around the world should be free, fair, and informed. We work to advance media freedom, raise awareness of human rights issues, and foster more inclusive economies. Through news, media development, free legal assistance and convening initiatives, we combine our unique services to drive systemic change.

We're seeking a **Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer** to sit within our **Inclusive Economie****s** team, a dynamic and growing team within the **Thomson Reuters Foundation**. This team forms the hub of expertise on responsible and sustainable business practices as well as the impact of technology on society for the Foundation. Additionally, the team leads on engaging and convening key stakeholders, bringing together thought leaders across sectors to create a collaborative ecosystem. We work across the Foundation teams employing a unique blend of our expertise in journalism, media development, legal research and convenings. We seek to foster responsible and sustainable business practices, raise awareness of the impact of technology on society, data privacy and data-led discrimination.

​

**About the Role** 

As **Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer** at the **Thomson Reuters Foundation**, you will:

* Work closely with the Foundation’s project managers to deliver and manage the ‘responsible and sustainable business model’ pillar. To do this, you'll focus on projects addressing labour rights, just transition and the 'S' in ESG in countries such as I**ndia, Malaysia, Thailand, Bangladesh** and **Colombia**.
* Oversee the content and strategic delivery of multi-stakeholder and private sector convenings. Here, you'll research and map trends to deliver outstanding and relevant content for programmes and convenings.
* Develop and oversee the drafting of papers for convenings and thought leadership activities.
* Identify key speakers and prepare briefings and questions for panels and convenings.
* Develop private sector engagement strategies for different projects and across the Foundation.
* Build excellent relationships with key stakeholders, both internal and external, including expanding our network of responsible businesses and expert NGOs.
* Feed into global initiatives such as our Trust Conference as well as other global convenings and outputs, in addition to project design and fundraising proposals.
* Feed into the development of the Inclusive Economies team’s private sector engagement strategy, templates, and map processes to build successful relationships with the private sector.

**About You** 

As **Responsible and Sustainable Business Officer** you may have experience in the following areas:

* Knowledge and enthusiasm about business and human rights (fair labour practices, inequality, sustainability, and just transition). Understanding of international standards on business and human rights and climate.
* Excellent programme design and organisational skills including the ability to manage effectively multiple matters and projects in a fast-paced environment, with a high degree of creative and flexible thinking
* Experience in researching topics, speakers and key issues on business and human rights and responsible and sustainable business. Ability to scope research and delivery partners and oversee their work providing timely and strategic feedback.
* Excellent oral and written communications skills (including report writing, brief writing and editing skills) with excellent attention to detail.
* Extensive experience in scoping and developing opportunities and partnerships with the private sector, engaging them in multi-stakeholder convenings around good practices to implement change.
* Experience in ESG with a focus on social issues.

**Please Note: Completed applications must be submitted by 23:59 on Sunday 15th January 2023.**

**What’s in it For You?**

At the Thomson Reuters Foundation, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Perspective and Impact**: Interested in working for a dynamic global organization with a focus on social impact? With hubs all over the world from Bangkok to Madrid to Rio de Janeiro, join a truly international team with a shared goal of helping to build societies around the world that are free, fair and informed.
* **A Unique Approach**: Our expertise in media and the law is world class; we combine the power of both to address the critical issues faced by humanity.
* **Our Relevance**: With a focus on advancing media freedom, fostering more inclusive economies and promoting human rights, our work has never been more needed than right now.
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits.
* **Learning & Development**: We are dedicated to the continual professional development of our employees and offer access to both in-house and external training opportunities.

#LI-JB2

title: Materials Management Associate - 1st shift
description:
We are hiring a **Materials Management Associate** for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a Materials Management Associate, you will be responsible for working as a member on our Core Publishing Solutions team performing tasks relating to warehousing, order fulfillment, inventory control and returns while utilizing ERP and other systems to ensure accuracy of inventory and delivery of a quality product to the customer. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months (excludes internal employees).

**Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* Monday - Friday from 6:30 am - 2:30 pm

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as a **Materials Management Associate,** you will be responsible for:   

* Safely operating powered material handling equipment in the course of completing work tasks.
* Tasks may include one or more of the following:
* Utilizing ERP (e.g., SAP, MII) and/or radio frequency (RF) equipment to obtain information or entering transactions regarding material/product movement activities.
* Picking, sorting or packing picked items in appropriate packaging; ensuring that the product arrives to the customer in quality condition.
* Monitoring, stocking and transporting materials or finished goods to designated area or assigned storage location.
* Inventory materials and finished goods and maintaining records, rejecting unsatisfactory items as needed.
* Researching and processing returns, accurately recording information in ERP and determining whether product should return to stock based on quality.
* Providing data to internal departments as requested.
* Accurately documents activities on Tier Boards.
* May operate 2-way radio for communication.
* Performing daily maintenance and changing batteries if needed.
* Actively participating in company safety program to ensure compliance and contribute to safety culture.
* Meeting or exceeding established quality and productivity standards utilizing standard work procedures.
* Implementing, performing and sustaining housekeeping procedures to maintain work area and equipment.
* Recommending process improvements; implementing process improvements.
* Participating in project teams as needed.
* Other duties as apparent or assigned.

**About You:** 

You’re a fit for the role of **Materials Management Associate** if your background includes:

**Education:** (minimum requirements)

* High School Diploma or general education degree (GED) required.

**Experience:**

* 1-2 years’ experience
* Some experience working in a shipping, receiving and/or warehouse environment
* Preference for experience with enterprise resource systems (e.g., SAP)
* Preference for previous lift truck experience

**Knowledge and Skills:**

* Able to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, equipment displays, operating and maintenance instructions, and production orders
* Able to be certified and operate power material handling equipment
* Basic math skills
* Basic computer skills
* Able to work overtime and flex schedule as required to meet customer demand
* Able to lift up to 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time
* Able to send and receive oral communications via 2-way radios
* Demonstrated ability to work well independently or in a team environment

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year (excludes internal employees)
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-JK3

title: Senior HR Advisor, Korea
description:
We are currently hiring a Senior HR Advisor role and the incumbent will be part of the North Asia regional HR team. This is a critical position in supporting the daily HR operations in our Seoul office.

**About the Role**

The role will include the below duties:

* Point of reference for policy, process and application in all HR disciplines, and work closely with HRBPs to resolve queries.
* Responsible for all HR Operations transactions which includes payroll instructions, benefits administration, time off and leave accrual data to Finance when required and submission of all Government Paid Leave claims e.g. Maternity, Childcare, Adoption etc.)
* Work with Hiring Manager, HRBP and Talent Acquisition Partner to support local recruitment activities and process.
* Manage the hiring and onboarding activities to provide positive employee experience.
* Host new joiner induction with HRBPs and Senior Managers.
* Coordinate and organize employees’ wellbeing and engagement events.
* Conduct inclusive workplace training and other mandatory training.
* Support HRBP and managers on employee relations and grievances matters.
* Conduct data gathering exercises for benefits review and insurance renewal.
* Update and maintain the Rules of Employment, HR information site and internal system.
* Support the Site Leader on the Management Council and keep meeting minutes.
* Perform periodic check and update of documents and records in preparation for labor official visits.
* Contribute to HR project, from time to time, as a team member, and may take ownership of certain elements of the project, providing support and input to actions and overall objectives.
* Provide general and daily HR support to local employees, and from time to time supporting the wider North Asia region as well.

**About You**

You’ll be a good fit for the role if you have the below:

* A Degree with a focus on HR is preferred, or any relevant Business degrees.
* At least 5 years of experience in HR or other experience in a large complex organization.
* Ability to understand and work effectively in complex multinational business environments.
* Commercial acumen with good problem solving and numerical ability.
* Ability to juggle multiple tasks at once and be flexible and resilient in a changing environment.
* Strong organisational skills, prioritization skills and excellent attention to detail.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Microsoft Word, Excel).
* Knowledge of, and practical experience with, Workday or another HRIS system is desirable.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills are a must.
* A self-starter, strong problem solving skills, collaborative and strong team player.
* Ability to work flexibly and globally with people at all levels in order to provide an optimal customer experience.

**What’s in it For You**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** A hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
This team player will seek out, identify, create and pursue new opportunities with our Legal, Tax and HR product line in the realm of course adoptions within the Ontario, Canada academic marketplace. They will participate in sales discussion meetings. Typical engagements will be with faculty, institutional departments within the schools, law school environments and bookstores. Candidates must demonstrate excellent communication and relationship-building skills as well as proficiency in technology.

**About the Role**

* Work closely with professors in law, tax and human resources programs at the University & College levels with the goal of gaining adoptions of Thomson Reuters academic textbooks;
* Drive new sales and revenue (90% of responsibility) by identifying and prospecting for new opportunities in the Ontario, Canada academic marketplace;
* Understand the campus environment and the ability to negotiate at all levels campus libraries, bookstores and Faculty members
* Work with internal partners to ensure the timely delivery of texts;
* Report weekly/monthly on all sales activity, market trends, competitor information, etc.;
* Continuously updating job knowledge/competencies by participating in skill development/educational opportunities.

**About You**

* University degree or equivalent business experience;
* 3-5 years+ experience in sales, preferably in the academic marketplace. Knowledge of legal considered an asset;
* Advanced verbal, written and presentation skills, Bilingulism ( French / English a plus);
* Strong influencing skills
* Excellent organizational skills and the ability to multi-task when working with dozens of active prospects;
* A high-level of responsiveness while efficiently marshalling prospects through the sales cycle;
* Ability to work independently from a home office and occasionally attend conferences with some overnight travel;
* Experience using customer relationship management (CRM) systems (i.e. Salesforce.com).

needs. If requested, accommodation will be provided throughout the recruitment and assessment process.

title: API Engineer – Reuters Technology
description:

* Executes on technology strategies.
* Primary area of influence is within own team and some influence on other teams.

title: Manager / Sr. Manager Finance
description:
DSIG is responsible for financial reporting, financial processes, and analytics, supporting all the segments of Thomson Reuters across the different functions. We drive business partnership, standardization, and automations across the groups – leveraging latest technology to drive efficiencies and ensuring best practice sharing across the business, for higher effectiveness. In addition, this team drives informational analysis and reporting to support Business decisions and strategies.

**Background**

**Qualifications:** Qualified CA, MBA Finance preferred

**Experience:** 10 to 15 years of corporate experience in finance/analytics

**Competencies**

* Good communicator
* Careful planning to achieve accurate and timely results
* Eye for Detail
* Ability to work with Global teams
* Ability to manage multiple stakeholders
* Self-motivated / Result oriented / Open to learning new technologies
* Managing small teams (as required by role)
* Interpersonal Skill to Guide and Motivate team members

**Skill set** 

* Good knowledge of Finance and Accounting
* Good Knowledge of MS office- Excel, Power Point
* Knowledge of SAP, Financial Planning Tools - e.g., Hyperion, OneStream (desirable)
* Knowledge of automation and visualization tools – VBA/Alteryx/Python/Power BI/Tableau (desirable)

**Responsibilities/tasks**

* P&L Ownership for Segments/ Functions
* Lead a team (based on role requirements)
* Generate and disseminate actionable business insights to help accomplish management objectives
* Ensure timely preparation of Management review decks and follow through on the decisions taken
* Drive all Planning processes – Forecasts, Annual Operating Plans and Strategic Planning -- and ensure that all operational/business decisions/events are properly reflected in financial metrics
* Working closely with Segment and Finance leaders to build Annual plan and forecasts.
* Standardize reporting across all segments to move towards self-service reporting
* Support segments on their Expenses & Investment, Sales & Revenue reporting, and analytics
* Provide end-to-end Business partnership to help segments drive strategic initiatives.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

Thomson Reuters provides knowledge to act: we deliver information quickly and efficiently so professionals can make decisions that matter. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the legal, tax and accounting, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization. We aim to provide every one of our employees with a positive working environment, continued professional development and a commitment to work-life balance and equal opportunities. We are also part of a vast network of global career opportunities and actively encourage development of staff in the business.

This position will allow you the opportunity to expand your technical skills while networking with professionals in Data Center operations, technology development and project management teams.

**In this opportunity as a Site Reliability Engineer, you will:**

* **Develop, Deliver and Support:** applying modern SRE operational & development practices, you will be involved in the entire operational support, Monitoring, automation, building and delivering high quality solutions for the team.
* **Be a Team Player:** Working in a collaborative team-oriented environment, you will share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams
* **Be an Agile Person:**  with strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment, you will deliver solutions against strict timelines.
* **Be Innovative:** you are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries
* **Be an Effective Communicator:** through active engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team members, you will effectively articulate ideas and collaborate on technical developments

**The ideal candidate will be:**

* Keen to learn complex architectures and come up to speed quickly.
* A self-learner, self-driven and able to operate with minimal supervision.
* Able to demonstrate ownership on accountabilities.
* Able to successfully communicate with business partners, management and technical team members.
* Proactive in raising problems and identifying solutions.
* Strong sense of customer service.
* Able to work in a highly collaborative team setting.
* Approaching work with a DevOps and continuous improvement mindset

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Represent operations in a technical fashion to leadership and development teams.
* Engagements that evolve the stability, scalability, and supportability with development and other operations team to continue evolving our monitoring and operational procedures for the architecture.
* Contribute and develop documentations on Application services, infrastructure details, Recovery Procedures, Root cause analysis and post incident review.
* Perform change management functions involving software deployment and server maintenance requests.  Documenting the change procedures/instructions and present in change advisory board meetings for necessary approvals.
* Respond and mitigate incidents as they occur within the environment.
* Security best practices for cloud
* Demonstrate high-proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications.
* Preference to work in an Agile environment, committed to continuously improve that environment.
* Familiar with software development and QA practices (e.g. Agile)
* Perform periodic on-call duty on a rotational basis.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* College degree
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in an enterprise level operations support role OR DevOps role.
* Expertise in Linux system administration, Java based applications, databases (relational and NoSQL), Web Servers (Apache, IIS), networking and storage technologies.
* Experience with Load balancers and AWS services such as AWS Docker and Kubernetes, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CodeDeploy, DynamoDB, Lambda, SQS, ECR, Fargate, Elastic Search, AWS Cognito, CloudFront, networking concepts etc.,
* Continuous delivery and Infrastructure automation tools such as AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeCommit, Git, CloudFormation, Jenkins, Ansible, terraform, AzureDevOps etc.,
* Ability to manage/support the centralised logging (ELK), performance metrics, event monitoring for infrastructure and cloud services via (Datadog)
* Ability to code in one of the programming languages (Java, C#, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
* Working knowledge of ITIL Change and Incident management processes.
* Working experience with tools such as PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Datadog.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong collaboration skills.

title: Assistant Manager Techno-Finance-Alteryx & FP&A
description:
**Qualifications****:** Bachelor's/Master’s degree in finance, accounting, business and/or Chartered Accountant, MBA

**Experience:** 7+ years of corporate experience in Finance Domain

**Job Summary:**Lead one of the functions within FP&A teams to enable planning and reporting function realize its vision of delivering high quality and timely insight, planning and reporting activities that add value to business. Looking for Individuals who translate the strategy into action, executing their relevant plans brilliantly and are the ‘go to’ people for their function. This position will be a critical business partner and a part of the leadership team.

**Competencies:**

* Excellent communication skills, ability to influence teams , leadership and stakeholder to achieve common vision and agenda
* Business acumen and understanding of organizational/ functional issues and challenges
* Ability to integrate & manage systems, tech and people
* Finance and Accounting skills (Advanced)
* Highly organized and self-directed individual, with strong interpersonal skills
* Agility / ability to quickly adapt to change
* Analytical thinking to interpret various input, build requirements, and partner to solve business problem

**Skills Set:**

* Good knowledge of Finance and Accounting
* Good Knowledge of MS office- Excel, Power Point
* Knowledge of SAP (desirable)
* Knowledge of BI and automation tools – VBA/Alteryx/Power BI/ Tableau (desirable)
* Good understanding of Financial systems, data inter-dependencies across numerous systems

**Scope and Impact:**

* Exceptionally strategic, analytical, and focus on providing data driven business and financial insights to the relevant stakeholders that will enable sound decision making.
* Work with the stakeholders and partners to constantly find opportunities, and ensure proactive solution building and delivery
* Build robust processes to ensure 100% accuracy and timely analysis
* Drive projects that provide answers to strategic and tactical business questions
* Quickly grasp the business problem and translates into tangible, usable actionable outputs
* Recommending suitable approach to problem solve based on facts, figures, data. Ability to story- tell with impact (why/what/how) enabling decision making and influence

**What’s in it for you:**

* You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community

description:

Location: Hyderabad/Bangalore

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Minimum 5+ years working/implementation experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
* implementation experience with EPM tools such as One Stream, Oracle Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) /Oracle Hyperion Planning & Budgeting (PBCS/EPBCS)/Essbase.
* OneStream experience is preferred.
* Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for the insights that result from those analyses, together with a strong understanding of the data and collection processes needed to fuel that analysis.

* Ability to design Forecasting models based on various methodologies like Driver based, ZBB etc.

title: Business Development Manager, Risk ANZ
description:
Are you keen to sell financial crime solutions into the corporate / government sectors? Do you have a solid Risk, Fraud & Compliance sales background in ANZ?

We are looking for a Business Development Manager, Risk to develop new businesses for our Risk, Fraud & Compliance solutions in Financial Crime across Australia and New Zealand.

The successful candidate will work alongside top-notch mentors and supportive colleagues in a global company.

**About the Role**

As a Business Development Manager, Risk, you will:

* Drive new business to hit sales targets throughout the year.
* Collaborate with the Pre-Sales function and the Risk team to target and develop sales territories and opportunities in order to attain assigned sales objectives
* Assist in scoping and managing the delivery of proof-or-concept work, in partnership with analysis and technology leads, to prospective clients
* Support conducting product and solutions demonstrations for both technical and decision-making audiences
* Respond quickly to new leads and working with urgency to progress deals through the sales cycle.
* Understand customer requirements / needs and find the best solution within Thomson Reuters Services capability to develop a suitable and strong proposal which can create difference from competitors.
* Effectively plan, coordinate and control your territory.
* Keep up to date with news and changes in policy, regulations and activities of major players in the industry to have sufficient domain knowledge to lead discussion with customers and present expertise in public.
* Use CRM system to maintain customer and opportunity data with discipline to enhance customer insight and ensure accurate forecasting.

**About You**

You will be successful as a Business Development Manager, Risk if you:

* Have a proven track record in achieving sales targets and the ability to prospect, develop and close strategic relationships and customer opportunities to achieve sales.
* Have the ability to engage with C-level decision makers.
* Are highly-motivated to work with internal and external customers and stakeholders to meet client needs and expand their relationships
* Get excited about speaking to new people, presenting complex ideas, and have excellent writing skills
* Enjoy working in a role where each client engagement is different and often requires a new solution or a significant re-think of existing processes
* Have a passion for working with an international team with varied backgrounds
* Are a team-player with a strong organisation skills and can manage tasks across multiple workgroups, while logging and monitoring information in systems like Salesforce.com
* Have a minimum of 5 years in sales, sales engineering, intelligence analysis, or other related discipline either commercially or within government.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-NT1

title: EMEA FX Analyst, FXBuzz
description:
Reuters is looking for an experienced trader or analyst to cover the foreign exchange market for professional clients of the Reuters FXBuzz service. The global service provides commentary that runs the gamut from blow-by-blow intra-day updates to sweeping macro think pieces. We’re looking for someone who knows the foreign exchange market inside and out and can generate original, high-level ideas on the direction of majors and select emerging market currency pairs.

Based in London, the **EMEA FX Analyst** will cover the majors and other currencies traded in the region, contributing intra-day updates in bullet format and short-form commentaries while also contributing content to the markets conversation in our live chat room for professional clients.

The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of the foreign exchange and other financial markets, technical analysis as well as factors that influence currencies, including interest rates, commodities, central banks and risk sentiment.

Writing experience and a track record of source building would be highly useful to the candidate.

**About the role**

As our **EMEA FX Analyst, FXBuzz** you will:

* Cover the majors and select emerging markets currencies
* Write short, intra-day market updates in bulleted format
* Generate original analysis for forward-looking commentaries about market direction
* Develop compelling charts to tell the markets story
* Build a strong network of market sources
* Write longer form analyses when asked

**About You**

To be our **EMEA Senior FX Analyst, FXBuzz** you are likely to have: 

* At least seven years’ experience in financial markets trading or analysis
* Knowledge of technical analysis
* Deep understanding of the foreign exchange market and its influences
* The ability to collaborate with a global team of analysts
* The ability to write quickly about a wide range of currencies and the factors affecting them

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Business Development Manager, Global Trade Solutions
description:
Are you keen to resolve global supply chain disruptions through software digitization?

We are looking for a Business Development Manager to develop new businesses for our ONESOURCE Global Trade Solutions business segment. The successful candidate will be working alongside a supportive and growing team within a global company.

**About the Role**

As our Business Development Manager, Global Trade Solutions, you will:

* Grow sales in collaboration with territory managers, solution consultants to deliver gross sales within Japanese automotive industry
* Drive the entire sales process ranging from lead generation to deal closure, with major emphasis on opening up new business, both within existing accounts and new customers
* Keep abreast of the FTA/EPA related news especially those which will have direct impact towards automotive industry
* Draft and prepare proposal documents
* Assist in key retention situations as required
* Ensure timely reporting of the sales activity and maintaining salesforce.com updated at all times for accurate forecasting

**About You**

As our Business Development Manager, Global Trade Solutions, you should ideally possess:

* Relevant knowledge related to global trade (e.g. customs brokerage, import/export, FTA/EPA regulations, inventory management) and/or experience working in in either third-party logistics (3PL) or Japanese automotive industry, or B2B sales to professionals.
* Track record in a professional field sales or SaaS business development role is a plus
* Demonstrated understanding of the Japanese Corporate market
* Commercial acumen and ability to identify opportunities in white space
* Ability to partner effectively with the wider sales team and internal stakeholders
* Proficiency in native Japanese and business level English. Those who are keen to improve their English speaking in an international environment are welcomed to apply.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: E-Learning Lead Experience Developer
description:
This role will create all elements of digital learning content for the Sales Enablement department. They will work closely with the Instructional Design team taking the designs envisioned by that team to develop and then maintaining the final collateral. The content could be any mix of eLearning, Micro Learning, audio, video, animation, or other digital elements. The developers work as parts of a team containing project managers, instructional designers and other developers collaborating daily to complete tasks individually and as a group.  The learning content is delivered on several learning platforms, for example MindTickle, Seismic, SharePoint and Salesforce.com. The developer could also create media for vILT delivery as needed.

Developers should be able to use existing Articulate Storyline templates to develop content as well as create new engaging interactive learning using tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud suite, Rise, or Camtasia.

**Main responsibilities/Accountabilities:**

* Digital Content creation
* Content Maintenance
* Video and Audio Editing
* Graphical Layout
* Performance Support creation

**Key Skills for the role:**

* eLearning development
* Micro learning development
* Video and Audio editing
* Graphic design
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to team with many different roles
* Personal time management across multiple concurrent responsibilities
* ADDIE, SAM, or LLAMA design processes
* Rapid instructional development techniques
* Gamified learning development
* Experience with learning technology standards such as SCORM, xAPI
* HTML/CSS/XML/JavaScript a plus

**Experience and Qualification:**

* Minimum of **6 -8** years’ experience in digital learning content development
* Demonstrated experience using **Articulate Storyline** 360, Camtasia, and the Adobe CC Suite
* Microsoft Office skills, specifically PowerPoint
* Experience collaborating with team members and leadership in a corporate setting
* Highly motivated and able to work independently as well as in a team environment
* Use of graphic design applications to develop visually appealing and engaging experiences
* Experience developing eLearning with integrated gamification components
* User Experience Design a plus
* BS or BA required
