title: Banco de Talentos: Analista de Suporte Jr (Espanhol)
HR Operations Coordinator
description:
**HR Operations Coordinator**
-----------------------------

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just, and inclusive future?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to provide support for the Global HR operations team, undertaking various HR administrative duties and helping to define policies and processes for the area.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an **HR Operations Coordinator**, you will work:

* On self-managed squads with colleagues from a wide range of functions to develop and deliver solutions to critical business challenges in service of the People and Business Strategy.
* Provides operational support and advice to HR
* Works independently and closely with HR specialists to help resolve queries
* May work in an HR project where tasks are driven by the specifics of this HR Function
* Develops, and analyzes reports independently and works with the HR systems team accordingly
* Works with third-party vendors to ensure SLAs are met and the objectives align with the business
* Provides HR Administrative support to HR projects
* Respond to HR-related inquiries or requests and provide assistance
* Liaise with other departments or functions (payroll, benefits, etc.)
* Coordinate training sessions and seminars as needed
* Provide administrative support for new hires (I’9 and background check support)
* Produce and submit reports regarding HR activity
* Support other functions as assigned

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s Degree required
* Fluent English is a must.
* 1- 2 years of experience doing similar activities.
* Ability to understand business needs/requirements

title: Strategic Alliance Manager
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? We are seeking a Strategic Alliance Manager who is knowledgeable, capable and charismatic with proven experience working with the big four advisory firms and/or leading Channel and Re-Seller businesses in Japan. You will have demonstrable success in building and executing go-to-market strategies via partner models; focused on meeting corporate sales, revenue, operational and strategic goals.**About the Role**

As a Strategic Alliance Manager, you will:

* Execute on the overall company partnership model across all the business units of the organization to leverage the channel to new markets. Leverage the central Partnerships capability and the regions business units’ partnerships capability to help build on the current Partner relationships, engagement models and agreements.
* Develop knowledge and strategic relationships of selected partners to build the Partnerships channel of the business. Orchestrate sales, marketing, operations, learning and support to the Partners on the execution of the partner engagement model.
* Construction and enhancement of the partner ecosystem to leverage the cross sell, up sell, and competitor displacement opportunities. Business development skills, commercial acumen and market knowledge will be required.
* Build engines and connections on channel development, partner sales plan and partner ecosystem construction through the proper number of partners & channels, including sales, marketing, training, support.
* Partner with assigned enterprises to identify and deliver on potential new opportunities such as new market development, co-creation or new products and services. Ensure a robust governance model for these partnerships.
* Drive sales strategy and planning jointly with partners through strategic relationships, joint account planning and clear go to market approach. Increase partner reach, frequency and yield, as KPIs to achieve revenue and market share goals.

**About You**

As a Strategic Alliance Manager, you should ideally possess:

* Degree or Master’s in Business Administration with at least 10 years of business development and or sales/partnership experience with large enterprise technology companies in Japan.
* Strong executor of strategies within the Japan market to establish effective alliance with identified partners. Successful track record of developing new business and leading multiple strategic partnerships.
* Strong networks in the industry and evidence of long-term collaborative relationships with external customers and partners. Aptitude for identifying and solving customer problems through creative solutions using a consultative sales approach.
* Experience to leverage resources based on both influence and authority across business units, functions, regions, and within and outside of the company. Experience in dealing with C Level executives.
* Results oriented, performance driven, and team minded.
* Excellent spoken and written communication both in Japanese and English.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-DL2

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Sales Operations Specialist
description:
**Sales Operations Specialist** 

 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience aligning policies and procedures with sales teams?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to provide support to partner closely with Commercial Excellence and Finance to help deliver streamlined and dependable data at every stage of the sales process in a timely and accurate manner.

**About the role**

In this opportunity as a **Sales Operations Specialist**, you will:

* Directly support and enhance the timely delivery of operational reporting, that enables sales activities and drives sales effectiveness.
* Provide insightful data, reporting, and analytics that drive actionable insights to support and enhance the day-to-day activities of the Sales Organization.
* Develop and deliver valuable reporting insights to support the vision of Commercial Excellence and the broader TR Sales Organization
* Leverage Alteryx and other tools to create efficient and robust data lakes to support the needs of Commercial Excellence and the Sales Organization.
* Think strategically and creatively to find ways to streamline existing data to consolidate and simplify the Sales Organization key data elements.
* Proactively identify trends and future reporting needs and present ideas to CE Leadership for new areas of opportunity to drive value via reporting insights.
* Build dynamic tools to provide visibility to frontline sales leaders with ease of use, accuracy and timely reporting in mind.

**About you**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's degree.
* 3 to 6 years of experience doing similar activities.
* Fluent English is a must.
* Experience using current technologies such as Oracle and Alteryx.
* Understand the complexities of a large matrixed sales organization and be able to navigate to all areas within that organization to offer data and reporting solutions for all levels
* Experience analyzing data and metrics to tell a story that drives sales insights and action
* Experience supporting other Commercial Excellence initiatives as required.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-EG1
-------

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Lead Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

Ideally you are an ex-application programmer who moved to SRE/DevOps out of a love for automation and to satisfy your curiosity about computer systems. You will join and lead a team of passionate technologists dedicated to core SRE principles and building an exemplary technology organization.

  
The role of the Lead – Site Reliability Engineer is to be hands-on and provide mentorship to other team members on core SRE principles and tools. The lead SRE will participate in end to end operational aspects of Production environment. The individual concerned will be able to work on cloud systems, networks, databases and help drive incident lifecycle management. As a member of the SRE team, you will also be working closely with the Architects, DevOps, Product and development teams to ensure we get the most out of the software on AWS platform. This role requires a highly skilled technology professional with excellent communication skills, strategic mindset, strong analytical and troubleshooting skills on AWS Cloud Platform.

Other responsibilities include working with internal business partners to gather requirements, prototyping, architecting, implementing/updating solutions, building and executing test plans, performing quality reviews, managing operations, and triaging and fixing operational issues. Site Reliability Engineers must be able to adjust to constant business change; common types of changes include new requirements, evolving goals and strategies, and emerging technologies.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Be hands-on and provide mentorship to a growing SRE team on core SRE principles and tools.
* Foster a sense of automation in issue resolution; everything possible should be automated, and only when automation can’t resolve an issue should people get involved in the resolution
* Lead efforts for updating production with new versions/infrastructures as they are available
* Lead capacity planning efforts in collaboration with Architects and DevOps engineers to determine changes to infrastructure that are needed to support new load and performance characteristics
* Leads engagement with software developers, DevOps and other infrastructure engineers to integrate software development and delivery from inception to full operation, ensuring robust released software and systems.
* Ensure highest level of uptime to meet the customer SLA by implementing system wide corrections to prevent reoccurrence of issues.
* Mentor other SRE team members to further develop their soft and hard skills
* Triage, troubleshoot and resolve issues using golden signals and go past golden signals
* Go past golden signals with additional principles such as chaos engineering to detect failure points and lead Game days for testing resiliency of team when it comes to incident response and remediations and synthetic monitoring.
* Lead SRE team members to create and maintain Recovery Procedures, RCA’s in collaboration with other engineering teams.
* Ensure Incidents assigned to the team are being managed within agreed SLAs
* Ensure alarms are documented in up to date Knowledge Base Articles.
* Ensures Production infrastructure is up to date with server/security patches and certificates.
* Continuous improvement of system and application monitoring and automation
* Identify and automate manual workarounds and process improvements
* Proactive monitoring of Monitor the availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of all services
* Perform periodic on-call duty as part of the SRE team

**Qualifications**  
 

* Skilled with cloud operations/administration in Amazon AWS.
* Tax/Accounting domain experience
* Bachelors or Master’s in Computer Science discipline.
* 5+ years’ experience focussed on Site Reliability Engineering or related position in AWS Cloud Platform.
* At least 2 AWS Certifications are must. (AWS Sysops Admin and Architects certifications preferred).
* Experience working with SQL, Windows Servers, Load balancers, Linux
* Deep experience with AWS, Docker and Kubernetes, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CodeDeploy, DynamoDB, Lambda, SQS, Amazon FSX, Elastic Search and networking concepts are must.
* Program at a high level in at least one language such as: Java, C#, Javascript, Python or Ruby.
* Integration experience with PagerDuty, ServiceNow, Datadog, CloudWatch.
* Good understanding of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) philosophies, technologies, platforms and tools, SLO management, incident resolution, and automation;
* Ability to explain technical concepts in clear, non-technical language
* Working knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage, and networks)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards such as SOC/PCI is a plus

title: Digital Training Specialist
description:
**Digital Training Specialist**

We are seeking an ambitious Digital Specialist responsible for monitoring Thomson Reuters and market eLearning tools and making recommendations to improve customer learning outcomes.

Create and maintain all digital assets and eLearning modules by industry standards and by global Thomson Reuters assets.

Based waterside in Pyrmont, Sydney.

**About the role:**

* The primary objective of the Digital Training Specialist is to design, build and manage the ongoing iteration of eLearning tools for our legal and tax products, enabling strong customer success outcomes, client retention and new sales.
* The role works closely with the practice and platform trainers, proposition and product teams to maintain the currency and relevancy of the learning assets
* The role will be part of the Customer Training team and operates across Asia and Emerging Markets reporting to the Head of Customer Training LP, AEM.
* Ensure the training and support portals are maintained and working efficiently.
* Challenge the status quo and deliver “best practice” Adult learning outcomes

**About you:**

* Graduate or with two years of experience
* Instructional design qualification and/or production experience in eLearning and digital training assets.
* Ideally have training and/or Adult Learning qualifications
* Strong communication skills
* Experience in the design training programs.

**What’s in it For You**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** A hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como Analista de Suporte, você irá:

* Prestar suporte dos módulos relacionados à Folha de Pagamento e E-Social do Sistema Domínio, via Telefone
* Garantir clareza e assertividade nas informações passadas ao cliente
* Garantir eficiência no suporte prestado, bem como a resolução de problemas
* Conhecer a Jornada do cliente e os caminhos para cada necessidade apresentada
* Intermediar as solicitações de alterações e correções dos Produtos
* Praticar e promover os valores e comportamentos da organização
* Atualizar-se constantemente na evolução das soluções que oferecem os aos clientes e legislação vigente da área que atua
* 

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Curso técnico (completo ou cursando) ou cursando graduação em Recursos Humanos, Administração, Contabilidade ou áreas afins
* Experiência em Folha de Pagamento (Cálculo de folha, Férias, Rescisão, Encargos trabalhistas, e-Social, Informativos e entre outros)

* Conhecimento no Sistema Domínio
* Conhecimento na área Contábil
* Tenha trabalhado com metas

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.

* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. title: Systems Engineer
description:
* Primarily responsible for design, development, creation, or modification of computer systems or programs based on and related to user or system design.
* Primarily responsible for design, documenting, testing and modification of computer programs related to computer, server, or other devices operating system.
* Works to identify risks & issues following appropriate escalation procedures.
* Primarily responsible for developing, designing, or testing software applications including complex databases and web enabled applications or systems.
* Primarily responsible for developing or designing systems, networks, or applications
* Independently provides proactive problem management in order to deliver high service levels. May follow up on root cause analysis and resolution of problems.
* Provides a sound level of technical and subject matter expertise in one or more technologies and serves as a point of escalation for technical issues related to specialty.
* Provides detailed implementation/project plans across multiple, complex work streams according to agreed standards and ensures project processes and timelines are understood and followed.
* Collaborates on Technical Recovery plans, and takes part in technical recovery for major incidents within your defined area.
* Provides assistance for the reduction in volume and mean time to recover incidents in your business unit by providing high-level, independent trouble shooting on technical issues.
* Produces, delivers, and maintains appropriate documentation for systems in accordance document control standards and procedures.
* Provides input to records, quality systems and management reports as required
* Works and cooperates with internal and external groups when required in order to fully support environments and maintain service.
* Adheres to change management procedures in defining, planning and implementing change in such a way that ensures appropriate coordination with other teams, minimizes service disruption, and ensures adherence to Service Level Agreements.
* Adheres and contributes to the definition and implementation of operating procedures and operability on new and existing systems, ensuring adherence to defined operations standards.
* Collaborates with business, third party vendors, developers, application support and technical operations groups to determine appropriate hardware/software needed and to resolve any issues impacting the application processes.
* Stays abreast of recent developments in related technical community, including new technology and business news that may impact vendors’ ability to provide service.
* Responsible to seek out all information and to fully understand all aspects of each device’s technology configuration and uses all approved engineering tools available to implement conforming change.
* Contributes to the analysis and design of complex solutions and requirements definition, including translating technical and business requirements into physical installations.
* Reviews and coordinates the implementation of proposed modifications, and changes to the production environment.
* Provides direction into standards and procedures for monitoring, capacity planning, tuning, maintenance, performance optimization, backups and recovery; ensures infrastructure will meet capacity requirements to deliver projects on time.
* Database Engineer:  
- Provides direction for: proactive health and performance monitoring of database, indexes, and logs and troubleshooting of reported issues.  
- Reviews implemented scripts, stored procedures, and reports generated by automated database maintenance scripts.  
- Participates in the technical design process as it relates to database implementations, reviews technical documents, and communicates any risks or issues using the appropriate escalation procedures.  
- Provides directions to technical recovery plans (Database Standby and Replication, Backup and Recovery).
* Platform Engineer:  
- Packages company approved hardened versions of targeted operating systems.  
- Ensures stack of agents for management systems are properly installed and connected.  
- Maintains patch levels in accordance with change management and security standards.
* Storage Engineer:  
- Participates in storage-related projects, including switch installations, disk consolidations, disk assignments, replication, and more.
* Network Engineer:  
- Reviews the network infrastructure documentation/ run book for standards adherence.  
Complies with all routing and rules sets, sequences, defaults, and standards.  
-Documents and maintains all applicable configuration standards.  
-Assures all NIC and port speeds are appropriately locked down.
* Application Engineer:  
- Fully familiarizes self with all aspects of the developed code.  
Recognizes design problems and errors and takes corrective action from a design perspective on the object code environment.  
Interfaces with development teams on system design enhancements and the elimination of intermittent hardware/software problems.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Why is this job important?**

Reuters News Agency engineering team develops business-critical applications and services for the Reuters news organization. We provide publishers and broadcasters with news text, photos, and video over both Internet and satellite, and we also provide web-scale hosted content solution to digital publishers.

**About the role**

**In your role you will be responsible for:**

* Communicating with product and business teams to gather and analyze business requirement and translating into technical design and preparing functional/technical specification documents.
* Researching and identifying new software technologies that can be leveraged to improve application performance and development efficiency, reducing cost and maintain quality.
* Developing web scale, high resilience web application for news distribution and hosted content.
* Developing low latency news collection and processing system that process text, picture, video news in various news message format.
* Developing news distribution services that deliver news content to clients globally via FTP/HTTP pushing, web services and agent application.
* Working together with Quality Assurance team to prepare test plans/test cases and define test execution methodology and perform tests. Identify and fix any defects.
* Working together with system operation team to ensure system stability and maintain high availability 24/7/365.

**About you**

**Qualifications - What do you need to bring?**

* A bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical/Electronic Engineering or a related field, plus 5 years of work experience in software development-related position.
* Deep understanding and experience in Python
* Experience in large-scale web application/web services design and development.
* Good understanding in SQL or NO-SQL database, XML, JSON, HTML. Good understanding in JavaScript is desirable.
* Experience in Linux platform and related tools including shell script.
* Experience in public cloud especially AWS is a big plus.
* Experience in search solution design and development using Elasticsearch, Solr, Lucene is a big plus.
* Experience in an application development role in low-latency data collecting and processing systems design and development is a big plus.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with product managers.
* Experience working in a global team with coworkers from different culture is desirable.
* Experience within the news industry and knowledge of industry standards is desirable.

title: Product Manager, Video
description:
Are you excited about the future of video? Does data and technology excite you? Are you passionate about content and working for an organization that supplies news to publishers across the globe? Reuters is looking for a dynamic product manager to lead our video initiatives across our direct-to-consumer business. 

The **Video Product Manager** will lead video focused initiatives across all advertising-supported video for the consumer business within Reuters – including OTT, social, and website – working closely with Editorial, Ad Sales & Operations, Technology and the wider Product teams. 

**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as **Video Product Manager****,** you will:  

* Own enterprise Video Digital Asset Management System, Video player and Internal Video CMS tools.
* Own product management for video streaming on existing and new OTT platforms and playout on reuters.com.
* Identify and implement new features for playback and ad-tech optimization.
* Closely partner with Revenue Operations team to ensure experience is optimized for various revenue streams (direct, open auction, and DTC).
* Prioritize the implementation of new features and set specific timelines; troubleshoot video related defects.
* Conduct research to identify user needs and gaps; keep on top of industry trends, technologies, and techniques.
* Conduct market research to identify trends to stay ahead of the curve.
* Act as the primary liaison between internal stakeholders including Sales, Analytics, Editorial, Technology and Partners.
* Work with editorial, technology, legal, customer support, and other teams to ensure that our practices, templates, and procedures make us easy to do business with.
* Collaborate with the design and engineering teams to reach the best possible version of a feature (or new product).
* Manage exceptions and unexpected changes to our product portfolio and operations.
* Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the overall health of products and identify new opportunities for improvements, new ways of working, and new areas of development.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of **Video Product Manager** if your background includes:  

* Working knowledge of digital video players and streaming technologies across multiple platforms (e.g., web, mobile and different connected TV devices)
* Minimum of 3 years product experience in agile software development, including integrating customer feedback into requirements, driving prioritization and execution with a focus on improving key metrics
* Ability to read and understand technical standards and specs
* Willingness to work either independently or collaboratively across multi-functional teams as the situation requires
* Translating concepts and requests between technical and non-technical audiences
* Strong track record partnering with design teams and guiding UX
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Understanding of project management tools such as JIRA, ADO and Trello
* Knowledge of video advertising
* Knowledge of video and content technology including production work streams, content management systems, and digital asset management
* Understanding of digital ad insertion and ad measurement (e.g. ad beacons, IAB Open Measurement, ComScore VCE or Nielsen DAR)
* Experience working with global teams

Please be advised that the deadline for applications is Monday 31st October, 2022

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model****:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

title: Tax Product Manager (UK based role)
description:
Thomson Reuters is a leading provider of compliance software to the tax and accounting profession in the UK, with solutions covering personal tax, corporate tax, accounting, practice management and client collaboration.

Our integrated software designed for accountants helps them save time, improve profit margins, and enhance the services they provide. Knowing they have a reliable and trusted platform underpinning their business frees them up to focus on the enhanced services they offer to their clients, providing them with a competitive edge.

We have an exciting opportunity for an innovative and collaborative **Tax** **Product Management professional** to lead our UK Tax products for Tax and Accounting UK Professionals.

We are seeking a self-starter with a passion for building strong products, tackling complex problems, and partnering with a diverse set of Professional Accounting firm customers, both large and small, as well as internal designers, engineers, colleagues and stakeholders. 

As a key part of the UK Product Management leadership team, the Tax Product Manager, is responsible for the growth and development of the Tax Products in the UK suite. They lead a small tax team, instilling in them the core tenants of Product Management at Thomson Reuters while delivering against their own objectives.  This person will work closely with design and engineering to solve customer problems throughout the end-to-end product life cycle. This role will be responsible both for developing a strategy to grow existing Tax products, and for leading new product development efforts. This person will provide strong leadership to their team, helping to mitigate and resolve setbacks and roadblocks, build and engage a high performing product team, and foster a culture of feedback, experimentation and learning.

**Please note, this is a 12-month fixed term contract and will be in our UK office (hybrid mode or remote).**

About the Role

As the Tax Product Manager you will: 

* Develop strong product intuition by interpreting and assessing customer problems, business needs and opportunities and offering potential solutions with a moderate level of guidance and direction.
* Build world class capabilities and products by assisting in the creation a vision for the Tax products and maintaining the tax products roadmap and partnering closely with dev teams and UX to execute the roadmap and deliver efficiently. This includes serving as the customer voice for the engineering teams, prioritizing the product backlog based on customer and business value, and using metrics to monitor and measure progress.
* Demonstrate leadership by taking extreme ownership for a product / product line, its performance and reliability, and delighting our clients with a positive experience. You will show that you can learn from your experiences, recover from setbacks, and effectively evangelize the product vision to colleagues.
* Build, manage and lead a world class team of product managers.  You will lead a team to define and deliver significant strategic initiatives.

In order to be successful in achieving these goals, you will be:

* Curious & Innovative, starting with an obsession for our customers’ problems and needs and then working closely with customers, partners, and other Thomson Reuters colleagues to solve them in unique ways.
* Agile, with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, unafraid of failure.
* An effective communicator who projects confidence and communicates concisely and clearly to management, peers, customers and partners.

About You:

You’re a fit for the role of Tax Product Manager if your background includes:

* Proven Product Management Professional
* Experience coaching and leading a team is preferred
* Experience working with technology development in the tax and/or accounting arena preferred
* University Degree in Business or Computer Science preferred (or equivalent experience)
* 1-2 years of Product Management background

title: Sr System Engineer - Linux
description:
**Technologies we work with**:

* Vmware, AWS,
* EKS & ECS experience
* Primarily : J2EE,Tomcat, Apache, Python, JavaScript, Shell Script and others
* CI/CD tools such as Git, Ansible, RunDeck
* Monitoring :Nagios, CheckMK, DataDog
* Database: Oracle, MySQL.
* Others: Jira, Confluence, MS Teams,
* Test automation tools such as JUnit

**Responsibilities:**

* Operational support to ensure system availability, scalability, performance, monitoring, alerting and efficient incident troubleshooting
* Act as the go to person for any production issue, troubleshoot and escalate as needed and monitor until successful resolution. Communicate status with the team and stakeholders.
* Establish best practices and direction applications upgrade
* Build and maintain monitoring for all aspects of infrastructure and the platform
* Maintain end-to-end security ensuring that we meet best practices standards
* Keep up-to-date with emerging cloud technology trends, especially around DevOps
* Extreme collaboration within our teams – Canada, US and India
* Ongoing participation in Scrum team, and an embrace of an agile work model.  This includes collaboration with other Software Engineers, Test Automation Engineers, DevOps Engineers, Product Owners and Scrum Masters
* Mentor other team members and act as a change agent within the group.
* Develop scripts, configuration and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms.
* Administer customer application server platform.
* Build validation and monitoring tools and processes in support of development, integration, deployment and delivery in cloud environments.
* Identify risks & issues and take ownership to deliver appropriate resolutions.
* Author technical documentation such as complex release instructions or operating procedures.
* Review, and update as appropriate, operation procedures, standards, and technical policies.
* Follow standards and procedures for building, packaging, deployment, monitoring, and capacity planning.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent
* Minimum 3-5 years of experience
* Working knowledge of leading deployment/operation technologies
* Problem solving skills
* Working knowledge of scripting like Perl or Python in Linux environments
* Experience in deployment and operation of complex distributed, multi-tier and multi-tenant systems
* Experience with Apache, Tomcat, RESTful services
* Experience with Linux based application servers

title: Data Visualization Developer
description:
Reuters is looking for an innovative and energetic data visualization developer to help transform our news file in Asia. The graphics journalist will create interactive data-driven explanations to accompany news stories across a spectrum of topics, supporting the drive at Reuters for new ways to present the news.

This position will report to the Deputy Global Editor, Graphics. The developer will be expected to work swiftly with little supervision under tight deadlines, producing graphics conceived by Reuters journalists and editors as well as generating original ideas for graphics projects.

Attention to detail and accuracy is a must. Technical mastery with applications such as Excel, Adobe Creative Suite are required and proficiency with HTML, CSS and JavaScript are a must.

In addition to technical know-how, candidates should possess strong interpersonal skills. The post requires the ability to collaborate with graphics colleagues in other regions as well as photo, video, and text reporters around the world.

**About the Role**

As our **Data Visualization Developer,** you will:

* Work to tight deadlines
* Understand the graphics file and envision how to represent news graphically
* Create graphics conceived by editors and journalists
* Generate original ideas for graphics

To be our **Data Visualization Developer**, you will likely have: 

* Degree in journalism, and/or graphic design
* Prior experience in newsroom data visualisation or graphics teams
* Knowledge of applications Excel, Adobe Illustrator a must
* Proficiency with HTML, CSS and JavaScript required
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Enthusiasm, curiosity and numeracy are essential

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Partner Program Operations Manager
description:
Do you enjoy supporting Strategic Alliance Partners? The **Partner Program Operations Manager** will manage the operations to support the Thomson Reuters Partner Program.  This person will drive the design, planning, and execution of strategic partner initiatives.  Success in this role requires the ability to manage complex projects, while working closely with multiple functional groups to ensure successful outcomes for Thomson Reuters partners.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a **Partner Program Operations Manager** you will:

* Partner with cross functional teams to design and launch programs, processes, policies, and systems
* Collaborate with Operations analysts to measure partner attainment of program requirements
* Measure success of the program as it relates to business goals
* Oversee fulfillment of partner benefits, and evolve those to meet the goals of the business
* Lead internal activities defining what is considered success for our partner ecosystem
* Collaborate with Marketing teams on outbound campaigns and communications

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Partner Program Operations Manager** if your background includes:

* Bachelor's degree preferred
* 5-7+ years of experience supporting global partner program operations
* Ability to take complex problems and summarise key insights and lead a team to drive the optimal outcomes
* Ability to communicate cross-functionally and with senior leaders to gain sponsorship on strategic programs and long-term initiatives
* Ability to be a self-starter, influencing others, tackling unstructured and undefined problems, taking ownership, and driving objectives to achieve the desired outcome
* Ability to lead a variety of stakeholders and manage multiple projects with competing priorities aligned to short and long-term objectives
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels
* The ability to answer unstructured business questions and work independently to drive projects and create new processes

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: China Health and Pharmaceutical Correspondent
description:
Reuters is seeking a dynamic reporter to help drive our coverage of healthcare and the pharmaceutical industry in China, based in either Beijing or Shanghai. The successful candidate will be a proven source-builder with strong news instincts, a knack for storytelling and an eagerness to build expertise. China is the world’s second largest pharmaceutical market and has been a global outlier in its ‘zero-COVD’ approach to the coronavirus. It is also home to an increasingly wealthy, and aging, population of 1.4 billion people that is seeking better access to affordable, quality health care.

This is a great opportunity for a resourceful and creative journalist to tell impactful stories on China from a unique perspective and from different angles, ranging from the corporate and regulatory to societal and political.

**About the Role**

As our ***China Health and Pharmaceutical Correspondent,*** you will:

* Build sources among regulators and pharmaceutical companies to break news on the impact of policy on the market
* Track key companies and technologies that are reshaping the pharmaceutical industry landscape and supply chains in China
* Identify trends and deliver deeply reported stories
* Write fast and accurate headlines and stories under time pressure
* Work closely with colleagues in China as well as the global healthcare team

To be ***China Health and Pharmaceutical Correspondent,*** you will:

* Have great ideas and demonstrated ability to develop sources and deliver outstanding stories
* Have strong news judgement
* Have fluent Mandarin and English
* Be a strong communicator and team player
* Have experience developing beat expertise

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

title: Asia Columnist, Reuters Breakingviews
description:
We’re looking for a talented and original thinker with excellent analytical and writing skills to join our team in Asia. This is an opportunity to set the agenda on corporate finance, banking, economics and markets across the region.

 

Reuters Breakingviews has an unrivalled reputation for delivering clear, punchy, and well-informed views for decision-makers around the world. As part of the global news organization, we combine access to high-level contacts with the highest standards of independence and accuracy.

 

You will be relentlessly curious; brim with original ideas; enjoy working collegially with a regional and global team; and bring a high level of numeracy. We are seeking an experienced journalist or analyst who is comfortable unpicking an income statement, deal term sheet or IPO prospectus, and someone able to craft sharp, punchy and well-sourced views.  
  
Though writing experience is a distinct advantage, deep curiosity about the inner workings of finance, a ready supply of original ideas and the ability to slice through complex concepts are more important.

 

Our preferred location for this role is Singapore, but there is some flexibility for strong candidates based elsewhere. 

**About the Role**  
As **Asia Columnist** you will:

* Research and write punchy and original views on business, finance and economics which set the agenda for our global subscribers.
* Develop and maintain contacts with senior executives, financiers, and policymakers.
* Present your ideas and research in fresh and interesting ways, including through arresting graphics.
* Work with our global team of columnists and editors to explore topical ideas and illuminate cross-border themes.

**About You**

To be our **Asia Columnist** you are likely to have:

* A firm understanding of how companies and financial markets work, and a grasp of the basic concepts of corporate finance
* The ability to formulate strong, well-argued opinions under tight deadlines
* A base of high-level contacts among corporate executives, bankers, investors, and policymakers
* Experience of presenting your views to a sophisticated financial audience
* The highest standards of editorial integrity and professionalism

 

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

title: Lead SRE
description:
* Analyzes high-value customer problems of significant complexity and provides guidance on analysis for team members
* Assesses scope of impact
* Anticipates customer impact of issues and defines, reviews, and leads the implementation of mitigation strategy
* Identifies options for problem resolution, recommends and decides on a solution, and leads an action plan
* Engages others as appropriate and escalates as required
* Provides advice or training to users about the application systems' functionality, correct operation, or constraints, and corrects user faults.
* Liaises with various application development and content teams, customer service teams, and other software and hardware support teams (including senior management members)
* Proactively monitor or lead other team members in production and nonproduction environments and/or applications
* Develops and/or reviews technical plans and solutions.
* Provides technical and/or managerial guidance to analysts
* Has in-depth technical expertise in various areas and provides subject matter expertise
* Leads and represents the team at key cross-functional workgroup discussions
* Provides technical leadership on complex projects.
* Evaluates new technologies.
* For team lead: Spends all or a large proportion of time managing team, in addition to doing aspects of work done by team members.
* Provides performance and talent development.
* Provides recommendations for hiring.
* Ensures root cause analysis is conducted and assists with and correlation of other system and/or application problems of significant complexity.
* Works on large complex projects/issues that require expert skills in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
* Develops and leads new projects of complex scope.
* Sets timeframes and schedules to meet customer and business needs.
* Assigns and reviews work and monitors results
* Prepares and presents status updates for various projects or customer problems.
* Regularly communicates and shares knowledge with teams, management, partners, and customers.
* Ensures processes are followed according to defined standards.
* Contribute to the definition of standards and best practices.
* The following are required for some positions but not all:
* Provides leadership in developing, configuring, or supporting tools for system monitoring and/ or troubleshooting.
* Provides leadership to others in developing software application modules using disciplined software development processes in order to fix a problem and communicate the changes effectively.
* Provides leadership in carrying out unit testing and implements application modules they have developed or modified, ensuring application meets the needs of client and business.
* Provides leadership for ongoing maintenance of product applications or tools.

title: Content Specialist
description:
**Content Specialist | Operations Content** The Content Specialist is responsible for reviewing Civil and Criminal Orders from State Trial Courts for history relationships with other orders and appellate court decisions.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Content Specialist, you will:

* **Publishing:**  Performs duties such as analyzing, keying, converting, coding, copyreading, editing, merging, rendering, loading or validation of data. Supports team publishing goals by meeting deadlines.
* **Qulaity Control**: Responsible for accuracy and completeness of work product. All work will be checked until competent process knowledge is developed.
* **Content Acquisition:** Duties may include acquisition of manuscripts or core content, analysis of manuscripts, and electronic files, coding (mark-up of data), and resolving coding errors, manuscript editing, compiling and editing of content, proofreading and copy reading, quality control and verification.
* **Individual and Team Skills:** Attends and participates in the performance management process (e.g. peer reviews, self evaluation)

**About You**

You're fit for the role of Content Specialist if you:

* Bachelor's degree
* Must have attended at least two years in Law School
* Must have satisfactorily completed subjects in Civil and Criminal Procedure
* Knowledgeable with Court Rules and Judicial Proceedings
* Excellent Analytical Skills

**What’s in it For You?**  
You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with most of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:**Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

title: Sales Product Specialist - HighQ
description:
The Sales Product Specialist is a key member of the Canadian sales organization and is responsible for driving growth by identifying and closing sales of specialty Thomson Reuters software solutions to assigned large law-firm accounts.  

**About The Role**

* Achieve / exceed monthly quota targets, while developing and building a strong customer base with sales to White-Space and current HIGHQ accounts
* Effectively prospect to uncover new sales opportunities within assigned territory
* Manage complex sales-cycles and effectively present the value of our solutions
* Develop a deep understanding of the product offering, customer need, and competitive landscape
* Forecast accurately and maintain all sales cycle activities within the Salesforce.com CRM system

**About You**

* 6+ years’ experience in legal technology sales or related field
* University degree preferred
* Experience in the SaaS/Cloud space ideal
* Proven success in consistently achieving/exceeding monthly quota targets in technology-based sales
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced business environment
* Excellent communication (written, oral) and presentation skills (in-person, virtual)
* Excellent organizational, prioritization, and time management skills
* A comprehensive understanding of the legal services marketplace, its business culture, processes, value drivers and business operations
* Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
* Proficient in MS Office / Internet / Salesforce / CRM use
* University degree preferred
* An LL. B will be considered an asset

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: Content Marketer
description:
**Content Marketer | Operations Customer Service & Support**

Are you a curious, smart, self-driven writer and content professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment? Do you enjoy collaborating with others to deliver outstanding content for customers on complex topics in English? Come and join FindLaw, part of Thomson Reuters, an industry leader in online attorney marketing. The primary responsibilities of the Content Marketer are to create blog content in English. The Content Marketer is part of a collaborative team that works with attorney clients throughout the United States. 

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Content Marketer, you will:  

* **Deliver on established content plans** for clients, including writing and fulfillment of blog posts.
* **Consult documented content strategy** and internal partners to understand client business goals, brand differentiators, target audiences, and tone and voice.
* **Research and write blog** content in English that complies with internal best practices, industry standards and corporate policies.
* **Edit or revise content** based on internal or external feedback.
* Meet established deliverables and quality expectations.
* Work in multiple processes or on multiple projects at a time.
* Write compelling content in English consistent with the customers practice area(s) and geographic location.
* Understand and use performance metrics to refine and improve writing performance.
* Work as part of a team, completing varied work assignments and collaborating with others as required.
* **Establish and maintain proficiency** in company business systems including content management, workflow management and time tracking systems.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Content Marketer if you have:

* 2+ years professional content writing experience in English.
* Internet writing experience in legal, marketing, social media or journalism field is preferred.
* Working knowledge of legal concepts and terminology, AP style / standard rules for grammar, punctuation, and spelling, and Digital Marketing and Search Engine Optimization strategies.
* Strong online and legal research skills.
* Excellent English writing skills.
* Ability to communicate in written and spoken English language with team members.
* Strong ability to prioritize and handle multiple and/or conflicting projects and priorities.
* Works well in a team environment, embraces change and is highly adaptable.
* Deadline driven and able to achieve output and metric goals.
* Ability to work independently with great attention to detail.
* Strong multi-tasking and time management skills.
* Ability to craft creative writing solutions for attorney clients in English from different geographies, backgrounds, and legal practices.
* English language fluency, both written and spoken (must be able to communicate with United States based, English speaking staff).

Education:

* Bachelor’s degree: Communications, Journalism, or related degree preferred.
* English language fluency, both written and spoken (must be able to communicate with United States based, English speaking staff).

Working Hours

* During training/onboarding will require working during US business hours. Once fully trained, will require working half of their day during US business hours.

Please Submit

* Resume/online application.
* Two professional writing samples in English.

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sport Editor, Global Pictures Desk
description:
About this position

  
Working at Thomson Reuters

Reuters are looking for an enthusiastic journalist with a knowledge of international sports, strong English, well organised and a sharp eye for detail who can effortlessly work through the vast amount of live photos our photographers shoot every day and apply the correct metadata accurately and quickly to deliver pictures to Reuters customers worldwide.

We have a dynamic newsroom including text, visuals, digital, polling, graphics, legal and sports journalists who collaborate to produce a compelling professional news product unavailable anywhere else. We are the first to know the news.

Our Sports Pictures Desk team ensures the speed, quality, and accuracy of delivery of sport  pictures to our clients worldwide. The job also includes big events like Olympics, World Cups and World Championships for summer and winter sports.

This is an entry level full-time, desk-based role, that requires flexibility. You must be willing to work as part of a global 24/7 rotating shift system, including weekends and public holidays, with occasional night shifts.

As a photo editor you will:

* Gather images sent in from editors and photographers from around the globe in real time
* Writing captions in English quickly and accurately for our global clients.
* Work as a team with pictures, text, video and on-line colleagues to ensure integrated multimedia news coverage and production

You should apply if you have:

* Fluent English, verbal and written. (Bonus points for additional languages).
* A love for all forms of journalism and an obsessive-level interest in global sport especially football.
* Ever dreamed of working for the world’s greatest multimedia team
* Unflappable interpersonal and organisational skills even when under pressure
* English language studies, Mass communication or a Journalism related degree or experience
* Experience and/or general interest in photography and/or journalism
* Competent working knowledge of Apple computers and Adobe Photoshop
* A desire to work with colleagues dedicated to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias
* A love for being part of a diverse, global team

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* Global Career — As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* Learning & Development — On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* Benefits — We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including various flexi benefit options, paid volunteering days, and medical insurance for you and your dependents.
* Newsroom — Work alongside award-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

To be considered for this role please ensure that you submit both a CV and cover letter. Your letter should detail in no more than 350 words how your previous experience would help enhance the role.   

About Reuters

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Data Engineer
description:
\***Daily functions and duties of this role require on-site presence in Tampa, FL. Candidates considered for this position must be willing to comply with the on-site requirement.\***

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your **engineering** experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to **support the delivery of structured and unstructured data**? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

**What You’ll Do:** As a **Data Engineer** you will be responsible for supporting the effective implementation of internal and external data enabled solutions supporting the Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) organization.  This role requires practical technology applications skills involving the cleaning, integration, extraction, analysis and delivery of structured and unstructured data.  This role works closely with other teams across the technology organization and other business units, including the product development and software engineering teams, the data science team, and often pre and post-sales support of the business development team.  The role will also have a customer facing component, involving direct implementation and support of existing or new applications at customer locations. As the **Data Engineer**, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:

* Work directly with internal resources as well as customer technology staff to implement and support custom TRSS client solutions and POCs
* Design, build and support data pipelines and workflows designed to maximize the usefulness and efficiency of internal and external data sets being brought to bear on customer issues
* Support and continually improve internal processes, to include automation of robotic processes across the organization where possible
* Provide solution architecture support for business opportunities
* Provide input to leadership teams using technical expertise and knowledge of customer technology requirements and infrastructure
* Understand and interpret unique client requirements and mission and provide custom solutions to integrate TRSS content into client applications

**About You:**

You’re a good fit for the role of **Data Engineer** if you have:

* **Minimum 5-6 years of data engineering experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Experience leading the implementation and customization of technical solutions, preferably for government clients
* Proficiency in multiple programming languages (particularly interested in python, Java but other languages could be useful as well)
* Experience with Restful web services and current data communications technologies
* Experience connecting to and querying a variety of relational and document-oriented databases
* Comfortable in GUI and command line environments in Linux and Windows OS
* Basic understanding of common data structures including flat files, XML, JSON, graph structures etc.
* Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure, including AWS
* Passionate, smart, and articulate technologist
* Self-starter and results oriented
* Must possess a strong personal work ethic
* Must be of superior moral and ethical character
* Must be able to operate under pressure with dynamic and changing requirements
* US National Secret security clearance required to start, TS preferred.

You’re a GREAT fit for the role of **Data Engineer** if you also have:

* High level understanding of network troubleshooting techniques and communications protocols
* Experience with information retrieval technologies such as Lucene and ElasticSearch
* Experience with connected data and graph databases
* Experience with workflow management tools, NIFI experience a plus
* Understanding of public records and open source data
* Experience working with data visualization tools (Power BI/Tableau, etc)
* Robotic Process Automation experience
* Understanding of public records and open source data
* Experience working in virtualized environments, including the ability to stand up and configure a local virtual machine with locally hosted web applications

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Events Intern
description:
**Events Intern - Marketing Latam** 

¿Estás apasionado sobre la oportunidad de brindar tus conocimientos y experiencia para apoyar a nuestro equipo de Marketing, utilizando las mejores prácticas dentro de una empresa multinacional?

***¡Que tus próximos pasos sean en TR!***

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de estudiantes que quieran dar inicio a su carrera profesional incorporandose en nuestra ***Pa*********s*antía** de eventos*** dentro del equipo de Marketing Strategy & Planning.

***Principales tareas *del rol:****

- Participar en la planificación y ejecución de reuniones simples y apoyar la planificación para eventos complejos *(tanto online como offline)*

- Brindar servicio al cliente excepcional a través de un entorno de colaboración. Incluye logística de eventos, estimaciones de costos, conciliación presupuestaria, adquisición de lugares, servicios de planificación, ejecución de eventos y soporte de informes.

- Asistir a la dirección de marketing y a especialista de eventos de la marca.

- Realizar tareas administrativas generales como: carga y seguimiento de gastos, pedidos, recepción de facturas y tareas administrativas varias principalmente con proveedores.

- Confección y análisis de reportes mensuales.

- Pedido de materiales promocionables y su posterior control de stock.

- Armado y colaboración en las presentaciones de Marketing, eventos internos/externos.

***¿Qué requisitos buscamos?***

- Estudiante de las carreras de Organización de Eventos, Administración de empresas, Marketing o a fines.

- Buenas habilidades comunicativas, trabajo en equipo y colaboración.

- Conocimientos básicos de marketing.

- Nivel intermedio/avanzado de inglés (deseable)

***Te Proponemos***

- Ser parte de una compañía multinacional totalmente comprometida en el respeto y cuidado de sus colaboradores

- Ser protagonista de tu desarrollo en un ambiente de aprendizaje, oportunidades y proyectos desafiantes.

- Formar parte de un equipo de excelentes profesionales, quienes serán tu guía y apoyo en todo desarrollo.

- Herramientas y recursos adecuados a tu disposición para identificar, priorizar y cerrar oportunidades.

- Gran clima laboral, de super importancia para tu formación y para que disfrutes la experiencia.

title: Picture Editor, Wider Image - Reuters
description:
This role is for an inspirational pictures editor to complete a small team of editors working with photographers to produce the most impactful, insightful, and competitive visual stories for global media clients. In this role, the Picture Editor will report to, and deputize for, the Senior Editor, Wider Image and Special Projects.

A commitment to preserving the Thomson Reuters Trust Principles of independence, integrity, and freedom from bias is essential. So is absolute dedication to the safety of all the photographers who provide pictures to Reuters.

As our **Editor, Wider Image at Reuters,** you will:

* Work with photographers and editors from idea generation to research, reporting, production, editing, and publication of in-depth, visually-led stories
* Liaise with text and video teams to make sure each Wider Image story has quality text and video elements, and all assets are coordinated. Work with the social and online teams to develop an approach to promote each story.
* Fact check and correct captions and identify any potential legal or ethical risks
* Layout and build multimedia stories using the Wider Image CMS
* Track story usage data across client publications and our own platforms to inform coverage decisions
* Help curate multiple yearend Pictures of the Year packages
* Provide edits of our best pictures for photo festivals as needed
* Produce at short notice a timely picture and text story based on viral or especially impactful imagePromote diversity of our photographer pool by helping identify and mentor new talent of diverse profiles and origins
* Help keep photographers safe in the field
* Ability to work under time pressure, on tight deadlines
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including some evenings and weekends

To be our **Editor, Wider Image at Reuters,** you will likely have:

* Previous experience in visual journalism
* Fluent English skills (speaking and writing). (Additional languages are an advantage.)
* Extensive experience as a photo editor, with an eye for editing large volumes of pictures quickly and precisely
* Experience in writing and editing photo captions for accuracy and risk
* Experience designing and building multimedia stories for digital publication
* Excellent news judgement
* Some experience editing video either as a separate product or in combination with still photos
* Some experience working with colleagues from across news bureaux and editing desks
* Ability to develop talent and build diverse teams

**As part of your applicatio****n, please attach a cover letter explaining why you would be good for this job and why this job would be good for you.**

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias.
