title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
**Job description:**

* Develop and deliver valuable reporting insights to support the vision of Commercial Excellence and the broader TR Sales Organization
* Leverage Alteryx and other tools to create efficient and robust data lakes to support the needs of Commercial Excellence and the TR Sales Organization
* Ability to aggregate and synthesize disparate data sets from disparate sources using current technologies such as Oracle and Alteryx
* Understand the complexities of a large matrixed sales organization and be able to navigate to all areas within that organization to offer data and reporting solutions for all levels
* Think strategically and creatively to find ways to streamline existing data to consolidate and simplify the Sales Organization key data elements
* Proactively identify trends and future reporting needs and present ideas to CE Leadership for new areas of opportunity to drive value via reporting insights
* Build dynamic tools to provide visibility to frontline sales leaders with ease of use, accuracy and timely reporting in mind
* Create executive level reporting output that is easily digestible, to the point and visually appealing
* Partner closely with sales operations and finance to execute and drive the reporting requirements for Commercial Excellence
* Provide insightful diagnostics and actionable insights to the sales leadership team in a proactive manner by spotting trends, questioning data and asking questions to understand underlying drivers
* Conduct statistical data analysis and communicate insights from trends to help drive strategic decisions
* Conduct deep dives to identify trends, risks and areas for improvement and action to the Sales Organization
* Analyze data and metrics to tell a story that drives sales insights and action
* Support other Commercial Excellence initiatives as required

**Experience and Qualification**:

* 4-year college degree
* 5- 10 years’ experience in business or financial, data analyst, data scientist roles with exceptional project management skills and attention to detail
* Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of TR product and customer landscape to enable balanced tradeoffs between standardization and customization across segments
* Advanced level skills in the following systems:  Alteryx, Tableau, Excel, MS Powerpoint, Power BI and Oracle
* Proven ability to take complex and disparate data sets and create streamlined and efficient data lakes with connected and routinized cadence
* Technical aptitude including knowledge of salesforce.com
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to team with partners from various business units
* Superior diagnostic and problem-solving skills
* Past experience with problem solving and communicating with sales channels, customers, and internal management
* Ability to be flexible with working hours to support everchanging demands of the business

title: Strategic Partnerships Manager - India
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive sales experience to a world-class company that is  
market-leading for both content and technology? We are seeking a Strategic Partnerships Manager who is  
knowledgeable, capable and charismatic with proven experience working with the big four advisory firms and/or  
leading Channel and Re-Seller businesses in India. You will have demonstrable success in building and executing go-to-market strategies via partner models; focused on meeting corporate sales, revenue, operational  
and strategic goals.

About the Role  
In this role, you will have the following responsibilities/accountabilities:  
Execute on the overall company partnership model across all the business units of the organization  
to leverage the channel to new markets. Leverage the central Partnerships capability and the  
regions business units’ partnerships capability to help build on the current Partner relationships,  
engagement models and agreements.  
l  
Develop knowledge and strategic relationships of selected partners to build the Partnerships  
channel of the business. Orchestrate sales, marketing, operations, learning and support to the  
Partners on the execution of the partner engagement model.  
l  
Construction and enhancement of the partner ecosystem to leverage the cross sell, up sell, and  
competitor displacement opportunities. Business development skills, commercial acumen and  
market knowledge will be required.  
l  
Build engines and connections on channel development, partner sales plan and partner ecosystem  
construction through the proper number of partners & channels, including sales, marketing, training,  
support.  
l  
Partner with assigned enterprises to identify and deliver on potential new opportunities such as new  
market development, co-creation or new products and services. Ensure a robust governance model  
for these partnerships.  
l  
Drive sales strategy and planning jointly with partners through strategic relationships, joint account  
planning and clear go to market approach. Increase partner reach, frequency and yield, as KPIs to  
achieve revenue and market share goals.  
l  
About You  
You’re a fit for this role if you possess the following qualifications and experiences:  
Degree or Master’s in Business Administration with at least 10 years of business development and  
or sales/partnership experience with large enterprise technology companies in India.  
l  
Strong executor of strategies within the India market to establish effective alliance with identified  
partners. Successful track record of developing new business and leading multiple strategic  
partnerships.  
l  
Strong networks in the industry and evidence of long-term collaborative relationships with external  
customers and partners. Aptitude for identifying and solving customer problems through creative  
solutions using a consultative sales approach.  
l  
Experience to leverage resources based on both influence and authority across business units,  
functions, regions, and within and outside of the company. Experience in dealing with C Level  
executives.  
l  
Revise Create Job Requisition 04:14 pm  
27/09/2022  
Page 2 of 7  
l Results oriented, performance driven, and team minded.  
l Excellent spoken and written communication in English.

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional  
growth through:  
Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid  
environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and  
guidelines.  
l  
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion,  
flexibility, work-life balance, and more  
l  
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance:  
company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition  
reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial  
wellbeing  
l  
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities  
to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking  
l  
Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days  
annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact  
l  
Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as  
we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice,  
truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold  
the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted,  
unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Shreveport-Bossier)
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!

**What You’ll Do:** As a Sales Executive, Digital Solutions you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/solo (1-10 attorney) firms.  You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

**About the Role:** 

* Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
* Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
* Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling.
* Create and maintain sales pipeline status ongoing by maintaining accurate and complete information in selected CRM database including activity, closing, project forecast, close ratios and market intelligence.
* Maintain in-depth knowledge of complete line of products/services and customers business issues and needs.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships.
* Communicate product and service opportunities, information or feedback gathered through client activity to appropriate internal resources, including relevant business issues and industry information for utilization in development of market specific action plans and sales strategy.
* Participate in marketing events, trade shows and Company events.

### **Experience & Experience:**

* 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of 2 years successful outside sales experience in professional B2B environments.
* Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
* Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment preferred.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
* Proven track record of developing new customer accounts requiring heavy prospecting, cold calling, appointment setting and closing ability.
* Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
* Ability to develop and deliver effective presentations.
* Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently
* Demonstrated ability to learn a complex product line quickly through self-initiative and discipline.
* Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).

**Travel:**

* Ability to be actively in field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

**What's in it for you!**

* You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community.
* You are will be joining a growing sales team that has the commitment of the company to prioritize organic growth and has made investments to expand the sales team capability.
* Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
* Extraordinary benefits package.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
Reuters is looking for bright, detail-orientated people to join its team of operations analysts in Bangalore. You will be part of a global operations team that forms the backbone of Reuters news management. The global team provides critical support to ensure our news operations run smoothly; our stories are resourced appropriately; we have the right staff in the right places at the right time; and that our staff are safe throughout the world. 

 

As anoperations analyst, you will provide critical support for a variety of functions including: 

 

·         Freelancer and vendor management

·         Payment follow-ups

·         Procurement

·         Customer queries

·         News research

·         Newsplanning assistance

 

This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new team that has made a real impact in freeing up resources across our news operation. You’ll need to be comfortable using spreadsheets and working diplomatically via email and phone to resolve problems and ensure our processes are running efficiently. An interest in news and an understanding of journalism is highly desirable as there will be opportunities to assist with updating newsplanning calendars, answering customer queries and helping journalists with database searches. You must be willing to work evening and overnight shifts.

 

**Key Deliverables & Accountabilities**

·         Assist General Managers on freelancer contracts, vendor account setup and payments

       Ensure timely follow through on unresolved issues

·         Track staff issues, including managing up-to-date headcount tracker and assisting on issues related to our contractor population.

·         Manage purchase orders using internal procurement tool, Ariba

·         Answer queries from Refinitiv customers about news stories

·         Update newsplanning calendars as required

·         Assist with news database searches 

·         Ensure all reports are accurate, current and easily accessible when needed

 

**Knowledge, Skills and Experience**

·         Understanding of the news management process

·         Exceptional organizational skills

·         Effective at managing multiple and competing priorities

·         Ability to use database search tools

·         Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

·         Self-starter and willing to identify opportunities to improve processes

·         Willingness to work in rotational shifts, 24/5 operations

title: Australia Agriculture Correspondent, Canberra
description:
Reuters is looking for a proactive and ambitious reporter to cover Australia’s agricultural sector and deliver an initiative-led file spanning diplomacy, international trade, climate change and the future-proofing of industrial farming in the 21st century.   
   
Australia is a major exporter of beef, wheat, barley, sugar, cotton, sorghum, oats, almonds and other commodities, and it has a substantial freight advantage over suppliers in the Americas and Western Europe in serving the world’s largest and fastest growing markets in Asia. But with the country embroiled in a trade spat with China, a major and inefficient rerouting of several commodity supply lines is underway as exporters scramble to replace that single mammoth buyer with dozens of smaller and farther-flung alternatives.   
   
The Australia Agriculture Correspondent’s reporting will also show the impact of climate change on the agricultural sector. Within the past decade, the country has suffered major droughts, horrendous bushfires and widespread flooding that have curbed or damaged large-scale rural investments and undermined lender confidence in the long-term viability of the Australian farm sector.  
   
Based in our office in Parliament House in Canberra, the successful candidate will also be the face of Reuters for politicians, industry bodies and government departments in the capital, will cover major government announcements on a range of issues, and will work with a team of specialist beat reporters across the Australian bureau.   
 

**About the Role**  
As our Australia Agriculture Correspondent, you will:

* Have a knack for reporting and writing high-impact stories
* Build sources across government, industry, and market participants
* Be able to Identify and develop exclusive news stories that will distinguish Reuters from other media
* Collaborate closely with reporters in Australia and in other regions
* Work with multimedia teams including pictures, graphics and video

   
To be our Australia Agriculture Correspondent, you will likely have:

* Experience covering commodity/financial markets
* Strong news judgement
* Ability to filter quickly through complex information to identify and explain key news elements
* Skill with social media news gathering and monitoring
* Experience working in real-time news bureau

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Senior Finance Manager, Technology Decision Support
description:
The **Senior Finance Manager** will manage Decision Support activities for the Technology organization.  This role will be responsible for supporting leaders across the organization from a finance perspective, with a key focus on guiding them through decisions on strategic priorities.  The role will serve as a lead liaison with technology leaders and segment/function finance.  This role will also have responsibility for coaching other members of the team. The successful candidate must have proven track record of working in a high-pressure environment and demonstrate the ability to work on several projects/deliverables at the same time.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as **Senior Finance Manager, Technology Decision Support**, you will:

* Lead and Partner with leaders in the Technology Organization on strategic priorities and initiatives
* Lead and Partner with other DSIG finance teams to deliver financial information and other data to Operational and Finance leaders, including providing recommendations, identifying opportunities and risk, and suggesting alternative actions through insight
* Ensure business targets are fully operationalized across the areas of Technology supported
* Review capital and expense spend to ensure alignment with EPC commitments
* Ensure business understanding of forecast and close results through strong commentary and storytelling from finance teams
* Lead and Partner with segment/function finance to drive consistency and alignment across the decision support team on projects and adhoc requests
* Ownership of forward-looking information, including decision making on areas of judgement, based on business knowledge and financial trends
* Develop effective relationships with Technology leadership teams
* Support business case preparation and investment decisions
* Guide business teams through the investment process, enabling decisions based on investment effectiveness / ROI
* Lead Collaboration with Operational team to develop capital forecast by product/capability
* Monitor key metrics closely to identify or to anticipate shortfalls or other shifts in the business requiring corrective action
* This role will be expected to support more junior members of the team
* Review financial assumptions and estimates to ensure they are reasonable and accurate and aligned to the O&T strategy
* Drive Standardisation and simplification in line with TR Enterprise Processes
* Perform ad-hoc reporting and analysis when necessary

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Finance Manager, Technology Decision Support** if your background includes:

* 12+ years of experience in Finance
* Bachelors degree or higher preferred
* Proactive, very organized, ability to multitask, managing time and competing priorities in a dynamic environment
* Strategic and critical thinker
* Self-starter with proven ability to work autonomously, collaborate and influence key leaders within the context of a complex, matrix organization to drive results
* Ability to manage a team/team members and develop staff ensuring cohesiveness, collaboration and clear linking of objectives and outcomes
* Familiarity with accounting and financial reporting
* Excellent communication and people skills; Ability to converse with senior management openly and confidently and influence all areas of the business
* Ability to synthesize complex information and present results in a clear and concise manner to senior executives
* Excellent excel modelling skills
* Anticipating and serving evolving needs
* Demonstrate adoption of the TR Mindsets and Behaviors

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: #1 Operator in Bindery - 2nd shift
description:
Job DescriptionWe are hiring experienced **#1/Lead Bindery Operators** for our printing plant team in Eagan, Minnesota. As a #1/Lead Bindery Operator**,** you will be responsible for the performance of the production line and crew on our Core Publishing Solutions team. For this role, you would also be eligible for $4,000 in bonuses your first year. A $2,000 signing bonus upon being in the role for 90 days, another $1,000 bonus at 6 months and a final $1,000 bonus at 12 months.  **Hours of Work – Eagan, Minnesota** 

* 2nd shift – 2:30 pm – 10:30 pm
* Occasional overtime up to 4 hours per day and occasional weekend shifts

**About the Role:** In this opportunity as a #1/Lead Bindery Operator, you will be responsible for:   

* Providing leadership, work direction, and training/developing the skills of the crew to consistently optimize overall performance
* In addition to ensuring that the line is running smoothly and producing a quality product for our customers, Lead Operators are expected to facilitate Tier 1 meetings and Gemba Walk discussions to drive communication and improvements to the processes associated with the equipment
* Training for crew members who are temps or are coming in from another area to support workload
* Motivating others and creating a team environment

**About You:** 

* Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher. Candidates with a vocational/technical degree are strongly preferred
* Experience leading and training others
* Experience working in an industrial setting with a wide range of production machinery
* Strong mechanical and technical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot, make decisions and resolve machine issues
* Experience with Lean and continuous improvement
* Good communication skills including experience sharing information across shifts and departments
* Proven success as a trainer
* Able to run multiple pieces of equipment
* Experience as a Lead on Perfect Binders with up to 40 station collators, 3-knife trimmers, inline boxing and palletizing
* Experience with hard-cover casing-in lines, collating/kitting lines with up to 30 streamfeeder stations, packaging/cartooning lines, Sitma mail lines and hot foil stampers
* Able to read, interpret and explain documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and production orders
* Can regularly lift at least 5 lbs. above the shoulder as well as push, pull and lift at least 10 lbs occasionally up to 50 lbs
* Can regularly stand, walk, crouch, bend, reach and kneel
* Can wear Personal Protective Equipment including steel toe shoes and ear protection
* Able to pass a background check and drug test, as applicable for the role

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year, shift premium of 2nd shift - $4.00 per hour, bonus plan
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

  

**Bonus:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success 

 #LI-PK1

title: Operations Management Trainee
description:
**Job Description:**

The Operations Management Trainee (OMT) program includes a rotation through all departments in Thomson Reuters Core Publishing Solutions in preparation for a supervisory role.  Candidates are introduced to the complete manufacturing processes of hard and softbound books plus warehouse and fulfillment functions, as well as operations management in a three-shift environment.  The program involves hands-on experience in all aspects of the production process, as well as leadership development and project work.  

 

**About You:**

**Education:** (minimum requirements)

  · Bachelor's Degree preferred OR a minimum of 7 years of experience in print manufacturing or similar work environment required

**Experience:**

· Experience in establishing a presence as a leader, formally or informally, and modeling appropriate behaviors

**Knowledge and Skills:** 

* Leadership Ability
* Comfortable interacting with people at all levels; adept at building relationships
* Experienced in addressing and working through conflict
* Ability to give coaching and feedback to colleagues and subordinates
* Demonstrated prioritization skills
* Able to manage both upward and downward in a professional manner
* Open to and willing to act on feedback and coaching
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
* Computer skills: MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint; SAP/ERP/EFI/Smartsheet/ a plus
* Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form; including presentations in front of employees and senior leadership
* Critical thinking and analytical skills
* Proficient in project management and reporting
* Flexibility to vary hours across three shifts as needed for rotational assignments in a 24x5 manufacturing operation
* Experience with lean manufacturing  or continuous improvement tools and methodologies preferred

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Bonus:** $4,000 in bonuses the first year
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
description:
The candidate for this position will be primarily responsible for providing change and incident management services for the applications that the team supports.  These services include coordinating and completing requested changes for those applications, responding to incidents that are reported either by automated alerting or customer report issues.  In addition to these primary responsibilities the candidate for this position will also provide some services within the application management service focus which includes working on specific applications with other AMS engineers or development teams and also participating in specific projects as assigned.  

This position includes hours outside the established work schedule as needed and requires being part of an on-call rotation.  A general understanding of Thomson and West business processes, product lines, and internal and external customers is also preferred.

Application Management Services has team members on all shifts.  This position will be a rotational position across all three shifts during the first three months of training with final placement to be determined after the completed training cycle.

*  BE/BTech
*   5 - 7 yrs of experience in IT Production Support
*  Experience supporting applications in an enterprise environment.
*  Experience supporting applications using WebSphere and Linux/ Unix/Windows.
* Candidate must have exposure to infrastructure automation framework development and testcase automation.
* Ability to write robust scripts in Ansible
* Deep knowledge of writing Ansible playbooks as well troubleshooting/debugging existing playbooks
* Expertise on Creating custom inventories and use of dynamic inventory sources
* Provisioning Callbacks and Job concurrency configuration
* Good understanding of Ansible file and directory structure
* Skillset on Ansible role creation & programming constructs like loops, dictionary, lists
* Should have YAML and JSON expertise
*  Vcenter Experience
* o    Azure Experience
* o    Kubernetes (nice to have)
* o    Experience maintaining Java Web Application servers
* ·         Troubleshooting Java environments
* o    Linux/Windows experience
* o    Basic scripting experience
* o    Jenkins Build Setup experience
* o    Basic Git experience
* o    Networking experience
* ·         Tasks that the team could take care of
* o    Environment config troubleshooting and triage
* o    Server maintenance
* o    Environment Buildouts
* o    General infrastructure maintenance
* o    OS patches/updates
* o    General infrastructure maintenance
* ·         Proxy reboots / config etc
* o    To assist the TRENVINF team and potentially contribute to production triage and troubleshooting

title: Senior SCM Engineer
description:
• At least 4-5 years of software configuration management experience. .  
• Experience in working on software configuration management of enterprise applications developed using object-oriented and distributed Internet technologies (Java, C++, C#, .NET, J2EE, web services, etc.)  
• Strong knowledge and/or experience with software configuration management tools (TFS, VSS, Clearcase, CVS,Perforce, etc.) and techniques used in automated solutions (MSBuild, Ant, perl scripts,etc.).  
• Professionals skilled in CI/CD,Github, ADO, AWS Cloud,Cloudformation,Jenkins,Kubernetes, Docker and Datadog  
• Strong bias for action and passion for taking initiative, accepting personal responsibility to deliver on commitments, having courage to raise issues, and proactively working to resolve issues and remove barriers in a timely manner.  
• Sound knowledge of Linux and Shell scripts and Python, Perl, Powershell scripting.  
• Knowledge of Application servers(Websphere) and webserver(Tomcat)  
• Execute the day to day build/deploy requests as per the request from the Dev team or Release Management team  
• Partner with software development teams and other organizations to ensure their needs are being met and that our services are adding value.  
• Research and implement new, innovative ways of providing quality SCM services.

title: Sr Lead Analyst / Assistant Manager - FP&A
description:
**Timing:** Depending upon the role (7am – 4pm / 10am – 7pm / 12pm – 9pm / 2pm – 11pm)

**Qualification: MBA graduate**

**Eligibility: Minimum experience of 6-8 years**

**Skills: MS Excel expertise, User level (advanced) understanding of financial / management reporting tools – SFDC, SAP, BO, Smartview, OBIEE, MS Access, Hyperion and automation tools.**

* Enthusiastic- open for learning and can-do mentality.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to juggle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines
* Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
* To take call of judgement
* Prior team handling experience of 2-4 members

**Position Purpose:**

This position would partner with various finance teams within CoE to provide analytical support and help drive business performance. This role is part of the FP&A Center of Expertise (COE) and is designed to participate in various project initiatives across the Legal enterprise in the FP&A space, driving consistent use of tools while at the same time identifying areas of efficiency and communicating best practices.

**Job Overview**

* Provide financial / management reporting and analysis to internal teams and high level management teams - representing actual and variance analysis of outlook and actual.
* Understand business requirements quickly and turn them around with accuracy and timeliness.
* Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
* Provide immediate supervision or manage team, assigning tasks, checking work frequently, ensure proper documentation and schedules are maintained.

**Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities**

* Support month close and Forecast / Plan activities – maintain templates, consolidation of numbers, submission into Hyperion, reports & dashboards, any information / analysis required
* Establish business & economic assumptions in developing and monitoring forecasts / plans
* Develop the SOP’s for the processes and projects
* Able to continuously evolve and improvise processes to make time for more value addition and reports meaningful to business finance
* Ability to multitask between priorities to meet deadlines and quality expectations
* Build functional and technical skill expertise within the team
* Use analytics tools such as SAP, BO, Smartview, OBIEE, Acess Database, Sales Force, Hyperion to provide insights to business
* Experience in use of new age reporting / simplification / dashboarding tools

title: Account Executive
description:
We are seeking an **Account Executive** to join Confirmation’s dynamic team.  Our company is growing and we are looking for ambitious qualified people to grow our Asset Verification base supporting credit managers, mortgage brokers & bank responders. The responsibilities include but are not limited to expansion of existing customers through customer success initiatives, growing our requestor/responder network, and ensuring a high level of client adoption to achieve revenue targets.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Account Executive, you will: 

* Create and implement a territory strategy that will achieve defined revenue growth objectives
* Drive growth and adoption of mortgage re-verification solution across assigned business by promoting value of solution and developing relationships with multi-level stakeholders
* Manage and respond to inbound request from our network of financial institutions looking to adopt the Confirmation solution.
* High volume of customer contacts through phone, email, and online presentations/trainings
* Obtain detailed understanding of product in order to properly demo and present the Confirmation solution to prospective clients
* Develop and maintain long term relationships by promoting the value of solution, responding timely to inquiries and providing insights on solution that will help client achieve business goals
* Ensure salesforce.com is utilized for all client updates and is the central repository for key client data (prospecting, opportunities, revenue, next steps)
* All other duties as assigned

**About You**

You are a fit for the role of Account Executive if your background includes:

* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* 4+ years’ of direct sales experience.  B2B and SaaS sales experience preferred
* Demonstrated experience conducting online sales presentations and demos
* Success prospecting, engaging, and adding net new logos as well as expansion of existing customers
* Excellent verbal and written skills in order to effectively work with various departments and stakeholders across multiple levels
* The ability to adapt in a fast-paced, rapid growth environment with a “Win as a Team” approach

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently many of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we have never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and variable compensation that is related to your success

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $105,000 - $195,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

As required by local legislation for this remote based role, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $95,900 - $178,100. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

title: Sr. Digital Analyst
description:
**Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Economic, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Management Information Systems, Computer Science Engineering, or similar data centric disciplines.
* **5+ years’ experience in marketing or digital analytics roles.**
* **3+ years of hands-on web analytics experience with Adobe Analytics**
* Experience analyzing digital data including analyses such as customer journey mapping, website flow analysis, audience profiling/segmentation, cohort/mix analysis, digital channel analysis
* Understanding of various concepts such as agile/scrum, A/B or multivariate testing, tag management, journey mapping, and segmentation
* Strong work ethic, attention to detail, ability to own and drive work forward, communication

**About the Role:** 

As the Senior Digital Analyst, you will

* Use web analytics/data to recognize patterns and trends to understand user behavior and identify improvement opportunities
* Design Tracking Strategy
	+ Co-own digital feature Wishlist(s) and roadmap with product managers, nurturing strong data-driven decision making; continuously draw insights to drive (or challenge) digital backlog
	+ Partner with marketers and digital product managers to establish measurement plan and then work with developers/platform architects to deploy relevant analytics solutions to ensure right metrics, journeys, and events are captured
	+ Collect business requirements and ask probing questions to fully understand business needs and how it relates to key performance measurements.
	+ Develop the analytics, measurement, and tracking strategy for the website and digital campaigns.
* Deliver Insights
	+ Produce reports and digital dashboards to track website and campaign performance, business trends, customer behavior and other key success indicators for various operating units and management.
	+ Leverage business knowledge and analytical skills to translate complex results into clear insights and recommendations for decision-makers that will support continuous improvement to campaigns and website.
	+ Investigate data anomalies to identify root cause and find opportunities for either optimization or clean-up.
	+ Share insights and recommendations to digital and marketing leadership through presentations and other communications.
	+ Proactively identify ways to improve reporting capabilities that enable bettor or more advanced analysis
* Serve as Thought Leader
	+ Collaborate with team to ensure consistency of information and reports, share best practices, and develop systems knowledge.
	+ Serve as a trusted consultant for digital analytics strategy
	+ Stay current with client and industry knowledge, benchmarks, and best practices.

title: Sales Operations Specialist
description:
**Sales Operations Specialist** 

 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience aligning policies and procedures with sales teams?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to provide support to partner closely with Commercial Excellence and Finance to help deliver streamlined and dependable data at every stage of the sales process in a timely and accurate manner.

**About the role**

In this opportunity as a **Sales Operations Specialist**, you will:

* Directly support and enhance the timely delivery of operational reporting, that enables sales activities and drives sales effectiveness.
* Provide insightful data, reporting, and analytics that drive actionable insights to support and enhance the day-to-day activities of the Sales Organization.
* Develop and deliver valuable reporting insights to support the vision of Commercial Excellence and the broader TR Sales Organization
* Leverage Alteryx and other tools to create efficient and robust data lakes to support the needs of Commercial Excellence and the Sales Organization.
* Think strategically and creatively to find ways to streamline existing data to consolidate and simplify the Sales Organization key data elements.
* Proactively identify trends and future reporting needs and present ideas to CE Leadership for new areas of opportunity to drive value via reporting insights.
* Build dynamic tools to provide visibility to frontline sales leaders with ease of use, accuracy and timely reporting in mind.

**About you**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's degree.
* 3 to 6 years of experience doing similar activities.
* Fluent English is a must.
* Experience using current technologies such as Oracle and Alteryx.
* Understand the complexities of a large matrixed sales organization and be able to navigate to all areas within that organization to offer data and reporting solutions for all levels
* Experience analyzing data and metrics to tell a story that drives sales insights and action
* Experience supporting other Commercial Excellence initiatives as required.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-EG1
-------

title: Sales Specialist, Legal Software
description:
**Sales Specialist**

**Legal and Compliance - Growth**  
 

**Role Purpose/ Summary:**

The Sales Specialist is responsible for new business growth in existing accounts in his/her assigned account territory. The Sales Specialist carries a monthly and annual sales quota based on new business sales through targeted upsell and cross sell campaigns of Thomson Reuters Legal and Compliance products which includes the market leading HighQ, Legal Tracker, Thought Trace, Practical Law, Westlaw, Regulatory Intelligence and Compliance Learning services. We are looking for an individual that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals.

The role will form part of the Corporate Europe business line, working with major Corporates, many of which are FTSE  250 and FTSE 500.  These organisations have long term, significant relationships with Thomson Reuters, not just in our Legal and Compliance business, but also in our Tax and Accounting businesses which can be leveraged.  The role will be office based, with significant face to face client interaction expected driving new business revenue growth.

**About The Role:** 

Manage a territory covering a specific sector, which includes a portfolio of existing customers, focusing on the Thomson Reuters Legal and Compliance portfolio of products

* Drive new business from targeted outbound activity, networking and referrals
* Build a strong sales pipeline to give 3x coverage to annual target
* Consistently overachieve monthly and annual quota through effectively managing pipeline, prioritising the right deals and creating urgency to buy.  Strong metric & KPI driven sales responsibility
* Feedback valuable market and product intelligence to our Product and Proposition teams
* Develop and maintain territory plans
* Working in Salesforce CRM environment throughout deal progression
* Reporting, analysis and meeting involvement as required by Sales Leadership team
* Actively engage in the sales coaching process, partnering well with managers and your peers to share ideas and learn from each other.
* Accurately, and in a timely manner, log all activities and customer contacts in Salesforce CRM.
* Pursue individualized development to improve performance not only in your current role, but for future career opportunities within Thomson Reuters.

**About You:** 

Experience and success working in a targeted and KPI driven sales environment

* Experience of all elements of sales process, client management and CRM tools
* Strong sales presentation and proposal building skills
* Customer centric focus
* Proven negotiator with C Suite, with strong opportunity qualification & client needs analysis skills
* Proven success of lead generation, pipeline development, up selling and cross selling within complex, online content and/or software products
* Experience of successfully managing complex accounts/client relationships
* Ability to navigate large organisations
* Ability to build internal network and manage multiple internal stakeholders to reach successful outcomes
* Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
* Self-motivated & driven
* Excellent face to face presentation and communication skills
* Knowledge and experience of selling to Legal and Compliance roles preferred but not essential
* Salesforce.com familiarity

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Strategic Partnerships Manager - ANZ
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your extensive sales experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? 

We are seeking a Strategic Partnerships Manager who is knowledgeable, capable and charismatic with proven experience working with the big four advisory firms and/or leading Channel and Re-Seller businesses in ANZ. 

You will have demonstrable success in building and executing go-to-market strategies via partner models; focused on meeting corporate sales, revenue, operational and strategic goals.

**About the Role**

In this role of Strategic Partnerships Manager ANZ, you will have the following responsibilities/accountabilities:

* Execute on the overall company partnership model across all the business units of the organization to leverage the channel to new markets. Leverage the central Partnerships capability and the regions business units’ partnerships capability to help build on the current Partner relationships, engagement models and agreements.
* Develop knowledge and strategic relationships of selected partners to build the Partnerships channel of the business. Orchestrate sales, marketing, operations, learning and support to the Partners on the execution of the partner engagement model.
* Construction and enhancement of the partner ecosystem to leverage the cross sell, up sell, and competitor displacement opportunities. Business development skills, commercial acumen and market knowledge will be required.
* Build engines and connections on channel development, partner sales plan and partner ecosystem construction through the proper number of partners & channels, including sales, marketing, training, support.
* Partner with assigned enterprises to identify and deliver on potential new opportunities such as new market development, co-creation or new products and services. Ensure a robust governance model for these partnerships.
* Drive sales strategy and planning jointly with partners through strategic relationships, joint account planning and clear go to market approach. Increase partner reach, frequency and yield, as KPIs to achieve revenue and market share goals.

**About You**

You’re a fit for this role if you possess the following qualifications and experiences:

* Degree or Master’s in Business Administration with at least 10 years of business development and or sales/partnership experience with large enterprise technology companies in ANZ.
* Strong executor of strategies within the A market to establish effective alliance with identified partners. Successful track record of developing new business and leading multiple strategic partnerships.
* Strong networks in the industry and evidence of long-term collaborative relationships with external customers and partners. Aptitude for identifying and solving customer problems through creative solutions using a consultative sales approach.
* Experience to leverage resources based on both influence and authority across business units, functions, regions, and within and outside of the company. Experience in dealing with C Level executives.
* Results oriented, performance driven, and team minded.
* Excellent spoken and written communication skills.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Product Manager - Video
description:
Are you excited about the future of video? Does data and technology excite you? Are you passionate about content and working for an organization that supplies news to publishers across the globe? Reuters is looking for a dynamic product manager to lead our video initiatives across our direct-to-consumer business. 

The **Video Product Manager** will lead video focused initiatives across all advertising-supported video for the consumer business within Reuters – including OTT, social, and website – working closely with Editorial, Ad Sales & Operations, Technology and the wider Product teams. 

**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as **Video Product Manager****,** you will:  

* Own enterprise Video Digital Asset Management System, Video player and Internal Video CMS tools.
* Own product management for video streaming on existing and new OTT platforms and playout on reuters.com.
* Identify and implement new features for playback and ad-tech optimization.
* Closely partner with Revenue Operations team to ensure experience is optimized for various revenue streams (direct, open auction, and DTC).
* Prioritize the implementation of new features and set specific timelines; troubleshoot video related defects.
* Conduct research to identify user needs and gaps; keep on top of industry trends, technologies, and techniques.
* Conduct market research to identify trends to stay ahead of the curve.
* Act as the primary liaison between internal stakeholders including Sales, Analytics, Editorial, Technology and Partners.
* Work with editorial, technology, legal, customer support, and other teams to ensure that our practices, templates, and procedures make us easy to do business with.
* Collaborate with the design and engineering teams to reach the best possible version of a feature (or new product).
* Manage exceptions and unexpected changes to our product portfolio and operations.
* Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the overall health of products and identify new opportunities for improvements, new ways of working, and new areas of development.

**About You** 

You’re a fit for the role of **Video Product Manager** if your background includes:  

* Working knowledge of digital video players and streaming technologies across multiple platforms (e.g., web, mobile and different connected TV devices)
* Minimum of 3 years product experience in agile software development, including integrating customer feedback into requirements, driving prioritization and execution with a focus on improving key metrics
* Ability to read and understand technical standards and specs
* Willingness to work either independently or collaboratively across multi-functional teams as the situation requires
* Translating concepts and requests between technical and non-technical audiences
* Strong track record partnering with design teams and guiding UX
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Understanding of project management tools such as JIRA, ADO and Trello
* Knowledge of video advertising
* Knowledge of video and content technology including production work streams, content management systems, and digital asset management
* Understanding of digital ad insertion and ad measurement (e.g. ad beacons, IAB Open Measurement, ComScore VCE or Nielsen DAR)
* Experience working with global teams

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **Hybrid Work Model****:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

title: Senior Marketing Manager - Reuters Events
description:
**Senior Marketing Manager - Reuters Events** 

**This full-time position is based in London.**

Reuters Events are looking for a **Senior Marketing Manager** based in London to lead the Reuters Events Marketing team. In this varied and fast-paced role, you'll be a crucial facet to driving our commercial success, improving our marketing strategies and keeping us at the cutting edge of the events industry.

**Reuters Events** brings together Reuters globally trusted brand, scale and editorial excellence aligned with domain expertise. We provide content-led conferences for professionals in highly specialized industry sectors to complement our extensive, in-depth content. Reuters Events exists to deliver the intelligence and foster the relationships that shape strategy and safeguard success at leading companies worldwide.

**The Role**

As a **Senior Marketing Manager**, you will be responsible for:

* The day-to-day management of the 25+ members of the Reuters Events Marketing team.
* Managing all aspects of marketing’s contribution to commercial targets & OKRs.
* Setting and ensuring engagement targets are achieved across the business.
* Defining and providing guidance in marketing best practice.
* Analyzing data and spotting gaps in our marketing strategies. We're looking for someone who can constructively critique the marketing strategies behind our events, to manage risks and ensure that our campaigns are as successful as possible.
* Overseeing training and development for marketing staff across the Reuters Events team.

  
**The Person**

To be our **Senior Marketing Manager**, you will likely:

* Be a team player with demonstrable experience of running a reasonably-sized team with a variety of stakeholders.
* Be a motivator with the ability to coach and nurture the development and success of your team
* Be a problem solver with a keen eye for detail. We're looking for someone who can spot gaps, cover inefficiencies and support our marketing team's development to ensure our commercial success.
* Have excellent working knowledge of marketing tactics with a good understanding of digital channels, martech, content and analytics.
* Possess a sound understanding of gathering customer insights and using them to drive successful demand generation campaigns.

**What’s in it For You?**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career:** As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development:** we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employees
* **Benefits:** we offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits
* **Perks:** Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity, and freedom from bias.

With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions.

It supplies business, financial, national, and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time.

Reporting to the Demand Generation Director for Reuters.

title: Analyst - Global Trade Content
description:
​**Analyst - Global Trade Content - Product Content**

Are you looking for a new career opportunity in Trade Content? Join the exceptional Product Content department of Thomson Reuters.

As an Analyst of Global Trade Content, you will participate in an editorial or content operations team and assist in the creation and/or acquisition, preparation and delivery of assigned content and information for creating products and product functionality in all publication media (print or electronic). You will also be responsible for the production of a product line or process.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as an Analyst - Global Trade Content, you will:

* **Research** Trade Content Online for various countries from authorized Government Websites
* The trade Content includes Denied Parties Lists, Regulatory Changes related to Sanctions and Embargoes  across the globe
* **Interpret** and **convert** government legislation related to DPS Sanctions and Embargoes  into Standard format/Software compatible format before loading in the system (Using MS Excel)
* **Extract** the DPS Content from source and convert into standard load file (Excel) and load them into system
* **Track** the daily regulatory changes from government websites for assigned Denied Party lists and update the data whenever applicable based on SLA
* **Validate** the DPS data by comparing source with system data
* **Document** the processes and work instructions
* **Apply** technology to client needs

**About You**

You're fit for the role of Analyst - Global Trade Content if your background includes:

* Knowledge of HS and Customs regulations.
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent command of English, including Chinese language proficiency which is a requisite.
* Analytical, interpretation and translation skills.
* Strong MS Excel skills.
* Strong focus on delivery, including attention to details.
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while at the same time fully participating in a team environment.\
* Language Proficiency Chinese (Simplified & Traditional) would  be an added advantage but not mandatory
* Expertise on various translation tools

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Commodities Correspondent, Indonesia
description:
Reuters is looking for a dynamic and experienced correspondent to cover commodities and energy in resource-rich Indonesia, Southeast Asia’s largest economy that is also the world's top producer of palm oil and a major global supplier of coal, tin, copper, nickel, rubber, coffee, oil and gas as well as a big global buyer of wheat.

The right candidate must be able to break news and deliver insightful, agenda-setting stories on these commodities and energy markets, the frequently changing government policy, as well as the economic and environmental impact of resource extraction. The role will require explaining complex topics to readers around the world.

The successful candidate will be a team player who will work with our financial team and is expected to help coverage in other industries such as aviation, batteries and automotive. As part of the Reuters Indonesia bureau, the successful candidate may also need to cover news stories on other subjects at times.

High proficiency in Indonesian and English languages is required. Experience as a journalist in Indonesia, with a network of sources, is desired.

**About the Role**

As our Indonesia Commodities Correspondent, you will:

* Cover fast-paced, breaking news while delivering deeper, exclusive stories
* Write fast and file accurate stories under time pressure
* Develop sources among policymakers, regulators, traders, companies and other stakeholders
* Generate story ideas, deliver scoops and stories that show a smart, creative approach
* Report on other subjects as needed for our overall Indonesia coverage

**About You**

To be our Indonesia Commodities Correspondent, you will likely have:

* Excellent news judgment and strong reporting skills
* Good understanding of and strong interest in commodity and energy markets and their regulatory environment
* Ability to think outside the box and produce deeply reported, impactful enterprise journalism that illuminates complex topics
* Minimum of three years of journalism experience
* Proven track record as team player
* Excellent English writing skills and preferably fluent in conversational Bahasa Indonesia
* Passion to learn new skills and adapt to new tools and technology

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Solution Consultant
description:
**Shift :- UK shift 12:30pm - 9:30pm IST**

**Experience :- 6+ years**

**​Roles & Responsibilities :-**

* Sales and demonstrations to new and existing customers for all legal software products and services in conjunction with Sales teams within the target market
* Professionally represent our legal software solutions to all levels of buyers as well as internal and external partners
* Supporting the Sales team with sales opportunity qualification and performing technical scope discovery of solution(s) required to address prospect and customer requirements
* Coordinate closely with the Sales team in putting together proposals to align solutions design with customer business requirements
* Delivery and creation of leadership initiatives, user events (user groups, roundtables, trade shows), software releases, and software enhancements
* Producing and maintaining demo data and technical resources for the Sales teams to use, training the Sales team on these, refining these and updating these materials as necessary
* Collecting feedback from the field and working with their Manager and Product Management on the go to market strategy; and
* Taking responsibility for the client experience and ensuring that customer excellence is delivered throughout the sales cycle and delivery process, developing a trusted advisor relationship with client stakeholders in order to help create client champions and advocates.

**Technical /Professional Skills & Competencies:**

* **Experience of working with Legal software products is an advantage**
* Experienced in demonstrating and presenting software solutions preferred
* **A legal work background, either as a lawyer or in a legal operations, legal project manager or similar role is preferred**
* Be a dynamic presenter and quick thinker, experienced in presenting with the personal gravitas to instill confidence in Thomson Reuters and our products
* Customer oriented approach with strong skills in negotiation, complex problem solving and conflict management
* Highly entrepreneurial and ability to work across multiple teams/parts of the organization
* Ability to successfully work in an agile environment. Ability to thrive amidst ambiguity and adapt to shifting circumstances
* Strong collaboration, teamwork and relationship building skills across multiple functions and levels in the organization to develop joint solutions
* Resourceful and highly organized self-starter with the ability to juggle multiple priorities and operate successfully in a complex, dynamic, fast paced, highly collaborative, and continuously evolving environment.

**Education/ Certifications: (Specific degrees and/or certifications required or preferred)**

* A law degree, university degree or equivalent business experience;
* Enterprise / SaaS Sales experience;
* Superior and demonstrable communication skills – verbal and written (English essential, additional languages will be considered an asset); and
* Computer and software skills/knowledge
