title: Sales Executive - Digital Marketing (San Jose, CA)
description:
**Sales Executive Job Description:** 

**Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!**

**What You’ll Do:** As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/solo (1-10 attorney) firms.  You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

**About the Role:** 

* Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
* Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
* Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling.
* Create and maintain sales pipeline status ongoing by maintaining accurate and complete information in selected CRM database including activity, closing, project forecast, close ratios and market intelligence.
* Maintain in-depth knowledge of complete line of products/services and customers business issues and needs.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships.
* Communicate product and service opportunities, information or feedback gathered through client activity to appropriate internal resources, including relevant business issues and industry information for utilization in development of market specific action plans and sales strategy.
* Participate in marketing events, trade shows and Company events.

**About You:**

**Experience & Experience:**

* 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
* Experience in outside sales in a professional B2B environment.
* Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
* Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment a plus.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
* Proven track record of developing new customer accounts requiring heavy prospecting, cold calling, appointment setting and closing ability.
* Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
* Ability to develop and deliver effective presentations.
* Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently
* Demonstrated ability to learn a complex product line quickly through self-initiative and discipline.
* Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).

**Travel:**

* Ability to be actively in the field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

title: Sr site reliability engineer
description:
Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest international multimedia news provider reaching more than one billion people every day. Reuters provides trusted business, financial, national and international news to professionals via Refintiv’s Eikon desktops, the world's media organizations and directly to consumers at Reuters.com and Reuters TV.

The purpose of this role is to support operational stability workflows, systems/services to sustain a high level of quality for Reuters Journalists based all over the world and improve efficiency in day-to-day activity.

You will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle, working collaborative with the team. 

You are empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. 

**You have..**

**Passion.** You are eager to learn new state of the art technologies, but also want to understand the business problems we are trying to solve. You are willing to question the status quo to find a more optimal solution to existing process. You are a strong advocate of DevOps and Cloud Technologies.

**Teamwork.** You thrive in a positive, collaborative environment with your great communication skills. You believe in the value of iterating together towards a common goal. 

The Site Reliability Engineer should have the ability to deliver high quality work on time in a high-energy environment while collaborating and brainstorming with operations and development staff in a dynamic team environment.  

A combination of strong planning, organization, time management skills, and the ability to handle multiple projects are key. The Site Reliability Engineer will also contribute to the maintenance and support of production systems as necessary.

At Thomson Reuters our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team is responsible for ensuring the global availability of critical news production 

**The SRE Role**

SREs are engineers with the right mix of knowledge and skills in software (i.e. programming, data structures and algorithms) and systems (i.e. operating software on internal and external infrastructure at scale).

We constantly evaluate products and services before and after production releases to prevent, identify and fix problems that impact service availability in deploying, configuring, releasing, monitoring, recovering, and scaling.

We participate in on-call rotations to monitor and support our products and services, taking recovery actions prior to and after disruptions.

We dedicate at least 50% of our time applying software engineering principles to resolve problems impacting service uptime or our operational efficiency.

**Our SRE Culture**

To accomplish our mission and continue to build our internal DevOps culture, we embrace and are strong advocates of the CALMS framework.

We seek to eliminate manual and repetitive operations tasks at every opportunity by exploiting open source tools, contributing to open source projects and building new tools when required.

**Requirements:**

7+ years of experience writing clean code in at least one modern system or scripting language such as: JavaScript, Python, Ruby...

Experienced automating software build, deployment and server configuration management using tools such as Puppet, Chef and Jenkins.

Expertise in Windows and Linux system administration, databases (relational and NoSQL), Web Servers (Apache, IIS), networking and storage technologies.

Experience with Cloud technologies and platforms such as AWS or Azure.

Experience and preference to work in an Agile environment, committed to continuously improve that environment.

At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 25,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, colour, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

  
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.

title: China Coal, Gas and Power Correspondent
description:
Reuters is seeking a dynamic reporter to help drive our coverage of China’s coal, gas and power markets as well as the closely watched energy transition in the world’s top coal producer and emitter of CO2.

Based in either Beijing or Shanghai, you will report on China’s coal market and the challenges it faces in balancing its energy security with its climate pledges as well as climate-related shocks such as this year’s drought that hit hydropower generation.

As part of the China energy and commodities team, you will also cover the country’s gas market, investment in grid infrastructure and the mega wind and solar farms that have made China the world’s fastest growing renewable energy market.

The successful candidate will be a proven source-builder with strong story instincts and an eagerness to build expertise in the world’s biggest energy consumer, delivering outstanding coverage for both specialist and general readers. The reporter will also need to be a team player, working closely with colleagues in Beijing, Shanghai and across the globe.

**About the Role:**

As China Coal, Gas and Power Correspondent, you will:

* Build sources among coal and gas traders and utilities to break news on the impact of policy on the market
* Track key companies and technologies that are reshaping the energy landscape in China
* Write fast and accurate headlines and stories under time pressure
* Work closely with colleagues in the China commodities and energy team and around the world

**About You:**

To be China Coal, Gas and Power Correspondent, you will:

* Have great ideas and demonstrated ability to develop sources and deliver outstanding stories
* Have strong news judgement
* Have fluent Mandarin and English
* Be comfortable working with data and have an interest in markets
* Be a strong communicator and team player
* Have experience developing beat expertise

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-NT1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. title: Sr Marketing Audience Activation Specialist
description:
Responsibilities

* Work with segment stakeholders to gather goals, success metrics, and size/prioritize segment creation to meet campaign KPIs
* Collaborate with marketing and customer data teams to build a cohesive and unified view of audience data, facilitating new integrations within and outside of the platform to enhance audience capabilities and design audiences that map to business goals.
* Continuously analyze digital channel data as well as internal, external, and integrated audience data to generate audience-specific insights that drive business decisions and initiatives, from planning phases through activation, and identify optimization opportunities against Demand Gen and eCommerce goals.
* Develop advanced customer segmentation strategies and use segmentation to build audiences in partnership with the Optimization team; target and find those customers (and similar customers) across marketing channels and build a process to ensure audience quality maintenance.
* Effectively develop new and efficient data strategies to keep up with the ever-changing landscape of data. Efficiently maintain multiple data sources supporting their respective data streams to onboard and integrate data into Audience Manager
* Develop reporting capabilities using the DMP to assess audience overlap, trends in size/composition, advertising effectiveness, etc.
* Understand the latest industry trends and use cases surrounding the use of the DMP and be a champion of industry best practices.

Requirements:

* 2+ years of Data Management Platform experience with significant knowledge of common marketing tactics and practices within major data management platforms & strategies.
* Familiarity with troubleshooting out-of-the-box data integrations. Experience in onboarding/maintaining multiple complex data sources.
* Experience with lookalike modeling, audience segmentation, audience strategy development, profile merge rules, and identity resolution solutions.
* Deep understanding of advertising technologies targeting and data collection, with a clear view on how media channels work together to create a cohesive personalized marketing experience
* Demonstrated use of analytical skills, data-driven decision-making, and strong teamwork to drive business results and future media/creative tactics.
* Flexible and nimble to think around tough business problems. Ability to provide out-of-the-box, data-backed solutions to business use cases.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* High attention to detail required

title: Pasante | Asesor de Fidelización de clientes
description:
***Pasante de Fidelización de clientes - Tax and Accounting***

¿Estás apasionado sobre la oportunidad de brindar tus conocimientos y experiencia para apoyar a nuestro equipo de Tax and Accounting, utilizando las mejores prácticas dentro de una empresa multinacional?

¡Queremos que seas parte de nuestro equipo en Thomson Reuters Argentina!

**¿Cuáles son las principales responsabilidades del rol?**

* Realizar llamados a los clientes para conocer su experiencia con la Compañía, tanto en servicio, producto, etc.
* Realizar convocatorias de actividades masivas con clientes
* Gestionar las disconformidades de los clientes desde su origen, desarrollando e implementando soluciones con foco en la resolución.
* Gestionar planes de acción para la mitigación del origen de las disconformidades, analizando y validando que resulten efectivos.
* Identificar tendencias y recopilar información clave para la gestión de la experiencia de nuestros clientes.
* Detectar en forma proactiva a los clientes con máximo riesgo, anticipándose a sus necesidades.
* Informar sobre el uso que el cliente realiza del producto.
* Desarrollar recomendaciones para mejorar la satisfacción del cliente

**Requisitos de la posición:**

* Preferentemente estudiantes de Cs. Económicas, Comunicación, Cs. Sociales o afines.
* Conocimientos de Office, especialmente Excel y Word
* Excelentes habilidades de comunicación interpersonal
* Poseer fuerte orientación al cliente
* Tener experiencia en la atención al cliente
* Capacidad creativa para mejorar los procesos y crear valor agregado.
* Capacidad de organización, gestión del tiempo y capacidad analítica.

***¿Qué te ofrecemos?***

🕑 Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (flexibilidad) 

🏥 OSDE 210

💰 Subsidio internet mensual

🚀 Flex my way (trabaja desde donde quieras dentro del país – 8 semanas al año)

🍀 Days off anuales (mental health – programa de Wellbeing)

🎁 Day off cumpleaños 

🍴 Servicio de vending in office

🏃 Gympass (red de gimnasios)

💻 Equipamiento de trabajo

Nos diferenciamos por tener una **cultura centrada en la diversidad e inclusión**, gran compromiso en el **respeto & bienestar** de los colaboradores, y por sobre todo, un **excelente clima laboral** para que disfrutes la experiencia de trabajar en Thomson Reuters. **¡Súmate a nuestro equipo!**

**#LI-FZ1**

title: Senior Business Development Manager, Tax Solutions Sales
description:
Do you have experience selling enterprise tax or accounting solutions in Japan? Are you keen to join a fast growth, global firm with significant and compelling Japan business cases to share with clients? 

We are seeking for a **Senior Business Development Manager******,** Tax Solutions Sales** to join a supportive, growing team and sell our ONESOURCE corporate tax solution in Japan.

**About the Role:**

As a **Senior Business Development Manager******,** Tax Solutions Sales,** you will:

* Manage a small team of tax solutions Sales Specialists to sell tax software solution in Japan to a pre-defined territory of accounts market segment and white space.
* Build on expert knowledge to target client base, recognize client needs and propose solution.
* Generate new business opportunities by taking qualified leads from multiple sources including marketing, BDRs and self-identified leads.
* Prospect and demonstrate Thomson Reuters’ capability to new customers, develop proposals, negotiate contracts and ultimately close new business
* Collaborate with Client/Strategic Account Managers to deliver sales within existing accounts
* Build competitor knowledge, maintain accurate customer contact and opportunity data in our CRM system, and conduct win/loss analysis plus maintain strong awareness of external market, to identify business opportunities.

**About You**

As a **Senior Business Development Manager******,** Tax Solutions Sales**, you should possess:

* Minimum of 5 years experience in a professional field sales or SaaS business development role
* Tax qualifications ideal, and/or experience working in the Tax/Accounting market or B2B sales to professionals.
* Demonstrated understanding of the Japanese Corporate market
* Demonstrated track record of success in meeting and exceeding sales targets
* Commercial acumen and ability to identify opportunities in white space
* Ability to partner effectively with the wider sales team and internal stakeholders

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Analyst
description:
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your **analysis** experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary provide research and expertise to the national security community, the US military, law enforcement, and the private sector? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

As an Analyst, you will be responsible for performing a wide range of work, from due diligence assessments to threat management reports. We leverage openly available data and our own proprietary holdings to develop relevant, insightful products.

Positions is located at TRSS headquarters in McLean, Virginia.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Analyst, you will:

* Work closely with both client managers and fellow TRSS analysts to develop strong collaborative practices
* Develops and implements large or complex projects and solutions and works on multiple projects with varying levels of complexity
* Provide insightful, well-researched analysis and guidance to clients bases on rigorous, in- depth analysis using public records, proprietary data, and open source data
* Participate in analytic development at TRSS, to include mentorship, training and developing analytic best practices
* Demonstrate personal accountability and ownership of work, with an emphasis on exhibiting success in accomplishing progressively more complex tasks, projects, and collaborations

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Analyst if your background includes:

REQUIREMENTS

* US Citizenship
* Active US Security Clearance – Top Secret or the ability to obtain US Security Clearance
* Active Full Scope Polygraph
* This position will have access to highly sensitive public record information and as a result, all new hires and current employees in positions of this level will be subject to periodic background checks

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Must be creative, intellectually curious, and willing to experiment and work in dynamic organizations and situations, sometimes with little oversight or well-defined requirements
* Bachelor’s degree preferred; relevant military or prior USG experience equivalent experience in lieu of degree.
* 3 to 6 years of previous experience relating to research and analysis.
* Good team player / self-starter with the ability to work using own initiative.
* Strong planning, time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation
* Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail, with a demonstrated high proficiency using open source and research database tools, with emphasis on incorporating multiple data streams into a single deliverable.
* Experience with data analytics, visualization, statistics, or associated tools (e.g. R, SPSS, Tableau, etc.)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience with database, workflow, and orchestration frameworks (e.g. SQL, NiFi)
* Familiarity with at least one major programming language (e.g. Java, Python, R)
* Familiarity with artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing, graph, and data modeling concepts
* An understanding of distributed computing concepts, search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems and relevant evaluation methodologies
* Foreign language skills
* Previous experience with network analysis and/or social network analysis tools and methodologies
* Experience with supply chain analysis and supply chain risk management

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

ABOUT THOMSON REUTERS SPECIAL SERVICES

TRSS is a wholly US-owned, independent subsidiary of Thomson Reuters. Our analysts combine open-source research with the full suite of proprietary Thomson Reuters data holdings to deliver actionable intelligence to our clients.

We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world’s businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise, and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science, and media markets, powered by the world’s most trusted news organization.

As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Please Note: TRSS is also considering candidates outside of the listed locations who wish to work remotely** 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your **analytical processing** experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to **design new software solutions for customers**? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

**What You’ll Do:** As a **Senior Software Engineer**, you will be responsible for working on projects that support and extend the full stack of the TRSS solutions suite to deliver global data using advanced search, big data ingestion and analytical processing using tools like MongoDB, Elastic, and Kafka as well as building leading edge web applications. You will work closely with the other members of the TRSS analytical staff and development to capture customer requirements and design new solutions. This role requires a polyglot engineer who is comfortable with data-intensive systems as well as some frontend UI development. You will be working with an extensive codebase, but this role is a great opportunity to engage in new development. 

As the **Senior Software Engineer,** you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:

* You will be expected to turn ideas in technical solutions with minimal direction
* You may be asked to lead projects or efforts and will act as a mentor to less experienced developers
* You will be part of the specialized TRSS development team and will design implement and deliver software solutions and data science efforts, as well as enhance and support existing applications
* You will engage the TRSS analytical staff to gather requirements, generate ideas, and develop documentation
* You will demo new software solutions as needed
* You will learn and expand your skill set on the job
* You will be expected to own your work and be passionate about the success of the customer

**About You:**

You’re a good fit for the role of **Senior Software Engineer** if you have:

* B.S. in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent work experience
* At least 3 years of professional software development experience
* Be of strong moral and ethical character and have a strong personal work ethic
* Experience mentoring less experienced developers and/or leading small projects or teams
* Strong Engineering and Problem-Solving skills
* Must be a passionate, smart, and articulate technologist
* Full Stack Development experience with the following stack or similar:
	+ Backend: Java SpringBoot (Preferred), or Python
	+ Frontend: React (Preferred), Angular, or Vue
	+ Database: MongoDB, MySQL
	+ Devops: Docker containerization, Jenkins, git, maven
* Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance

**The following skills and tools are preferred, but not required:**

* AWS experience strongly desired
* Neo4J or other graph technology
* Kafka
* Grails, Groovy
* ElasticSearch

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** Environment that encourages continuous learning and development
* **Social Impact:** Six employee-driven Employee Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Compensation:** Competitive salary and bonus component with market-leading benefits

You’re a good fit for the role of **Senior Software Engineer** if you have:

* B.S. in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent work experience
* At least 5 years of professional software development experience
* Be of strong moral and ethical character and have a strong personal work ethic
* Experience mentoring less experienced developers and/or leading small projects or teams
* Strong Engineering and Problem-Solving skills
* Must be a passionate, smart, and articulate technologist
* Full Stack Development experience with the following stack or similar:
	+ Backend: Java SpringBoot (Preferred), or Python
	+ Frontend: React (Preferred), Angular, or Vue
	+ Database: MongoDB, MySQL
	+ Devops: Docker containerization, Jenkins, git, maven
* Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance

**The following skills and tools are preferred, but not required:**

* AWS experience strongly desired
* Elasticsearch
* Kafka
* Neo4J or other graph technology
* Grails, Groovy

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** Environment that encourages continuous learning and development
* **Social Impact:** Six employee-driven Employee Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Compensation:** Competitive salary and bonus component with market-leading benefits

title: Conga Order capture Specialist
description:
**Key Responsibilities**

* Perform hands-on configurations and administration activities
* Ensure the Apttus/Conga environment is reliable, stable, scalable, secure and has good performance
* Configure Price Quote Management, Price Rule Configuration, constraint rule configuration, product catalogue management
* Take care of contract life cycle management configuration including review & approvals
* Take care of billing and Invoicing management, Integration of Billing & Invoicing with downstream ERP systems
* Understand the Customer’s Needs and Wishes, influence and refine their requirements, and guide customers for their business processes keeping domain and Product best practices intact.
* Ensure solution is scalable and meets overall business requirements including that of non-functional requirements
* Will be functional expert in Quote to Cash domain
* Guide technical team (developers) to deliver a flexible and scalable solution
* You will develop relationships with the business units to better understand their needs and find appropriate solutions.
* Provide end-user support across QTC applications, supporting critical business workflows.
* Monitor and ensure the availability of QTC application and the underlying technology stack, manage and monitor the roll-out of QTC application updates, undertake systems testing and verification at the functional level and monitor and evaluate QTC application performance and implement modifications or adjustments as needed.
* Provide business analytics data and ah-hoc reporting.
* Serve as a subject matter expert in gathering business requirements and makes presentations.
* Define, document, and maintain rigor for software releases with best practices.
* Analyze business operations and the QTC application to determine which application changes could improve efficiency, enhance security, and reduce cost.

**Skills & Experience**

* Should have 2 to 5 years of experience (of which >=2 years in Salesforce) as a team member and must have experience in SaaS, Quote-to-Cash, Salesforce.com CRM
* Should have experience in Configuration, support and troubleshooting of Conga CPQ, CLM & Billing issues
* Strong Team Playing, Critical Thinking, Analytical, and strong Problem-solving skills
* Solution Consulting, Requirement Gathering, Requirement Analysis and Salesforce Configuration related skillset
* Should have the ability to understand the underlying architecture of the existing implementation quickly and perform the effective impact assessment within the competitive timeframe
* should have proven ability to design and optimize business processes and to integrate business processes across disparate systems.
* should have ability to work collaboratively within a team environment of cross functional and cross vendor teams, and deliver to aggressive timelines
* should have strong communication and collaboration skills
* certification in Salesforce Platform or  Admin
* Certified & Trained in Conga CPQ,   CLM, Billing Modules

**Summary-**

This role exists to implement configuration changes to Order Capture (Conga) application in the areas of CPQ, Promotions, Approvals/Deal Guidance and Templates as needed by all Thomson Reuters Legal businesses with the implementation and maintenance of Order Capture among Thomson Reuters.

The Order Capture Business Process Analyst & Admin will work closely with the Change, Omni, Success and Merger initiatives and will play a key role in the Order Capture (Conga CPQ & DocuSign) deployment within Thomson Reuters and ongoing integration with Salesforce.com. He/she will work with all segments and business unites to understand current business processes, assess Order Capture processes, develop business requirements, consult with Commercial Engineering and TCS regarding solutions, test for suitable delivery and usability and assist with overall End User Support tickets and issue resolution relative to Order Capture.

title: Tax Content Analyst
description:
In this opportunity as Team Lead, Tax eFiling you will:

* Update existing and assist in building new country templates (and their associated eFiling submissions) in ONESOURCE Corporate Tax in accordance with written requirements / specifications prepared by others
* Test tax templates, to ensure they meet written requirements / specifications prepared by more senior developers based on legislative or tax legislation changes published by Tax Authorities
* Assist with third line support, escalated from the ONESOURCE product support teams and local client service teams
* Support the team, undertaking basic research such as reviewing tax authority documents and tax legislation (for instance looking at technical eFiling information from tax authority webpages)

title: Service Delivery Lead - SAP
description:
* C2C –Service Delivery Lead

ACCOUNTABILITIES
* The Service Lead (SL) role is responsible for defining and prioritizing Defect and Service improvement initiatives with our Technology partners and for driving Root Cause Analysis completion.
* The SL is responsible for ensuring consistent TR wide adherence to Problem Management processes and for working with our Technology Demand Lead to ensure that fixes are prioritized alongside New Demand.
* The SL role is responsible for representing TR during all Major Outages to ensure that preventative measures are pursued through to closure to ensure risk of recurrence is minimized.
* The SL role will also take a lead in defining Service Models for new strategic offerings pursued by the business, and for defining and owning our TCS incident Escalation processes.
* Should be a hands on expert on SAP ABAP and SD areas
* Vision & Strategy 

• Act as the Champion for best-in-class Service and challenge partners to deliver reliable and user-friendly solutions.

Uses his techno functional expertise in SAP to deep dive , understand and provide inputs to fix SAP issues technically and propose improvements.

• Partners with Technology owners to identify solutions to existing Service risks which can be delivered within budget.

• Collaborates with the wider Business Units to ensure our priorities are aligned with addressing Priority pain points. Key Responsibilities

• Owns standardization of support processes to align with C2C&TCS ticketing and problem management processes.

• Owns Defect Problem Working Sessions on behalf of C2C teams and determines priority fixes to be worked into Demand.

• Represents C2C teams during all Major Technology outages. Ensuring fixes and corrective measures are adopted.

• Responsible for managing, communicating, and approving routine system maintenance downtimes

• Works alongside EBS teams to manage and maintain application portfolio and contributes to the application-based pricing model.

• Works alongside stakeholders outside of C2C on Service Improvement initiatives where required. Stakeholder Management

• Partners with OTC leads on Technology Service initiatives.

• Partners with BU stakeholders to identify issues, define approach, solutions, prioritization considerations and implementation tactics

title: Senior Desk Editor, Bangalore Desk
description:
**Senior Desk Editor, Bangalore Desk**
--------------------------------------

The Reuters Bangalore bureau, the largest Reuters news operation in the world, has set a global benchmark for producing real-time company and markets news at speed. The Bangalore Desk is an integral part of this operation, editing every story produced in the bureau and providing hands-on editorial guidance to hundreds of reporters who are covering companies from Sydney to San Francisco. The team of editors, which works 24x5, is also integrated with the Global News Desk, editing stories from other locations as well.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Reuters News** is looking for a **Senior Desk Editor** to help run the fast-paced editing desk in the Bangalore bureau.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**About You:**
--------------

The ideal candidate will:
-------------------------

* Have a strong background in news editing, with an eye for detail and the ability to simplify and explain often-complex material. They will be well versed in financial news and comfortable editing stories across financial markets and company news;
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Adept at making split-second editing decisions on fast-moving news, while also masterfully crafting longer stories that appeal both to professionals who rely on Reuters News to help make investment decisions and general readers who access news through Reuters.com and media outlets worldwide;
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Be skilled at giving constructive and real-time feedback as they safeguard Reuters’ high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**And as a Senior Desk Editor, you will:**
------------------------------------------

* Edit, rewrite and reshape stories with dynamic prose and strong news judgment; ensure stories have context and actionable content for clients; produce sharp headlines, punchy leads and overall lively writing
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Run shifts
----------
* Ensure that stories meet Reuters’ standards for accuracy, speed, balance and clarity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Enforce Reuters’ high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies laid out by the Reuters Trust Principles and the Reuters Handbook for Journalists
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Experience & Behaviours:**
----------------------------

To apply for this role, you will likely have:
---------------------------------------------

* **5-10 years** of experience editing business news. Reporters with proven writing and team leading skills will also be considered.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* An ability to multi-task and deliver under pressure
---------------------------------------------------
* Strong communication skills along with a Diverse & Inclusive mindset.
---------------------------------------------------------------------

**What’s in it for you:**
-------------------------

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Learning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training resources and offers exposure to leading talent programs both internally & externally
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days, Flexible Work Arrangements, Work-From-Anywhere option, comprehensive health cover self & family, savings & investment plans
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Perks: Work alongside diverse global professionals to gain true global experience, social events & activities.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**About Reuters**
-----------------

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Senior Editor, Practical Law: International Trade
description:
We are seeking an experienced international trade lawyer to join the Practical Law Commercial team in the UK. The role offers an opportunity to further develop Practical Law's international trade law offering and lead on writing content covering international trade issues for Practical Law UK/EU/Global.

Practical Law is a leading online know-how service providing rigorous, peer-reviewed resources, such as practice notes, current awareness and checklists to help legal professionals work smarter and advise with confidence. Practical Law is part of Thomson Reuters, one of the world’s most trusted providers of answers across law, tax, compliance, government and media.

**About the role**

As a senior editor in Practical Law, you will use your specialist knowledge of international trade law to provide and maintain a wide range of Practical Law content. Working in a supportive team of highly experienced colleagues, you will deal with a breadth of interesting legal and editorial work including:

* Analysing the latest legal, regulatory and policy developments, deciding which items to cover and to what extent
* Creating new and maintaining existing materials spanning a variety of formats including comparative resources
* Commissioning, reviewing and editing content written internally and externally
* Meeting with external customers and industry experts to maintain and build understanding of the latest trends and pressures in international trade law and practice

In addition to this, you will assist:

* With marketing the Practical Law international trade law offering and engaging with subscribers
* The wider Thomson Reuters team (including Sweet & Maxwell and Westlaw), liaising with sales, marketing, product management, technology and segment functions where necessary

The successful candidate is likely to have:

* At least five years’ post qualification experience in either a law firm, in-house or at the bar
* A demonstrable interest and ability in writing
* In-depth understanding of international trade law
* Substantial experience in a range of international trade law work

**What’s in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines
* **Culture**: Globally recognised and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development**: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work**: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world

**We are happy to discuss remote/hybrid working**

**#LI-EH2**

title: Manager, Product Management
description:
Thomson Reuters is a leading provider of compliance software to the tax and accounting profession in the UK, with solutions covering personal tax, corporate tax, accounting, practice management and client collaboration.

Our integrated software designed for accountants helps them save time, improve profit margins, and enhance the services they provide. Knowing they have a reliable and trusted platform underpinning their business frees them up to focus on the enhanced services they offer to their clients, providing them with a competitive edge.

We have an exciting opportunity for an innovative and collaborative Product Management professional to lead our UK suite of products for Tax and Accounting Professionals.

We are seeking a self-starter with a passion for building strong product teams, tackling complex problems, and partnering with a diverse set of global customers, designers, engineers, colleagues and stakeholders. 

As part of the Product Management people leadership team, the **Manager, Product Management** is responsible for the growth and development of the Product Managers they lead, instilling in them the core tenants of Product Management at Thomson Reuters while delivering against their own objectives.  This person will work closely with design and engineering to solve customer problems throughout the end-to-end product life cycle. This role will be responsible both for developing a strategy to grow existing products, and for leading new product development efforts. This person will provide strong leadership to their team, helping to mitigate and resolve setbacks and roadblocks, build and engage a high performing product team, and foster a culture of feedback, experimentation and learning.

**About the Role**

*As a*Manager, Product Management *you will:* 

* **Develop strong product intuition** by interpreting and assessing customer problems, business needs and opportunities and offering potential solutions with a moderate level of guidance and direction.
* **Build world class capabilities and products** by creating a vision for product and maintaining the product roadmap and partnering closely with dev teams and UX to execute the roadmap and deliver efficiently. This includes serving as the customer voice for the engineering teams, prioritizing the product backlog based on customer and business value, and using metrics to monitor and measure progress.
* **Demonstrate leadership by taking extreme ownership** for a product / product line, its performance and reliability, and delighting our clients with a positive experience. You will show that you can learn from your experiences, recover from setbacks, and effectively evangelize the product vision to colleagues.
* **Build, manage and lead a world class team of product managers**.  You will lead a team to define and deliver significant strategic initiatives.

In order to be successful in achieving these goals, you will be:

* **Curious & Innovative,** starting with an obsession for our customers’ problems and needs and then working closely with customers, partners, and other Thomson Reuters colleagues to solve them in unique ways
* **Agile** with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines, unafraid of failure
* **An effective communicator** who projects confidence and communicates concisely and clearly to management, peers, customers and partners

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Manager, Product Management if your background includes:

* Proven Product Management Professional
* Experience coaching and leading a team is preferred
* Experience working with technology development in the tax and/or accounting arena preferred
* University Degree in Business or Computer Science preferred (or equivalent experience)
* 5-7 years of Product Management background

**What’s in it for you?** 

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the beneﬁts we oﬀer for your personal and professional growth:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: Gerente de Canais
description:
**Gerente de Canais**

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Gerente de Canais em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição**

Nesta oportunidade, como Gerente de Canais, você irá:

* Atuar na prospecção e recrutamento de Parceiros de mercado.
* Apresentar a proposta de valor da Thomson Reuters para os Parceiros que estejam interessados em nossa parceria.
* Realizar o Onboard dos Parceiros alinhado com o Programa de Canais Thomson Reuters.
* Atuar na Prospecção de Canais de vendas e serviços.
* Executar o plano de onboard e conexão com os times de vendas.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Ter atuado em empresas de tecnologia que possuam vendas através de Parceiros.
* Experiência solida como Gerente de Canais e Parcerias, no segmento de tecnologia.
* Experiência com business plan no nível executivo (C-Level).

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Bem-estar**: benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Aprendizagem e Desenvolvimento:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Dez mil cafés Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: Business Development Manager, Risk - ANZ
description:
We are seeking an experienced sales professional who is passionate about making a positive impact on companies that strive for excellence in regulatory compliance. This role will be based in our Sydney office.

Thomson Reuters Compliance Learning and Regulatory Intelligence solutions lead the market globally and count many blue-chip financial institutions and leading corporates among their clients.

Our compliance learning products offer engaging and innovative courses to drive cultural change and compliance across the organization, and our regulatory intelligence database helps executives and compliance specialists stay on top of the overwhelming scope of global regulatory change.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Business Development Manager, Risk you will:

* **New Sales–** Grow compliance learning and regulatory intelligence business in the Pacific-region by proactively developing and deploying sales strategies in collaboration with account management and utilizing specialist knowledge. Major emphasis on opening up new business, both within existing accounts and new customers. Bring inbound leads to closure.  Use CRM to manage client communication, sales pipeline, and prioritize leads to effective closing.
* **Grow selected strategic accounts –** Work with our existing client base to both retain repeat business and open new opportunities.  Develop strategic annual plans with our largest customers to map out their regulatory learning journeys for current year and future.  Leverage your domain expertise to build credibility and trust. Collaborate and support the GTM-teams from our Tax and Legal divisions.
* **Market Development & Thought Leadership -** work with marketing teams to execute and provide expertise to support our market development efforts.  Represent Thomson Reuters at relevant events and fora.
* **Local Product & Market Expertise –** capture feedback from customers and monitor regulatory changes that necessitate new product offerings or updates.  Work with global teams to ensure our products meet local needs and will drive growth.  Attend relevant events and monitor other sources to ensure knowledge currency.
* **Invest & Collaborate with the Team** - you will serve a central role in our Emerging Markets and Asia regulatory team.   Be an internal and external advocate for these solutions and get others excited.  Mentor new joiners to drive business growth

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Business Development Manager, Risk if your background includes:

* Year 5 years of sales experience, with track record of exceeding quota
* Demonstrated strong sales ‘closer’
* Structured and hands-on approach to managing their prospecting and business development activities
* Consultative selling experience: Ability to discuss with and understand client needs, map clients’ requirements to our offerings, provide comprehensive solutions, discuss with pre-sales team, quote prices, prepare proposals and presentations.
* Experience in financial and non-financial markets dealing with associated compliance obligations and regulations
* Strong understanding of training and learning workflows within client organizations preferred

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Proposition "Go to Market" Manager - Content
description:
Do you have "go to market" experience, ideally in legal publishing or similar? Are you commercially savvy with analysis and reporting skills and the ability to collaborate and influence effectively? The Proposition Manager is responsible for performance of Westlaw portfolio in ANZ, including ownership of go-to-market strategy, delivery of new sales, retention and price increase objectives.

title: Implementation Consultant
description:
**Day-to-Day Responsibilities:**

* Ability to develop complex Object-Oriented ABAP objects independently.
* Gather business, process and integration requirements between OneSource Indirect Tax Determination and SAP (SD, FI, MM)
* Lead requirements and analysis workshops with clients to define business, process, functional and data mapping requirements
* Perform Pricing and Tax related configurations for SD, MM and FI modules and develop ABAP programs to integrate OneSource Determination and SAP
* Analyze SAP code and functionality to design and develop custom solutions as per requirements.
* Configure OneSource Indirect Tax Determination for integration with SAP.
* Coordinate technical implementation with the client, providing technical expertise necessary to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
* Prepare and execute test scripts and test cases
* Ability to maintain a SAP ECC, S/4HANA system and take care of simple maintenance tasks like User maintenance, Authorizations, Archiving.
* Write Technical design document before development begins

**Qualification**:

Education: Masters or Bachelor’s Engineering degree.

**Required Skills (Must Have’s):**

* Must have good interpersonal and communication skills – written and verbal
* Must have experience in consulting or supporting clients in the US, APAC or Europe – either over conference calls or in-person
* Must be able to demonstrate analytical/critical thinking
* Must have 4+ years of developing ABAP programs for SD, MM, and/or FI.
* Must have 4+ years of experience of supporting or implementing for SD, MM, and/or FI.
* Must have solid understanding of O2C (order to cash) and P2P (procure to pay) business processes related to SAP ECC and SAP S/4 HANA functionalities and configuration
* Must be skilled in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues
* Must have experience creating and executing test cases and test scripts for SAP ECC and SAP S/4 HANA implementations
* Experience working with clients to determine transaction tax requirements (VAT), particularly with enterprise financial solutions is highly desired.
* Experience with integrating third party enterprise tax products (e.g. ONESOURCE, Sovos, Avalara and/or Vertex) is highly desired
* Custom report development using SAP framework
* Custom UI development using SAP framework

**Desired Skills (Nice to have but not mandatory):**

* SQL experience would be a plus.
* Experience in developing enterprise-class solutions using tech such as Java / .NET would be a plus
* CI/CD on cloud (preferably AWS or OCI) would be a plus
* SD/MM/FI certification desirable

Data modelling and ER concepts for extension design and development

title: Associate Sales Executive
description:
**Team Mission**  
  
Our team is responsible for helping both new and existing customers make informed business decisions to better manage the ever-changing business ecosystem through our highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for Tax & Accounting professionals. Our software products drive productivity, data, content and research capabilities through world-class AI and machine learning. We measure our success by achieving new sales and retention targets as well as achieving high customer and employee satisfaction scores.

We enable success through intensive training and onboarding that allows you to become a product expert, and continued mentorship programs to help you hit those sales goals every month. If you want to be a part of a high performing sales organization and have an immediate impact, apply today!

**About the Role**

The **Associate Sales Executive** in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Small-Mid client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 1-30 professionals. The Associate Sales Executive position is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.

The successful Associate Sales Executive:

* Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.
* Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.
* Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.

***Note:*** *This is an inside sales \***hybrid** role (**\***mix of working 2 days 'in-office' and 3 days from home/remote each week) that can be based in **any** of these corporate Hub office locations: **Ann Arbor, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Dallas/Carrollton.***

**What You Will Do:**

In this opportunity as an **Associate Sales Executive**, you will:

* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You:**

You may be a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Minimum 3 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Ability to win new customers as well as cross sell/upsell existing customers
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently many of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we have never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success.

title: China Breaking News Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for an energetic journalist with proven news judgement to join our Breaking News team in Beijing. The successful candidate will be part of a high-performing team working in a fast-paced environment covering breaking news across a broad range of topics, from the economy and diplomacy to COVID 19, the environment and social media trends.

    

The Breaking News Correspondent will be a confident writer who thrives under pressure, able to pull the most important elements out of often-complex statements and breaking news events and write clear, concise, accurate and fast headlines and stories.

**About the Role**

As China Breaking News Correspondent, you will:

--Report from a range of sources, mostly in Chinese, on news developments across China

--Write fast and accurate headlines and crisp, clear stories under time pressure

--Work with colleagues across the Greater China bureaus and across multiple areas of coverage

**About You**

To be our Breaking News Correspondent, you will likely:

--Have at least two years of journalism experience

--Have strong and proven news judgement

--Be able to filter quickly through complex information to identify and explain key news elements

--Have strong Mandarin and fluent English

--Be social media savvy

--Be a strong team player

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
