title: Sr. Implementation Consultant - GTM
description:
**Job responsibilities include:**

* Assist and provide directions to customers in installing, configuring, and testing the integrations.
* Perform detailed analysis of the integration with SAP.
* Configure and test ONESOURCE Global Trade APIs and interfaces.
* Deliver ABAP development to customize the existing extractor.
* Provide SAP domain know-how, act as an SAP expert at Thomson Reuters’ projects and coordinate with other functional consultants within the ONESOURCE Global Trade application to ensure a full end-to-end integration solution.
* Work closely with other Functional Consultants, as well as the Product & Technology teams and Customer Support in some phases of the implementation.
* Participation in projects in the US and global projects.

**Qualifications / Requirements:**

* At least 3+ years of technical experience with SAP, interface configuration and support, and/or ABAP development.
* Experience with process analysis, design, field mapping, configuration, and implementation.
* Excellent debugging skills.
* Experience with SOAP Services using XML Payload
* Experience with configuring and monitoring endpoints for web services with SOAMANAGER, SAP PI/PO or SAP CPI.

**Highly Desirable Skills/Experience:**

·       5+ years of relative work experience

* Experience with SAP CPI (highly desirable).
* Experience with configuring endpoints in SAP PI/PO and monitoring integrated scenarios.
* Experience with Proxies, SOAMANAGER
* Experience with implementation in large-scale SAP implementations.
* Exposure to Global Trade or Supply Chain Businesses, processes
* Experience Implementing Enterprise Software including Cloud Solutions and third-party applications
* Experience creating and executing test cases and test scripts

**Other Qualifications:**

* Fluency in English.
* Excellent communication skills in interacting with management and communicating with both internal and external stakeholders.
* Strong customer-facing experience and skills.
* Strong desire to learn & highly self-motivated.
* Ability to multi-task and work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Possesses a professional and cooperative attitude.
* Self-starter who works well both independently and on a team.

·       Experience being managed by remote teams/offices.

**Education Required:**

* Higher Education Degree or Diploma – Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain, International Business, Computer Science or Engineering preferred.

title: Salesforce (HVS) - Implementation and Adoption Specialist
description:
This role exists to provide end user support to the sales and account management teams on Salesforce.com  High Velocity Sales.

**MAJOR AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY**

* Provide level 1 response to HVS questions from Sales professionals.
* Live monitor SFDC Answers site providing near real time issue resolution.
* Support hours are from 7:00am to 6:00pm Central Time Monday through Friday including on call support as needed.
* Identify Training Opportunities and partner with Sales Operations Leaders and Training Team to promote on-going learning related to HVS.
* Support systems enhancement and upgrade processes, UAT, BVT, and Regression testing.
* Recommend enhancements based on experience in the systems and feedback from users including rationally for recommending one enhancement over another.
* Partner with Business Analysts to develop BRS Documentation establishing the technology requirements for all SFDC Enhancements.
* Develop Testing Scenarios for User Acceptance Testing, Establish test control and execute testing.
* Develop email templates and cadences for HVS based on the requirements brought forward by reps and managers.
* Aid in the design and produce reporting and analysis.
* Provide reporting to Sales Operations leadership relating to salesforce.com HVS adoption and use.
* Provide reporting to Sales management relating to salesforce.com HVS usage and support the managers to insure our reps are acting on cadence steps in a timely manner.
* Miscellaneous other duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s Degree with 2+ years of technology experience
* General knowledge of Salesforce.com High Velocity Sales
* Sound understanding of our offerings in the Marketplace; ability to connect usage of SFDC to an improved sales process.
* Ability to communicate effectively face to face, in videoconference and in telephone conversations
* Ability to communicate effectively in writing; including the ability to present information, ideas and strategies in writing in ways that facilitate understanding
* Effectively manage projects in order to achieve intended outcomes within allocated timescale and resources
* Ability to lead by influencing others
* Experience developing SFDC curriculum to drive adoption of SFDC
* Excellent writing, presentation and overall communication skills
* Excellent organization and prioritization skills

title: Senior Sales Executive
description:
**Team Mission**  
  
Our team is responsible for helping both new and existing customers make informed business decisions to better manage the ever-changing business ecosystem through our highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for Tax & Accounting professionals. Our software products drive productivity, data, content and research capabilities through world-class AI and machine learning. We measure our success by achieving new sales and retention targets as well as achieving high customer and employee satisfaction scores.

We enable success through intensive training and onboarding that allows you to become a product expert, and continued mentorship programs to help you hit those sales goals every month. If you want to be a part of a high performing sales organization and have an immediate impact, apply today!

**About the Role**

The **Senior Sales Executive** in our Tax & Accounting Professionals Small-Mid client segment is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their geographic area of responsibility. Their territory consists of customers and prospects with 1-30 professionals. The Sales Executive position is a virtual role, requiring excellent telephone and writing skills.

The successful Senior Sales Executive:

* Draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts.
* Has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the tax and accounting industry.
* Tailors their client presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.

***Note:*** *This is an inside sales \***hybrid** role (**\***mix of working 2 days 'in-office' and 3 days from home/remote each week) that can be based in **any** of these corporate Hub office locations: **Ann Arbor, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Dallas/Carrollton.***

**What You Will Do:**

In this opportunity as a **Senior Sales Executive**, you will:

* Attain sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis
* Demonstrate the use of Tax & Accounting products to the customer
* Obtain and provide territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
* Confer with and assist in customer-related issues as needed to maintain good customer relations
* Complete weekly sales performance reports and completes all CRM reporting in a timely and accurate manner
* Drives strategic initiatives supported by assigned account team consisting of Sales Development Representative, Account Development Representative and Solutions Consultants to drive growth in assigned territory
* Leverage sales automation tools and data insights to engage prospects and expedite sales cycles (such as utilizing Flash/EMS/Salesforce)
* Attend sales meetings and conventions as required

**About You:**

You may be a fit for the role if you have/are:

* Minimum 5 years of successful sales experience with proven/consistent track record of quota attainment
* Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) experience a plus
* Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
* Excellent communication skills & presentation skills to maximize phone and virtual client meetings/presentations
* Strong prospecting and closing skills
* Ability to win new customers as well as cross sell/upsell existing customers
* Strong time management and organization skills
* Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
* Highly proficient in MS Office suite, utilizing a CRM (such as Salesforce preferred) and overall technical aptitude
* Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded, positive attitude
* High level of integrity and understanding of sales ethics

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently many of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we have never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
* **Compensation:** Base salary and variable compensation that is related to your success

As required by local legislation for this remote based role, the total target cash compensation range for this position is $84,000 - $156,000. This is inclusive of both base pay and any target sales incentive.

title: Sr. Consultant- One Stream
description:
* **Job Description Summary**

The Thomson Reuters Financial transformation team instrumenting on implementing and delivering solution relating to digital finance strategies, enterprise performance strategies and technologies solutions. This position will play a key role as part of Performance Management projects, including tech driven transformation with tools like Hyperion and OneStream.

**Required Experience and Skills:**
* Minimum 5+ years working experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
* Hands on experience in BI analytics and visualization tools: OneStream, Hyperion
* Experience in SQL, Data Warehouse
* Experience working in at least one Financial Planning System: Hyperion Planning / HFM/ Essbase / OneStream XF
* Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for the insights that result from those analyses, together with a strong understanding of the data and collection processes needed to fuel that analysis.
* Must have a passion for serving others, work well in a team, be self-motivated, and be a problem-solver.
* **About a Role:**
* Leading Financial Planning and Performance Management projects, including tech driven transformation with tools like Hyperion and OneStream
* Leading of designing multi-dimensional planning models
* Will be responsible for ensuring successful implementation of OneStream solutions
* Will focus on technical delivery and will be responsible for the quality of deliverables
* Will work independently with technical/functional direction from the leads
* Will provide functional knowledge and expertise in the core consolidation and FPA processes to translate into system solutions
* Deliver BI and Analytics capabilities: work with Finance partners to build an accurate, consistent and easy to navigate data visualization and analytics solutions
* **What’s in it for you:**
* You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* Learning and Working on cutting edge Process and Technology like OneStream and Power BI
* Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
* Excellent benefits Package

description:

title: Senior Product Manager - Search & Network Advertising
description:
As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career.

As Senior Product Manager – Search & Network Advertising within our FindLaw business, you will play a crucial role in helping our law firm customers achieve their marketing and business development goals through digital advertising products covering search, ad networks and marketplaces, and partnerships.

In this role you’ll own the vision, direction, and priorities for these digital advertising products, managing the entire product life cycle from strategic planning to tactical execution.  You will understand customer and user needs in depth; communicate those needs crisply and succinctly across the organization; and work with execution teams to translate those needs into clear priorities, compelling roadmaps and high-impact, innovative solutions.  You’ll be trusted to take on new and ambiguous projects and initiatives related to these products and help set clear direction and solve complex and difficult marketing problems with for customers.

**About the Role**

As the Senior Product Manager – Search & Network Advertising, you will: 

* Develop strong product intuition by interpreting and assessing customer problems, business needs, market opportunities and competitive assets to develop products and solutions with a moderate level of guidance and direction.
* Build market leading capabilities and products by creating a vision for product and maintaining the product roadmap and partnering closely Tech, Analytics and Operations teams to execute the roadmap and deliver efficiently. This includes serving as the customer voice for the engineering teams, prioritizing the product backlog based on customer and business value, and using metrics to monitor and measure progress.
* Work closely with Digital Solutions operations teams responsible for executing and delivering the products for law firm customers to collect feedback, identify opportunities for product and operational improvement.
* Demonstrate leadership by taking extreme ownership for a feature/product, its performance and reliability, and delighting our clients with a positive experience. You will show that you can learn from your experiences, recover from setbacks, and effectively evangelize the product vision to colleagues.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Product Manager – Search & Network Advertising if you have: 

* A Bachelor’s degree with a background in background in business, economics, marketing, analytics, statistics, or related field.
* A deep, demonstrated understanding of digital marketing and the metrics and economics surrounding it, with an emphasis on search advertising, ad networks or programmatic marketplaces.  A background in actively managing and purchasing digital marketing or search ad campaigns a significant plus.
* 4+ years of progressively accountable product management experience, in line with the description of the role above and with demonstrated results of success.
* Experience in serving and addressing the needs of our core market of law firms (or other similar professional services firms) with digital marketing products and services is a significant plus.
* A strong knowledge of digital advertising and analytics platforms such as Google Ads, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc., and the metrics and measures they report.
* Proven track record of using data to drive digital marketing decisions for customers and products you have managed
* Excellent oral, written, and visual (PowerPoint slides) communication skills, especially in distilling information into digestible bites, telling stories with data, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.

  

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-SB4

description:

title: Business Analyst - Target & Territory Design
description:
**Business Operations Analyst**
-------------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? Do you have previous experience designing territories, assigning accounts, and setting targets for the customer success organization?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to partner closely with customer success and business leaders in the annual quota and territory design cycles.

**About the role**

In this opportunity as a **Business Operations Analyst**, you will:

* Be responsible for setting the sales targets and designing the territories for the customer success team.
* Align the company’s targets, resources, and opportunities, to provide the customer success organization with the targets and territory structure needed to deliver on the objectives in a way that makes both the company and customer success team successful and rewarded.
* Analyze, discuss, and evaluate, the quotas and territories will be designed to motivate the customer success team in a way that aligns their priorities with the organization’s goals.
* Support functions such as Finance, HR, Sales Operations, and Sales Compensation teams.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if you have:

* Bachelor's Degree.
* Fluent English is a must.
* +2 years of corporate experience in a finance or operations role (e.g., Sales Compensation, Sales Operations, Commercial Policy).
* Customer success experience.
* Experience calculating and setting sales quotas.
* Experience with territory design and management.
* Thorough understanding of sales roles and objectives.
* Ability to balance attention to detail with aligning to the big picture.
* Strong analytical skills with a propensity towards data analysis and interpretation.

**Location: CDMX**

#LI-EG1
-------

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

title: QA Software Test Engineer
description:
* Provides the planning, integration, casing, scripting, and execution of all testing required of a single software change or project or program.
* Independently develops test plan documents, writes and executes automation scripts, manual test cases etc. Provides guidance to less experienced staff for the above.
* Reviews business requirements, and design specifications complex changes/systems for completeness and testability.
* Conducts testing using company-specific, manual, programmatic or automated processes.
* Develops and executes test scripts, lead bug triage meetings, coordinate with the development teams, and communicate on Testing status and Test Results, all independently.
* Typically spends time doing "hands on" work such as producing design documents, reviewing deliverables and making code changes on complex modules
* Develops software to test Applications.
* Logs defects per defined project guidelines and standards and analyzes defects including the origin and cause, communicates pertinent information, and confirms resolution of defects.
* Provides subject matter expertise across sub-units.
* Gives advice to middle management on functional matters, or on the interpretation of policies and practices.
* May have some responsibility for managing third party deliveries.
* Leverages technical solutions across multiple projects
* Stays current with industry trends and identifies technologies that will impact the business.
* May lead a small group on implementing projects with manageable risks and resources requirements.
* Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or problems of high complexity.
* Works on medium to large, moderately complex projects/issues that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines.
* Typically works on one project at a time and as the leader of one or more small-medium technical team
* Works on projects of varying complexity including very large and complex projects that require increased skill in multiple technical disciplines.
* Estimates effort required for own work and checks and agrees other team members' estimates.
* Accountable for planning work assigned to their team, including work breakdown, accurate estimate and identification of possible solution options.
* Accountable for tracking status of team's work and ensuring deliverables are produced on agreed schedules.
* Identifies risk, comes up with mitigation plan, communicates the same, and develops and escalation process.
* Responsible for communicating accurately the status of ongoing work to stakeholders
* Recommends improvements to the testing processes to create efficiencies.
* Software Process:
* Prepare SQA plans for projects according to documented procedure.
* Works with the software project during its early stages to establish plans, standards, and procedures.
* Reviews projects software engineering activity to verify compliance.
* Audits designated software work products to verify compliance.
* Implements collection of software metrics.
* Escalates software process issues to appropriate levels of management.

title: Back End Software Engineer
description:
* Writes new software, makes modifications to existing software, or integrates software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications, created in partnership with others
* Creates and executes unit testing and integration testing ensuring software meets requirements.
* Contributes to the creation of design. May lead the design of less complex components.
* May provide technical support to operations or other development teams.
* Creates, reviews, and maintains all required technical documentation/ manual related to assigned software to ensure supportability and reuse.
* Reviews work of peers and more junior developers.
* Provides wider feedback into performance
* Assists in identification and implementation of short-term and long-term solution options, including risk assessments.
* Assists with improvements to prevent problems, including problem resolution workflow.
* Participates in remediation solutions.
* Participates in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide design options, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
* Provides work breakdown and estimates for small software development tasks.
* Provides timely status updates for areas of individual responsibilities within projects to supervisor
* Actively participates in team and status meetings.
* Demonstrates software as requested
* Develops software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to team/company standards and software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies.

**Backend Software Engineer – Reuters Technology:** 

The Reuters Technology team supports Reuters’ staff and products throughout the News production lifecycle - from discovery of newsworthy events, to researching the story, through publication and delivery of content to our customers. We are working to improve Reuters news production, automation, and content delivery and we are seeking an experienced and motivated engineers to help build and evolve our technology platforms. Do you want to learn what drives news, and learn about the depth and breadth of Thomson Reuters' content? Come join us! 

In this role you will work closely with UI engineers and product team members to prioritize and deliver new technology components and capabilities. You will help us build these new capabilities in the public cloud-based to drive improvements in content production workflows, news content formats, and news distribution and display in our various web-based products. 

**Roles and Responsibilities** 

* Own large and complex technical projects that interact with several other systems
* Participate and contribute to requirements analysis
* Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
* Write clean, scalable, and testable code using modern programming languages to support application frontends
* Test and deploy applications and systems
* Revise, update, refactor and debug code
* Help recruit, hire, and mentor your peers and other engineers as we grow
 

**Qualification**: 

Education: Minimum bachelor’s degree in computer science and engineering or related field of study, or equivalent experience 

**Requirements**: 

* You are curious, want to know how things work, and learn new skills
* 3+ yrs. experience with NET Core (preferably in Linux)
* AWS knowledge (SNS/SQS, ECR/ECS, EC2, S3 minimum demonstrable programmer knowledge especially in .NET and/or Python)
* Docker containerization/microservice architecture in cloud environments
* Experience with websockets, REST
* Detailed understanding of webpages at a source level, DoM (xpath, css selectors), basic javascript
* Agile development and delivery
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability and passion to learn modern technologies quickly
* Team player and self-starter
 

 

**Desired**: 

 

* Experience with CI/CD, especially github actions and/or gitlab runners
* Experience with Selenium
* Knowledge of Networking Concepts and Protocols

title: Architect, Tax and Accounting Professionals
description:
As an employee at **Thomson Reuters**, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business and your career. 

**About the Role**

*In this opportunity as an Architect, Tax and Accounting Professionals, and you will:*

* **Be a Technical Leader:**Research and recommend technical standards and best practices, ensure the architecture and design is well communicated and fits with overall technology and product strategy; and be hands-on in required areas to implement core components which would be reusable across applications.
* **Be a Decision Maker**: Make quick and effective data-driven decisions, with good problem solving and analytical skills to infer qualitative and quantitative data and roll-out strategy that aligns with company goals.
* **Be a Team Player** – the ability to work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, diverse ideas, partner with cross-functional and remote teams
* **Be Curious & Innovative** – continuously update yourself with next-generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices.
* **Be an Agile Person** – with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.
* **Be an efficient Stakeholder Manager**: Collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders such as business teams, product owners, project management in defining a roadmap for products and processes. Act as point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
* **Focus on quality, continuous improvement and technical standards –** keep service focus on reliability, performance, and scalability while driving improvements in productivity and software development/architecture. Prepare technical specifications and align with industry best practices
* **Be an Effective Communicator –**the ability to articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills. Work with the business owners to translate requirements into actionable architectures.

**About You**

*You're a fit for the role of an Architect if you:*

* Have 9+ years of professional experience designing, developing, deploying, and supporting products in an enterprise or SaaS environment
	+ Have hands on experience in developing distributed applications using frameworks and technologies like Java, C#, J2EE, Asp.net Web Api/MVC, Spring frameworks, ORMs and UI frameworks like Angular, React etc
	+ Have experience in implementing containerized applications using orchestration technologies like dockers, kuberenetes (optional)
	+ Have experience in Event driven architecture using messaging frameworks like RabbitMQ, Kafka, SQS, etc.
	+ Have a strong experience in designing cloud native applications in microservices architecture pattern which are highly scalable, resilient, and self-healing
	+ Have experience in designing APIs which are highly secured and meets the industry design standards.
	+ Possess knowledge in the areas of automation (CI/CD), and system & application monitoring using tools like DataDog, NewRelic, etc.
	+ Have experience with relational database and/or NoSQL databases

**What's in it For You**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Learning & Development:**Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology 
	+ Career growth - the ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams
	+ Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series etc.
	+ Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone
* **Benefits/Perks**:  
	+ Health benefits
	+ Savings/investment plans
	+ Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)
* **Flexibility:** We've been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance
* **Global Opportunities:** We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries
* **Your wellbeing:** We offer programs that focus on making our lives healthier

**#LI-ED1**

title: Sales Representative
description:
Territory Manager ***para Thomson Reuters Argentina***

***¡Que tus próximos pasos sean en TR!***

Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de profesionales con *motivación, orientación al cliente y proactividad para* desarrollarse en el rol de **Territory Manager** dentro de nuestro equipo de Latam – Legal

***Responsabilidades del rol:***

- Formar parte del área de ventas suscriptivas de información y gestión legal.

- Realizar venta consultiva de nuestros productos intangibles (Legal One – La Ley Next) tanto de forma telefónica o presencial)

- Brindar capacitaciones de los productos // capacidad de oratorio y buenas relaciones interpersonales

- Realizar ventas principalmente a pequeños/medianos estudios de abogados

- Prospección de nuevos clientes para ampliar cartera asignada (Excluyente)

- Manejo y mantenimiento de cartera de clientes en territorio asignado (dependiendo necesidad del negocio)

- Capacidad de autogestionarse y ser proactivo/a

- Facilidad para trabajar en equipo

***¿Qué requisitos buscamos?***

- Profesional graduado o avanzado en la carrera universitaria de derecho (preferentemente) administración de empresas o a fines.

- Tener mínimo 2 años de experiencia en el área comercial/ventas

- Manejo de Salesforce

- Idioma inglés (deseable)

title: Reader Revenue Operations Manager,  Reuters Professional
description:
**Reader Revenue Operations Manager - Reuters**

Reuters is seeking a talented and experienced **Reader Revenue Operations Manager** to join our Professional team in North America. Reuters Professional is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news with impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

**About the Role**

As our **Reader Revenue Operations Manager****,** you will:

* Set operational goals for the reader revenue team and build a strategy around achieving those goals.
* Act as the main liaison between our analytics, technology, and customer service teams to ensure our end-to-end operations provide a world-class customer experience.
* Support the set-up of new products in new territories, with a clear roadmap to accelerate growth for Reuters Professional.
* Oversee the implementation of our pricing strategies, working closely with our commercial policy and technology teams.
* Collaborate with our analytics and research functions to provide actionable insights to the wider team to support growth.
* Have a clear understanding of the goals of Reuters Professional and proactively find areas of improvement in our operations.

**About You**

To be our **Reader Revenue Operations Manager****,** you will have:

* 5 years of experience in a business operations or commercial strategy role, ideally in media or publishing
* The ability to identify the relevant information required to make a decision and present that information in a concise, logical manner
* Embody a “test and learn” mentality to drive results
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas and generate buy-in from key stakeholders
* Experience managing multiple projects and stakeholders in a structured and logical way to ensure you’re always delivering the right work at the right time

**Please be advised that the deadline for applications is 23:59 on Sunday 22nd January 2023**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

As required by the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL) for New York City based roles, the base compensation range for this position is $102,200 - $189,800. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

title: Director of Global Reader Revenue, Reuters Professional
description:
**Director of Global Reader Revenue, Reuters Professional**

The **Director of Global Reader Revenue, Reuters Professional**, will be responsible for driving reader revenue and audience engagement/development both on and off our range of platforms. **Reuters Professional** is a high growth, diversified business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization. Our mission is to be the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. We provide news with impact on people, businesses and markets around the world and serve millions of globally minded individuals and professionals seeking insight and context.

**About the Role**

As our **Director of Global Reader Revenue****,** you will:

* Analyze audience data to establish the scale of different audience groupings and customer cohorts to inform product development.
* Develop and execute a global audience strategy
* Create a strategy and lead Reuters entry into new reader revenue streams
* Articulate the value of highly-engaged audiences to advertising sales.
* Partner with product teams to deploy the right tools to build relationships with the Reuters audience (i.e. content personalization and machine learning).
* Partner with product teams to optimize the on and off platform experience to drive audience acquisition and monetization.
* Partner with editorial teams and customers to develop, test and launch new content services and products aimed at increasing audience volume and engagement.
* People management:  Guide development of a high performing team ensuring they receive sufficient structured training, monitoring and mentoring as appropriate.
* Play a core role on Professional leadership team, influencing direction and strategy over time.

**Key areas of responsibility include:**

* Serving as the voice and champion of our professional audience.
* Utilizing data and continual testing to drive continuous improvement in average revenue per user (ARPU) and customer experience metrics.
* Partnering with editorial and product teams to modify, enhance and create services and products with the goal of increasing audience volume and engagement.
* Providing the thought leadership and implementation strategy for new revenue streams.

**Key Deliverables:**

* Develop an audience proposition with insight to guide product development
* Devise and deliver a Customer Voice Program across all markets that frequently gathers customer feedback, generates actionable insights and converts to business improvements.
* Reader revenue and ARPU targets
* Customer churn and retention targets
* Customer CPA and LTV targets
* Continue to test models and solutions with A/B parallel approach
* Expand and enhance existing offerings (newsletters, verticals, new services)
* Data driven analysis to continually improve engagement

**About You**

To be our **Director of Global Reader Revenue** you will have:

* Proven leadership experience working in the online media sector, ideally with strong record of accomplishments in the news or media sector
* Proven ability to think strategically about business opportunities and future customer needs in the media industry
* Ability to work effectively at detailed level with product requirements and delivery against customer needs
* Proven track record in audience development and acquisition, ideally within an international news or business environment
* Extensive data analytical skills
* Proven track record of success working in complex and highly matrixed corporate business environments
* Experience working in a global organization.

**Please be advised that the deadline for applications is 23:59 on Sunday 5th February 2023.**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

· **COVID-19 Response**: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture**: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

· **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact**: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s leading provider of trusted news, insight and analysis. Founded in 1851, it brings together world-class journalism, industry expertise and cutting-edge technology to enable people to make better decisions. Reuters is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. It delivers unmatched coverage to the world’s news and media organizations and professionals in over 16 languages. Reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters is the essential source of business and world news, delivering with unparalleled speed, reliability and accuracy.

title: Pasante Customer Experience - Tax & Accounting
description:

As an employee at Thomson Reuters, you will play a role in shaping and leading the global knowledge economy. Our technology drives global markets and helps professionals around the world make decisions that matter.  Whether solving for today’s challenges or tomorrow’s aspirations, you will work with the industry’s brightest thinkers on diverse projects, creating next-generation solutions that deliver powerful results.   As the world’s leading provider of intelligent information, we want your unique perspective to create the solutions that advance our business—and your career. 

We are seeking a highly motivated **customer experience intern,** to help the team on following up with legal customers.

* ### **Be a Team Player** –  Work along with the LatAm legal customer experience team, participate in the welcome program for the legal segment
* ### **Be an Agile Person** – Follow up cases in Salesforce
* ### **Be an Effective Communicator –** Offer online training to clients
* ### **Take Ownership** – Contact by phone the portfolio of clients of the legal segment.

title: Assistant Manager Finance-FP&A
description:
**Timing:** Depending upon the role (7am – 4pm / 10am – 7pm / 12pm – 9pm / 2pm – 11pm)

**Qualification:** MBA graduate/ CA

**Eligibility:** Minimum experience of 6-8 years

**Skills: MS Excel expertise, User level (advanced) understanding of financial / management reporting tools – SFDC, SAP, BO, Smartview, OBIEE, MS Access, Hyperion and automation tools.**

* Enthusiastic- open for learning and can-do mentality.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to juggle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines
* Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
* To take call of judgement
* Prior team handling experience of 2-4 members

**Position Purpose:**

This position would partner with various finance teams within CoE to provide analytical support and help drive business performance. This role is part of the FP&A Center of Expertise (COE) and is designed to participate in various project initiatives across the Legal enterprise in the FP&A space, driving consistent use of tools while at the same time identifying areas of efficiency and communicating best practices.

**Job Overview**

Provide financial / management reporting and analysis to internal teams and high level management teams - representing actual and variance analysis of outlook and actual.

Understand business requirements quickly and turn them around with accuracy and timeliness.

Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis

Provide immediate supervision or manage team, assigning tasks, checking work frequently, ensure proper documentation and schedules are maintained.

**Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities**

Support month close and Forecast / Plan activities – maintain templates, consolidation of numbers, submission into Hyperion, reports & dashboards, any information / analysis required

Establish business & economic assumptions in developing and monitoring forecasts / plans

Develop the SOP’s for the processes and projects 

Able to continuously evolve and improvise processes to make time for more value addition and reports meaningful to business finance

Ability to multitask between priorities to meet deadlines and quality expectations  
Build functional and technical skill expertise within the team  
Use analytics tools such as SAP, BO, Smartview, OBIEE, Acess Database, Sales Force, Hyperion to provide insights to business

Experience in use of new age reporting / simplification / dashboarding tools

title: Sr. Software Engineer - .Net Full-Stack
description:
As a ***Sr. Software Engineer,***you will:

* ***Build and Develop***: software applications by understanding user needs, writing well-designed code, conducting validation/testing and executing full SDLC from design through release.
* ***Be a Team Player***: work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, share information, value diverse ideas, partner with cross functional and remote teams.
* ***Be Curious & Innovative***: continuously update yourself with next generation technology, development tools, and contribute to process development practices.
* ***Be an Agile Person***: with a strong sense of urgency and a desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment to deliver solutions against strict timelines.
* ***Be an Effective Communicator***: articulate complex technical issues, and share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills.
* ***Take Ownership***: responsible for performance, reliability and implement changes for improving the efficiency of a technical component.

**Basic Qualification**

* 3+ years’ experience in Software Development using **C#, .NET or .NET Core framework**
* Extensive experience with **Full-Stack Development**
* Experience in Front-end technologies like **Angular 7 (or later) / React / Vue**

* Experience developing and deploying **cloud native applications**

description:

title: Senior Data Engineer – News Technology
description:
**Sr. Data Engineer, News Technology**

The Reuters News technology team supports Reuters’ journalists throughout the News production lifecycle - from discovery of newsworthy events to researching the story to publication, and all that at the speed of light in an increasingly competitive landscape.  We are working to improve Reuters editorial news production and automation, and we are seeking an experienced and motivated engineer in Toronto, to help deliver this game-changing platform. Do you want to learn what drives news, and learn about the depth and breadth of Thomson Reuters' content? Come join us!  
 

**About the Role**

As a Sr. Data Engineer joining our team, you will be responsible to:

* **Design** **and Develop** data warehousing functionality including the use and management of Snowflake data warehouse, pipelines and monitoring, in partnership with Data Analysts and Architects.
* **Design and Develop**migration of data warehouses and reports from SQL Server ecosystem to Snowflake and PowerBI.
* **Innovate** with new approaches to meeting data management requirements for Reuters Data Platform. Make recommendations about platform adoption, including technology integrations, application servers, libraries, and frameworks.
* **Partner** across the company with analytics teams, engineering managers, architecture teams and data scientists to design and agree on solutions that meet business requirements.
* **Effectively communicate and liaise** with other data management teams embedded across the organization and data consumers in data science and business analytic groups.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Sr. Data Engineer if your background includes:

* Minimum bachelor’s degree in computer science and engineering or related field of study, or equivalent experience
* 5+ yrs in database/data warehousing/ETL/BI software stack development.
* In-depth experience with:  
- Data warehousing, analysis and reporting technologies like SQL Server Analysis Services, Reporting Services, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik.  
- ETL looks like AWS Glue, integrate.io, Talend, SQL Server Integration Services  
- Relational databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle)

  
**Desired**:

* Hands-on experience working with AWS ecosystem
* Hands-on experience with modern data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift, Google BigQuery.

**What’s in it For You?**

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: work form anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Lead Consultant- Hyperion/OneStream
description:
The Thomson Reuters Financial transformation team instrumenting on implementing and delivering solution relating to digital finance strategies, enterprise performance strategies and technologies solutions. This position will play a key role as part of Performance Management projects, including tech driven transformation with tools like Hyperion and OneStream.

* Minimum 5+ years working experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
* Hands on experience in BI analytics and visualization tools: OneStream, Hyperion
* Experience in SQL, Data Warehouse

* Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for the insights that result from those analyses, together with a strong understanding of the data and collection processes needed to fuel that analysis.
* Must have a passion for serving others, work well in a team, be self-motivated, and be a problem-solver.

* Leading of designing multi-dimensional planning models

* Will focus on technical delivery and will be responsible for the quality of deliverables
* Will work independently with technical/functional direction from the leads

title: Application Support Analyst
description:
We are seeking an Application Support Analyst to work as part of our Global Support team.

As our Application Support Analyst you’ll already have demonstrable experience working in a support desk environment, preferably within the legal sector or a similar time-sensitive industry.  You’ll speak and communicate directly with customers across the globe as well as internal staff based in offices in multiple time zones.  You’ll embrace the customer centric philosophy of Thomson Reuters and be able to competently handle and take ownership of problems and situations reported to the team by troubleshooting and coordinating with internal teams, or technical contacts and third parties, to resolve the issues quickly and efficiently.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Application Support Analyst, you will: 

* Your primary responsibility will be providing application and technical support to Legal Platform customers across the entire product range.
* You’ll be expected to liaise with customer personnel and internal development teams to troubleshoot software, or system configuration problems, and identify and provide solutions.
* You understand that timely and informative communication is the key element to good customer service.
* You understand the importance of effectively documenting customer issues and updating call tracking software in a timely manner.
* You are passionate about providing a high standard of customer service and are not afraid to take ownership of support issues and to ‘go the extra mile’ to succeed.
* You’ll be required to participate as part of the global emergency support rota for escalated customer issues, which includes an on-call provision to cover some early, late, weekend and holiday support requirements.
* You will display a strong desire to learn and to share that knowledge with colleagues, through documentation and training, capitalising on the opportunity to become a ‘Product Champion’ for your team.
* Coming from a technical support background, you will understand the importance of being flexible and that the role will continue to evolve as the team develops globally.
* In addition to customer support responsibilities, you will also have the opportunity to play an integral part within the implementation and configuration process for new customer instances.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Application Support Analyst, if you:

* You’ll need to have 3-4 Years of previous experience in similar support engineer or analyst role at an enterprise software vendor, or with an end user of enterprise software.
* You’ll possess strong technical troubleshooting/analytic skills.
* You’ll have a good understanding of browser, plugin and computer settings that can affect web applications.
* You’ll have strong knowledge/experience with web applications.
* You’ll need a good working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, Android & iOS.
* You possess exemplary communication skills, both written and verbal, and will be able to communicate effectively and professionally at all business levels.
* You particularly enjoy working in a team environment.
* Experience supporting or delivering legal online services such as extranets and deal rooms.

#LI-MR3

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** A hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

title: China Agriculture Correspondent
description:
Reuters is looking for a dynamic journalist with great ideas and experience reporting on commodities to cover China’s vast agriculture sector, based in Beijing. The  successful candidate will break news and report and write insightful and high-value initiative stories on the trade and production of foodstuffs that feed China’s 1.4 billion people, covering everything from grain harvests and food security to hog prices, animal health and international trade (including trade disputes).

The China Agriculture Correspondent will have a penchant for source-building and a knack for reporting and writing high-impact stories, from scoops to features, on the world’s biggest consumer of most key agricultural commodities. This is a great opportunity for a journalist eager to build deep expertise and report from the field - literally - to deliver outstanding stories for a global audience of both specialist and general readers.

***As China Agriculture Correspondent, you will:***

* Build sources in trading firms to break news on purchases of farm commodities
* Report on often opaque government policies and their impact on global agricultural markets
* Cover trade in agricultural futures and physical markets
* Write fast and accurate headlines and stories under time pressure
* Work closely with colleagues in the China commodities and energy team and around the world

***To be China Agriculture Correspondent, you will:***

* Have great ideas and demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding stories
* Have strong news judgement
* Have strong Mandarin and fluent English
* Be comfortable working with data and have an interest in markets
* Be a strong communicator and team player
* Have experience covering commodities

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

title: Editor, Practical Law Corporate
description:
We are seeking a corporate lawyer (solicitor or barrister) or certified company secretary to join the Practical Law Corporate team in the UK.

Practical Law is a leading online know-how service providing rigorous, peer-reviewed resources, such as practice notes, current awareness and standard documents to help legal professionals work smarter and advise with confidence. Practical Law is part of Thomson Reuters, one of the world’s most trusted providers of answers across law, tax, compliance, government and media.

**About the role**

As an Editor in Practical Law, you will use your specialist legal knowledge of Corporate - to provide and maintain a wide range of Practical Law content. Working in a supportive team of highly experienced colleagues, you will with their support and supervision deal with a breadth of interesting legal and editorial work including:

* Creating new and maintaining existing materials spanning a variety of formats, including for our What's Market (deal and AGM database) product.
* Reviewing and editing content written internally and externally.
* Answering legal questions on Corporate submitted by subscribers daily through the Ask service.

In addition to this, an Editor will assist:

* With marketing Practical Law Corporate and engaging with subscribers
* The wider Thomson Reuters team (including Sweet & Maxwell, Lawtel and Westlaw), liaising with sales, marketing product management, technology and segment functions where necessary

The successful candidate is likely to have:

* At least 2 years’ post qualification experience in-house, in private practice or at the bar
* Experience in a law firm or in-house working on corporate matters
* A demonstrable interest and ability in writing

**We can discuss remote/hybrid working.**

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Breaking News Correspondent, China C&E
description:
Reuters is looking for an energetic journalist with strong news judgement and an eagerness to learn to join our Beijing bureau as a Breaking News Correspondent, specializing in commodities and energy. The successful candidate will be part of a high-performing team covering spot news and managing data releases in the energy, metals and agriculture sectors, generating high-impact stories in a competitive setting for a demanding global audience with an insatiable appetite for fast and exclusive news.

The Breaking News Correspondent will be a fast learner who thrives under pressure, able to pull the most important elements out of a breaking news item and write clear, accurate and fast headlines and stories that can move markets. This is an ideal position for a journalist with a thirst for learning about China’s production, buying and selling of the world‘s most important commodities, and a keenness to develop their journalistic skills inside the world’s largest independent news organization.

***As Breaking News Correspondent, China C&E, you will:***

* Cover a range of sources, mostly in Chinese, for key policy, market and trade-related developments
* Write fast and accurate headlines and stories under time pressure
* Work closely with colleagues in the China commodities and energy team and around the world

***To be Breaking News Correspondent, China C&E, you will:***

* Have strong news judgement
* Be able to filter quickly through complex information to identify and explain key news elements
* Have native-level Mandarin and fluent English
* Be comfortable working with data and have an interest in markets
* Be a fast learner and strong team player
* Have experience working in real-time financial news

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

**About Reuters**

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time

#LI-NT1

title: Sr Marketing Audience Activation Specialist
description:
Responsibilities

* Work with segment stakeholders to gather goals, success metrics, and size/prioritize segment creation to meet campaign KPIs
* Collaborate with marketing and customer data teams to build a cohesive and unified view of audience data, facilitating new integrations within and outside of the platform to enhance audience capabilities and design audiences that map to business goals.
* Continuously analyze digital channel data as well as internal, external, and integrated audience data to generate audience-specific insights that drive business decisions and initiatives, from planning phases through activation, and identify optimization opportunities against Demand Gen and eCommerce goals.
* Develop advanced customer segmentation strategies and use segmentation to build audiences in partnership with the Optimization team; target and find those customers (and similar customers) across marketing channels and build a process to ensure audience quality maintenance.
* Effectively develop new and efficient data strategies to keep up with the ever-changing landscape of data. Efficiently maintain multiple data sources supporting their respective data streams to onboard and integrate data into Audience Manager
* Develop reporting capabilities using the DMP to assess audience overlap, trends in size/composition, advertising effectiveness, etc.
* Understand the latest industry trends and use cases surrounding the use of the DMP and be a champion of industry best practices.

Requirements:

* 3v + years of Data Management Platform experience with significant knowledge of common marketing tactics and practices within major data management platforms & strategies.
* Familiarity with troubleshooting out-of-the-box data integrations. Experience in onboarding/maintaining multiple complex data sources.
* Experience with lookalike modeling, audience segmentation, audience strategy development, profile merge rules, and identity resolution solutions.
* Deep understanding of advertising technologies targeting and data collection, with a clear view on how media channels work together to create a cohesive personalized marketing experience
* Demonstrated use of analytical skills, data-driven decision-making, and strong teamwork to drive business results and future media/creative tactics.
* Flexible and nimble to think around tough business problems. Ability to provide out-of-the-box, data-backed solutions to business use cases.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* High attention to detail required

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Objectives of this Role**

* Run the production environment by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health
* Build software and systems to manage platform infrastructure and applications
* Improve reliability, quality, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions
* Measure and optimize system performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating to continually improve
* Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple large distributed software applications
* Willingness to work in 24x7x365 shifts on rotation basis or fixed US/UK shifts
* Work schedule will be such that both week-offs will be over the weekend or at least one week-off over the weekend
* This position includes hours outside the established work schedule as needed and requires being part of an on-call rotation including weekends.

**Responsibilities**

* Gather and analyze metrics from both operating systems and applications to assist in performance tuning and fault finding
* Fixing support escalation issues
* Partner with development teams to improve services through rigorous testing and release procedures
* Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning
* Create sustainable systems and services through automation and uplifts
* Building software to help operations and support teams
* Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service level objectives
* Documenting “tribal” knowledge. Constant upkeep of documentation and runbooks can ensure that teams get the information they need right when they need it
* Conducting post-incident review

**Required Skills and Qualifications**

* • At least 2-4 years of Devops experience. .   
• Experience in working on software configuration management of enterprise applications developed using object-oriented and distributed Internet technologies (Java, C++, C#, .NET, J2EE, web services, etc.)  
• Strong knowledge and/or experience with software configuration management tools (TFS, VSS, Clearcase, CVS,Perforce, etc.) and techniques used in automated solutions (MSBuild, Ant, perl scripts,etc.).   
• Professionals skilled in CI/CD,Github, ADO, AWS Cloud,Cloudformation,Jenkins,Kubernetes, Docker and Datadog  
• Strong bias for action and passion for taking initiative, accepting personal responsibility to deliver on commitments, having courage to raise issues, and proactively working to resolve issues and remove barriers in a timely manner.   
• Sound knowledge of Linux and Shell scripts and Python, Perl, Powershell scripting.  
• Knowledge of Application servers(Websphere) and webserver(Tomcat)  
• Execute the day to day build/deploy requests as per the request from the Dev team or Release Management team  
• Partner with software development teams and other organizations to ensure their needs are being met and that our services are adding value.   
• Research and implement new, innovative ways of providing quality SCM services.  
• Willingness to work in shifts.
