title: SAP Tax Implementation Consultant
description:
**SAP Tax Implementation Consultant**
-------------------------------------

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology?  If yes, we are looking for you.

Join our team to support the Indirect Tax division at Thomson Reuters, this will include activities such as needs analysis calls (discovery calls), filling out RFPs, product presentations, integration demonstrations, technical deep dives, follow-up calls, one-off demonstrations with the intent to educate, and work with Professional Services to create the "complete solution" during the pre-sales process.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as SAP Tax Implementations Consultant, you will: 

* Build relationships with potential customer's IT Department
* Perform extensive needs analysis and client contact before product demonstration.
* Perform focused product demonstrations.
* Respond to RFPs with great detail and professionalism.
* Assists sales managers/sales reps in preparation of proposals.
* Answer one-off questions from potential customers.
* Maintain and continually upgrades technical understanding of products.
* Provide technical leadership and ensures technical issues are resolved.
* Work with Product Management to enhance solution offering and provide feedback and direction from the field.
* Visit customers and develop relationships to provide insight and value-add stories to the sales cycle.
* Work closely with Professional Services to sell services and provide detailed Statements of Work.
* May provide work leadership to more junior technical support staff.
* Travel within assigned territory as required.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Advanced English proficiency both written and oral
* Bachelor's degree in business or computer science.
* Three to four years of pre-sales systems engineering experience directly supporting complex sales engagements; selling a solution spanning multiple departments in a company and requiring their approval.
* ERP experience desired – preference to candidates with hands-on experience with one of the major ERP platforms (e.g. SAP, Oracle etc.) especially in financial modules (AR, AP and GL). The ideal candidate has worked for a company that provides a complementary bolt-on product for a major ERP platform.
* Implementation experience is a bonus.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate highly technical concepts and processes to the "common person"
* Excellent knowledge of Order to Cash and Procure to Pay business operations
* Demonstrated ability to resolve complex pre-sales technical problems, working with field sales personnel.
* Demonstrated ability to present technical concepts in clear manner to customers through demos and proposals
* Excellent and professional writing, editing, and communication skills are required
* Ability to work externally and internally with all levels of the organization

**Location: CDMX**

**#LI-EG1**

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 a majority of our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines, with the majority of our offices planning to embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work in 2022.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Executivo de Vendas
description:
**Executivo de Vendas**

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Nome da Posição em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como Executivo de Vendas, você irá:

* Auxiliar na criação e implementações de uma estratégia de território que atingirá os objetivos definidos de crescimento de receita
* Impulsionar o crescimento e a adoção de toda a base de clientes atribuída, promovendo o valor da solução e desenvolvendo relacionamentos com partes interessadas em vários níveis
* Gerenciar as solicitações de entrada de nossa rede de instituições financeiras que desejam adotar a solução Confirmation.
* Desenvolver e manter relacionamentos de longo prazo, promovendo o valor da solução, respondendo a consultas em tempo hábil e fornecendo insights sobre a solução que ajudará o cliente a atingir as metas de negócios
* Prospectar novos clientes de forma independente, utilizando LinkedIn e/ou outro banco de dados
* Fazer proposta comercial e todo relacionamento com clientes
* Prospectar novos clientes e fechar vendas para a geografia atribuída
* Impulsionar a retenção, upselling e renovação de contas existentes. Escopo e tamanho do impacto, natureza e complexidade do trabalho. Responsabilidade orçamentária
* Gerenciar o orçamento de projetos ou programas da área.
* Contribui para o desenvolvimento de novos princípios e conceitos e estratégia da unidade de negócios.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Graduação completa
* Inglês avançado (mandatório)
* Experiência com vendas de soluções de Tecnologia SaaS
* Solida experiência com Executivo de vendas (Hunter)
* Experiência em vendas B2B e SaaS​
* Imprescindível inglês fluente

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter
description:
**Job Description:**   

Reuters is looking for an outstanding reporter and writer for a high-profile position covering liquefied natural gas (LNG), the industry that feeds into gas exports and the broader energy transition to cleaner and renewable fuels, based in Houston. This is an exciting opportunity to cover a fast-growing market for a fuel many governments view as a transition fuel. Global gas supplies are high on the news agenda as the war in Ukraine disrupts energy trade lines and puts energy security top of the agenda in Europe and much of Asia. Investor and public pressures for a rapid transition from fossil fuels to clean energies are upending the energy business and may curtail LNG’s growth. The successful candidate will be able to write on deadline and use video and other media to capture the enormous financial, political and technological upheaval as lower-carbon fuels become a larger force in markets.

**About the Role:**

As our **U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter**, you will: 

* Report on LNG markets, suppliers, customers and pricing, and contribute to and write regular reports on LNG markets.
* Report on natural gas production, demand and flows, and the pipeline business.
* Produce scoops and set the agenda on coverage as U.S. LNG exporters challenge global rivals.
* Generate and execute ambitious and enterprising stories on the gas and LNG industry.
* Report on the utility sector, growing renewable power supplies, carbon credits and their interplay with gas and LNG.
* Bring ideas and drive to reporting and writing about the intricacies of global energy flows.
* Collaborate with journalists in Asia, Europe, and the United States to break exclusive news.
* Work with other journalists in Houston and beyond on regional and national coverage across the file. This can include election, storm, sports and other general news, as necessary.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of **U.S. LNG and Energy Transition Reporter** if you have:

* At least five years’ experience covering finance or commodities, preferably in energy.
* A track record in breaking news.
* A clip file that shows extensive in-depth reporting and your ability to tackle ambitious and high impact stories.
* Strong news judgment and the ability to deliver stories in a fast-paced newsroom.
* Outstanding source building skills.
* Multimedia skills.
* Excellent team skills.

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

**Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities

**Learning & Development**: we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employees

**Benefits**: we offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits

**Perks**:  Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers.

title: Risk Client Relationship Associate, Asia & Emerging Markets (AEM) - FIXED TERM
description:
Risk Client Relationship Associate, Asia & Emerging Markets (AEM) An exciting opportunity has been made available for a Risk Client Relationship Associate to support our Client Relationship Management (CRM) team in our AEM region.

About the Role:

Key Responsibilities: Assisting Risk Client Relationship Management (CRM) team in account related activities including but not limited to:

* Providing effective administrative support on the management of opportunities and contracts through the sales cycle, working closely with the CRM Managers
* Managing post contracting processing, from distributing to all departments, handling of hard and soft copies, maintaining accurate database and others relevant duties. •
* Managing and assisting termination of contracts from clients, from procedures to reporting statistics.
* Generating regular reports for the ongoing assessment of active contracts in order to track renewals
* Checking through invoices and liaise with internal teams for any efficient and timely rectification work as necessary
* Ensuring sales documentation and flows are properly documented, filed on system and communicated to respective departments; to follow up with the respective departments to perform any rectification work if necessary
* Providing administrative support on post migration client data verifications
* Liaising with clients to ensure payments are made on time
* Supporting Business in Client Retention activities including account management
* Other ad hoc administrative duties as the business may require

About You:

The skills required of the Risk Client Relationship Associate are:

* Excellent communication skills (written, oral, presentation) with both internal and external stakeholders
* Flexible and adaptable to fast paced environment and changes in work processes
* Confident, helpful, customer-oriented email-etiquette and phone presence required
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to apply knowledge and creativity to resolve standard and complex client issues, improve service offerings
* Organizational and prioritization skills with attention to detail as the bulk of the role requires ability to connect the dots and maintain accurate database
* Takes initiative, innovative and suggests better ways of working when appropriate
* Ability to troubleshoot and make appropriate decisions based on knowledge of business objectives • Excellent team player but also disciplined to work independently
* Knowledge of Salesforce (SFDC), Microsoft Office (especially MS Excel) will be vital
* Understanding of Sales cycle, Order Management workflow, and Invoicing tools are a strong plus
* Willing to work in Mckinly Hill Taguig – HYBRID
* Willing to work on night either night shift . day shift

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your

personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote until further notice. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance; work from anywhere (in country); caregiver paid time off, bereavement leave; company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees - Thomson Reuters café networking.
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Video Journalist
description:
Reuters is looking for an energetic Video Journalist with strong news judgement to join our Visuals team in Beijing. The successful candidate will be part of a high-performing team, where Reuters video content is published directly to subscribers.The successful candidate should have strong English language and writing abilities, able to speak, read and write business Mandarin to a level where he or she can work independently in the field and communicate with Chinese clients and sources. You should have an experienced shooting background, both desk and field producing experience, able to edit, and have a strong personality to meet tough challenges in one of the world's news hotspots.

Working closely with multi-media teams across Greater China, the successful candidate will need to be a proven self-starter with excellent communication skills, an unflappable temperament and a passion for news gathering and visual story telling. It is essential to have a global perspective to go with a strong knowledge of the Greater China story.

**As a trusted Video Journalist at Reuters, you will:**

* Have strong camera skills using broadcast-quality video camera or DSLR, produce, edit, write and deliver a story from both office and field.
* Thorough understanding of television editorial technology and social media skills.
* Meet tight deadlines in the China bureau.
* Produce tight, well-written accurate news copy to deadline.
* Have excellent news judgment, with a clear vision of what makes a compelling visuals story.
* Pitch story ideas which travel well for broadcast and digital platforms.
* Work as part of a team covering events starting from the planning phase through to field work.
* Work closely with multimedia teams on a daily news basis to produce comprehensive packages.
* Uphold Reuters Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias.

**To be a Video Journalist at Reuters, you will likely have:**

* At least 3 years’ experience as a professional Video Journalist.
* Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities.
* Excellent English writing skills.
* Writes and speaks Mandarin fluently.
* Excellent news judgment and a passion for breaking news.
* Ability to drive speed and accuracy.
* Have a clear understanding of the news video needs of major broadcasters and digital clients.
* Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities.
* Strong skills in driving accuracy and speed while upholding Thomson Reuters editorial principles and policies.
* Understanding needs of video and photo clients, regionally and internationally.
* Willingness to travel on breaking news stories, often at short notice.

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

title: Senior Fact-Checking Producer
description:
Reuters is looking for an experienced journalist with strong research skills to join its dynamic fact-checking team. As a fact-checking producer, you’ll be working on an exciting project that aims to tackle misinformation on social media. You’ll be deeply familiar with communication styles on social media and have a proven interest in global current affairs.

The successful candidate must: 

Demonstrate an analytical approach and an ability to research independently   
Show strong news judgement   
Be able to identify emerging trends and stories   
Have precise written English 

This position will involve identifying viral content relating to misinformation topics and taking the appropriate steps to establish the facts behind it. You will be expected to communicate your findings in a clear format, so strong writing and communication skills are necessary. 

Two to six years' experience in reporting, social media newsgathering or fact-checking would be a clear advantage for this senior position. However, as full training will be given, a willingness to learn quickly is at least as important. This role has a daytime shift pattern and includes weekend work.

title: Manager EPM OneStream
description:
Qualifications:  B.Tech/B.E./MCA/MBA Finance or equivalent

Location: Hyderabad/Bangalore

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Minimum 8+ years working and implementation experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
* Relevant experience with EPM tools such as OneStream or Oracle Planning & Budgeting (PBCS/EPBCS).
* One Stream experience is preferred.
* Proficient in creating Workflows, Data Integration, Dashboards, Cube views, SQL Grids, Templates/ Quick Views.
* Advanced Concepts like Market Place Solution and Bi Blend will be preferred
* Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for the insights that result from those analyses, together with a strong understanding of the data and collection processes needed to fuel that analysis.
* Must have a passion for serving others, work well in a team, be self-motivated, and be a problem-solver.

**About a Role:**

* Act as a techno-functional OneStream implementation expert.
* Understanding the business requirements and building specific components.
* Evaluate and explore functionalities in OneStream and fit in requirements.
* Bring in innovative ideas for complex challenges.
* Independently identify areas of improvement and makes recommendations
* Lead Finance transformation engagements involving strategy, operating model design and Decision Support technologies to enable transformation of business
* Will provide functional knowledge and expertise in the core consolidation and FPA processes to translate into system solutions
* Deliver BI and Analytics capabilities: work with Finance partners to build an accurate, consistent and easy to navigate data visualization and analytics solutions
* Ability to design Forecasting models based on various methodologies like Driver based, ZBB etc.
* Equipped with automation and process improvement mindset to assist the month-end close

* You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community

title: News Reporter, Reuters (German Speaking)
description:
Reuters is seeking a candidate who can speak fluent English and German to join its real-time news operation in Gdansk, Poland.

The reporter will work in fast-paced, international environment and get to produce headlines and write stories about German, Austrian and Swiss companies, from Europe’s biggest economies and become part of Reuters global network. The reporters will also have a chance to 

translate stories for German speaking audience, produce multimedia packages for our online clients.

Trading desks, hedge funds and asset managers at major multinational banks use subscription-based Eikon terminal to get fast & accurate information to base their investment decision. Your stories for Reuters will also be seen by our media clients, on Reuters.com and other extensions available to read for everyone. Reuters news and information reaches one billion people every day. 

**About the Role**

As our **German Speaking News Reporter,** you will:

* Write headlines and news summaries accurately, quickly and with high standards of credibility, in accordance with Reuters principles and operating standards
* Identify market-moving figures and comments to filter out news stories from sources including electronic news releases, conferences calls, Webcasts
* Explain reasons behind stock moves in form of short stories
* Write short alerts on Austrian and Swiss  macroeconomic data such as GDP and inflation

**About You**  
To be our **German Speaking News Reporter**, you will have:

* Fluency in English and German
* Knowledge of corporate activity, stock markets and financial vocabulary, or an ability to gain such knowledge quickly
* Comfort with handling financial data and facts accurately and quickly
* Strong news judgment
* Strong translation skills
* Ability to write with speed, clarity, accuracy and freedom from bias
* A sound command of grammar, spelling, punctuation
* An ability to work under time pressure
* Willingness to undertake shifts

**What’s in it For You**

At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Global Career**: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* **Learning & Development**: On the job learning and coaching with an intensive training package. We also have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our journalists
* **Benefits**: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days and a wellbeing scheme including private healthcare and Multisport card
* **Perks**: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories.

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. title: Senior Mobile Software Engineer
description:
As a software engineer for the Android platform of Reuters News app, you will be responsible for technical design, definition, implementation, testing, deployment, and optimizations.

As an experienced engineer, you will influence how we build features and products as well as the best practices and patterns we use for development and automated testing. With your peers, you’ll manage product implementation across the Android ecosystem.

About the Role

In this opportunity as Senior Mobile Software Engineer, you will:

* Write new features for the existing mobile software. Modernize the front-end stack with headless CMS integration and other back-end services
* Promote code re-usability across both iOS and Android platforms leveraging communication and technical frameworks
* Create and execute unit and integration tests ensuring the software meets quality assurance requirements
* Coordinate application design plans with product managers, brainstorm, design the prototype application or use other iterative methods to validate concepts and inform product at decision-making
* Develop the software using disciplined software development processes, adhering to the organization standards, software best practice guidelines, and corporate policies
* Participates in remediations for production issues escalations arising from operations
* Participates in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements; provide implementation suggestions, options, articulate dependencies and risks to product managers, and estimate software development tasks
* Provides timely status updates for areas of individual responsibilities to supervisor
* Reviews work of both full-time employees and contractual developers

About You

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Mobile Software Engineer if your background includes:

* Degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Mechanical Engineering, Mathematics, or related field of study
* 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
* Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on Google app stores
* Working knowledge of software development methodologies like Agile, Scrum, Kanban
* Strong Computer Science fundamentals including data structures and algorithms
* Expert knowledge in Object-Oriented Programming
* Expert knowledge of Java, JDK and Android Developers Kit.
* Expert knowledge of Android Architecture, performance optimization, and Security
* Advanced Android UI Skills: Fragments, Custom view components
* Comfortable with Android Studio and Gradle build system.
* Experience using standard concepts and technologies such as Asynchronous Programming (Rx or Coroutines), Dagger2, OkHttp3, Retrofit
* Solid understanding of various architecture patterns such as MVVM, MVP
* Strong understanding of Google’s Android design principles, interface guidelines, and best practices

**Preferred Qualifications and Experience:** 

* 3+ years of experience developing enterprise mobile applications
* Comprehensive knowledge of cross-platform mobile development tools, including Kotlin MM, Flutter, NativeScript, React Native
* Knowledge of software engineering & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding patterns, styles, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, monitoring
* Practical knowledge or hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform
* Extensive knowledge of APIs including RESTful and GraphQL
* Knowledge of CMS: its workflow and headless integrations with Front-end
* Knowledge of Design Systems, UX and UI
* Knowledge of typical app monetization strategies and their implementations: e.g. In-app advertising or digital subscriptions
* In-depth knowledge of application performance benchmarking, optimization, and monitoring
* Experience with working or creating a streamlined mobile software workflow using CI/CD tools

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

**· Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

**· Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**· Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

**· Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**· Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact

**· Purpose-Driven Work:** We have a superpower we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Desk Editor, Bangalore (Mumbai/Bangalore)
description:
**Desk Editor, Reuters** 

Reuters News is looking for **Desk Editors** with exceptional editing skills and news judgment to drive coverage of **India** news across policy, economics, financial markets, company news, corporate fund raising and banking & finance.

**About You:**

The ideal candidate will be:

* Adept at performing quickly under pressure as they work with reporters and news editors to produce compelling stories that appeal both to professional clients who rely on Reuters to help make investment decisions and general readers who access Reuters news through Reuters.com and media outlets worldwide
* An individual who has a strong background in news editing, with an eye for detail and the ability to simplify and explain often-complex material
* Well versed in financial news and comfortable editing stories ranging from policy and companies to stocks, bonds and money markets.

And as a Desk Editor, you will:

* Edit, rewrite and reshape stories with dynamic prose and strong news judgment; ensure stories have context and actionable content for clients; produce sharp headlines, punchy leads and overall lively writing
* Ensure that stories meet Reuters’ standards for accuracy, speed, balance and clarity
* Enforce Reuters’ high editorial and ethical standards, adhering to style, guidelines and policies laid out by the Reuters Trust Principles and the Reuters Handbook of Journalists

**Experience & Expectations:**

To apply for this role, you will likely have:

* 5-10 years of experience editing business news. Reporters with proven writing skills will also be considered
* An ability to multi-task and deliver under pressure
* Strong communication skills along with a Diverse & Inclusive mindset
* The role is based in Bangalore. Other locations might be considered.
* 

**What’s in it for you:**

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. In addition to rewarding and challenging work with exceptional colleagues, we offer the following benefits for your personal and professional growth:

* Global Career: As a global company, we can offer a truly international career and progression opportunities
* Learning & Development: On the job learning and coaching. We also have dedicated training resources and offer exposure to leading talent programs both internally & externally
* Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market leading benefits including paid volunteering days, Flexible Work Arrangements, Work-From-Anywhere option, comprehensive health cover for self & family, savings & investment plans
* Perks: Work alongside diverse global professionals to gain true global experience, social events & activities.

**About Reuters** 

Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. title: Executivo de Vendas 5A
description:
**Executivo de Vendas 5A, Tax&Acctg**

*Você busca desenvolver sua carreira e atuar como Nome da Posição em uma empresa líder no segmento de Tecnologia? Junte-se a nós!*

A Thomson Reuters combina a inteligência, tecnologia e expertise humana para fornecer respostas confiáveis que ajudam os profissionais a tomar decisões confiantes e administrar melhor seus negócios.

Nós os ajudamos a reinventar a maneira como os profissionais trabalham, nossa equipe de especialistas reúne informação, inovação e insight para desvendar situações complexas nos mercados Tributário, Comercio Exterior, Contábil e Jurídico, respaldando nossos clientes na tomada de decisão.

**Sobre a Posição** 

Nesta oportunidade, como Executivo de Vendas 5A, você irá:

* Prospecção ativa, com visitas à prospectes e clientes;
* Realizar contatos telefônicos e e-mail;
* Realização de demonstrações dos sistemas;
* Reuniões comerciais para apresentação da proposta de valor, direitos e deveres das partes;
* Negociação de contratos dentro das normas e política comercial da empresa.
* Vaga para São Paulo e região metropolitana/ Rio de Janeiro e região metropolitana.

**Sobre Você**

Para esta posição, buscamos profissionais com as Habilidades & Experiência:

* Experiência comprovada na área comercial ou contábil (desejável experiência com venda de software ou informativos contábeis);
* Noções de informática;
* Possuir carro ou moto;
* Dinamismo, boa comunicação, dedicação, capacidade de argumentação e negociação, comprometimento, disposição para obter capacitação, raciocínio lógico.
* Pacote Office, noções de folha de pagamento, escrituração fiscal, contabilidade e demais rotinas de escritórios contábeis.

**O que iremos te oferecer**

Você irá se juntar a uma empresa com ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e comprometida com seu desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal através de:

* **Medidas contra a COVID-19:** Atualmente muitos de nossos funcionários estão trabalhando em um modelo híbrido que consiste em trabalho em escritório e remoto e seguindo as diretrizes locais da COVID-19.
* **Cultura:** Reputação mundialmente reconhecida e premiada por igualdade, diversidade e inclusão, flexibilidade, equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal, e muito mais.
* **Wellbeing:** benefícios flexíveis e de apoio para o equilíbrio entre trabalho e vida pessoal: Mental Health Days Off em toda a empresa; assinatura do aplicativo Headspace; aposentadoria, poupança, reembolso de mensalidades e programas de incentivo aos funcionários; recursos para o bem-estar mental, físico e financeiro
* **Learning & Development:** Acesso ao Linkedin Learning; Talent Marketplace com oportunidades para trabalhar em projetos entre empresas; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters
* **Impacto Social:** Oito grupos de recursos empresariais dirigidos por funcionários; dois dias de voluntariado pagos anualmente; iniciativas ambientais, sociais e de governança (ESG) para impacto local e global.
* **Trabalho com propósitos específicos**: Temos uma superpotência da qual nunca falamos com tanto orgulho quanto deveríamos - somos uma das únicas empresas no planeta que ajuda seus clientes a buscar justiça, verdade e transparência. Juntos, com os profissionais e instituições que servimos, ajudamos a manter o Estado de Direito, viramos as rodas do comércio, pegamos os maus atores, relatamos os fatos e fornecemos informações confiáveis e imparciais às pessoas em todo o mundo.

***Remuneração****: Salário e pacote de benefícios competitivos com o mercado.*

title: Gestor de Informação
description:
**About the role**

- Responsible for tax information content  
- Management of a team of taxes analysts, supporting their activities including supporting career development  
- Accountable for response the tickets with tax content  
- Accountable for communicate all changes in tax area  
- Responsible to ensure that the tax changes were correctly implementing on the products, in the correct deadline  
- Support internal teams ( product , development , sales )  
- It is desirable to have already participated in working groups with the government  
- Support clients to ensure an excellent NPS in taxes rules  
- Identifies ways to improve the operation of own area and to achieve efficiencies and results  
- Sets timeframes and schedules to meet business needs  
- Presents status updates for various projects to their sponsors

**About you**

- Be a speaker and organizer in Webinars about tax content  
- Take fast decisions in changing environment

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: EPM OneStream Manager
description:
**EPM OneStream Manager** 

Qualifications:  B.Tech/B.E./MCA/MBA Finance or equivalent

Location: Hyderabad/Bangalore

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Minimum 8+ years working and implementation experience in a fast-paced corporate environment
* Relevant experience with EPM tools such as OneStream or Oracle Planning & Budgeting (PBCS/EPBCS).
* One Stream experience is preferred.
* Proficient in creating Workflows, Data Integration, Dashboards, Cube views, SQL Grids, Templates/ Quick Views.
* Advanced Concepts like Market Place Solution and Bi Blend will be preferred
* Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for the insights that result from those analyses, together with a strong understanding of the data and collection processes needed to fuel that analysis.
* Must have a passion for serving others, work well in a team, be self-motivated, and be a problem-solver.

**About a Role:**

* Act as a techno-functional OneStream implementation expert.
* Understanding the business requirements and building specific components.
* Evaluate and explore functionalities in OneStream and fit in requirements.
* Bring in innovative ideas for complex challenges.
* Independently identify areas of improvement and makes recommendations
* Lead Finance transformation engagements involving strategy, operating model design and Decision Support technologies to enable transformation of business
* Will provide functional knowledge and expertise in the core consolidation and FPA processes to translate into system solutions
* Deliver BI and Analytics capabilities: work with Finance partners to build an accurate, consistent and easy to navigate data visualization and analytics solutions
* Ability to design Forecasting models based on various methodologies like Driver based, ZBB etc.
* Equipped with automation and process improvement mindset to assist the month-end close

**What’s in it for you:**

* You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* Learning and Working on cutting edge Process and Technology like OneStream and Power BI
* Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success
* Excellent benefits Package

title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer
description:
* **Required experience:**
* 5 - 6 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role
* 3+ year of hands-on experience on DevOps technologies like Git, GitHub, Ansible, CI/CD, infrastructure automation, ADO Pipeline, containerization, and orchestration.
* Scripting knowledge like Shell script, PowerShell, bash, yaml and groovy
* Tools like GitHub actions, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
* **Essential Skills**
* Typically, 6+ years’ experience of supporting web application systems
* Experience of ITIL processes and practices
* Thorough and logical with attention to detail
* Good understanding of Infrastructure technical architecture
* Take ownership of customer impacting issues, organize cross functional teams to work the issues end to end and provide updates to leadership.
* Mentoring members of the team to up skills in required areas.
* Asses and prioritize work, understanding both tactical and strategic goals.
* Assist in development, design and training to implement process improvement.
* Self-starter, methodical, collaborative, comfortable taking ownership, adapting to change and learning quickly in a fast-paced team with minimal supervision
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Java Web Application development / support background
* Windows Server 2016, Powershell. DNS.
* Apache HTTP Web Server; installation, configuration, troubleshooting. SSL Certificates.
* Apache Tomcat; configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning,
* JVM optimization
* MS SQL Server 2016; understanding of SQL queries, maintenance plans, alerting
* Exposure and working knowledge of networking concepts
* Ability to analyse application and server logs, error interpretation
* To work well under pressure, both autonomously and as part of a team
* Proven problem-solving ability
* Excellent written and oral communication
* Working experience on Clusters and High Availability solution
* Hands-on experience in Linux/Windows infrastructure & knowledge of networking
* Proactively resolve technical hurdles and continue innovative efforts within SAFe development practices
* Collaborate and communicate with other team members to decompose large tasks into small testable tasks.
* Experience with integrating into a team employing Agile and Scrum methodologies
*

title: Data Scientist
description:
**\*The physical employment location will be in McLean, VA for this role\***

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your **data quality improvement** experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to **manage, understand, and analyze in-house and customer data** including text mining, developing predictive systems, risk scoring, creating efficient algorithms, data quality improvement and other related activities? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

**What You’ll Do:** As a **Data Scientist,** you will be responsible for driving, identify, evaluate, design and implement statistical analyses of gathered open source, proprietary, and customer data to create analytic metrics and tools to support TRSS analysts, customers and existing product offerings. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute directly to the features and capabilities deployed in our applications. They will work with customers to assist in gathering requirements and contributing to Statements of Work (SOWs) for new sales or POCs, and executing design post sale while getting deeply involved into the delivery of the proposed solutions. The role will interface with the customer and provide continuity of technical and data-exploration expertise to ensure we are delivering a workable solution that meets the customer requirements and technical capabilities. The position requires a proactive, mission-oriented person who strives to produce the best possible work for the customer.

As the **Data Scientist,** you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:

* Working with interdisciplinary engineering and research teams on designing, building and deploying data analysis systems for large data sets.
* Working closely with customers to apply data science to their mission specific content.
* Creating algorithms to extract information from large data sets.
* Establishment of scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model validation, model implementation, and large-scale data analysis.
* Development of metrics and prototypes that can be used to drive business decisions.
* Providing thought-leadership and dependable execution on diverse projects.
* Identification of emergent trends and opportunities for future client growth and development.
* Researching and identifying Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods – including Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods.
* Identification of new applications of AI in the context of Thomson Reuters and TRSS content sets.
* Exploring existing data for insights, and recommends additional sources of data for improvement.

**About You:**

You’re a good fit for the role of **Data Scientist** if you have:

* **A minimum of DHS-granted public trust suitability required, active DOD Secret or Top-Secret clearance preferred.**
* **A Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, computer science, mathematics, physical/biological sciences, or GIS).**
* **10 years of experience with data cleaning, analysis, programming, and reporting of results to internal or external stakeholders (education can substitute for some years of experience)**
* Programming skills in one or more major programming languages (Python/R/Java).
* Are creative, intellectually curious, and willing to experiment and work in dynamic organizations and situations, sometimes with little oversight or well-defined requirements.
* The ability to take ownership for defined areas of accountability, most critically the integrity of the technical and data design in terms of meeting customer needs, design delivery and supportability.
* A good understanding of distributed computing concepts.
* Experience facilitating and gathering input from subject matter experts.
* Excellent understanding of ML, NLP, and statistical methodologies.
* ​The ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation.
* Strong planning, time management, and organizational skills.
* A team player / self-starter mentality with the ability to work using own initiative.
* Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance.

**Additional Desired Skills:**

* Big Data analytics experience (preferred, but not required).
* Previous experience with data modeling for graphs (preferred, but not required).
* Experience with search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems, and relevance evaluation methodologies (preferred, but not required).

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** Environment that encourages continuous learning and development
* **Social Impact:** Six employee-driven Employee Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Compensation:** Competitive salary and bonus component with market-leading benefits

title: Sales Executive, Digital Marketing (Detroit/Southfield, MI)
description:
**Sales Executive, Digital Solutions:** 

**Small Law Division (SLF)**

**Are you passionate about the chance to bring your sales experience to a world class company that is market leading for both content and technology? Does hearing that we are completely committed to organic growth and that we have extensive investments to expand our sales capability excite you? Do you have previous experience driving sales and revenue growth within a specific territory? Are you motivated by uncapped commissions? We are looking for you!**

**What You’ll Do:** As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for developing and growing new customer accounts in the legal community within an assigned territory.  Each territory consists of a large base of small/solo (1-10 attorney) firms.  You will utilize your prospecting and consultative selling skills, high energy and initiative to identify opportunities to provide FindLaw web-based marketing and advertising solutions.  You will also be responsible to partner with our internal Account Management team related to the post-sales satisfaction and retention of existing FindLaw customers. 

**About the Role:** 

* Responsible for the attainment of sales targets and quota on a monthly basis in assigned territory.
* Consult with the client regarding web-based marketing strategies and solutions that will meet their business needs and will improve their ability to generate business.
* Strategically grow a customer base through prospecting and cold calling.
* Technical aptitude (MS Office, internet applications, Salesforce.com).
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns; establish and maintain current and potential client relationships.

### About You:

**Experience:**

* 4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
* Experience in outside sales in a professional B2B environment.
* Proven track record of sales success, fast growth and consistently achieving performance at 100%+.
* Previous sales experience in online/advertising environment a plus.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Working knowledge of sales process, methods and techniques.
* Strong Interpersonal skills, ability to interpret marketplace needs and translate them into products and/or services.
* Proven organization skills, effective time management skills and ability to work independently

**Travel:**

* Ability to be actively in the field on most business days with some overnight travel based on territory to various client sites.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

**COVID-19 Response:** Currently working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices being remote until July 2021. Upon return, we will be embracing a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work

**Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

**Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing

**Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking

**Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

**Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Are you looking to work in a forward-thinking sales environment that offers great earnings and growth potential with an industry leader?

As a **Sales Development Representative (SDR)** at Thomson Reuters you will generate qualified leads by prospecting for business opportunities within new and existing clients. The SDR will also be responsible for cultivating and nurturing prospects to move them from unidentified leads to scored leads with an appointment to talk with an Account Executive. The SDR utilizes outbound phone calls, email, video and social media to reach decision makers within predefined targets; develops ongoing relationships with contacts by providing value to the contact in every interaction, demonstrates a high level of product competency and oral and written communication.

We provide generous employee benefits, which include paid vacation/sick time annually, comprehensive health/vision/dental plan options, retirement savings with company match, education assistance, health & wellness incentives, etc.

Thomson Reuters is also consistently recognized as a ‘Top Employer to Work For’ across a broad range of categories, such as Work-Life Balance, Diversity & Inclusion, Opportunities for Women, Culture, Volunteerism.

**About the Role:**

In this opportunity as a Sales Development Representative you will:

* Make outbound phone calls to customers and prospects to set appointments
* Create fun email & video campaigns to create hand raising opportunities
* Use your social media strengths to connect and further score potential leads
* Work with our great Marketing team on effectiveness of constructive ad campaigns to bring in leads
* Share your personal insight and feedback to the team on effectiveness of software tools and product packaging

**Your Goals:**

* Number of Appointments set
* Value of total pipeline created
* Total revenue of deals closed from appointments set
* Minimize lead to response time
* Track qualifying data in CRM to properly score leads
* Pilot new sales enablement tools

**About You:**

You’re a fit for the role of Sales Development Representative if you are/have:

* One or more years of B2B or B2C inside sales experience
* Outbound prospecting experience, successfully generating new business
* An ability to tell a story with enthusiasm, communicate and influence others over phone, email, video
* Strong time management/organization skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office, sales automation, CRM (customer relationship management) and/or web-based software programs
* Goal oriented, driven to succeed
* Technical aptitude for learning products, solving problems and relating to people
* Collaborative/Team player
* High School diploma or equivalent required, 4-year degree (BA, BS) preferred

**What’s in it For You?** 

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your 

personal and professional growth through: 

* **COVID-19 Response:** Currently many of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Days Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we have never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

In this opportunity asTax Technology Consultant you will:

* Perform process requirements and analysis workshops with clients to define business, process, functional requirements, and data element requirements.
* Consult and guide with the best process, project scheduling, resource availability for successful tax & accounting automation implementations
* Manage project schedules, budget allocations, define statements of work, manage change control and change requests
* Troubleshoot software and implementation issues, provide workaround and functional implementation guidance.
* Support customers in preparing and documenting tax use cases and testing scenarios.

* Bachelor's Degree.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
* Analyzes customer problems of low complexity
* Assesses scope of impact
* Mitigates customer impact of issues and executes work arounds
* Implements problem resolution as identified in documented solutions
* Engages others as appropriate and escalates as required
* Provides advice or training to users about the application systems' functionality, correct operation or constraints, and corrects user faults.
* Proactively monitors production and nonproduction environments and/or applications
* Conducts root cause analysis and correlation of other system and/or application problems of low complexity
* Works on smaller, minimally complex projects/issues that require a singular area of expertise.
* Participates in project planning sessions with team members.
* Manages multiple and sometimes competing priorities with guidance.
* Aids the preparation of status updates for customer problems or projects.
* Regularly communicates and shares knowledge with the rest of the team.
* Performs actions aligned with defined standards.
* The following are required for some positions but not all:
* Makes general or site-specific modifications update system documentation, manipulate data and defines enhancements.\*

title: Direct Tax Proposition Lead - Melbourne or Sydney
description:
Do you offer Direct Tax expertise for ANZ or APAC in Big 4, corporate firm or vendor? Are you keen to help shape the direct tax go to market Proposition for ONESOURCE? This role will focus Thomson Reuters Direct Tax Proposition, taking ownership of strategy, commercial design, business requirements, feature and functionality trade-offs and release schedule. We are seeking candidates from tax technology OR Direct Tax in Big 4 with tax technology experience.

You will partner closely with sales / marketing to develop marketing strategy and product launch activities, directly influence cross-functional teams in order to ensure dependencies for proposition, product and/ or service delivery are met and gather needs from clients to drive innovation and increase client adoption and retention.

You will be responsible for developing comprehensive product definitions, concept proposals and business cases which result in marketable products and services, be involved in budgeting activities, development of 3rd party partnerships, etc, support commercial facing teams in client engagement and retention activities as the Direct Tax SME and be responsible for reviewing current products to ensure that quality and currency are being maintained.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity, you will:

* Product launch and post launch management new and / or enhanced proposition, products and/or services, including design, development, and launch activities.
* Participate in or lead cross-functional meetings in order to ensure on-time, in-scope delivery Create standards, processes, and policies and participate in testing/validation.
* Create proposals or business case to obtain approval for project and gain support for new propositions, products, or services.
* Conduct or participate in market and competitive analysis in order to drive the creation and positioning of propositions, products, or services
* Supports definition and communication of features and benefits/key selling points and competitive positioning to key stakeholders
* May support commercial facing teams in client engagement and retention activities

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:

* Demonstrated experience in product management including significant involvement in product definition and launch management OR be keen to move into product management from Senior Manager Big 4 Direct Tax role.
* Experience writing comprehensive business and functional requirements.
* Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and clients and must love collaborating across boundaries, driving results and Championing Innovation.
* Ability to keep up to date with trends in direct tax and understand and apply technology to product development. Proficiency in product commercialization and marketing is ideal.
* Ability to drive the direct tax team to execute product strategy.
* Superior demonstrated client facing skills and strong verbal skills, with competency in collaboration. Excellent written skills.
* Analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy. Strong organizational skills with the ability to meet deadlines.
* Complex problem-solving ability and project management skills

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.

title: Senior Technical Solutions Architect
description:
Thomson Reuters is looking to hire a Senior Technical Solutions Architect. We require a highly motivated, goal-oriented individual who will be responsible for managing a team that builds software solutions to meet client needs. Ideal candidates will have technical experience including object-oriented programming (.NET), SQL Server (T-SQL) knowledge, and experience in the professional service industry. Candidates should be excellent team players and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Senior Technical Solutions Architects are responsible for the specification, design, development, and implementation of custom software projects for our customers using our 3E practice management solution as well as other Thomson Reuters products.  Candidates should possess knowledge of several development languages, databases, and technologies.  The Senior Technical Solutions Architect should have the ability to understand a customer’s business requirement and advise customers with the most compelling solution available within the 3E software architecture. In addition to this the Senior Technical Solutions Architect is responsible for managing development resources, both on and offshore to ensure a quality product is delivered to the customer.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Senior Technical Solutions Architect, you will: 

* Direct the resolution of complex or unusual customer requirements.
* Responsible for development of custom solutions.
* Implements best practices for delivering custom solutions.
* Provides technical assistance to sales team where necessary e.g., developing prototypes for pre-sales.
* Provides detailed estimates for new business.

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of Senior Technical Solutions Architect if you have:

* Bachelor Degree or above in Computer Science or Mathematics
* 3-5+ years experience in the complete SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle).
* 3-5+ years experience with SQL Server.
* 3-5+ years experience developing in Microsoft development tools .NET, ASP.NET., REST API, XLST, DevOps
* Clear communication capabilities on projects, including project documentation
* Adherence to conversion methodology within projects, including exercising sound project planning and monitoring skills.
* Comprehensive analytical skills and ability to formulate client-specific solutions
* A solid understanding of the various database structures
* Positive track record for customer satisfaction
* Strong team player capabilities, i.e., willing to help others as appropriate
* Desire for self-improvement i.e., taking advantage of CE classes, self-study on own initiative
* Participation in both client facing and internal projects
* Ability to work under tight schedules and under pressure
* Ability to work on multiple tasks within same time frame
* Ability to work well across departments and skill levels

title: Westlaw Student Representative
description:
**Description**

The principal role of the Westlaw Student Representative is to work with the Academic Account Manager to increase Westlaw preference, usage and users at their law school via training, customer relations and marketing.  
  
**Division/Group/Role**  
Legal, Westlaw  
  
**Responsibilities**

Work closely with Account Manager to understand the nuances of the school culture

Attain school goals and ensure that school is Westlaw preferred 

Assist Account Manager with administrative tasks

Maintain Westlaw presence on campus 

Educate students on the benefits of West products and cultivate new business opportunities

Create and execute local marketing activities 

Keep Account Manager up to date with competitive activities 

We are the leading source of intelligent information for the world's businesses and professionals, providing customers with competitive advantage. Intelligent information is a unique synthesis of human intelligence, industry expertise and innovative technology that provides decision-makers with the knowledge to act, enabling them to make better decisions faster. We deliver this must-have insight to the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting, intellectual property and science and media markets, powered by the world's most trusted news organization.

**Qualifications**

Current student at the specific School of Law, in good standing

Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills

Excellent organizational skills

Some marketing experience preferred

Sound knowledge of Westlaw.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Please Note: TRSS is also considering candidates outside of the listed locations who wish to work remotely** 

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your software experience to a world-class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad?  Do you have the skills necessary to build and maintain high-performing, front-end big data visualizations and analytics?  If you’re a team player with attention to detail and excellent customer service, then **Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS)** is looking for you!

Thomson Reuters Special Services, LLC delivers a comprehensive suite of solutions designed to help customers achieve mission objectives, address uncertainty, and identify and manage risk. We leverage Thomson Reuters’ market-leading solutions to help our clients perform intelligence collection and analysis on cyber security, supply chain risk, insider threat detection, and risk management issues.

**About the Role**

*As a****Senior Software Engineer****, you will:* 

* Build and maintain high-performing, front-end big data visualizations and analytics
* Engage the TRSS analytical staff to gather requirements, generate ideas, and develop documentation
* Demo new software solutions as needed
* Learn and expand your skill set on the job
* Work with a variety of technologies, anchoring a small team across a complex network

**About You**

*You’re a fit for the role of **Senior Software Engineer** if you are/have:*

**Basic qualifications:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in computer-related field or equivalent experience
* US Citizen able to acquire and maintain a Security Clearance
* 2+ years experience in **Java, Javascript, Groovy and Grails**
* Experience with **Amazon Web Services (AWS)**
* Strong familiarity with React, Vue.js, D3, Bootstrap, and other similar sites and tools

**Preferred qualifications:** 

* Experience with Big Data analytics, especially with ETL and data wrangling
* Experience with Information retrieval technologies such as Solr, Lucene and/or ElasticSearch
* Experience with Redis, Snowflake and Unix/Linux

**What’s in it For You?**

At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

* **Our Culture:** You will have the opportunity to work for a company that has a market dominant position for both content and technology and is passionate about giving back to the community
* **Learning & Development:** You will be joining a growing sales team that has the commitment of the company to prioritize organic growth and has made investments to expand the sales team capability
* **Benefits:** Extraordinary benefits package
* **Social Impact:** Global volunteer network, organized virtual volunteer events, 2 paid volunteer workdays a year, company matching for personal charitable giving and fundraising
* **Compensation:** Base salary and a variable compensation that is directly related to your success

**#LI-RP1**

title: Legal Software "Go to Market" Lead
description:
Do you have experience in driving software commercial outcomes, product management / marketing or “Go to Market” proposition / consulting to the legal vertical? Are you keen to drive success, shape product to future proof and help position cutting edge, AI enabled Thomson Reuters Legal Solutions within the growing Asia & Emerging Markets region?  We are seeking a Go to Market Lea, Legal Software, AEM.

Ideally you will be familiar with legal practice management solutions for large law and or legal solutions for corporates. You will be driving commercial business cases and outcomes for these products in our fast-growing Asia & Emerging Markets region. An understanding of value selling methodology to enterprise or consulting for legal / enterprise solutions would be preferred as you will work closely with large law and / or corporate sales teams. 

As the “Go to Market” Lead for Legal Solutions in Asia & Emerging Markets at Thomson Reuters, your role is a critical contributor for the growth of our Legal Solutions in the region.

**About the Role**

In this opportunity as Legal Software Proposition Lead, you will:

* Devising strategy, determining legal solutions priorities and driving commercial outcomes and business cases for AEM region
* Working effectively with a cross section of sales, services, product, marketing, finance and go to market teams
* Managing a team, driving development and performance Developing prioritised proposition roadmaps and strategies and ensuring up to date on the competitor landscape.
* Preparing business cases and championing legal solutions incremental investment and ongoing business support in line with agreed strategies and business objectives
* Initiating and playing a key role in ensuring legal software projects are delivered to agreed scope, schedule, specifications, and budget Leverage relationships with key stakeholders in support of strategic and go to market objectives for Legal Software
* Develop commercial plans to optimize business performance Proactively maintain pricing and packaging to optimize gross and net sales outcomes.
* Actively participating in go to market planning and execution to accelerate growth of legal solution net sales and profitability.

**About You**

* You’re a fit for the role of Legal Software Proposition Lead , if your background includes:
* A creative, commercial, customer-focused skill set with product, proposition management or relevant consulting experience
* A customer centric obsession and enjoy being the voice of the customer
* Can identify, scope, cost, project manage and deliver the enhancements to our Legal Software functionality that will help our clients achieve their commercial, productivity, collaboration and compliance ends.
* Can partner effectively with go to market functions to formulate and deliver on strategic segment approaches and campaigns to drive increased adoption of Thomson Reuters Legal Solutions.

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

*Under the Thomson Reuters Australia COVID-19 Vaccination Policy all Australian-based new employees must be fully vaccinated by having received an acceptable course of COVID-19 vaccination as defined by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI) as a condition of employment.*

#LI-NT1
